review_title: Good monitor, frustrating input auto-switching on new firmware
review_body: I like this monitor enough to own two of them now (bought one in 2014 and another in 2015). It is inexpensive, lightweight (for a wall-mounted multi-monitor rack; I'm a developer and I like to have coding screens open along with output screens), and good looking. I haven't had any problems with backlight color, bleed, or uneven-ness, so I'm pleased overall.

review_title: Their visual quality and easy mounting makes them useful
review_body: ASUS was my go-to brand for monitors. Their visual quality and easy mounting makes them useful. But Lord help you if you get one and need to get it serviced/replaced. Asus makes the following claim: "ASUS Warranty: All ASUS Monitors come with a 3-Year warranty and ASUS Rapid Replacement service offering free 2-way cross-shipping that swaps any verified defective monitor with a replacement before you send it back. " That is a load of crap. I've tried for over 3 weeks to get Rapid Replacement service and they keep telling me they don't have any stock on this monitor.  Ok, how long is a specific monitor going to be made? Six months before the tech improves? How realistic is it to have to have the exact same monitor to replace it in advance? That's beyond stupid.  Buyer Beware! False advertising!  Be prepared for a 2 week to 6 month repair process or buy another brand.

ASUS offered rebates in the past but  will find fault if they can with the paper work f they can.  I have bought three of these monitors for my business just this year alone.  First monitor rebate was denied because they didn't like the Amazon invoice so it was recent then again denied.  The a second monitor I requested rebate on was approved however I did receive the Email approval and here it is 4 moths later no rebate.  The third monitor I purchased I needed but I gave up on their rebate procedure and won't be buying from them again.  Their rebate in my opinion is a scam although the monitors worked well!

review_title: Great IPS monitor, wow on the price
review_body: Never owned an ASUS product before, but if this is an indicator, their products ought to be fantastic.

review_title: GREAT Monitors for Home or Office Use - Thin Bevel - Great Size for Work or Gamingf
review_body: I bought 2 of these a year and a half ago for my office workstation. I love the thin bevel that makes a side-by-side monitor configuration feel near seamless. The size is perfect for managing a true split screen that allows research to be on one side while writing in a document on the other. The monitor rests stable on the desk, and the round stand base is great for collecting coins, paperclips, etc. The monitor + stand is super thin and doesn't eat up very much footprint on your desk at all. I liked them so much at work that I just purchased 2 of them on my own for my home office.
Ordered this to replace my ASUS VX238H which was randomly shutting off (new power adapter did not fix it).

review_title: Solid Monitors at a Solid Price
review_body: Having come from other 1080p monitors like HP and ASUS, I must say I was thoroughly impressed with these. When I saw Amazon had these in stock for a decent price, I jumped onto the opportunity to check them out, and I must say, I'm quite glad I did. I never though Acer had a decent cheap monitor. Upon receiving them, I noticed no dead pixels, and the colors were bright and vibrant. The monitors had thin bezels, which is a must for this modern era. With a wide array of ports, you should have no problems hooking these up to a desktop or GPU. Performance-wise, there was no screen tearing with light gaming, and videos look very nice on these. They're not perfect, but at this price point, it's best price to performance.

review_title: Great, Crisp Picture - Lacks Port Diversity
review_body: This monitor is great, picture quality-wise. Super clean lines with vivid colors that make gaming and movie watching enjoyable. Very thin bezel makes the picture pop and will allow this monitor to look sleek in any environment. My only complaint is the lack of ports. There is only one HDMI port, one VGA, one DVI; so I either have to constantly swap out HDMI ports between devices or sacrifice the picture quality or sound with one device and just use DVI/VGA. Granted this monitor was pretty affordable when I bought it, so the price may reflect in the lack of features.
These are my absolute favorite monitors! The thin bezel design with the vibrant colors makes looking at your screen enjoyable. Acer has long since been my go to for monitors.

I've had this monitor for over two months now, and it's still functioning nicely.  I didn't have to calibrate it or install any special software.  Windows 10 recognized it right away.  I love the wide screen and the fact that it has HDMI, DVI and VGA inputs.  If the display is in "standby" mode, it will automatically switch to the first input that has a signal.  But if you have multiple devices sending video signals, you can easily switch between sources using a hardware button along the bottom of the screen.  This is the best monitor I've ever owned.  It's also the least expensive.

review_title: I knew she didn't need particularly gamer-centric features like GSYNC or 144hz refresh times
review_body: I purchased two of these for my wife, for light gaming and entertainment purposes, to replace my old dying LCD and a small TV.  I knew she didn't need particularly gamer-centric features like GSYNC or 144hz refresh times, so this seemed to fit the bill.  I have to say I'm pleased with what I got, considering how little I paid.

review_title: Very good budget monitor with very little black bleed
review_body: Excellent budget 23.8 in computer monitor.  It has a tiny amount of black bleed when viewing off axis, but nothing that is overly bothersome. The colors are vibrant and full out of the box with the default settings.  The stand limits the tilt somewhat, but it is adjustable within its limited range and works for most desktop viewing situations.  Having SVGA, DVI and HDMI input allows options in setup and configuration.  The mini audio out is a nice bonus to connect speakers since the monitor does not have built-in ones.  Overall, I am quite please with this monitor.

I've had this monitor for about 4 years now, and i accidentally knocked it off while horse playing with husband on my very small desk and cracked the screen! i just ordered another one same exact one and honestly THIS IS THE BEST desktop monitor for your money! I've done lots of research and i love the size! not too big not too small, its perfect. The resolution and everything is great! no complaints here!!! its sleek, and thin borders and it's a great price you cant beat, and I'm not a super huge fan of ACER, because i fell their desktops are a meh brand, but this monitor specifically, i am surprised. DEFF recommend if you're needing a monitor screen!

Was a bit hesitant on purchasing this monitor considering how low the price was versus all the specs. After I received it I was pretty thrilled about the quality and size of this monitor.  I had an 8 year old 19'' monitor prior to this one so the difference in image quality was staggering. There wasn't any instructions on the assembling of the stand and monitor mount but it was pretty intuitive. Now I am considering getting another one for dual screen!

review_title: Poor Wired Connection - Don't Waste Your Money
review_body: I rarely write reviews on here, but I felt like I had to speak up on this one. This monitor is practically unusable thanks to the TERRIBLE wire that connects your laptop/computer to the monitor. It is extremely touchy, not secured well at all, and unless you get it *just* right, the screen doesn't work. Once you do get it *just* right, you better not even think of moving your laptop or the screen, because if you do, it's lights out again.

review_title: Solid For The Price, But Not Perfect
review_body: I bought these for a rather non-standard usage scenario.  We travel in our motorhome, but I am often working while we are physically on the move.  When we are camped, I have a single 34" Ultrawide that I use to take the place of two monitors at home.  However, the problem with that situation is that a monitor of that size is top-heavy and not really suited well to travel.  Instead, I am starting to use two of these AOC monitors in place of my larger monitor.

review_title: Great on the go monitor - very pleased
review_body: For the price and what it is I give it 5 stars.

Our office has transitioned to NextGeneration Workspace, no more cubicles, no more assigned seats, and no more dual monitors, for every ten associates there are five monitors, we are left with working only from our laptops.

review_title: Monitor is great, the plug on the back is the pits; and I'm on the second instance of this monitor
review_body: Update (12/5/2016) - Sorry, I love the concept and when it works it awesome, but my monitor has pretty much become unusable. I would give it zero stars if that was an option. Unless the cable is held in just the perfect position, the monitor will not stay connected. This is definitely a quality issue, I've gone through 2. I'm going to be looking for another manufacture. When I find one that works, I will be back to update.

I have had issues with the connection on the back of the monitor.  It only took about 4 months before the connection failed and wouldn't keep a complete connection.  I sent it to the manufacturer and they replaced the portion of the monitor where it plugs in on the back.  However, it has failed a second time.  It lasted a little longer (6 months) only because I didn't move it at all.  I feel that I handled the monitor very carefully.  This is supposed to be portable but the connections are not reliable enough to be used as an "on the go" monitor.  I travel a lot with my laptop and this was supposed to be used as the second screen to be able to work more efficiently.  I am disappointed in the low quality and will not recommend this to the rest of the office or anyone else needing a travel monitor.

review_title: think that you should know about before purchasing this monitor
review_body: product works great on my laptop but I wanted to use also with a desktop.

review_title: Non-technical people = poor reviews: sad for AOC
review_body: Preliminarily- I do hope I don't have the same problems contacting support if I ever need it (ears on AOC?).

I have owned one of these for over a year and traveled around the world on business. I liked it so much I purchased a second one recently to add to my new Wali dual monitor stand with the Versa mounting feature. It is light weight and travels well with its neoprene sleeve and fits into my computer backpack with my laptop.

I bought this extra screen because I recently started working at a coworking space after my company closed our physical office. The screen is fantastic for my needs. It's not ultra sharp, but for getting my work done and needing a second screen is does the job.
- No true black color depth. Everything was a desaturated grey, with detail loss.

review_title: Avoid - defective after 5 weeks & warranty will not replace a brand new unit
review_body: Monitor is dead after 5 weeks - 1 week past the Amazon return window of course. Same behavior others have noted. Screen goes in and out flickering then dies completely.  Most companies would send you a replacement when you have a brand new item that is clearly a defective unit but not Asus. They want to try to "repair" it & send back what should have been a brand new items but is now a repair job, and if they can't, they will eventually send you a replacement. That replacement is likely a refurbish job and not a new one. *** Tech stated they never replace brand new units that are defective.*** I might eventually have a monitor to use but it'll be junk and I'll likely have to go get another one to use in the mean time. Save yourself the Asus run around and just get a different monitor to begin with.

review_title: Amazing Product... If It's not Defective
review_body: The visual quality that this item produces is just amazing. I really didn't get all the fuzz about IPS monitors before. Now I know. And i bet that you will never stray from and IPS monitor again. This is coming from a 20" Samsung Syncmaster B2030.
When the ASUS Monitor I bought in 2015 gave out, I bought this updated model. It cost substantially less than the first one, which doesn't owe we many money :)
I just bought two of these monitors, after comparing many monitors. I am happy with my purchase. I have hooked these up via DVI to my computer with them on

review_title: Have two, might go three for surround.
review_body: I have 2 of these monitors currently.  They were bought years apart.  I love these monitors.  There is a slight backlight bleed on the edges but under normal use you will barely notice it.

review_title: Nice monitor, can be picky about hdmi cables.
review_body: Nice monitor, great display properties. Minimal edge bleed, which is common for IPS displays. Great viewing angles. Wide bezel edges though (kind of clunky), not as slim as the monitor it replaced. Very finicky about the hdmi cables. First time I turned it on, there were green horizontal lines like static. I've seen that before with other monitors, so I tried a different cable and it went away. If you buy one and see this, try new cables before returning it.

Purchased this monitor, worked well for the first year. After first year I now have two dead pixels. I have had a similar viewsonic monitor for 7 years now without a single dead pixel. Assuming just a quality issue.

review_title: Excellent budget gaming monitor without sacrificing performance!
review_body: I have a Gigabyte Xtreme Gaming Waterforce GTX 1080 - 8GB card and I have tried many monitors, a 1080p projector, and even a 4k TV. None of these match up to the speed of this monitor. I can't stand the screen tearing or motion blurring on slower monitors/TVs. I couldn't afford a 4k monitor of this spec so I went with this after doing some research an I am glad I did. An amazing monitor. The best response time of any monitor I've gamed with in 15 years. If you're looking for a great budget 1920x1080 monitor that can keep up with good gaming hardware look no further.

review_title: Good Budget All Around Monitors (Gaming, Multimedia, Productivity)
review_body: I was using a single Samsung 22" LCD (S22B310) for years and wanted a multi monitor setup with slightly larger monitors, better response time, and at least 2x digital connections per monitor. I needed to be able to connect 2x computers to them and switch inputs built in (KVM's for 2x computer 6x outputs are expensive and rare). I have my personal main desktop used for gaming, productivity (office, video and photo editing, etc) and watching videos. I also have a Asrock N3150 Beebox I am using to remote connect to work (low power, vesa mount and 3x digital video outs built in).

Worked great for 3 months, awesome color, great blacks, slim bezels, until one day it no longer worked. I woke up in the morning and it was flashing different colors in sequence. I know it has nothing to do with my pc, because it does the same thing even with no input, and none of the buttons (including the power button) work. The internet was no help, and when i contacted acer they told me to ship it to texas to get it replaced, which would have cost over $100 to ship. The monitor may only be defective for a select few, but the fact that they don’t cover the shipping cost renders the warrenty practically useless.

review_title: Gorgeous display, but it stopped working in days
review_body: This monitor had the most amazing and gorgeous display. It had a lovely slim design as well, though a bit wobbly because it was so thin and light. I would have given it 6 stars except that it stopped working. I did all the things the Acer people suggested to get it back to work. The service person on the phone was helpful. Since it had not received any harsh treatment at all, I decided to return it instead of dealing with repairs. I replaced it with a workhorse monitor which I guess is what I need, but I miss that display!

review_title: If you have 2 you are deciding between, get this one now!
review_body: I've had this monitor for a while now. A good couple months anyways. I have to say, the quality is amazing! I use this for my video editing PC. It helps with seeing the little details in my videos! Clarity of the images are fantastic, even more than I'd expect from this price point! If you are on the verge of choosing between this and another at this price range, get this one! Don't hesitate another minute!
Extremely pleased with the color, brightness, and size. The controls are hard to manipulate. I don't think I've succeeded yet, but the balance seems fine right out of the box.

review_title: and I couldn't be happier. As others have pointed out
review_body: Before using this screen I had an old RCA TV that suited me for a very long time. Thought it was time to upgrade and snaged two of this for a dual monitor setup, and I couldn't be happier.

Good monitors for the price. Ordered 2 at the same time. Very small physical bezel + almost a 1/4" in-screen bezel (black bar? idk what to call it).  Nice to use side by side, or in my case one slightly at an angle so one monitor slightly overlaps the other to minimize the blackness between.

review_title: Manufacturer has poor customer support for defective product
review_body: I’ll start this off by saying the screen looks great and the visual quality is top notch. However when I received the monitor it only worked for about 2 days. Then every time I turned it on it started restarting over and over every 2 seconds. So I contacted the manufacturer and they decided I should send it to their repair facility and I had to pay for the $80 shipping (wouldn’t have been that big of a deal if they had actually fixed it). About 2 weeks goes by and they returned the exact same monitor to me with a note saying they could not duplicate the issue and that they turn it on and off a bunch of times to make sure it worked properly. I knew exactly what was about to happen as I put it together and plugged it into the wall. Sure enough, it started cycling on and off immediately. Changed outlets, jiggled the power cord and unplugged and replugged them in and nothing changed. “Could not duplicate cust reported issue” pretty convinced they never even took it out of the box. Video is after it was sent back from the repair facility. The photo is their comment after “testing it”

This monitor is a great gaming monitor for the price. A little bit of screen tearing happens in some games, I experienced some in Rainbow Six Siege, but I did not experience any screen tearing in COD WWII. Yes, their is minor ghosting, but for $130 the 4ms response time is amazing for the price. The minor ghosting problems don't matter to me because it is very hard to spot and you wont notice a difference unless you are switching form a 1ms response time. The Acer monitor that I received does not have any backlight problems like others complain about. I am coming form an Dell S2417DG and the Dell has worse backlight bleeding than this one, oh and you can buy 3 of these acer monitors for the price of one Dell 2417DG. I bought one of these so far, I'm so happy with it that I am going to buy 2 more to have a full 3 monitor setup.

review_title: I absolutely loved this monitor for the first two months
review_body: I absolutely loved this monitor for the first two months.  Now I have any entire vertical line of dead pixels down the screen about 2-3 inches from the right edge.  I looked online for a quick repair and it seems when this happens on an LCD panel it typically requires replacement of components that will cost almost as much aftermarket as I paid for the entire monitor retail.

I have had this monitor for a little more than a week. Shipping & Delivery was good, and it arrived in three days. The box or the monitor itself was not damaged, and all was good. Acer even included a free VGA cable for those who didn't have one.

Dead red pixel on arrival. This is the second ASUS monitor that had a dead pixel on arrival (this one was green and on the top center). What I have now is the replacement they sent me (well they discontinued the model I had previously and so they sent me a refurbished different model). Still dead pixel on arrival.

This is a fantastic screen. I ordered it as a replacement for a 22" monitor that had a lot of ghosting around the lettering, and I'm so glad I did. The quality is excellent--I have another Asus with similar specs, just larger, and this one is very similar.

review_title: For gaming? No. For Work? Yes
review_body: This is decent. I don't use  for anything but my second monitor on my gaming rig. I originally got this for twitch so I could have my obs streaming options and stuff on another screen and it worked great.Its been a while since I've done that cause of PC issues. This is a okay screen for some light gaming and viewing the internet / working etc. I would not recommend it for gaming though as I would recommend something with a 1 ms response time, it makes a difference a big difference in gaming.This screen doesn't have anything that stands out from others it's just a nice monitor. I do like the back of it pretty thin d it does not collect dust like my other Asus I use for gaming. The swivle at the bottom is a standerd one i don't really like that to much but that's because right next to it the gaming one has up and down and tilt which is great for a standerd stand. The gaming monitor by Asus I am talking about I believe it's called VG24 something something but it's a 1ms response and 144 refresh rate so I recommend checking it out if your wanting a gaming monitor or just look up 1ms 144hrtz monitor cause there's probobly better ones now!

review_title: GREAT for dual monitor custom set up on home PC!
review_body: I bought 2 of these monitors to mount together on one stand as a dual screen set up for my home built computer (see pic).  I love them!!  They are bright and crisp and after a few years of use still look amazing with no dead pixels.  I highly recommend Asus products and these monitors in particular!  Great value for the price!  My only niggle with these (and it's a very small niggle) is that there is a very slight discrepancy in the display color of the two.  I only notice because of the dual screen set up with them side by side.  It's usually much worse with other monitors (even two of the exact same ones are usually quite different).  These are much better than others I've used, but there is still a difference and I wish there wasn't.

review_title: Dual Monitor Displays are making me more productive in my home office.
review_body: I bought this ASUS VS248H-P 24" Full HD 1920x1080 2ms HDMI Monitor originally in late 2017.  I liked it so much I thought I'd set my home office up for a Dual Monitor display and bought a second monitor.  The images from DVI Cable connections are sharp and clear, the screens are bright and clean, and the controls are on the bottom of the monitor screens, where they are easily accessible.  The original manufacturers' packaging protected the hardware well for the shipping trip via USPS.  These make nice replacements for my old 19" Samsung SyncMaster monitors.  These larger displays help me work more efficiently too, as I open more windows and see more data at a glance.

I have 2 of these, and just bought a 3rd as a gift. I'm obviously happy with the product. The two I have are both several years old and going strong. They're bright, and work well for gaming, work, or watching movies. They've even survived 3 moves with things falling on them. I recommend it.

review_title: Amazing Monitors! Stop looking and buys these!
review_body: An amazing monitor! These monitors are great. The picture quality is clear and crisp. The factory settings are pretty good out the box, but can be adjusted for improved visuals. I really enjoy watching high quality videos on this screen.

review_title: I often felt like when I would come across an enemy I'd either ...
review_body: After binge-playing the new Call of Duty: Black Ops 3 on this monitor all weekend I have noticed a difference in my game experience. I'm aware that some of it is mental/confidence but I'm certain most of it is because of the low response time of the monitor compared to my TV. I switched from my 47" Vizio TV which I tested on www.displaylag.com/ and had a response time of 43 ms. Before, I often felt like when I would come across an enemy I'd either shoot him first or I just would've even see him wondering how I died and how he reacted so fast. I'd look at the killcam and it showed me being on the enemy's screen like a half a second before him appearing on my screen. I'd run into this issue over and over which is why I decided to purchase a monitor. So now, when I die in game it's not a matter of "I didn't even see that guy".

review_title: 24" is perfect size for programming!  Screen is a bit bright but can be adjusted down easily.
review_body: This monitor replaced a 19" second monitor for my laptop and provides a significant amount of additional horizontal real estate.  I am extremely happy to have this extra width to use with apps such as Eclipse or even OneNote, which seem to thrive on extra horizontal space.  I won't be going back to my 19" monitor.

Update: Monitor began to flicker after about 16 months of use. Tried a new HDMI cable, reset monitor, changed refresh rate and tested the port on laptop. Sent the monitor back to Asus for repair. Thankfully, they covered the shipping both directions. Received the 'fixed' monitor only to experience the same problem. Called support again. Start the process over. Asus is again covering shipping both directions. Seems like a lot of money for a $130 monitor. I have two other Asus monitors that I use at my main office. This one is used at my 2nd office location. It's a great monitor (at least when it's not flickering). Jury out. 16 months and done?? Will provide another update when 'fixed' again.

review_title: Perfect for the road warrior.  Make sure you have Thunderbolt 3 or USB-C that supports ALT mode.
review_body: I originally purchased this from Amazon, but their in-house delivery service botched the delivery and I never received it.  I found it on sale at another on-line store that uses traditional delivery services.  That being said, it is a great monitor.  Make sure you have a Thunderbolt 3 or a USB-C port that supports ALT mode.  I have tested it with a both a touch bar MacBook Pro and a PC with Thunderbolt 3.  It was plug-and-play on both laptops.  The image looks great.  The colors are crisp.  The dust cover is magnetic and doubles as the stand.  Make sure you use the magnet to hold the monitor in place.

review_title: Screen quality makes it hard to read
review_body: Using this as a travel monitor when not at home, or the office.  Reason for the 2 stars is due to image quality, which I originally read about on other reviews.  However, I didn't mind too much as this was supposed to be for quickly referencing an email or spreadsheet while working on my laptop's main screen.  However, the image quality is so poor that it's difficult to use even for these purposes. It's really that bad.  Also, the brightness is very low & you have to look at the screen at just the right angle in order to make it out.

This monitor works well for me.  I use a Macbook Pro with retina display.  If you have a Mac, in order to make it work at all, you need to go to the AOC website and download the Mac driver.  The USB 3.0 jack works, but is sadly the only one that works for mine.  The picture quality is fairly good.  The biggest drawback is that the driver does not add any controls, so there is no way to adjust the brightness and only minimal control over anything else.  Sometimes it errors in funny ways - such as a window not showing up quite right, or the background bleeding through the foreground window.  But in general, this goes away if I move the windows slightly.  I "solved" the brightness issue by simply turning the screen away from me when it is too bright for my surroundings.  However, because the picture quality is not pristine (still good, but not perfect), the brightness cannot be adjusted, and it sometimes has minor glitches in the image, I would not use this monitor for gaming.

review_title: Works on USB 2.0, don't bother loading drivers. May require 2 USB Ports to run on Battery.
review_body: Windows 10 Pro has no issues with this monitor. Recognized as generic PnP, with correct resolution. W10 will manage it as it will any monitor. Don't bother installing drivers,  I could not make ANY Displaylink driver do auto-rotate, either from disk or website. No deductions for that, I could not care less, landscape is where my monitors live. None of my monitors will change, on Windows, even if the  CORRECT drivers are installed. Unit is lightweight, don't expect it to survive being toted around in a back pack or other soft sided case/luggage. if you think it will, then ........... oh well. I could only wish for a matte finish screen, not advertised as having one, so no points off. Clarity is good. resolution good. Viewing angle due to screen, not so great. Glare gets ya. If you are a road warrior or RV traveler & need more than a single laptop screen, buy this. A gaming monitor this isn't, but for viewing stock charts, or duplicating your screen for demo purposes, etc it's fine. FYI on battery only, it required the power input also. Used a Thinkpad T520, unplugged on the patio for testing, connected to both of my USB 2.0 ports, would not start otherwise. I have not tested it while on AC power.

review_title: Works great, no dead pixels, good color and response time, connects via USB, so no power brick needed.
review_body: Received as an early holiday present.

review_title: a higher quality screen would probably make my life 10x better than that
review_body: I want to preface this review by saying this screen has vastly improved my work life ten-fold! However, a higher quality screen would probably make my life 10x better than that.

I bought two of this for using as 2nd and 3rd additional monitors for my pc. Easy to configure through my USB 3.0 ports. Had to buy two USB extension cords (3 feet) because of the distance to my PC. See my configuration on Pictures by Users.

I received the monitor - great concept - monitor with its own stand.  Very large - larger than I expected, but fits well in my briefcase.  Loaded the software as directed and hooked up the monitor.  Other than the fact that the connection in the back of the monitor is hard to attach, I loved it.  Used it for about 5-10 minutes and then packed it up.  Has it's own sleeve, which was great.  Put it on my coffee table.  About an hour later, I decided I wanted to use it again for doing some of my work.  Took it out of the case.  It had a bleed on the screen.  I was thinking of returning it, but figured,  you know what, if it works, I'll just keep it.  It didn't - the bleed caused the picture on the monitor to be nothing but shapes.  I called Amazon customer service and they were fantastic - exchanged it immediately.  The new one came and I figured that, since I already had the software loaded into my computer, all I have to do is attach the monitor.  It turned on, but my computer refused to recognize it.  I figured maybe I needed to use the software that specifically came with that monitor.  Nope.  I read online articles about how to fix, which had me loading a newer version of the software on my computer.  Nope.  Spent hours trying to figure it out to no avail. Called AOC customer service.  The guy walked through all of those steps with me again and had me try everything again.  Nope. He said there is a KNOWN compatibility problem with Surface  Book because it does not give off enough power.  I was confused because the first monitor worked fine ... until the bleed.  He told me that not every monitor is made the same in the manufacturing process and some require more power.  I said that there's a second USB which comes with the unit which is supposed to be for less powerful laptops and that I tried it and it didn't work.  He said that the second USB is not made for Surface Books.  Because of what he said, I decided to try one more time and get another monitor to see if it was one of the ones that requires less power.  Nope.  Returning it.  Nice product if it works with your system.  Before you waste time and money, you might want to contact AOC to find out if your specific unit is compatible with their product. since they do not provide that information in any of their advertisements or literature.

review_title: don't buy, terrible viewing angles, no where near as good as any laptop lcd display
review_body: I really want this to work as a portable second screen, the price was reasonable but the performance is terrible.  You can't look straight at it or you can't see half the colors, it has some weird view angle issues if I move my head a few inches half the screen images turn black.  It is nothing like my laptop screen, this reminds me of a screen maybe from the 90s.  Because of the distortion and what looks like polarization/distortion when I move my head even an inch from the optimal viewing angle which honestly there is no optimal viewing angle with this screen.  Waste of time, will most likely be re-packaging and sending back to Amazon.  The kickstand and portability is the only redeeming features.  This effects the dark colors if you only look at white web pages and don't use dark themes (which I use extensively) this product may work for you.  I also notice that mouse and keyboard seem to be a bit delayed from the USB sharing with the screen so think HDMI is a better choice as well.
Pros

review_title: That being said everything else I love, this monitor has DVI
review_body: Lets start right off with the cons. The colors displayed on this monitor are by no means vibrant. Comparing it to any of my other displays it lands itself in last place in that regard. That being said everything else I love, this monitor has DVI, VGA, HMDI and suprisingly a headphone jack. I have it set up on an arm that I can swing over the side of my couch. I was just sitting here late at night with my earbuds and my computer clear across the room thinking, gee I wish I could plug this in, I wonder if this monitor has a headphone jack. Now here I am leaving my first Amazon review on a monitor that disappointed me out of the box and has since been amazing me. It is kinda like an under-promise over deliver thing.

review_title: Amazon was great at sending me another monitor as fast as possible ...
review_body: This monitor seems to be manufactured by different companies even though they have the same ASUS branding and model number. I ordered two of these monitors and one had the colors spot on with those on my laptop display while the other had washed out colors and reds appeared orange. I couldn't fix the washed out colors with any of the settings provided by the monitor nor manually changing the RGB parameters on the monitor and my NVIDIA settings. I promptly decided I couldn't deal with that and I returned the monitor with the washed out colors and received another one without any hassle. Amazon was great at sending me another monitor as fast as possible without any gimmicks. The two monitors I have now are great and colors are the same. I noted differences between the two monitors with the same model number. I will describe the good monitor first and the bad monitor second. The images will also be in the same order.

This was a gift for my brother who lives just over 600 miles from me. He needed a monitor for his security system as his old one was beginning to fail on him. As a early Christmas gift I decided to order him one through Amazon and chose an Asus monitor. My laptop is an Asus and it has been an excellent, trouble-free computer. My brother tells me this monitor was easy to connect as a replacement to his old one. Asus had provided two cables which came as a surprise to us both since most electronics often come without the much needed assessories. I was told the picture and sound was crystal clear and I could hear how pleased my brother was from the tone of his voice. That brought a smile to my face because when I give a gift, sight unseen, and it turns out to be the perfect gift....well that is worth everything to me.

I use this monitor as my main display every day, for many hours at a time. I use it for web-browsing and can always read everything clearly, video/series/movie watching and can see everything (including film grain and subtle digital noise) clearly, editing video and can see every detail I need to (including accurate colors) and gaming and can spot everything important as soon as it's visible. Nothing about the visual quality and accuracy of this monitor is sub-par is any way. The only thing that's wrong with this device as a whole is every audio feature. The speakers are worthless and the audio that comes through the 3.5mm jack on the back sounds awful (no bass, distant). Sure, it's bearable if you need speakers in a pinch, but if you're considering it for any use besides that of a visual nature, skip it. I'm not subtracting any stars because it's nearly perfect in every other way.

Maybe too soon to write a review, I just un-boxed and and set up with 23" monitor to run with my MSI laptop. I was stuck between this ASUS monitor and a HP one and I ultimately chose this one. So I read a lot of review that the color is off and whatnot, which I can agree with, there is a slight difference between the monitor and my laptop but i dont really care as much as other, I mainly go this monitor to help with multitasking and studying. Im and engineering student and sometimes homework is a bit troublesome with only one display and of course I wanted a larger screen to game with. I have the monitor hooked with the HDMI connection and so far I think this is a great monitor, I think that the color contrast is better than my laptop. Ive played Fall out 4 on it and the refresh rate is fast enough to keep up with the game. The only thing that Im slightly pissy about is with the seller. When I first looked at this monitor it was only $109 then 2 hours later when i was ready to make the purchase, the price was increased to $119 and now a week later, the price is $147. Im attempting to do the $20 dollar mail in rebate but the ASUS company doesnt make it easy on you, you have to sign a form, give a copy of the invoice, and original UPS and serial number bar codes off the box. There is no option to submit online, you have to mail the rebate in. So if the rebate comes back, that means I got this monitor for $99, which in my opinion is a great deal for a newer lcd monitor with an hdmi hook up.

This monitor is one of my favorite electronic purchases I've gotten in the last year or two, the 24" size is great to sit in front of and it's perfect for Xbox/PC gaming (or any console). Everything looks fantastic in 1080p on this monitor and I use it daily - never had any issues so far. It was also fairly easy to calibrate, the out of box calibrations were good, and I used some tools to sharpen everything a bit (everything is SO clear and the colors POP!). I absolutely love it and the 1ms response time is great for online gaming. Will continue to use this brand for any monitors I need.

review_title: Perfect monitor, but lacks height adjustment
review_body: I'll start out by saying that I've owned this monitor for well over a year and, as of this review, it's still working properly and is as clear as the day I bought it.

review_title: Fast response time for an IPS monitor (2ms). Beautiful, clean, crisp graphics for gaming and otherwise.
review_body: Purchased two of these for a two monitor setup. I did test them in a "super wide" screen setup (2.5k graphics) and they performed quite well, actually. However, my usage is for productivity and the occasional streaming of video games. Having a second monitor for that (gaming and streaming) is a must. Eventually when I get a desk worthy of having the 3rd monitor that I wanted, I'll get the third. As always, ASUS brings quality to the table, and it doesn't lack with these monitors. When I purchased these, I hadn't realized that I bought IPS monitors (which these are). And, the best part is, these are truly 2ms IPS monitors. Typically IPS monitors run at 5-6ms and you can tell it when gaming.

review_title: Cheap monitor, poor color but sharp screen with wall mount
review_body: This monitor is the 2nd big monitor for my desk. I have been very happy with a 23" Samsung LED monitor but they don't seem to be making many good 23-24" monitors now that meet my requirements. This one had very good price (under $150) and was delivered on Christmas eve.
text looks terrible. eveything else is ok. Scaling won't help.

I received this monitor and after two months the LCD Screen randomly appeared with a black dot. I then had to ship in the product after paying nearly $30 for a box/shipping and wrapping at Fedex and Acer now wants me to pay an additional $79 to repair the screen that now looks even worse. I was asked to take pictures of the screen before shipping (first 3 images are mine) and once Acer receive my monitor (4th/last picture taken by Acer) the LCD screen looks even worse. After two months of hardly using my monitor (work purposes only), which has zero scratches and was in great condition has now worsened and I am being asked to pay $79 to repair plus the $150 I already paid two months ago + the $30 I had to pay to ship the product. Warranty does not cover this issue, which as you can see in the images are MUCH MUCH worse. The picture quality was great when the screen was working properly, however, I would not buy this product again nor any products from Acer. Two months and this monitor broke? Such a waist of money. Acer's durability is poor.

When I ordered this Acer R240HY bidx product I thought that I was not going to be that satisfied with this monitor because it does not have VESA mounting functionality. An earlier review from another customer bought a V3 mounting bracket, disassembled the stand and managed to get it set up on a mount.
Great Monitors.  I have two.  They work great.  The reason that I am only giving two stars is that

review_title: GREAT MONITORY FOR THE MONEY & HAS DVI-D PORT
review_body: This monitor has been perfect. I'm not a gamer but I am a geek & clarity is critical to my eye. If it weren't for the good reviews like this, I may have not thought about buying an Acer monitor. I also needed a monitor that still had a DVI-D port and this fit the bill.

review_title: Adjustable Brightness is a Life saver
review_body: The color on this screen is amazing and the frameless look is great; very sophisticated and modern. The color is really lovely and there is no screen bleeding. ALSO, a very, very, very important thing for me when looking for a screen was if the monitor was adjustable in brightness. Thin screen DOES have adjustable brightness from a zero to one hundred scale which is exactly what I was looking for. You can easily adjust these settings by using the buttons on the very bottom right area of the screen. Overall this is a really great screen for a great price.

review_title: I find this monitor to be very good. It has a very nice display with no ...
review_body: I find this monitor to be very good. It has a very nice display with no internal speakers. If you use the HDMI input, you will need to hook up your external speakers to the back of the monitor (audio output), or you could opt to use earphones there.

review_title: Big and Cheap, but I'm happy
review_body: If you are looking for a big screen that is cheap, well, that is this. The resolution is low for such a big screen. The controls are frustrating, but minimal(so you won't use them much). The screen doesn't adapt well to varied resolutions, so you really want to avoid using screen mirroring on a laptop. BUT, it IS big, and it is old enough tech to be cheap. So I'm happy with mine.

For the price it's one heck of a deal.  I only gave it four stars because the controls are a pain in the tush.  They're located underneath the monitor but once it's set up you shouldn't have to monkey with them.  When I first installed it I had to reboot the computer twice before it started.  Forget the instructions that came with it (virtually non-existant) the hardest part of the whole process was setting up the stand which is real easy.
A pretty good monitor for the money.

Fantastic viewing angles and colors, as to be expected with an IPS display. Sub-par blacks, though. Which is also to be expected from an IPS panel. Would not recommend for watching movies, due to its 60 hz refresh rate which creates judder when watching 24p content and its sub par blacks. I also would like to note that I bought two of these and they have slightly different color temperatures. The both are calibrated identically and have identical color settings across the board, yet one of the monitors is noticeably warmer than the other. But overall, it's a great value. Considering you get HDMI, DVI, and IPS for such a cheap price (I got it for $129), it's definitely worth it.
A very very valuable and useful tool - especially when price comparing with other products.
I like the weight and the resolution compared to other portable screens. Very portable.

review_title: AOC Monitor for Laptop Not Recommended
review_body: I purchased this monitor in April to use with my MacPro retina 15" laptop running Mavericks.  I was excited to have a small monitor that I could carry to use at home or work. At first it worked great as my second screen, but now it flickers on and off, mostly the screen turns black while I am working on multiple documents. If I attempt to move a document from the AOC screen, block text to move, or try to move the document over slightly the screen will turn black.  It sometimes comes back up after 30 or more seconds and other times it does not and I have to unplug the monitor from the laptop and plug it back in again to work. There is often a small rectangle flickering fast near the top of the screen.  I purchased a high quality powered USB multi outlet from Amazon thinking that would help rather than have just the USB plugged into the laptop...but, it still has the same problem. I also made sure I had the latest drivers and have searched the internet for advice...I have had it!  I will try the AOC call center and if they can not rectify the problem it will end up in the electronics recycle bin at work! Has taken more time then it is worth.

When the monitor works, it's very useful.  It looks nice, it's light and compact and is easy to use.  It if only lasted, it would make a great second monitor to take with you on business trips.  However, the quality/durability is horrible.  I bought one for my wife to use for her business trips.  It worked great so bought a second one for my daughter at college.  It worked about 20 days then wouldn't sync properly.  Returned it for a replacement.  Bought a third monitor for me to use while traveling.  Six months later, my daughter's failed again and this time I just replaced it with a different brand.  Now mine died setting on my desk; it lasted about 8 months. I never got around to traveling with it, just used it as a second monitor when I brought my laptop home from work.  I'm an IT person, so tried troubleshooting with different drivers and OSs on 4 different systems, but no luck. So only 1 out of  4 lasted more than 8 months and two didn't last more than 6 months.  I know some will ask what do you expect for $100?  Even at a hundred dollars a monitor, I would expect the monitor to last longer than 6-8 months.  I've never had this type of issue with an AOC product before now.  3 failures out of 4 is horrible quality.

The USB-C model is a wonderful monitor, and a godsend if you want to do actual work while away from your office. As long as your laptop supports DP Alt-mode over USB-C, it should truly be plug-and-play. Just one cable for both the video signal and the power. No weird drivers necessary - it's just a DisplayPort monitor. And the magnetic cover/stand is a brilliant design - it sticks to the front of the monitor for transport, and to the back to use as a stand. It works for both portrait and landscape mode, and has a large adjustment range for tilt angle. I wish my tablet PCs came with a stand this useful.

review_title: Company does not support their product responsibly
review_body: Monitor worked well. Bought to use for travel but then didn’t need it. Kept it in the protective neoprene  sleeve  for Over Six months on a shelf unused. Took it out to use at home and screen display is all fill of lines completely unusable. Contacted Company re return policy. They told me I caused damage therefore no repair. After turning it on once it went back in the package. How could I have damaged it? It is obviously defective yet the company takes no responsibility. I am extremely disappointed with them and I’m out the full amount without being able to use it at all

review_title: Go to Displaylink for the drivers
review_body: Just set it up this morning.  I don't have a CDRom drive, so downloaded the drivers from AOC website.  I get error messages about the driver (I use Windows 7).  Uninstalled those and got the latest from the displaylink.com website instead.  Those worked.  The color seems to be washed out on the monitor a bit, and I don't know if that can be changed anywhere.  I'm using the monitor for work, so it's not a deal breaker for me. The cover is a thin foam rubber sleeve.  I suppose it will provide some protection, but I wish it was more sturdy.  I will find a piece of rigid cardboard to go inside.

At home I have a docking station and two 24" monitors that I use extensively every day.  When I travel, I have only my laptop monitor and its highest resolution is not very good at all.  Looking for a portable 2nd screen that would be easy to use, I found this one from AOC.  It had the higher resolution and was powered and connected via a single USB 3.0 port.  I connected it up and it started working right away - no drivers needed (I am running Windows 10).

review_title: Great HD display for on the go
review_body: This monitor is amazing! Clear and high quality display. I went with the 17 inch version as a personal preference but have coworkers with the smaller version who also love it. We work from multiple locations and having two screens is essential to our productivity. It is also super light which is great for being on the go. Super easy setup where you can literally just plug it into a USB and use it. If you want to use it in portrait mode, you can by using the install disc on the laptop, otherwise it isn’t really needed. It is super fast adjustment by the computer when you plug it in and haven’t had any problems with it recognizing the second display. The only thing that someone may consider bothersome is every once in a while, I’ll open a window on my main screen and the font will be smaller. Once I move that window from one screen to another or minimize then restore it, it is fixed. This is a rare occurrence and may just be my computer as well. Overall, I would highly suggest this for people on the move a lot or even to use at home. Make sure it can fit in your bag, I have a laptop backpack for mine, but a smaller laptop briefcase-type bag may not fit this display.

review_title: Great, would highly recommend, just make sure to download and install the most current drivers!!!!
review_body: Ok, so first things first...

review_title: Amazing image quality, let down by significant backlight bleed.
review_body: Overall, I'm fairly satisfied with the VS239H-P. The colors are truer and richer than any TN panel I've ever seen. I'm able to see detail in movies, photos and games that I never would have thought was there. The picture quality is incredibly sharp and does not seem to suffer much, if at all, from the anti-glare coating. The only real adjustment that I had to make was brightness. At the default brightness setting of 100, it can be difficult to look at the display for more than a half hour before taking a break. For sustained use, a brightness setting between 30-40 is much more comfortable, and will provide a brightness that is close to the widely preferred 120 cd/m². Since this is a small-moderate sized monitor at 23 inches, the pixel density is fine enough (95.78 PPI, 0.2652 mm dot pitch) to not see individual pixels at a normal viewing distance (~3 feet). There is ghosting despite the trace-free being set to 60. But you really have to be looking for it to be noticeable. There are no dead or stuck pixels.

Like a few other reviewers, I could not get text too look sharp enough to be acceptable, whatever the settings. I tried adjusting the monitor's settings, re-installing video drivers, adjusting ClearType and all sorts of things to no avail. If you're going to do any kind of work that involves reading some text, this monitor is going to suck. This is unacceptable. I ordered a Dell P2314H as a replacement and the issue was gone so that tells me the problem indeed came from the monitor itself. Now I don't know whether mine was faulty or they all display this problem but whatever it is, buyer beware!

review_title: ICC PROFILE HELP...USE THE LATEST FROM ASUS FOR PA328Q
review_body: If you have this hooked up to a dvi connection like me do this and i think you will be even more amazed. I have three, two side by side and want to help you obtain a even better picture with clear text, whites blacks etc. I have both hooked up to dvi connections on a gtx 660 card.......

review_title: coincidentally is on the same item page as the 27 inch monitor i got a couple years ago on best buy. The 21
review_body: I upgraded from a 21.5 monitor, which, coincidentally is on the same item page as the 27 inch monitor i got a couple years ago on best buy. The 21.5 inch had 1 dead pixel stuck green colored, however, the 27 inch monitor arrived with no imperfections. The box was slightly damaged, but not enough to harm the item inside. Im mainly using this for movies, but i do occasionally game. I played Elite Dangerous on this screen and it was absolutely beautiful.

11/2/15 UPDATE ---- I just can't say this enough: spend another $20-40 and get a Samsung or LG. ASUS customer service is absolutely horrendous. I bought two of these and BOTH were defective; the ASUS customer service labyrinth is a nightmare; and once I do finally get someone on the line, there is no help available anyway. I'm out of pocket $190 because ASUS won't allow me to return a defective monitor SEVEN DAYS past their due date (they allow just 14 days) - this is after all the phone calls I had to make to get a replacement in the first place; this is after NOT even getting a return shipping label until making MORE phone calls. I guess I'm not surprised that ASUS doesn't realize that by not refunding me $190, they're losing a customer *for life*. Well done, asus.

I LOVE this monitor. I saved up for a few months to purchase it, also because I wanted to see if something better became available in the meantime. Nothing did, and the price remained one of the best, so I got it. I love this guy. Crystal clear picture, minimal base and... neck (?), and the power button and power light are on the bottom so they aren't staring you in the eyes while you sit in front of it.
DON"T BUY !!

review_title: Best Color accuracy in the price range and great overall performance.
review_body: This monitor is all around pretty great. I had a pretty tall order for selecting a monitor. I wanted good color accuracy for my photo and video editing as well as good response time for gaming and of course I also wanted great overall picture. I also was looking for a monitor that has an internal power supply rather than a wall wart or inline brick and one that had VESA mount capabilities. Oh and I wanted to get all of that for as close to $100 as possible. This monitor checked all those boxes and came in pretty close to my target price.

I bought two of these monitors.  They seem to work fine, no bad pixels.  However, they are too bright.  I have turned the brightness on the monitors themselves all the way down as low as it will go, and have turned down the brightness via my video card's (GTX 570) driver software as far as I can without losing significant range and they're still too bright.  Having two of these things on my desk can be an eye strain.  I have to keep enough ambient light on around the monitors to keep it from straining my eyes.  I have also been changing the color schemes in every program I own to darker colors to compensate.  With such extreme measures needed to tame the overly-bright screens, trying to roughly color calibrate the monitors was difficult.  I have achieved a calibration that I would label as "marginally acceptable," and the only way to improve it would be to put some brightness back in, which is not an option for me.

review_title: HORRIBLE WHITES and FUZZY - last year's version of exact same model VS248H-P has far better hardware.  DO NOT BUY THIS ONE!
review_body: Used to be an awesome monitor, but they must be putting different (crap) components in it this year.  I purchased two last year and they are awesome, and I'm writing this on a 2 of them plus a 3rd I purchased this year and it is TOTAL GARBAGE in comparison.  I can't even use it, not with the other two identical models because it hurts my eyes!!!

Very good monitors for the price, the image is bright and spills off the edge of the screen as the bezel is so thing.  We put two of them on a pluggable hub and an Acer laptop and video is great on all screens.  I've bought Acer for years, for personal use and as an IT buyer, and the very few problems i've had with tthe products, their warranty covered and had it back on my desk in a week, although it does help that I live 3 hours away.

review_title: Good value, wish it was higher resolution
review_body: First off, this is a great monitor. It’s HDMI and has great color. Can’t comment for gaming, but it’s perfect for my home office. I’ll probably buy a second so have two matching monitors for lots of real estate. My only complaint is that I wish the resolution was a bit higher. Some docking stations limit resolution when two monitors are connected (would make equivalent to this item) so when getting higher res monitors you still have to be careful!

review_title: Great Resolution, works well with Macbook Pro and Lenovo Laptops
review_body: I have this set up for my home office. It was much bigger than I anticipated, but the resolution is perfect! I don't use it for gaming, but I have tried a couple games on it and it looks clear for those as well.

review_title: this Acer monitor has a sharp screen and is the perfect size for a smaller desk where you want a ...
review_body: Very light and simple to set up, this Acer monitor has a sharp screen and is the perfect size for a smaller desk where you want a bright, large screen, but not too overwhelming. It's quite thin, with good response times and no flicker. Picture quality is overall very sharp and impressive. For the price, it's an excellent choice.

When I first received the 2 monitors I ordered, the images didn't fill the entire screen.  I had ordered DVI to HDMI cables.  I ordered DVI to DVI cables and that fixed the problem.  Theses are great monitors, especially when considering the price.  They are perfect for what I needed them for.

I picked up a docking station and decided to go duel monitor.  I could not make up my mind about what monitors I wanted to go with.  These are fabulous for my needs!!  Love the wide screen, which completely changed the game for me and spreadsheets.  I run them exclusively on Eco mode as they are to bright for my eyes otherwise, but I do work in a poorly lit basement, so maybe that is why.

The picture quality on this monitor, and clarity, is wonderful. We had been using an older sony, nice, but the updated Acer is terrific. The difference in videos is noticeably upgraded, the screen populates very quickly going from website to website, or looking at pictures or .AVI.

review_title: it was 100 time better than the +400$ samsung i had
review_body: First of all, i was skeptical when purchased this because of it's " The cheapest option". Turns out, it was 100 time better than the +400$ samsung i had.

review_title: Started off really well. 6 months down the road, now restarts itself after 1+hours of gaming.
review_body: This monitor started off amazing. I couldn't have been happier with this purchase.6 months later from the date of my purchase, and anytime I play more than an hour or so of gaming, the monitor starts to turn off and on again on its own, as if it overheats or something. I have no idea what it is, but I narrowed it down to the monitor itself being the problem. I tested another monitor under the same exact conditions and no problems whatsoever. Then I tested the power cable of the monitor by replacing it with a similar one under the same voltage and similar amperage, and the same thing happened. The restarting gets really annoying when playing games, especially online ones.

review_title: Nice monitor, but needs color calibration, particularly in a dual monitor setup
review_body: Bought a pair of these to replace a pair of monitors I bought 8 years ago.  Once I calibrated with SpyderPro, very happy overall, especially for the price.

review_title: about the quality - this $99 one is pretty crappy, and the resolution is only 1366x788 which ...
review_body: Let me start with...this is NOT user friendly to download drivers for Macbook Air. I am running High Sierra and apparently there was a security change to the OS. After hours and finally giving up, I found the fix on the Q&A here. First you will need to go to the Displaylink website and download the driver (for mac), pick the one that matches your OS. Then go to this site in order to enable the security and privacy block https://support.displaylink.com/knowledgebase/articles/1188004-macos-high-sierra-video-functionality-not-enabled.

review_title: It works but has very low build quality
review_body: I wanted to like this monitor, I waited months for it to be restocked and finally shipped to me. That excitement quickly soured into disappointment upon handling it for the first time. The build quality was remarkably low and didn't seem like it would last very long. So, I ultimately returned it for the much nicer Asus monitor.

review_title: Great external monitor with a few quirks for Mac users
review_body: Great monitor that I got to work with my Macbook Pro 2017 (4 USB-C ports). Everyone at work loves it, but there are a few features that would make me switch to something else if I could find them.

This is one of my favorite purchases.  I use it ALL the time.  I did buy a matte screen overlay for it because the screen is very shiny and I want to be able to work outside with it.  I use it to view PDF's so I don't need top of the line resolution but nothing about the resolution bothers me or is noticeable to me. I have said multiple times that it is the best $100, well a little less, that I have spent.  Comes with a case you can slip it into. Really light and fits in my laptop bag with my laptop easily. The stand on the back adjusts so if I am sitting higher up I can lean it back or more straight up if needed.

I’ve had 2 of these monitors in the past year. The 1st fell on itself from a standing position to laying position on the table, and stopped working. It would turn on with logo but never go past that - no cracks in the screen or any major damage could be seen. Since my boyfriend was the one that bumped the table and rocked it, he was nice enough to buy my second one knowing I love using 2 screens for work. The 2nd monitor’s cord was pulled on by accident and it fell much farther - to the ground from a portable table on to a carpeted floor. In my opinion the monitor severely over-reacted - haha! But seriously, half of the screen cracked and the whole frame came off which made it break into 3 pieces - back circuit boards exposed, led screen and frame.

Day 1 with the AOC 16" display and thus far, it is exactly what I was looking for.  I'm writing an application which the customer needs to be able to see the items the employee is ringing-in to the sale.  The AOC is potentially going to function as the customer-facing display and thus far, it fits the bill perfectly.

review_title: No longer turns on.... less than a year later.
review_body: I originally bought this is in August last year.  I ended up getting a replacement a few weeks later, as it would not connect anymore and simple display the USB icon.  It worked fine for a while, but once again will not connect, though this time it doesn't display anything.  It seems as though the USB connector is defective.  There aren't any screws to take off the back panel.  Even though it is beyond the 30 day window, it would be nice to get a replacement, but I am expecting to have to open this thing up myself and fix it.

review_title: does NOT work with Macs as of early 2018
review_body: Had a few good months with this monitor, but without warning a Mac update bricked the monitor. Now I've spent longer without use of my purchase than with it.

Great for traveling.  Easy to plug in across different devices - I use it on a toshiba laptop, and an acer chromebook.  With the windows based laptop, it automatically changes from portrait and landscape as you turn the monitor, but the chromebook only works in landscape mode.  (I use landscape mostly).  Nice quality on the screen and ok on the sound.  I bought this for traveling for business, and it has held up for the last 8 months of traveling via car, plane, train.  It comes with a nicely padded slipcase, but the 17" fits tightly - need to use both hands to get it to fit in.  While traveling, I still do keep it inside of a padded messenger bag as well.  I have larger model, the 15" may have been adequate.

review_title: Still one of the best portable monitors on the market
review_body: I had previously owned the AOC E1659fwu 16-inch version, and decided to upgrade to this version after selling off the 16-inch version to a friend who needed it.

review_title: Rebate almost impossible because it is not worth the hassle.
review_body: UPDATE: the HDMI port simply stopped working after 4 months for no specific reason. Besides, I can see moving horizontal lines on the screen which is hard to see but certainly they tire the eyes after a while. All in all, I can say POOR QUALITY.
Update - changing to 4 stars - figured out how to make the monitor tilt..I just had to adjust the stand a bit. thank goodness for reviews on YouTube!

review_title: Best Monitor I Have Ever Owned
review_body: For starters, we have to look at my old monitor. It was great when it was in like new condition. Samsung usually makes good monitors. However, I started noticing a lot of lines throughout performance for the last 6 weeks or so. I found out that it means the capacitor is going bad, but I also discovered online that capacitors are easy to fix. I am pretty good, but I do not want to be without a monitor at all. The Samsung monitor was like a lot of my previous purchases...I just bought whatever was on sale because I just needed a monitor; didn't do any research into what monitors are better than others.

review_title: Not sure what all the hype is
review_body: Not sure what all the hype is about this monitor. It's ok. I liked my old LG 2734 IPS LED HD Monitor much better! While the monitor looks great, there are a lot of flaws.

review_title: Perfect Monitor in This Price Range!
review_body: I am not an ultra-technical person, by any stretch-of--the-imagination. I just like a nice big monitor, that is fast, looks nice, has great color, and is durable. So far, this monitor delivers on all of those.

I do graphic design and video production and just got a brand new fully-loaded MacBook Pro 15" at work and was looking for a decent LED IPS monitor that was sub $200 with good color reproduction. After researching what would be the best monitor (not considering price), this model repeatedly came up. The reviews were clear that this was the winner.

review_title: Amazing.  About the best out there at this price and size!
review_body: One of the BEST monitors out there!  Just perfect standard quality.  The colors are the best in this monitor, even over some other ASUS monitors.  You will never be disappointed with this one!  Plus, you get all three major connectors for the mutli-monitor set ups that you need. This monitor, out of the box. is about as true on your colors as I have known. Red is red, and white is white, etc...  As with any monitor, you can get a dead pixel here and there, but I own, and have installed for others, many of these and have never seen a dead pixel in one yet!  That could just be my luck, but I don't believe in coincidence.
Not really happy with this monitor and plan to return.

review_title: Nice monitor, horrible customer service. Buy at your own risk.
review_body: I purchased this monitor in January 2015. It is now September 2015 as of the writing of this review.

review_title: Awesome monitor. Was really happy until I tried to ...
review_body: I purchased this monitor in mid December 2015 to use with a 2012 Dell Latitude e6420 laptop. Waited until mid January to set up and begin to use. Awesome monitor. Was really happy until I tried to reboot my laptop and Windows 7 pro would not load. System froze on the "starting windows" screen. I assumed it was a windows problem - corrupted files. Made arrangements to have windows re-installed on my laptop. However, when I disconnected the laptop to use at home, it worked and booted up. More troubleshooting narrowed the problem to re-booting when the hdmi cable is connected to the monitor. When laptop is "on" and then connected to the Asus monitor, no problem.  I also have a 24" Samsung 2015 monitor and I have no problems rebooting. I have two Dell Latitude e6420 laptops. Both laptops cannot reboot when the hdmi is connected to the Asus monitor. Both laptops can reboot when connected to the Samsung monitor. I then called Asus tech support and the tech had me go through his list of trouble shooting to no avail. Finally, the tech did some internet searches and came back and said it was an Intel HD Graphics 3000 problem and not the Asus monitor. He refused to help any further. My research on the internet is showing that there is considerable amount of compatibility problems being reported between hdmi connections to monitors. Not sure if this is only Asus.

A great price and screen size for new users to break into the IPS market. Color and image detail reproduction is miles ahead of my old Acer TN panels. The thin bezel design helps the frame fade away into insignificance and places the focus on your screen where it should be. Miraculously, my panel arrived with not a single dead or stuck pixel; Amazon and UPS really took care of the packaging. My only nitpick is the slightly darkened bottom area of the screen near the edge, which is only really apparent if you're looking hard for it. I was expecting light bleed here, not a lack of light.

review_title: Great price for a fantastic monitor
review_body: If you're looking for a gaming monitor, and all your PC friends are telling you that you need the 1ms response time, you don't, your eyes can't tell the difference unless you're coming from a 1ms response time monitor. The colors are gorgeous on this and the response time is great. The border is super small, so the monitor itself looks really fresh and modern. No complaints from me, ordered a second one for my mom, so that she can have a second monitor to work on; perfect for really any situation - 24 inches and beautiful, really can't beat it

Fantastic monitor and great price ! I could not be happier with it. I currently have an Acer laptop and connected this monitor using an HDMI cable (also purchased from Amazon when I ordered this monitor). It was very simple to set it up and WOW - what a relief and pleasant experience for my eyes. Fabulous quality of display, regardless of what I'm viewing - spreadsheet, gradebook, blog posts, ebook, images, etc. The stand is easy to connect and is very stable, the directions for connecting it and turning it on are very clear. It arrived very well packaged in foam and in the original box, then there was packing materials around the original box and everything was all tuckled up and tight within a second box.

review_title: Good picture but has other problem issues.
review_body: Picture is good, but the lower left corner has a 3 by 2 inch triangle of where the brightness is different - it looks like a manufacturing defect. One other big thin is that the base sticks way out in front of the monitor unlike any other monitor I have ever owned. It interferes with my keyboard placement and means I have to set the monitor back further than i want to. Also, the blue power light flashes the whole time when the computer is off and the monitor is on and that is annoying.

review_title: Easy to fix ghosting. Bezels thin, but a thin margin of blank black screen extends the bezel by a little less than a 1/4
review_body: This is an excellent monitor for the price. There are two important things you need to know about this monitor, one of which you can fix.

I've been using this monitor for a few months now, and it's been great. I wanted to get an IPS monitor and found this one to be one of the best values. Setup was very simple and I love the thin bezel. It would be great for a dual monitor setup. I have not noticed any of the light bleed issues that others have mentioned, but I'm also not a heavy gamer. If there was one thing I would like to change about the monitor it would be to have a vertical adjustment feature instead of just tilt. Overall a great purchase.

For the price, this monitor is an excellent deal. Crisp display with good colors and very thin bezels which makes it easy to use for multiple monitor setups. The display is definitely good, but not fantastic. Regardless, it's great for the price.  Comes with a stable stand that offers a decent range of tilt; no HDMI cable in the box, only a VGA cable is included.

Purchased to replace 2 monitors to make more room on a small desk.  The resolution is just fine for a monitor in this price range.  I've had no problems with it whatsoever.  I will split the screen and have it do the double duty my two prior monitors were doing.  My only problem is it is stationary -- cannot shift up/down.  I'd like it to shift up a tad, but I was aware this was not a function when I ordered it and thought it would not be much of a problem; hence, the 4 stars rather than a 5 star rating.

Great monitor, I purchased the 23.8" without speakers and at $119.99 you're getting the best price per inch out of all the sizes available. I have the monitor connected to a late 2016 Mac Book Pro and use it for graphic design and running the entire Adobe suite and have absolutely no issues. Monitor DOES NOT COME WITH HDMI - HMDI CABLE though it does include an HDMI - DVI cable so be aware of that. Monitor works as expected, did include stand, and was very easy to put together. Would definitely buy again, was going to buy a second after setting the first one up but I don't have room on my desk.

review_title: A Terrific Monitor and very affordable.
review_body: This is an excellent monitor and for the price, doubly excellent.  It is a perfect size for everything (I don't play games), tilts, and the clarity is fantastic. I felt the brightness was a bit bright so I turned it down. No problems doing that. The base makes it very stable and it fits perfectly on my desktop. Plugged it in, turned it on, and everything was loaded. For someone who is a non-techie, this was a plus. I couldn't be happier with it.

review_title: Windows 10 drivers don't come with it.
review_body: This seems to be a pretty good monitor.  It will be a relief to use one of the same resolution as my laptop.  However, the description doesn't mention that information that comes packed with it doesn't remind you to go to their website to download for yourself the latest Windows 10 drivers.  Works fine once you have the correct drivers.  Otherwise you get to look at a blank screen and wonder what the heck...

I bought this for my Mac with the Yosemite IOS the latest High Sierra IOS. I've spent hours trying to follow the online instructions to get this monitor to work and talking to various AOC technical reps who offered several work-arounds that DID NOT WORK. The Yosemite IOS DOES NOT WORK with the latest AOC monitor software. While I could have downloaded an older version of the monitor software, the rep recommended I update my IOS. I updated to High Sierra and called back. I was then told there were serious incompatibilities with this this monitor and the High Sierra IOS - they blamed it on Apple and did not take accountability for the dishonest and misleading product description. The next rep instructed me on how to complete a complicated work-around use monitor with the High Sierra IOS and it DID NOT WORK. So, they told me to again upgrade the High Sierra IOS to Mojave. Of course the Mojave IOS is still beta and hasn't been fully released yet. I am beyond frustrated and will be looking for a new travel monitor that can be used on a Mac.
Who should buy it: if you need a mobile 2nd display.

review_title: Isn't clear and can't adjust brightness with Windows 10!
review_body: I would have given it 5 stars except the monitor is not clear or bright when used with Windows 10. I contacted the company, and they gave me a website where I could download a driver for it. I went to that website and it covered every Windows version EXCEPT 10. I relayed that information back to the company, and the response I got was, "You were right this adjustment will not work with Windows 10." REALLY? That's all they had to say. I replied with, "Well why don't you tell me where I can locate a Windows 10 driver, or tell me that one doesn't exist." Stupid.

review_title: The monitor itself works well when I can get it ...
review_body: The monitor itself works well when I can get it working.  I give it a 3 star because in my office i use 2 additional monitors for my laptop and they use a specific monitor driver.

review_title: Great for a while, but ultimately a disappointment.
review_body: I bought this product in August 2016, and it slowly stopped working the last week of May 2017. I honestly was stoked to have a travel monitor, as I do web development and design and need the extra screen when traveling. It worked well after the initial pain of getting it to setup with my Macbook. I was pleased - for a while. Then, around the beginning of May (when the device was 7-8 months old), the screen started having obvious issues. Certain colors began to be "noisy" or filled with "static." On my most recent trip, I needed my monitor desperately only to plug it in and find that it's life has finally ended.
