I've always taken care to store the monitor in the provided protective sleeve, and I've always taken great care to as not to drop or damage the equipment. It's unfortunate. I had high hopes.

Best $90 bucks I ever spent.. I hate having just one monitor-- it makes my work take about 1.25x as long as it does if I don't have to constantly be flipping back and forth between windows. BUT, my job requires me to be somewhere different every day, so this portable monitor has been perfect. It's not the most beautiful display ever-- definitely not as nice as the display on my Macbook Pro, but that's OK with me because I don't need it to be, especially at this price point.

review_title: Pretty Useful. Color Gamut could be better. (Edit: Bottom corner does not have enough reinforcement)
review_body: UPDATE 10/7/2015

review_title: Perfect mobile solution for people who need a dual-monitor setup on the go!
review_body: I love this external monitor.  It's light, slim and has decent resolution.  The monitor is hooked up a to a late model MacBook Pro via USB-C.  I work in technology and am often at the client's location for part of the week.  Similar to other reviewers, I work best with a dual-monitor setup - which can be difficult when working at the client location.  This fits the bill perfectly and fits in my bag without a problem.  Additionally, the price point is relatively, so I won't feel devastated if it gets dinged or nicked.  That it comes with a magnetic cover is a nice touch.  Definitely recommend if you're not expecting extra high resolution for graphic type work.  But for programming, Word, PowerPoint/Keynote, I think it's great.

review_title: The screen was actually very good if it's the right fit
review_body: The screen was actually very good if it's the right fit. Trying to use it as a second monitor for viewing videos, not a good fit. Trying to use it as a second monitor to view the 3D Viewer of a DJ/Stage lighting control program? Definitely not a good fit. Sadly, those are 2 of the 4 uses I needed it for, and the most important of the 4 as well. Using for spreadsheets, websites etc as a second monitor did work quite well, as did using it for a second screen to use with a karaoke program. The stand is actually great, very sturdy, the only complaint I had about the screen itself was the resolution, but since it struggled to display video or rendering at 1600x900, 1920x1080 would obviously be impossible. The USB bandwidth just doesn't seem to be large enough for such features.

review_title: Good bargain IPS, but falls short of "Persistent Perfection"
review_body: I got two of these to replace my dying CRT. Here's what I was aiming for, and how they measure up.

review_title: ASUS Rebates Are Not Honored By ASUS - Don't Trust Them
review_body: Dear ASUS,

review_title: A green dot formed.. defect product.
review_body: So far, I love it. I took advantage of the Black Friday deal and ordered one on 27th (After 8pm) but I got it today (29th)!

review_title: Contrast stinks.  Avoid.  Look for something with more honest (non-dynamic) contrast numbers listed.
review_body: I'll try to play around with the settings.  First impressions:  Contrast is TERRIBLE.  I purchased it as a secondary monitor to a 22" Dell I already had.  I can excuse the colors looking different.  That I know I can adjust (once I take the time) to make them more nearly match.  But the contrast... I'm less hopeful that can be helped.  The specific Dell model that it is next to is a Dell P2212H.  Out of the box, after basic contrast adjustment to get the best I can, and slight adjustment to the color settings, it is not even close.  And in this case they are both being run at full resolution.  The Dell is using only a VGA cable.  The Asus is using a DVI-D, which should be better than a basic VGA.  I'm a tad disappointed, but again, I'll play with the colors a bit and try to see if I cannot get it to improve.  Otherwise, I might just return it.

review_title: A fault advertise rebate? Asus is not paying on debate
review_body: I bought this monitor in Dec 14, 2016. It is OK for the price of it after rebate. You got what you pay, so I will not complain for the color is poor. I sent in rebate and was approved on 1/3/17.  Until now I did not get the money pay by master card as they said. I called the number on the website, but only a recorded, no human to talk. I read lots of complain as others had the same issued about the NON rebate. If that is the case, Amazon should not let them advertise a fault rebate make people think they buy a bargain monitor but it is not. If without a debate I would buy a Dell monitor.

review_title: It looks great from straight on
review_body: ASUS 23.6 monitor.  The unit arrived in perfect condition.  I have a dual monitor system with an HP desktop computer. The system had a new HP monitor and a really old second monitor. I wanted the DVI interface to match my existing equipment.  I just unplugged my old monitor and plugged the new monitor into the existing cables.  Everything came up fine.  It took a few minutes to get use to the adjustments but I have the new monitor looking better than the HP monitor.  My only issue with the new monitor is that it looks fine from straight on but the side angle view is not as good.  Since I spend all of my time directly in front of it and since it looks really good from the front, I'm happy.  A power cable, DVI, and VGA cables came with the unit.

review_title: Might be okay if you don't need customer service
review_body: Bought this monitor and a similar Samsung 27-inch monitor. For how I use the monitors (to edit books, surf, and watch movies), the picture on the Samsung is much better, and the controls on the Samsung are FAR more intuitive. This ASUS monitor's controls are all available along the bottom-right of the screen, and it takes some kind of magic to make them work. There's a weird half-screen test mode that lets you see if you like a particular setting, but it gets stuck on. ASUS documentation and customer service were no help. (Thank you to the stranger online who had figured out how to solve the issue and posted the fix, step by step.)

review_title: Good value for the money, easy setup, using for amateur Lightroom/Photoshop work
review_body: I'm using this with my HP Envy LT with a 13" 1920 x 1080 screen, and GeForce GTX 850M GPU for post production LIghtroom/Photoshop, so as you can imagine I needed something larger for the LR/PS work. This monitor won't compare to a 4k system, but then again I'm not shooting 4k. The package arrived promptly and in good order. Set up was easy, though since I ordered an HDMI unit, I thought it would come with an HDMI cable...interestingly DVI and VGA cables are provided with the monitor, but an HDMI cable is not.  So, I had to temporarily steal the HDMI cable from my Roku until I get another; and now I have yet another VGA cable in my junk box. Controls are pretty straightforward, though I'm used to doing it with a remote control.  I searched AVS Forums and found settings a senior member used for a similar ASUS monitor for color correction.  So far I"m happy with the unit. If I'd spent a little more, I probably could've had one with more fine adjustments for color correction, but I'll get that monitor if I go pro.  I took a star off only because of the HDMI cable not being supplied, and that I know there are higher quality monitors out there in this class...but don't pass the ASUS VS247H up if you're on a tight budget, but looking for a decent quality work monitor.

review_title: Not even good, but I guess it's decent for the price.
review_body: It's a decent size 1080p screen that costs less than $130, so I can't be too harsh on this display, but the picture quality here is pretty terrible.

review_title: Fast and beautiful, but only good at a distance.
review_body: I was looking for a monitor that would be good for gaming and good for photo editing. I am not a hardcore gamer and am not too worried about lag, but I wanted to avoid it as much as possible. After purchasing and testing it out I have decided this is not for me. I wasn't sure how much I would like a 27" monitor compared to a 24", but I thought bigger might be better. Unfortunately I have this mount next to my couch so I can play games while my wife watches movies and I must keep it at maximum distance from me for comfortable viewing (far enough that you can't touch it). Something I had read reviews about was the issue with resolution on a 27" screen. They are right. My wife will not use this for photo editing, because of this. Her 15" XPS laptop has a much better screen. Of course after playing on it for a few weeks I have no complaints, but I also don't notice pixels when I'm playing a FPS. Also I have been playing on an LG 60 LED smart TV that has been amazing and this is better in terms of color reproduction, but the TV has a better resolution making everything smoother and slightly less grainy.

I have purchased two of these monitors, and run a dual setup on a windows 10 based desktop, a lot of people complained about back lighting issues, I have not noticed any issues what so ever! I do light weight gaming, a lot with Photoshop and CAD software. If I had the space I would even by a 3rd! the only Draw back is you have to purchase a separate adapter place to mount to a VESA wall/desk mount. Which is listed in the description!

I am a huge fan of the acer brand, have had tons of their other types of monitors and computers. I like the value of their brands, my old acer monitor still works just fine and its over 6yrs old. I bought 2 of these because i want to run duel monitors, and I like the vivid color reproduction of IPS monitors better than TN types. Sure the response time is not as good as TN types, but im not a huge gamer anyway, it will work just fine even in games, some people just like the faster response times that TN panels give. Personally, id rather have the better view angles, and color reproduction of the IPS panels.

Crisp, bright images. No dead pixels. Nice thin bezel makes it very attractive. Plug and play - HDMI connection couldn't be easier. Thought my old Samsung 2253BW was nice, but this is nicer. A pleasure to look at. Menus are straightforward, though tweaking is not required. It's gorgeous straight out of the box. The base is a little funky, but seems quite stable. Overall, a tremendous value, and an excellent choice for most desktop work. I don't think you'll be disappointed.

review_title: Great IPS at a great Price!
review_body: Monitor has a crisp and clean picture, easy to assemble and is 4ms refresh on an IPS panel that's nice! I play a lot of games and it has handled all of the games I play very well, from simulators to FPS to Tank battles on very grassy and hilly graphics. I'm only running an EVGA GeForce GTX 750 Ti 2GB card and it handles the games very well at native resolution 1920x1080. If in the future I need another monitor I will buy another of these.

I like the screen. Its large and does what I am looking for. My only problem is that is shakes a lot. Lets say I am typing, then it will start shaking because my desk is shaking. I also have periods of restless leg syndrome that shake my hands that are on the desk when I am touching the mouse. The vibrations travel though my hands, to the desk, and then to the monitor. Since the monitors stand is a little small for the large size. it just keeps shaking. That annoys me, a lot. Product could have been 5 stars, but since I will forever be annoyed. It gets 3

review_title: Nice Lightweight Monitor With A Clear Image
review_body: Very nice monitor. I specifically got this resolution as it matches that of my laptop, and so, it's basically like a magnifying glass for my screen! The picture is very good, and the light weight of the monitor is a nice feature. I only bought one monitor, but it looks like this would be a good model for side-by-side display (bezel is 3mm by my quick measurement with a ruler.)

review_title: they are beautiful. The screen reaches to nearly the edge of ...
review_body: I purchased two of these monitors and have been very impressed. The stock photos do not do them justice, they are beautiful. The screen reaches to nearly the edge of the screen, leaving a smaller bezel than I was expecting. Image quality is good, and they have a variety of inputs to make it easy to connect to any computer. For the price, I am very impressed. Each monitor comes with the stand, which was simple to install, and a VGA cable and a power cord. These screens for my desktop will make it painful to use  my 15 inch laptop screen! Definitely a good way to make you enjoy your computer experience, whatever you might use it for.

Very disappointed in the lack of longetivity and quality. The monitor functioned well for about 10 months, then started to constantly flicker on and off rendering it useless. I expected better reliability from acer and seeing all of the five star reviews moved me to purchase this display. Hope they improve the longetivity of the display.

review_title: the monitor has the connection ports (VGA and HDMI) I wanted and some nice-to-have features like IPS. Also the price seems reaso
review_body: My monitor needs are basic: I use standard office applications; no gaming, video production, etc. My 7-year Samsung monitor just bit the dust.  I am not a techy, but I am decent at reading and understanding directions and set-up.

review_title: Good screen for the artist on a budget
review_body: Good screen for the price and for the artist on a budget. In my opinion the description its a little confusing as it gives you de idea that the screen goes all the way to edge living you a no frame sensation. In reality, the glass of the screen goes all the way to the edge, but the actual picture/ screen stops 1 inch before the edge , leaving you with a black frame look.

review_title: Pure Junk.......if you need a paperweight, this will work.
review_body: Can't put zero stars, so AOC gets a 1.  Do not buy anything from AOC....their customer support technicians are very poor; they don't take ownership of the defects in quality and performance in the junk they sell.  This item, despite being advertised as being compatible with iOS (MacBook Pro Retina 15-inch running High Sierra v. 10.13.4), doesn't work and all the technician could do was say "I am not a Mac expert".  Shoddy!

review_title: Works with my MacBook Pro even though the included CD has no Mac drivers
review_body: This is really a good deal for the price. The "SONY glossy" look on the screen is better than my dull ASUS laptop screen, and it makes a huge difference for some apps I use that I have the additional screen real estate. I put this monitor on a music stand so I can adjust the height and move it close to me while lounging in my favorite chair with laptop on my tummy. I feel like an air traffic controller in a Barcalounger!

I had high hopes bc of the great price and *some* favorable reviews but this is truly terrible. Don't be like me and hope against hope that the bad reviews are wrong, they most definitely are NOT. For one, after using it for only 30 minutes I had a headache from the extreme blue light. When I tried to figure out how to turn down the brightness, I went down a rabbit hole of all kinds of different plug-ins and apps and none of them worked. On top of that, after I downloaded one such app, the monitor stopped working with my mac altogether. I even went so far as to buy a powered usb hub in case it was a power issue but it was not.

I realize there are some so-so reviews of the AOC 1601 FWUX usb-c monitor, especially with MacBook Pros, but I’ve got to say, I plugged it in and it was immediately recognized. To use portrait mode all I had to do was use the monitor setup in System Preferences and rotate it 90 degrees. Works like a champ. No, it doesn’t auto rotate, but this is simple. I had no problem with the cover/stand for portrait mode.

review_title: Right Price for a Specific Need / Not So Thin
review_body: This USB 3.0 monitor works as advertised, plug it in and it works.  The reason for the low score is the build quality and the description of "ultra-thin" being questionable and also the viewing angles.  It's all plastic with the exception of a built-in metal (I think) stand.  It is a lot cheaper than the other USB monitors. I question it's travel worthiness unless protected very well.  If you need this for an extra screen for programing, web pages,  or email it would work just fine.  For presentations, detailed work or gaming I would upgrade to the MB169B+ from ASUS.

Good resolution, and nice look.  I wouldn't call it ultra slim because it's rounded edges are actually too thick to fit in any of the standard side clip mounts, but the built in stand has worked fine so far.  Another word of warning is that the software that comes with it has an outdated driver that wont work with windows 10, but all you have to do is go online and get the updated driver (search for the software company's website, as the link on the monitor manufactures website is outdated as well). Would've given 4 stars if it had come with the most updated software instead of my having to search for it.

This is the best laptop accessory that I have! I travel for work and bring this everywhere with me.  It is plug and play - never had any issues with it ... worked straight out of the box as advertised.  I love that you are able to turn it to either portrait or landscape without changing any settings - just rotate the screen.  It works just like a phone!  It also has its own icon in the tray so that the display can be set to extend to left, right, top, bottom, mirror, main display or off without having to go to your DISPLAY settings.  I had to set up 2 additional monitors for our home desktop and it was such a pain.  I was tempted to buy two more of these screens to use at home.  But we already had the other monitors which I still cannot get to display with the resolution that I want.

review_title: A perfect travel companion for your laptop or tablet.
review_body: I couldn't be happier with this product. It works great on my Surface Pro 2 and my Dell M6800. I have used it on several business trips to have dual monitors without having to lug around an expensive and heavy monitor. This AOC 16in monitor fits easily into my laptop bag or laptop rolling case, which ever I travel with that day. The kick stand allows a great angle to work at. Since using this for a month or so, I have had at least a half dozen friends purchase one too. No complaints from anyone. I have also had a couple of other friends opt for a more expensive model that gives a higher resolution as the Optimum Resolution for this unit is only 1366 x 768 @60Hz. For me 1366 x 768 is perfect for internet browsing, twitter, email, or even working in the MS Office Suite. For anything that required a super high resolution I would use my primary display. If you use this for what it is for, a travel companion to expand your desktop to, you will love it. For those yanking on it for limited resolution, this isn't meant to be a primary all the time monitor. For travel, and for the price, you simply can't beat it.
This item has been wonderful so far.

review_title: Easy setup, good display, sometimes lag
review_body: The stand and cords are great. It's got good color and sharpness, with even illumination. On my modern laptop, I only need to plug in one of the USB plugs for both power and data. I have had display issues with lag, though not consistently. Sometimes if I move the mouse from integrated display to this one, it slows down. Make sure you update your DisplayLink drivers as I think that has helped (time will tell). Biggest complaint is lack of brightness controls, though it supports Night Light in Windows 10. It responds to DDC/CI commands (search for DisplayLink DDC brightness) so there are 3rd party utilities that can control color/contrast/brightness. Overall, recommended

review_title: BEST purchase decision I have made after making the mistake of purchasing an Acer
review_body: I originally purchased the

The monitor performed flawlessly. No dead or stuck pixels, good color balance out of the box and only minor tweaking. Assembly is pretty trivial, and it works well in sunlight and office lighting. The color seems to be much more angle sensitive than the intensity, but it's tolerable since as I monitor I'm always right in front of it. The stand is fine and reasonably solid, but it isn't terribly adjustable. I do some gaming (Skyrim, Battlefield 4, Diablo III) on this at the highest settings at maxed out frame rates and I have no complaints about the colors or performance. The bottom line is that with a reasonable video card you can do most everything except be a professional gamer and feel comfortable with this monitor.

review_title: When you think Asus couldn't do gamers any better, my god they do
review_body: When you think Asus couldn't do gamers any better, my god they do ! Hands down this moniter is beautiful ! The colors are rich and the screen is nice and bright ! The 1ms response time dramatically cut down almost to 0 when it comes to "ghosting" which is extremely useful for those who play fast paced games like league of legends and or Call Of Duty.

review_title: Gamers and movie watchers, read this review!
review_body: Reviewing this product so far is difficult as we just received it this morning. This monitor out of box is beautiful, came fully equipped with a nice stand as shown, comes with two cable choices and has quality picture. Also, unlike the computer screen we've been looking at, when I am at an angle, because of the IPS factor, I can see the picture clear as if I were right in front of it. its 23 inches (which looks surprisingly large) 5MS which is great for games and movies and entertainment, high quality and just all-around great purchase. Asus is a reputable brand too, which influenced our decision. If you know your videogames, 7 Days To Die plays on ultra amazing high graphic settings up around 90 frames per second, constantly. (you can look this up if you don't know the game but would like a reference.)

I bought another one recently after having purchased the same monitor from another retailer, last year. Needed 2 monitors for programming and photography. I currently have both monitors on a vesa compatible dual monitor desk clamp by Halter, also available on amazon.

review_title: and in case you're lost like I was when I started looking
review_body: I purchased this monitor based on features, and in case you're lost like I was when I started looking....
would not work with sony dvd. picture flashes on and off

review_title: Great monitor at a very good price
review_body: Great monitor at a very good price.  This is my third purchase of this monitor.  I bought one for my parents who were still using a monitor the size of a postage stamp.  I bought another for my husband when his monitor died and most recently treated myself to a new monitor when I built a new rig for myself.  All TERRIFIC!  Sorry, I don't have a pic, but it is "as advertised".  The only complaint I have is that I am still trying to get my rebate from ASUS.  They are still saying it's "on the way" but it has been far longer than the time frame I was originally given.  It is only $20, but it is the principle.  If I ever receive it, I will update this post.  Fingers crossed. :)

I had purchased one for work a few months ago and again via Amazon Prime Now this week. I have been partial to Samsung TV's until I recently looked at a new Sharp Aquos and then for monitors I have also been partial to Samsung, but at the time it was a face off between an Asus and ViewSonic as I was not happy with the Samsung offerings..... Side by side the Asus was just more consistent for me, so that is what I stuck with and have been happy.

review_title: and it worked like a dream
review_body: I've had this monitor for almost 4 years. It was one of the first HD monitors that I ever owned, and it worked like a dream, and still does. The reason why I give this monitor 3 stars is due to the fact that around 2 years ago it no longer was recognized as an ASUS monitor to my computer. Instead, it was recognized as a Generic Non-PnP Monitor. This caused resolution issues with the HDMI port not being able to display the monitor's native 1920x1080 resolution and bumped it down to 1024x728. Unfortunately, there is no fix for the resolution issue since there isn't any drivers for this particular model of monitor, and no bypass. I've spent countless hours trying to solve this issue but to no avail. However, using the VGA port solved this issue, but it would've been nice use the HDMI.

review_title: THIS ACER IS AWESOME AND PERFECT!!!!
review_body: I'm going to keep this simple for those who love to read lots of reviews.  This is the perfect monitor and I have absolutely no cons or negative things to say about it.  I am not a gamer at all but this not the "TV" I use to watch movies or shows on; but the picture quality is brilliant!!!  I use this monitor for my PC and MAC and I am going to order a second monitor in the next few days!!!

review_title: I ain't afraid of no ghost.
review_body: The only problem I've had is with the button strip along the bottom.  If this monitor is in a cold area the casings around the buttons will contract and cause them to activate, causing a well-known bug where the menu keeps popping up like there's a ghost in the machine.  I solved this by removing the button strip so it's outside the casing of the monitor where I taped it to the bottom, thus removing the phenomenon.

I was searching around for a monitor to use with my 2016 MacBook Pro. Didn't want to pay a lot either. After getting this, it was super easy to put together and use. I am super pleased with it. Now, my eyes can get a break. Picture is very good, colors and sharpness very good. I use my USB-C to HDMI hook up. Great buy.

review_title: Very Satisfied with this purchase and the product.
review_body: Just received and installed two of these puppies on one PC after returning the (un-named) copy cats. These are better. Basically the same monitor except these have DVI inputs in addition to HDMI and VGA. I was very disturbed to learn that there just are not any graphics cards out there that have dual HDMI outputs and any type of converter is really expensive. These monitor are tool-less assembly, good, power supply in the middle of the cord, good, not a wall wart blocking the outlets. The same bezel-less design as the copy-cat's. The don't have height adjustment, but at $130 what do you expect. FYI they are the correct height for my use. These will be my monitors for several years to come.

review_title: bright and love having no bezels
review_body: It appears to be what I needed, crisp, bright and love having no bezels.  Reason I only gave it 3 stars is the owners manual, or I should say the lack of one that's useful.  Basically shows how to assemble it but nothing on the controls and there use.  You have to have excellent feeling in your finger tips to be able to count the unmarked control buttons underneath that you can't see.

Great monitor for the price.  Great resolution and color rendition. Having HDMI, DVI, and VGA ports is handy. Supplied VGA cable is a nice touch even if a bit out dated. One downside is that the supplied mounting base is non adjustable. No height or tilt adjustment. No mounting holes for third party mounting.  You will need to buy an adapter if you don't like the rather low and vertical only base mount and want to mount it on a stand etc.

review_title: Monitor stopped working after a couple months and now the screen remains black when powered on.
review_body: Monitor stopped working after a couple months and now the screen remains black when powered on. Disappointed, will not be purchasing products from the Acer brand again.

Colors and brightness are perfect for me. I am a digital artist and this monitor is pretty decent for its price point. I love that the screen goes so far to the edge of the monitor. Mine arrived without any defect, and I don't notice any huge color shift/bleed/etc. Maybe if you watch a lot of dark movies, that would be an issue, but it's an unavoidable part of this type of monitor anyway.

review_title: No glare and low profile borders
review_body: This is a great monitor that looks great, with its low profile borders. I like that it turns on and off automatically, so I don't have to worry about remembering to it off when I leave work.

review_title: I bought Acer R240HY 23. 8 inch on Feb ...
review_body: I bought Acer R240HY 23.8 inch on Feb. 2, 2018.  Few days after the return period ended (after March 3, 2018) it started to display blurry text and images. It is an intermittent fault, so I have to switch the monitor off, to get back to normal images.  I use it for writing text documents and this kind of blurry text that  this monitor displays huts my eyes. I do not know what to do, except to replace it with another monitor.  Do not buy this type as it is unreliable.  My previous monitor lasted 10 years, so I consider this one as a lemon.

review_title: No adapaters required.  Great way to add additional monitors with ease and excellent for travel.....
review_body: I have two of these usb monitors, one first generation, one second generation (this model).  I word from home in software application support and one of these is dedicated to Microsoft Outlook and the other for Microsoft Lync.  Having a monitor dedicated for internal communications is the way to go, because the instant message windows won't pop up in the front of your work and get in the way.  Not to mention, they are super portable, light and thin, and great for adding a 2nd and/or 3rd monitor when you have to travel with a makeshift workstation.  If you're like me, working from a singe laptop monitor is awful.  I have travelled with these monitors several times and they seem to be nice and tough, and as I said, don't add much weight to my pack.
I wanted this to work so badly.
I was really excited to find this monitor as I work remotely and this would make working from any location much more convenient.

review_title: Unpack from box, plug into laptop, done!
review_body: Exactly what I was looking for.  I live in the US but going to be in Italy cooped up in a media room for 15 days, working 15-hour days the whole time, staring at my screen, powering through Excel spreadsheets.  I worried my laptop's screen will ruin my eyes, and the squareness of my laptop's screen has never been great for working in spreadsheets, which is why I work daily on my giant 21" screen.  But how to save my eyes overseas when you must pack light?  This screen is perfect.  Actual measurements are 16" wide by 10" high, with the screen being 15" x 8.5".  And the whole thing is 1/2" thick, even with the stand, which tucks into the plastic but pulls out to be a stand like a picture frame.

review_title: A product that works, but may not be that robust
review_body: UPDATE: my old review is still accurate about the product when functional, but after just a few months of light use the screen has cracked internally. I always keep it in its protective case when not in use, and there is no visible external damage, but the screen has cracked internally and is now unusable. I just submitted an RMA today and hopefully they will resolve the issue, but I'll post an update and adjust my star rating either way based on their customer service.

review_title: but it works great on my windows 10 asus laptop
review_body: I haven't used this as much as I wanted to yet, but it works great on my windows 10 asus laptop. The displays and bezels on my laptop screen and this monitor are almost identical in color and style and it sits at the exact same height, which was a nice bonus. My co-worker saw it and needed to have one and said there is no way to adjust the brightness, which I found difficult to believe, but I didn't feel the need to do that as of yet. It's also very slim and fits right into my laptop bag without noticing it much. Not have needing a power supply for it is also a huge bonus, though I am imagining if your laptop is not plugged in, it probably takes a hefty told on your battery. Anyway, a solid monitor for a solid price.

review_title: Decent offering with some major flaws
review_body: This is an interesting solution for adding a monitor, with its main advantage being portability. Overall, one is better off buying a real monitor that connects via DisplayPort/HDMI/DVI. You will have a better experience that way. I used this with a Z87 motherboard with Intel USB 3.0 ports and Windows 7 Ultimate 64-bit. The pros and cons are as follows...

Best thing ever!!! Works well, plug and play on newer laptops and uses 1 USB port. Install software on older ones and uses both USBs on older ones. I have three laptops and it works on them all!!! It does drain battery but not much. Try to be plugged in if you can and if not, just monitor your power level.

review_title: It's ok, but not the best software.
review_body: The screen is pretty good, but make sure you know what you are getting. The colors are washed out and setting next to my ThinkPad, it is not the greatest picture. The cable it came with is pretty short - it would have been nice to have gotten a longer USB cable. I like the automatic screen orientation - it makes putting it into landscape and reading documents really easy.
Works great, I have it when I undock my work laptop from my two nice monitors.  I run a VPN on each to different company networks so I need two monitors.

review_title: Quality, price, reliability, specs all make this a no-brainer
review_body: I upgraded to dual 24's and love it. So much room its overkill. You probably won't need anything bigger. I used a separate screen mount. The monitors came well packed and setup easily, just make sure you get the correct connection for your needs. I needed DVI as I had a computer with DVI outputs only. Like everyone said, the initial brightness setting will cause blindness, adjust that first. Mine have been great. I'm not a expert but they are for the money great monitors and well spec'd . Asus seems to be a good brand and worth buying quality. The rebate that was in effect when I bought it helped seal the deal as well. Been using a few months nearly constantly and zero issues.
Pros:

review_title: Its been sturdy and put through plenty of abuse and hard use
review_body: I just bought this again.  This is my 3rd purchase of this model.  I wanted to keep all my monitors uniform.  The first one I bought about 3 yrs ago.  Its been sturdy and put through plenty of abuse and hard use.  I'm writing this on my first monitor of this model now.  There are better monitors and this model is a bit dated, still for the price I am happy.  When I first bought this ASUS VS248H-P I was replacing a LG  that lasted just over a yr.

review_title: Hazy picture no matter the settings on top of other issues
review_body: Not sure how to reconcile all the positive reviews with my experience of seeing a dull picture when doing basic office work in Windows 10. Perhaps it looks good for video/game playback but for day-to-day applications, no matter what you do with the settings, the picture quality is severely bad. It is as if the monitor had a layer of dust built in with screens coming across depressingly gloomy. The lack of brightness and color are the only things that pop on this monitor. Other grievances, which on top of the picture quality issues beg the question as to what the people who like this monitor are smoking, are gimmicky/useless scene modes and the menu/buttons which had to have been designed to showcase the Asus dinosaur hardware engineers' UI design skills.

I decided to go with this monitor over any other mostly because of the price and size. Wanted something that wasn't too expensive, a good size, and that was actually enjoyable to play games on. Pleasantly surprised with the quality.

This ASUS monitor works as expected in every way except that there is a bright spot (almost white) on the right side of the screen from top to bottom about a quarter-inch wide.  My computer is NOT producing this spot (a desktop background) as all other monitors I have connected it to do not have it.  Sounds like a manufacturing problem to me.

review_title: nice ips screen , vesa mount may need 12mm screws though...
review_body: Nice IPS monitor for the price. It does have a vesa back for arm or wall mounting..however I did need to use longer screws because of the plastic on the back is not recessed like most vesa backplates... this caused the normal M4x10mm not to be long enough I had to use M4x12mm to connect it to my monitor arm properly.... so if you going to hook it to an arm or wall plate you ' may ' need to pickup 12mm screws ... other than thumbs up.

I upgraded to this from my old 2001 Samsung 19" LCD. As you might have guessed going from a 14 year old 19" TN LCD to a new 23" IPS LCD showed some big changes. At first the colors did not look right so I did a calibration with AVSHD 709. The colors still looked strange but side by side I could see how limited the old TN LCD was when it came to color accuracy.

I found the display brightness to be too much and have it dialed down ALL THE WAY to zero using the menu.  Colors are a bit off too (dialed down BLUE intensity for some warmth) but I can live with it.  Had to tinker to get the computer and monitor display in sync also.  I use the VGA port interface.  My old monitor (Sceptre) had better color but it bit the dust.  At this point, I have the color and brightness set at tolerable levels, but I also miss my old monitor.  Instructions on how to make adjustments are poor.  I can live with this though.

review_title: I have 3 of their monitors and they have been perfect for me
review_body: I have been a fan of ASUS for years now! I have 3 of their monitors and they have been perfect for me. I have the 24 inch, this monitor and a 19 inch display. These monitors are amazing! Crisp picture and easy set up are one of the great things these monitors have in common. I have had two of the monitors for 3 years and they are still going strong. You are not going to be disappointed!

review_title: but the price was very good and, well
review_body: I was apprehensive when purchasing two of these monitors.  I hadn't heard of Acer, but the price was very good and, well...it's Amazon, I could always ship it back.  I was surprised when I set them up side by side.  The clarity was amazing and for the price even better!  I would recommend to anyone.

I liked this monitor to begin with, but after a couple of months the on-screen display started popping up on it's own & cycles through all the different settings endlessly. Resetting it doesn't help & none of the buttons are physically stuck. It's pretty much unusable at this point. I wouldn't recommend this monitor to anyone.

Exactly what I needed. It's worth spending a of couple bucks more for this quality. Great design! At first I was hesitant about the wall wart (transformer), as the Asus has the power supply built in. The Acer advantage is that the monitor is slimmer, and the disadvantage is that you've got a wall wart using a trickle of power even when the unit is turned off. (I have a separate switching system for my computer, so this wasn't a big issue.) They use wall warts to save money by making exporting to foreign countries simpler.

I absolutely love this monitor! People can argue it's not meant for gaming, and well they're mostly right. If you've got a nice graphics card like I do (GTX 1070 or above) I'd look for a 1440p monitor...however if you're also like me and don't mind about gaming at 1080p to get a start, this is perfect! The picture quality is great! All the colors are nice and vibrant. My only gripe is the menu on this monitor is a little goofy and takes some getting used to. Once I get a different "gaming monitor" in the future, this will make a great back up/2nd monitor!

review_title: Everything is working terrific! The monitor has very good display and is ...
review_body: This was part of the system of my new computer I had built.  Everything is working terrific!  The monitor has very good display and is nice and stable on my desk.  Very narrow frame which is nice.  Upon my son's advice I replaced the cable this had with DVI-D Single-Link 18-pin Male to DVI-D Single-Link 18-pin Male and got immediate improvement in the display sharpness and detail.  Could have lived with the original cable, but appreciate the upgrade.

review_title: Great monitor for work, satisfactory monitor for gaming.
review_body: Great monitor. I mostly use it for office work, so I needed a crisp display that wouldn't give me eye fatigue (or more than is necessary) and that was wide enough to let me see multiple documents at once. It does that very well. In fact, I prefer this monitor to my double-screen set up in my work office, since this screen is so crisp and bright! Plus, I've been able to play some FPS gaming on this monitor without a noticeable difference from playing on my laptop.

review_title: Great basic monitor for the price.
review_body: Not a gamer, this review is from an individual using it for office programs, business uses and light office work.  The monitor is a nice size for the price.  The picture is clear.  It is no where as sharp as my sons super duper gaming monitor, but it is a definite upgrade from my old 21 in backlit monitor that I had for years and years.

Deeply impressed with the quality of this screen. I discovered Acer quality not too long ago so I had quite a bit of faith when I purchased this monitor as my third monitor. After a year of use, I haven't met with any disappointment. As for picture quality it competes with their higher end line of monitors.

The Acer R240HY Display was fantastic for the time that it lasted. Within 1 year of purchase however the display failed and began flickering disastrously. Acer warranty coverage is practically non-existent and their customer service is atrocious. Will NEVER buy acer again after trying to fill out their "self-service repair form" which appears to be intentionally convoluted and even intentionally non-responsive to most browsers to deter users from filing warranties. 11/10 would not buy again...

review_title: Both look and work great. Colors are very clear
review_body: Got 2 of these. Use them for video editing, gaming, and audio recording. Both look and work great. Colors are very clear.
Love this monitor.  BUT I ONLY JUST RECEIVED IT.  This review is being posted on 3-27-17.

review_title: Best Form Factor in Its Segment
review_body: I have the LT1421 monitor also and prefer the display on that as the text read more crisp. I use them with my OS 10.9.2 MacBook 2011 15" and works with the DisplayLink drivers (which can be downloaded on their website). I got this monitor because I could make it stand in portrait for reading legal docs. The AOC angles and reading text really need to be improved. The angles are so bad it actually strains my eyes and often find myself moving my head around trying to find a comfortable perspective. Non-rendered text in PDF are really dark which can be improved by lowering the resolution, but will have less data on a given time glance.

review_title: 17" version is much better than the 16" one
review_body: I have both the 16" and 17" versions, and the 17" is much better working with my Surface Pro 4. For instance, when I open a browser, the web page automatically appears on this 17" AOC display, whereas with the 16" one, I have to drag the page there, and the drag itself is quite troublesome, often jumping back by itself. Also, the 17" one is truly plug and play, hitting the ground running immediately when plugged into Surface Pro 4, even for the 1st time. While the 16" can also plug and play, it has encountered problems, which were only resolved after I installed the driver from the included disk (I have to buy an external disk player for that purpose, for Surface Pro doesn't have a DVD drive). The picture quality on both displays are very good to my eyes, even though not as good as Surface Pro 4.  The only improvement I wish AOC to make is to make a groove around the back to store the cable flush, while fixing the proprietary end of the cable on the display (no point removing it if it can be stored flush on the back).

review_title: More difficult to use with a Mac than anticipated...
review_body: I'm giving this 4 stars because I think it's one of the best options for what it is, but it is not perfect.  If you have a Mac, this will technically work, but it is a pain.  I had to track down a driver (which I could NOT find on the website), and finally found one that worked.  But, it will NOT auto-rotate with my Mac (which is annoying).  So, I had to figure out how to manually rotate it in my settings.  It took a while, but I figured it out and can now use it in both aspects.

review_title: Great Second Monitor for the Business Traveler Needing to Keep Things Small
review_body: Another review I read complained about the screen clarity. If you're buying this to do photographic editing, gaming or other applications where you require a crystal clear screen with lots of resolution, don't buy it. If you're needs are for a compact second monitor to take care of email, web browsing and business apps while traveling, you're in luck. This monitor is perfect for that need. It is extremely compact, it was very simple to set up and I am confident it will serve my business needs. After reading that review, my expectations were low. This second monitor easily exceeded those expectations.

review_title: I love how this monitor uses only 1 USB port
review_body: Just received the monitor. Using it with my work 14" laptop. I wanted a monitor that I could move around with out much fuss (cables and ac adapter). I love how this monitor uses only 1 USB port. I was skeptical but when I first tried the monitor but it turned right on after I downloaded the drivers from AOC support website and installed those drivers. After that it was just plug in the monitor into an open USB port and use it! It doesn't have an on/off switch but one is not needed, just unplug the USB cable. I did not notice any lag (some reviews said there was a lag) while using the monitor all day and I only have USB 2.0. The monitor doesn't weight much and right now I have it up against my 14" monitor on my laptop and that was I can still use my laptop keyboard and mouse. So it's like my 14" laptop now has a 17.3" screen! Also, I am using it as my one and only screen. You can set it up with dual screen but the size of this I only need to use this monitor. Also, if you turn the monitor portrait it will automatically turn your windows display (like most cell phones do now). I am using Windows 7 Professional.

This is not a perfect monitor, but it is really a great option for having a second monitor while travelling.  It is true that it does not have a wide angle of view -- really, it's quite narrow.  But it's certainly better than having no external monitor at all while on the road.  For me, the set-up went smoothly; the auto-rotate works great; and the monitor is thin and light for easy portability.  I use this with a Surface Pro 3.  When plugged in, SP3 will power this monitor though a USB3 connection.  However, when the SP3 is itself running on its battery, it will not power this monitor through the USB3 port alone.  However, it will do so if you connect the power prong of the AOC monitor's USB3 Y cable  to an external battery.  So, this monitor is fully usable with a SP3 even when you need to be unplugged because there is no AC power source available.  As for room for improvement, I'd like the monitor to have a higher pixel density.  More importantly, I'd like AOC, or someone, to make one of these USB monitors with a 3:2 aspect ratio, instead of the 16:9 that it has, like the Surface Pro 3 and 4, and like the many clones of the Surface line that other computer manufacturers are now putting out.
I waited to review this until I had used it enough to be sure how I liked it.

review_title: The monitor itself is great - it just doesn't seem to be well made
review_body: I've had this monitor in use for less than 2 months.  From day 1, the end of the cable that plugs into the monitor has been loose - often falling out simply while sitting there in use.  Since I didn't want to be without it, I opted to put up with it.  Unfortunately, now it doesn't even recognize that it's plugged in.  When I contacted customer service they said that this is a known issue.  I see that others have had similar problems.  Seems that they need to either improve the production of the monitors or implement a quality check before they go out the door.  Unfortunately, I'm without it now for approximately 2 weeks while it's mailed in (at my expense) to them for repair and then returned to me.  Fingers crossed the fix works and lasts.  The monitor itself is great - it just doesn't seem to be well made.l

review_title: You might not be happy with the screen resolution.
review_body: First of all this monitor is THICK. like almost an inch at it's center. I connected it to a Microsoft Surface Pro 4. While it worked, I wasn't happy with the resolution and image quality. It was probably state-of-the-art five years ago but 1366 x 768 is distinctly 2010 technology. Put another way, it would also look just fine if you connected it to your standard $379 notebook PC.  Hard on the eyes when set up next to the Surface Pro 4. On the plus side, the stand is very nicely designed an integrated into the monitor, I had little trouble getting it to work and the price wasn't bad. I just think you might want to spend a little more for better resolution.

I am not an online game player, nor a gambler.  A simple and functional work station with multiple screens would serve my purposes well.  One of my HP monitors went black on me the other day.  As I shopped for a replacement, I found this one, and decide to give a try.  One of the most important factors aside from picture quality is VESA compliant so that I can mount the monitor along with others of mine.  Buying an adapter, which cost as much as a desk mount itself, is not cost effective, nor make any business sense.

review_title: Excellent monitor for gaming after adjusting the factory settings
review_body: I bought this monitor to upgrade from an ASUS 24" monitor that I bought about five years ago (which is still going strong).

review_title: 4.8 out of 5.  LOVE this monitor even compared to my benq zowie.
review_body: I love this monitor right out of the box.  I owned a benq zowie 24" and while I did like it, it was too bright.  I played around with the settings ALOT, even using other people's setting recomendations from you tube.  I primarily play destiny.  the pvp has alot of color flashing and effects goin on.  the flashing on the monitor would make it so you couldnt see whats goin on when someone is shooting you.  I know its kind of designed that way, but I played on a vizio tv on the gaming setting and never had a problem with it for 2 years prior.

review_title: Don't buy if you plan to use it for long sessions.
review_body: I'm returning this monitor or selling it as used.

review_title: A good choice for photo editing
review_body: I do a lot of photo editing. It's not uncommon for a single uninterrupted session to last over two hours. There are a lot of monitors out there of this size that are less expensive, or have more features (speakers, USB hubs, etc), but they may fatigue your eyes more rapidly than this unit. The contrast and quality of the image is a noticeable improvement over the 22" Dell monitor I use for work. The controls on the bezel are simple, though not that quick, for making adjustments to contrast and color and brightness. The brightness and sharpness of the image hardly changes even at extreme viewing angles.

This was the perfect monitor I needed to set up my 2-screen PC. I already had a 22-inch ASUS with internal speakers so I didn’t need another one with speakers. I use my computer for work-related issues (documents, spreadsheets, etc), to surf the web, check my e-mail. If you are a professional photographer, movie maker or something requiring super-high quality resolution, my review might not be of such an interest to you.

What an amazing monitor. I bought this monitor as a second mo itor for my gaming setup and I have to say, I am well pleased with my purchase. The monitor gives a nice, crisp image of what you are viewing, with no blurryness or dead pixels. I use the monitor for gaming and watching youtube mainly and It does the job very well. Now its no 400 dollar gaming monitor, but this monitor gives a great picture with a good amount of brightness for this price range. You really cant beat the price for what you get. I would buy this in a hearbeat if ai needed another monitor, which I might just do if I get another video card for my computer. Must buy

review_title: Your battlestation isn't even ready for this upgrade.
review_body: Or maybe it's long overdue!

review_title: The copy I received had poor picture quality
review_body: I ordered this because I was frustrated with the Samsung U28D590D 4K monitor I had recently received.  Not because it's a bad display, but because it refuses to work correctly with DPMS (power management) and Samsung customer support is lacking.  Instead I returned this ASUS monitor the same day I received it because the picture quality was very poor compared to every other monitor I use.  At work I use at least five different 24" Dell monitors every day.  For the last seven years I've used a 24" iMac at home.  I just recently built a new computer and got the Samsung 4K monitor.  All of them have far superior picture quality to this ASUS monitor.  I even have a 10+ year old Dell FPW2005 I use for my surveillance system and it has better picture.  I have to assume I got a bad copy because on the average this monitor gets very good reviews from a very large number of people.  Viewing angle was also very limited.

review_title: Side-by-side, I like the VN-series better
review_body: I purchased this because I already have a VN247H-P and I thought that it would be close enough for a workable dual-monitor setup using a GTX 980. First, the monitor bezel is much larger than the VN-series, roughly two to three times as thick. This is very noticeable in a side-by-side configuration, particularly since the VN-series has such a thin bezel. Second, the monitor is brighter than the VN-series when looking at the exact same image, but the contrast is significantly worse. Black is much more gray on this monitor. The final major difference is that the cables plug straight back into the monitor, where on the VN-series they are down, allowing for much less rear clearance. Since this is not my primary monitor, I am happy using it next to the VN-series, and by itself it would look perfectly fine, but in a direct side-by-side comparison there is a reason that I had paid more for the VN-series monitor and I wish my local electronics store had still carried them. When being driven by exactly the same video card using digital outputs, I prefer the slightly dimmer VN-series with a better perceived contrast ratio. In the end it is acceptable, but in retrospect I should have purchased another VN247H-P.

I am very pleased with this monitor. Bright display, good brilliance, clear contrast, vibrant colors. Great size for standard desk top application. Is nice to hold a couple of applications concurrently at sizes that are very functional. Has 1 HDMI port. Very thin and light so east to move around work station. I have used Acer and trust them, this monitor is no exception. I do recommend.

review_title: You get what you pay for.
review_body: Picked this up as a spare external monitor for work stuff when my work-issued one died on me.  Cheaply made, but works well enough.  Base doesn't line up properly - monitor was skewed and out of level.  This could just be user error.  There was nothing in the directions on how to fasten the base to the monitor.  But at least the directions were finally good for something.  You can see them in the picture folded up under the base on the left side to get the monitor level.  I'll have to come up with something a bit more permanent when I get the chance.

review_title: A nice monitor for the price
review_body: A nice monitor for the price!  My old 17-inch monitor was getting hard for my old eyes to view, so I got this nice, big monitor.  I really enjoy it and the screen seems crisp and clear. Of course, that is compared to a four-year-old, 17-inch monitor so, it had well ought to be! :)

beautiful monitor, nice image, sleek design. I would have given it 1 more star if it came with an HDMI cable. who uses VGA? my grandpa would throw a VGA cable in the garbage, right after he told it a story about Nam.

review_title: Dual Monitor set up, all three cables
review_body: I purchased 2 monitors for a dual desktop experience. These monitors were easy to set up and look great! There are a few reviews that state is doesn't come with all 3 types of cables (HDMI, VGA and DVI) however mine did. I turned them on set up my display and was up and working in about 15 minutes.
Purchased as a replacement for a family member.  I've heard not one complaint.
One of the best purchases I have made in a while.  Brighter, clearer, crisper than my monitor at my office and much easier to do side by side viewing of programs running in tandem.

I don't qualify as a real discriminating user. The monitor works fine. I had to check if my computer had an HDMI output. When I plugged it in, I discovered that I had the Microsoft dual monitor setup. This was a true and pleasant surprise. In the past in order to run 2 monitors I had to purchase a special video card. My Lenovo computer treated the monitor plugged into the video out port and the one connected to the HDMI port as 2 separate displays. I really expected that they would each display the same thing. I found nothing to dislike about the monitor, but I love the dual display.
Got it for my son (college apt) and since he hasn't complain, it must be good :)  The delivery was kind of weird since it took longer than promised and it may be due to the area he was living at.

review_title: Delivered Jan 26, 2018 by April (just past the ...
review_body: Delivered Jan 26, 2018 by April (just past the return window) it starts over heating and blinking off. Acer will only allow me to send it in for repairs at my expense, no returns. Since I can not be without my monitor for the time this will take to repair, I have had to purchase another monitor to use while waiting. In light of the customer service I received on this new monitor, it was not an Acer.

This product isn’t ready for market, and AOC customer service isn’t ready for anything.  I got this monitor to work once.  It didn’t at first, then it did, then it never did again.  I’m using it with a brand new top-of-the-line HP Spectre x360.  Sometimes it could recognize the monitor; most times not.  Research online suggests that this monitor doesn’t play well with a lot of laptops, including higher-end mainstream ones.  So you’re basically taking a crap shoot when you buy.

I wasn't sure what to expect, especially since I bought this for my work desk where I have a laptop (with an underpowered video card) with two external monitors already. I plugged it in and it turned on and Windows 10 immediately extended my desktop. No driver installation, no configuration. While I wasn't sure what to expect, I certainly wasn't expecting such ease of setup.

review_title: Product - 4 stars, but AOC customer service is really lacking.
review_body: First, I want to say that this monitor, while it still worked, did its job with no real issues. The two annoyances were: 1) not full HD resolution but the lower price made up for that, and 2) the cable connection is loose/flimsy on the monitor (note, it is not a USB to some other standard port but rather USB to something more proprietary).

review_title: Very good, a few minor considerations for Mac, high pitched buzzing sound
review_body: Overall a very good product, very good for doing coding or general application work on the go. I use this both on Windows and Mac.
I tried three other monitors. This is my favorite because it's very portable. Specifically, the stand is built into the back, only one cord, and it's fairly light. Also came with a decent soft cover.
The image quality of the monitor is very good. :-)  You can't adjust any of the colors :-(

With the USB-C model there are no drivers to install (as you would expect for DisplayPort alt mode over USB-C). Plugged it in, and immediately came on and looked fantastic. Does require a manual settings change to go from landscape to portrait.

I have had a total of 3 of these monitors and I couldn't be happier with them.  My first monitor broke when I dropped it while unpacking my suitcase.  I love how light-weight the monitor is and I use it whenever I travel for work so that I'm still able to extend my desktop when I'm away from my office desk.

review_title: Perfect for travel and office too.
review_body: It's perfect for me for travel and office.  I've owned the 1649, which has been banging around in my backpack for about 3 years, until it finally gave up the ghost.  I just replaced it with the 1659.  I travel a fair amount and this is light-weight and fairly compact.  This has a few of minor improvements over the 1649, which I like:  I'm tall, and the screen angle is better - I no longer have to prop a book under the front edge.  It now comes with a protective foam sleeve.  The jack for the USB cable now aims flat against the back of the monitor instead of sticking straight out.

review_title: Can't go back to not having this
review_body: I gave this to my husband last year, father's day. He loves it!! It's been 9 months and the monitor is doing well.

review_title: Dual Asus Monitors are the way to go.
review_body: I recently purchased all of the pieces to build my own computer for business and gaming purposes. I bought two of these ASUS monitors and I can say that I have been overly pleased with them. I will rate this monitor based on display, design, gaming performance, and price.

I bought this monitor largely on the basis of Amazon's "Best Seller" rating. Several other monitors seemed to enjoy comparable customer favor, but I went ahead and chose the Asus. I also have a Dell 24 inch monitor and oddly enough, the Asus at 23.6 inches seems slightly larger! I have measured both but the Asus continues to look a bit larger in screen area. This may be due to the Asus monitor having a brighter picture generally.

review_title: Terrible Monitor - This is not the same monitor that ASUS used to sell under this product Number
review_body: After reading the reviews and seeing the product in person I was excited to get this monitor.  When i received I was very disappointed as it is very washed out and bright and the settings do nothing to fix it.  The bottom of the monitor seems much worse than the top and the color and brightness is uneven. A good example of the issue is the windows task bar at the bottom of the screen should be black, solid black, it is black on my laptop, black on my samsung monitor, on this monitor it is bright grey at best. Read the recent reviews, there appear to be 2 different manufactures making this monitor.  I found another reviewer who had the exact information.  If you get a box with a black handle and the installation guide is for vs228/vs238/vs247 you have the bad model.  Amazon was great and I returned the monitor and they sent me a new one in 2 days!  Second monitor- same box with the black handle.  Believe it or not this monitor is worse than the first one.  I guess I am unlucky as both monitors i received are the black handle boxes and not the white handles.  At this point amazon has only given me the option to return for a refund, which i am doing.  I am disappointed as the price and rebate were awesome, a friend bought one several months ago and there's is really nice, but these are terrible.

review_title: Inexpensive but surprisingly poor picture quality
review_body: Despite a number of positive things I could say about this monitor (see Pros below,) I personally found it unusable because of the low picture quality. I would recommend this to someone needing to purchase a big cheap monitor for office use, but not at all recommend it for anyone who wants to use it for gaming, graphics, or watching video.
Quick summary: The stand is terrible, but the panel is nice.
This screen was a great addition to my laptop. It has been years since I used a screen larger than a 16" and I have found this purchase to be worth it.

It's about as much as you could expect from a monitor - no dead pixels or significant defects. The default brightness might be a bit high for some tastes but you can of course adjust it. At under $160 this is a pretty good deal on a 23.6" monitor.

review_title: I Am Picky And Happy With This Monitor
review_body: I rate it at 4 stars because I think the stand is not so hot. Okay, just kind of plastic and no movement.

review_title: Best monitors in this price range currently in the market
review_body: I purchased two of these monitors for my home office. They're replacing two 22'' DELLs. These monitors hit the sweet spot in terms of aesthetics, size, performance and cost.

This is the tale of two monitors. The first monitor was built in Aug 2012 and for the most part was dependable and worked like a champ. The second monitor was built in Oct 2014 was an epic failure. Why was it a FAIL? We the main points:

review_title: I'd heard many good things about this monitor especially how the colors WOWed ...
review_body: First desktop monitor I've had in a very long time (had laptops for the last 9 years or so). I'd heard many good things about this monitor especially how the colors WOWed people, but I think I may have been spoiled by my laptops and streaming things through my tv - the colors look ok by comparison (not saying that they look bad, just comparatively worse lol).

God I love this monitor. From the sleek finish of the screen, the round stand, the slim frame that makes you feel like you have more screen, to the screen itself. It's radiant. I use it as  second monitor for my laptop, connected via VGA and it looks wonderful. I haven't yet connected it via HDMI or watched HD content, as that's not the reason I purchased it. But if and when I do, I will update my review.

These monitors are fantastic for the price and show to be a good value. The super thin bezel makes it a great monitor for a dual monitor setup. I haven't and won't be using the sound aspect of these so I can comment on that. The color is great and they're plenty bright. I was bummed that they weren't VESA compatible right out of the box (mysteriously a hard to find option among monitors lest than $200) but there are adapters https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B01771Q6U2/ref=ox_sc_sfl_title_2?ie=UTF8&psc=1&smid=A383DI1D5IGYZ0  that will allow you to mount them to a VESA system but they will knock the price up to the realm of monitors that may come with the VESA capability out of the box.

I am very indecisive and could not pick a monitor. I looked for weeks to find one when I finally gave in because I needed to pick one and just decided to buy this one. I was very impressed and wish I had gotten it sooner. I've had it for a week now and I have zero issues. No dead pixles, no ips bleed or back light bleed. The screen is a nice matte. Bezels are about 4mm. The stand is sturdy and completely removable. Mine came with a VGA cable. It does not have built in speakers, but it does have an aux in for speakers. Thinking about getting one more to have my dual monitor setup.

review_title: ... tv before can't do without this monitor now very happy with it thinking that built in vesa would be ...
review_body: heard about this from tech deals on youtube oc'd it to 75ish hertz was computing on tv before can't do without this monitor now very happy with it thinking that built in vesa would be nice didn't think i would need it at first but now i don't know. love how thin the bezzle is makes it sim bigger than it is. great first proper monitor.

review_title: Works great connected to my laptop
review_body: I connected this to my laptop so I could work on two screens or have a video conference and look at documents without losing the video. I bought the 21" size. It's working great for me! I neglected to buy the connector initially so had to order that as well. My Mac needed the adaptor to connect.

I bought 3 of these. One was broken on delivery. They helped with the refund process very quickly. Its only been a few weeks and both of my other monitors are already getting dead pixels. 3-4 spots on each monitor that are white no matter what color is on the screen. This should fall back on Acer since they are factory certified refurbished and not starpc.
Works well. I can't complain. I am not much an aficionado, but I do use this for gaming, and there is nothing about this monitor that detracts from that.

This monitor definitely has ghosting issues! Others mentioned disabling the OD option in settings, which helped reduce ghosting, but it's still there! I thought that the VGA cable was the culprit, so I tried using an HDMI cable, but the ghosting and blurred font was still there. I don't usually write reviews but I'm so disappointed in this monitor. Will be sending this back and looking for something else.

review_title: A great 25" IPS monitor that functions great for high quality images
review_body: I am not a monitor know-it-all but I did do research before purchasing a fairly cheap 1080p IPS monitor for my newly built computer designed primarily for gaming. This monitor has worked perfectly since taking it out of the box and as I write this review almost two months later.
Purchased this monitor in 2012 and am writing a review about it in 2015. Overall, this has been an exceptional monitor.

review_title: Good Budget Monitor but Colors Seem Off
review_body: Colors seem always a little yellow no matter how the controls are tweaked and the white even seems a little yellow. Bought this as a "second" screen to go with my excellent Asus ProArt 24" which is as good as I've ever seen. Unfortunately, you get what you pay for and I couldn't come close to matching the colors between the 2 Asus models. No matter what I tried, the VS228 always had a yellow tint to it (defect?) so I returned it and now I'm going to try another, less expensive Asus, the PB238Q which is an IPS, so maybe I can get an affordable "second" monitor that will come close to matching the ProArt. If not, I guess I'll have to break the bank and get another ProArt. If I didn't have the ProArt to compare this to, I would give it 4 stars as the images are fairly bright and sharp, and for price/value 5 stars. But it just looks VERY inferior next to the ProArt.

review_title: Excellent monitor, enabled me to mount on one of ...
review_body: Excellent monitor, enabled me to mount on one of the dual gas arm mounts I bought without needing an adapter piece.  I don't quite understand why Asus produces current monitors that DO require that.  I also have their 25 inch M250 which has a blue lit tonal adaptor in its color display that eliminates the faint yellowish cast this one still has.  Which again surprises me when this is a newer Asus model.  Both are gorgeous displays, with easy and extensive menu features to adjust to closer to my tastes, but I'm still more fond of the bluish cast to the older model.  Please note it's only a temperature hint of blue, just enough to eliminate the yellow.  Think of sunglass lenses that have the blue gray finish versus the brown finish, and you may better understand what I mean.  My third monitor is going to be another one of the M250's.  But, the Asus quality is definitely there and for just a hair under 150 this is a super buy.

review_title: A nice but wobbly monitor worth the price
review_body: Asus entered the monitor market out of nowhere, and they didn't hold back. The VS239H-P is a nice 1080p60 IPS display with a decent price. The monitor stand is noticeably wobbly, and there are no VESA mounting options built in, but these are things I can easily overlook. I have not been able to notice any major ghosting issues while gaming, and I am not an expert when it comes to color accuracy. However, it is a very worthy upgrade over the old 1440x900 TN panel I used before purchasing this. The built in 3.5mm audio out is a nice touch for systems which do not already have one available (Alienware Alpha comes to mind). There have been no dead pixels or noticeable light bleed with my specific monitor after almost a year of use. Definitely recommended.

Used it for almost two weeks now. Worked fine until yesterday when the screen turned a reddish tint. Turned it off and turned it back on, everything was back to normal. Tonight I came back from eating dinner to see a fat line right down the middle, purple, blue, and white. Called up ASUS tech support. After taking 20 minutes giving them my personal info they asked me to hook it up to another monitor to see if it was doing the same thing. After it was determined that it was indeed just the ASUS monitor they informed me that I would have to send it to them so that they could try and repair it. No replacement. I would have to wait, possibly months, for them to try and fix their faulty monitor!

I bought two of these monitors.  One for work and one for home.  Both have serious issues recognizing the HDMI input from either of my laptops -- including my ASUS laptop.  I have no trouble using the HDMI from my laptops to any other monitor.  I have replaced HDMI cables to no avail.  I contacted customer service who requested I send one back and they replaced it, but the problem continues on BOTH monitors with different laptops and different cables.  I have used the hardware reset sequence provided by ASUS customer service, and it usually fixes the problem, but not without several frustrating attempts, and either way, I can no longer invoke the menu or any other setting on the monitor.  It's like they are disabled.  It's very frustrating.  When it works, its' a great monitor, but not worth the hassle, and I would not buy one again.

review_title: High hopes initially dashed -- but now feeling better about my purchase
review_body: I thought this was a great buy & liked all the good reviews. It's been a month and it has some quirky behavior: 1) it will go into sleep mode every few minutes in the middle of streaming video (haven't figured out how to stop that); 2) without me doing anything, it suddenly stopped going into sleep mode so I have to be careful not to fall asleep watching a movie or the monitor will stay on all night; 3) this morning I opened email and entered my password. When I looked up, the monitor has 2 lines vertically and 2 lines horizontally in equal quadrants. I am not aware of hitting any keys to make this happen and cannot get it to go away. Very disappointing. Now I have to track down customer service to see if this is an easy fix.

review_title: It's ok so far, but one dead pixel >:(
review_body: Not a bad price, and quite pretty compared to the old one I had. It's lightweight. It has some type of oscillating gyroscope mount so if your desk shakes the monitor rocks back and forth with the movement. Tad annoying.

I agree with most of the previous reviewers so I'm not going to write a whole lot.  This monitor is a bargain and it does not seem to have the light-bleed or viewing-angle issues that have plagued TN panels.  No dead/stuck pixels on mine, either.
Great monitor! I just love it, it turns on very fast and image colors are true colors.

review_title: USB-C port needs the infamous "wiggle to get working" right out of the box
review_body: Bought this screen, then sold our house, and naturally this brand new screen in the box was packed with everything else. Fast forward a few months, I open it, and the USB-C cable  on the side of the screen needs to be wiggled in order to get the screen to get a connection. Cheaply built. Normally I would consider this kind of problem a "user error" and would scoff at the reviewer because they probably broke it from negligence, but I just pulled this thing out of the box and it's not working. And of course, since it's so far past the date that I bought it there's no way I'm getting a return/exchange on this. Blah.

review_title: NOT FOR THE MAC USER... YET
review_body: I am a professional video editor and picked up this puppy to use with my Late 2013 Mac Pro. It was a perfect option for me as my normal monitor is huge and I just wanted something to convert footage and backup to an FTP at the end of the day. This made my whole mac pro system able to be put into a small hand held case.

review_title: Not Linux friendly. This includes RedHat, Debian, ...
review_body: Not Linux friendly.  This includes RedHat, Debian, SuSE, Raspberry Pi.  There is one version of ubuntu that is supported.  However, they do not have a debian repository for software updates.

review_title: This monitor will NOT work with the latest Mac OS
review_body: BEWARE, this monitor will NOT work with the latest Mac OS (10.13.4). I purchased the monitor a few months ago and was generally happy with my purchase. A few complaints like the cheap plastic casing and very stiff USB cord, but pretty decent display for the price. When I upgraded my Mac OS to the latest version it would no longer work. When I talked to the AOC support, after waiting 5 days for a reply, simply said "Sorry, you will have to use the macOS 10.13.3 or earlier version at this time." Fast forward a month, still no new software driver. AOC has to have known that Mac was making a conversion to 64-bit software for over two years now, and they have not written their drivers to work with the new standards that are clearly provided for all developers. Between poor support and poor software, I recommend you look elsewhere.
I've waited for a product like this forever.  The quality is excellent for the price.  We plan on buying more!

For the price, this is a good choice for many. The screen is darker than your laptop (as expected) and does not seem to lag when your laptop is plugged into a power source; however, if your laptop is not charging then the frame rate can be so slow to the point of being intolerable.
1st a little background information.

The monitor worked great for about six months, but lately it shuts off every time the cord is jostled at all, and when I reboot my computer, it does not connect.  I have to continually unplug the cord from the base of the monitor and plug it in again, until the device is recognized.

review_title: If you are running Windows 10 DO NOT USE THE DRIVER INSTALLATION DISK THAT COMES WITH PRODUCT!
review_body: I just recently purchased this item and have only used it for a couple of days, but I thought I would share my experience to help other Windows 10 users, since most Windows customers are probably using that system at this point.  I bought this monitor to use when I am on the road with my second laptop that I bought for work/travel.
