Before I tried to use the monitor for the first time, I ran the driver installation program on the CD Rom disk that was included with the monitor as per the instructions.  Big mistake.  I knew going into the purchase that Windows 10 was a little iffy with this product, but I thought I would take a gamble since the price was reasonable and other users said they were able to get it to work.  After running the install, I plugged the monitor into my computer and the screen flashed the AOC logo and my computer made the device connected beep, then nothing.  When I went to the display settings and clicked the detect additional display button and the computer couldn't detect the device. I tried all of the USB ports with the same result.  I even tried running the uninstall driver option on the driver disk setup program and restarted the computer and had no luck, as well as trying help suggestions I found on several message boards.  I was about ready to give up and return the product, but thought I would test the monitor on a couple of other computers.  I tried it on my computer at work that runs windows 10 and it worked within a few seconds of plugging it in with no driver install.  I tried it on my home computer that also runs windows 10, which is also an HP laptop like my travel laptop, and it worked perfectly.  As a last ditch attempt, I decided to try the radical approach and do a system restore to a date before I had run the driver install program on the cd rom.  Sure enough, after the system restore completed and the computer rebooted, I plugged the monitor into one of the USB ports and the monitor worked perfectly.  So, for now I will give it 4 stars just because of the aggravation caused by the driver cd.  Otherwise, if the monitor continues to work, then I would say it does what is supposed to do for a pretty reasonable price.  Also, it comes with a neoprene travel case, which is a nice add-on.

review_title: A decent deal for the price.  Get an anti-glare cover for it.
review_body: AOC e1659Fwu 2017-07-19  At under $100 for a USB monitor there aren't many other options.  Resolution and contrast are OK, but the glossy screen means glare that can really degrade the readability.  I highly recommend an anti-glare screen protector.  It greatly improved things for me under normal lighting conditions.  It works best in landscape mode.  The viewing angle is not good in portrait mode.

review_title: love it. Great size and quality
review_body: love it. Great size and quality. The picture is geat and it looks great. There is a little bit of light bleeding onto the screen from the backlit screen. Especially when I watch a movie that has the black bars on the top and bottom, you can sometimes see a little bit of a lighter spot, but honestly, it isnt that bad at all, doesnt bother me, which most things like that would bother me, and I still love the monitor.

review_title: I bought 2 of these for a dual montior desktop and love them.
review_body: I ordered 2 of these to replace a single 6 year old Samsung 24" 1080p monitor, which was still working fine, and I love these monitors.  The thin bezel allows for just a small gap between them and their brightness, white level, color & text clarity is better than the replaced Samsung.  If you want a dual monitor desktop environment don't hesitate.  Buy these!
Really good for the price. I don’t have any issues with light bleed but I rarely work in the dark.
Edit: Turning off the OD in the settings helped reduce the ghosting. Bumping this to a 4 star.

review_title: Beautiful Screen, excellent buy as long as you are not going to rely primarily on the built in speakers. (they are weak)
review_body: Solid and beautiful construction, This works for me as a secondary screen to my laptop to increase work productivity.

review_title: What more can a gamer ask for?
review_body: Came in days after purchasing with standard shipping in working order. Beautiful picture with a fast refresh rate for under $150 what more can a gamer ask for?

review_title: Puts my HD 1080p TV to shame
review_body: This monitor has such good picture quality that it puts my HD television to shame. I am glad I chose this monitor because the HD 1080p resolution makes the images much clearer which is perfect for gaming. The monitor is also the perfect size to completely fill my field of vision even at 30 inches away. It also has an HDMI port so that you can connect it to a cable box to watch television. I am not disappointed and if I knew someone that needed a new monitor I would get them this one as a gift.

Bought this as a Christmas present for my wife who was using an old, dim 4:3 aspect monitor for her MacBook Pro.  We are both very pleased that the monitor automatically detected the old DVI input and came alive immediately with a big, bright, accurate image.  It's size works well in that it allows her to maintain posture in her desk chair from a proper viewing distance (no leaning in and squinting required).  It was, at the time of purchase, the best value available on Amazon for this size screen and features which will be used primarily for day-to-day browsing and business work.  Highly recommended.

review_title: They are good for the price
review_body: Bought these for office computers. They are good for the price. In my opinion 1920x1080 seems to low of a resolution for a 27 inch monitor. I am use to a higher resolution monitor so when I am using this one the icons look very large. Only down falls are no height adjustment.

Monitor worked perfectly for 1.5 years, then suddenly one day there was a vertical line going down the screen - not dead pixels, just a line of pixels a few shades darker than the surround pixels.  Just enough to be annoying.  The warranty was mostly useless, as it requires me to pack and ship to Texas at my expense.  Just not worth it, which is probably what Acer is counting on.  Fortunately I don't use the monitor daily, so for now I will probably live with it.  It's really a shame, it was a beautiful monitor while it lasted.  I definitely won't buy another Acer.

This is actually the 2nd monitor of this model that I have purchased. I will start by saying the reason I gave it 4 stars was because after about a year of use, my first monitor started to experience screen burn and a pinkish hue on the left side. This most likely stems from a slight manufacturer's defect and I'm hoping it will be easy to fix. I also have yet to contact Asus to see if there is anything that can be done at this time by them. However, I loved the first monitor so much while it was working, that I had no worries going ahead and purchasing another one, but with the 2 year protection plan added to it.

review_title: Decent IPS panel for a super low price.
review_body: I purchased this monitor as a secondary monitor for my PB278Q 27" 1440p IPS panel. It has a similar pixel density and when both panels are set to standard mode, there is no difference in color to the naked eye. The matte finish on the screen show little to no glare and I can't complain about the price. The only issue is the base is a bit flimsy, but I really don't care since I am using a desk mounted dual monitor stand.
I'm going to give a review with the following expectations:

review_title: After a few years of excellent service my Samsung Syncmaster SM2493HM died
review_body: After a few years of excellent service my Samsung Syncmaster SM2493HM died.  I do a lot of video and graphics editing in my ministry and needed another 24" monitor for my dual monitor setup.  After extensive research I settled on this Asus VS247H-P.  The specs looked decent and the literally dozens of user reviews—both favorable and unfavorable—that I read from different sites led me to buy one.  Price was also a factor as I had to keep to a tight budget. You can read the objective specs for yourself; but specs do not tell the entire story.  I can tell you that, subjectively, this monitor beats the pants off my Samsung.  It is fast, brilliant (remember it is rated as 300 nits), and highly responsive, with the ability to accurately control the color profile to match what you need. I love it.  Maybe after Christmas I will be able to afford a second one (they're not that expensive, but I live on a small pastor's salary) and then I won't be looking at a night and day difference between my dual monitors!  I highly recommend this Asus monitor.

review_title: A great inexpensive monitor, better for video than text
review_body: This monitor has a lot going for the price. I bought this to replace a 21.5" 1600x1200 pixel monitor. The aspect ratio is obviously different, but what I'm losing in vertical height, I gain in horizontal width. Packaging was very good and the monitor arrived in perfect condition. Here's the good, bad and the ugly of this monitor.

review_title: Absolutely beautiful monitor. I bought two of the IPS version ...
review_body: Absolutely beautiful monitor.  I bought two of the IPS version and they are awesome.  Absolutely perfect!  If you are looking for a good monitor, look no further.  These are beautiful and they have every connector you need.  VGA(hopefully no one is using this unless they have no choice), DVI, and HDMI.  I am also a gamer and these work great for gaming.  Smooth and the colors are bright, crisp, and amazing.

review_title: ASUS VS278Q-P 27" $278: Better than I'd expected, except for the stand
review_body: I bought this as an external monitor for an old MacBook (6+ years, DVI to HDMI) and a 2-3 yo MacBook Air (DisplayPort to HDMI, I should have bought a DisplayPort but the HDMI seems fine).

review_title: I'm glad I purchased this monitor
review_body: I was honestly very hesitant when I clicked the purchase button. I read and re-read all the reviews regarding the monitors and did some external searches as to what was a good monitor. Ultimately, the price point was the main driving force behind this purchase. I'm very glad I decided to purchase this monitor. I'm using my this monitor as an extension to my laptop's screen and mostly use for texts.

When my rubbish Gateway All-In-One computer crashed in May 2013, I knew I would never buy another all-in-one PC. So I borrowed my dad's notebook PC and logged onto Amazon to look for a new desktop PC. I ordered an
Good monitor with a 2 caveats.

review_title: Great paper weight to go with an HP Spectre
review_body: This product does not work at all with an HP Spectre. I have downloaded every driver requested and followed all instructions. Previously I owned several of these models but they quickly crack during transport for my work. I purchased a new one this winter but it never worked correctly. It won't even display a screen at all but displays random grey markings vertically. I'm past the point of return so I suppose I'll drop it at the hotel I'm staying at since it's useless.

I'm a programmer. I spent three hours trying to get this working. Documentation is a f'ing picture of how to plug it in. There are 1,000's of people on Google trying to get this working. You down drivers, reboot, upgrade your operating system, waste 3 hours and nothing. The companies website is beyond useless. DisplayLink's website isn't much better. What a joke.

Granted it's only the second day I've had it, so I can't speak to the longevity of the unit.  Still, it's an outstanding little monitor, perfect for my laptop. I use it in vertical mode, and it is perfect to house all the office messaging apps, freeing my main screen for productivity apps.  I also love that it is powered by the USB 3.0 slot, meaning a single, simple cable is enough for both power and connectivity.  On the downside, the viewing angles are slight, but for my purposes, they're fine - I just angle the monitor to fit my working position.  It came with a pouch to protect it from travel-scratches.  Finally the stand is very sturdy, and allows additional flexibility of viewing angles.

review_title: Almost a 5 star | Compatible with Bontend tablet stand | A bit dim
review_body: Writing this review mostly to let people know that this AOC-E1659Fwu screen is compatible with the Bontend tablet stand (see pictures). I really had to force the holder to fit so it is not something that you would undo/redo every morning when setting up but it works.

review_title: Must have for working on the go, also useful otherwise. good value, simple
review_body: great backup screen, but not top of the line

The product worked fine in the beginning, but today as I connected it to my laptop, nothing happened.  This also happened to a colleague soon after he purchased it.  It seems all my options for returning have expired as well.  I purchased it in July of this year, so in less than 3 months, it seems I have no options.  I would highly recommend you not purchase this item.  It is very unreliable.

review_title: A good second screen to my laptop
review_body: A good second screen to my laptop. I ordered it because I need a second screen for my laptop to work from home. I’ve noticed that some websites freeze when I move the browser to this screen - not sure if the screen has something to do with it, but when I move them back to the main screen they work fast. Also, I’ve lost a connection Y wire that was in the box with it, and can’t find a replacement anywhere, even contacted the customer support. They said that it will work with a regular M to M USB but it doesn’t 🤷‍♀️

review_title: Excellent, slim product which works in all orientations; VERY FRAGILE LIKE ITS PREDECESSOR
review_body: So here's the good stuff (there is also bad stuff): I had their previous USB 2.0 model, which was thick and difficult to carry, though weighed less than this newer model.  It was a nice display, but it whistled at a high pitch that only some of us can hear.  The whistle was very irritating.

review_title: The quality of this monitor was great, but I did have one issue which resulted ...
review_body: The quality of this monitor was great, but I did have one issue which resulted in me returning it. When I was working within a Citrix environment with the monitor plugged in, it uncalibrated my computer altogether. I couldn't click anything because I wasn't sure where the mouse was. I had all drivers installed, and ultimately couldn't get it resoled. Who knows if this was a one off issue for just myself. I have another AOC USB 3 powered monitor and have no issues with that.

review_title: Great, portable extended monitor for tablets!
review_body: I bought a Microsoft Surface Pro 4 and love the tablet because it's lite and I travel but the screen is sometimes just too small when you have multiple spreadsheets open.  This monitor is PERFECT as an add on when I need to have a larger, extended monitor.  It doesn't require power, I can plug it directly into the USB port on my Surface, and it works fantastic!!!  The resolution is GREAT, it came with a nice sleeve  so I can carry it with me if I need to.  I love this monitor.

I like the fact of the narrow frame around the edges. However my eyes have bothered me ever since my HP Monitor burned out and I purchased this one as nothing seems sharp and adjustments have not totally sharpened the images. Also don't like the fact that instead of coming on when started or awakened it cycles through several screens as though searching for a connection. SLOW! Perhaps I expect too much but have had better at the same price.

review_title: Okay for the price, but has Screen Door Effect
review_body: Just got these monitors about 1 hour ago so this is purely a first impression review. I purchased the 23.8 inch R240HY bidx version.

I originally bought one of this monitor. I later bought a second so that I could have a matching dual display. The second monitor recently broke. My computer can detect that the monitor is there and connected, but no image displays. Now it's just a blank black screen. It's funny because the first monitor I bought is still working fine.

review_title: Very disappointed. This product doesn’t deserve a rating.
review_body: This is BY FAR THE WORST MONITOR EVERY!! I would not recommend this to anyone, especially someone who got hired to work from home. The screen turns on and off non-stop imediatly after it is turned on. I have not had this computer 4 months, and It won’t stay on for anything... this is the worst experience and now I’m looking for a RELIABLE monitor for work... ya gotta do better

review_title: Great product. Shipped and received on time
review_body: Great product. Shipped and received on time. Not sure if it is how I put it together but it is a wee bit crooked and it is driving me insane. Leans to the left and it is not the stand. Perhaps it is faulty? Have to stick a folded paper under it to get it to keep straight. Not thrilled with that. If it were straight it would be 5 out of 5.

review_title: You will not find a better monitor for this price
review_body: I was shocked at the quality of this monitor. The graphics are very clear and the lighting is perfect.

review_title: We thought it was working great so we didn't keep the box and now I'm ...
review_body: Bought this monitor and it is already malfunctioning after a week or so. The screen is grainy and fuzzy and sometimes has a line through it. We thought it was working great so we didn't keep the box and now I'm not sure we can return it.... Disappointed by this Acer product.

Good looking display HOWEVER there are what appears to be smudges on the screen when it is off, and they are impossible to take off. So far I have had no issues due to these, but just be aware. Also it runs through all of the inputs before turning on which is incredibly frustrating when trying to access BIOS.

review_title: Very sharp picture when using hdmi input
review_body: Bought for my wife. Very sharp picture when using hdmi input from laptop. The thin bezel makes the monitor seem even larger. Planning to buy the 27" model for myself now that I have seen this work for wife. The hdmi input and the built-in speaker jack just makes things a lot easier for her because when connecting and discounting her laptop because no docking station is need. Just plug in hdmi and she is ready to go (her keyboard and mouse are wireless).

review_title: they are very good for the value
review_body: I purchased two of these to act as spare monitors for a home office.  While I wouldn't want one as my main display, they are very good for the value.  They do wobble a bit, but I just set them close together to minimize that.  They came with very similar color calibration and overall serve their purpose well.

review_title: Great monitor just dont throw your headset at it!
review_body: So I've had this monitor for about two years or so and I've come to love it. Its viewing angles are supriaingly good and its colors are pretty vibrant (don't use game mode, turn on demo mode and then turn it off and it will save with more vibrant colors) with pretty good blacks. It gets very bright (I usually keep mind around 70). The stand is flimsy and your monitor will shake if you move your desk but its easily removable and it does come with a vesa mount so props Asus. For fps it does a fine job with its 2ms gtg time though I don't know what the actual input lag is. If you're a pro gamer, keep looking but casual gamers its a nice  monitor. It feels very responsive and it doesn't hurt the eyes after 8+ hours of continuous use (tested). I now have to replace it because I raged during csgo and I threw my hyperx clouds at it and it cracked the LCD itself so there's a few lines running through it horizontally and vertically though I can still game just fine in fps's.

review_title: The first "lemon" I've ever received from ASUS...twice in a row.
review_body: I have bought numerous ASUS monitors over the years.  In fact, all of my personally owned displays are ASUS.  When a brand works for you, why change?  Well, I almost did after buying the VS278Q-P.  This screen seems to be well reviewed by a lot of people on various sites and has attractive specs such as the 1ms refresh rate.  My primary use for the screen was to be gaming.  At the time, my AV system involved HDMI passing video and audio to my display, and using the headphone jack on the monitor to send that audio to my computer speaker system.

review_title: ASUS, YOU SUCK.  Poor track record, poor documentation, poor support.
review_body: The specs look great. The brand is well regarded. BUT I had one DOA, replaced it, and the second one is also dead right out of the box.  I used all three cable options and different power cables.  This last time I went to ASUS support site to make doubly sure, found nothing of help, and opted for online technical support chat.  After a few minutes of typing I was informed that I MANAGED TO LOG IN TO THE WRONG CHAT, although there was only one option and it did not specify which products are covered there.  It's my time that's being wasted.
UPDATE 2-3-2014

review_title: Really nice monitor for a pretty good price
review_body: This monitor is very pretty, but very difficult to keep clean. I have cleaned it on the regular since I got it, but there is one streak in the middle that won't go away. On the very first day I got it, I got a tiny bit of a sneeze on the monitor. I cleaned everything off with a microfiber cloth and monitor cleaner. Everything came off except for one tiny little discolored streak right in the middle of the screen. It has been nagging me since day one and I have tried everything to clean it. Otherwise, this monitor is great. It's sturdy, has plenty of plugs, and the colors are beautiful. I haven't had any troubles in games. Glare isn't an issue either.

review_title: Vibrant Full HD display with VESA mount capability
review_body: I bought a pair of these and have had these monitors for over a year now and they are still going strong. The main reason I chose this particular model is because they include VESA mount capability. I knew that later on I was going to want to mount them to my office desk and that is exactly where they are now. Mounting them can be a little confusing at first as you must unscrew and pry open the back panel to get them stand removed. They are not many helpful articles online explaining exactly how it is done, but I figured it out with a little research. Other than that they are pretty good quality and I paid just a little over $100 each for them.

review_title: Good purchase. Monitor is a good one.
review_body: For ASUS VS239H-P 23", rec'd Monitor today 10-13-15. Colors and brightness are fine.  I just tested with Assassin's Creed and things looked great. I changed the settings to what others had in their review but honestly this looked great right out of the box.

review_title: so that's nice compared to something like the HP 25xw (which you ...
review_body: Solid monitor for the money. The screen itself is not reflective, it's matte, so that's nice compared to something like the HP 25xw (which you can see yourself in if there is ambient lighting because it doesnt have a matte panel like this Asus).....but for whatever reason Asus thought it would be good to put a very reflective glossy bezel on these, which sucks. You can see the overhead lights on the ceiling reflecting off of the bezel right into your line of vision. Also the stand is really short and stubby, which is annoying. I thought the HP 25xw looked better on certain videos & pictures, and on some looked better on the Asus 248H-P. The 248H-P viewing angles are not great compared to an IPS panel but better than an older LCD.

review_title: Pretty nice travel monitor (Macbook Pro via MiniDisplayPort to HDMI)
review_body: I had this shipped to a hotel that I was going to be staying at for a week and expected to get work done.  It's so much nicer to recline in front of a monitor vs. hunched over a laptop (at least for me)

review_title: Had it for a few months, nice monitor
review_body: Very sleek design. Thin and light. I can easily carry it one handed without the worry of dropping it. There is a small indent in the back which might not be designed as a handle/hand support, but works just the same.

review_title: USB Connection to Monitor Loose After Six Months, Will Not Stay Powered ON
review_body: Bought this in August 16' but after only six months the USB plug into the back of the monitor is loose, and the monitor will not stay turned on because of it.  I can feel the connection is loose and have to apply firm pressure for the screen to turn on, once I let go the monitor looses power. Never dropped on handled the monitor roughly. I also cannot seem to find warranty information to see if I can have this replace/repaired.

review_title: Great screen! Poor design for cord connection.
review_body: Having a second screen that is mobile is outstanding.  The screen is convenient to use and works well.  The picture is very good and the kickstand  adjusts to easily get the view that you want.  ALSO note that it comes with a protective sleeve.  I did not know this when I bought it so I tacked on an additional sleeve to my order.

review_title: The plug and play made it simple to use and it displays a nice clear picture
review_body: I work from home and bought this monitor with the intention of having a lightweight external monitor for working while traveling.  The plug and play made it simple to use and it displays a nice clear picture.  I enjoy this monitor so much that I use it daily at home as my 3rd monitor.  When I'm traveling, I enjoy it being lightweight and able to fit in my laptop case even with it's own, included case on.The only reason its not 5 star, in my opinion is it does make this high pitch noise while on.  Nothing too loud, and I've gotten use to it now but, it's still annoying at times.  I have recommended this to my daughter and would recommend it to anyone in the market for a plug and play, usb monitor.

review_title: Resolution is not great. I had it in my car to attach ...
review_body: Very cheap screen. Resolution is not great. I had it in my car to attach to my laptop when working in our datacenter...  needless to say there is no physical appearance of damage and I have been careful during transport.  I wiped it down with a screen wipe and there is a large visible line and what looks like a crack in the LCD panel under the protective layer..... I know this is physical damage but I have been careful.... the product is not high quality.

review_title: Great monitor but pulls a lot of power
review_body: This portable monitor has been great for business trips. It's light weight, the back stand folds nicely into the back slot and very easy to set-up with my travel laptop.

review_title: GREAT 2nd screen for my Dell 17" laptop
review_body: GREAT 2nd screen for my Dell 17" laptop! No display-delay, when using its USB-input.

review_title: For what I need, I like it!
review_body: I like it.  To qualify that statement, I wish it were a little brighter and a bit sharper.  But, for the price, and a USB powered monitor - I'm fine with what it does.  I wasn't looking for something to watch movies on, or leverage photoshop etc.  I'm a road warrior, and having that second monitor for more screen real estate KICKS BUTT!  Especially when that middle seat is vacant on the airplane.  Always fun to tick off the person at the window.  Until they have to go to the bathroom!  Anyway, I digress.  Does what I want, great for a mobile workers, no issues so far, if I had high expectations, I'd be upset.  But this meets my needs.

review_title: maybe it was damaged in shipping but the resolution was like CGA from 30 years ago
review_body: The first one i recieved had a problem, maybe it was damaged in shipping but the resolution was like CGA from 30 years ago.  Sent it back, the replacement came quickly and it is awsome.  It works fine with my older HP 6460b business laptop on one USB 2 port and my HP Envy with USB 3 on one USB port,  The supplied cable has 2 USB connectors on the computer end for signal and power, apparently some machines don't get enough power from just one, but has not been a problem so far.  The display is thin and light weight, and comes with a black protective pouch I use every day, and i fit a thin keyboard in there too.  The resolution is great, I use a lot of applications during the work day with sometimes fine fonts with no problem.  The kickstand is recessed in the back, and folds out easily and the monitor stands firmly on the desk.  The software was a little clunky to install, I finally got something directly from Display Link that works well.  I am thinking about having a 2nd AOC 17 to give me a third monitor, and apparently there is support for that, I have USB ports on both sides of the laptop as well.  I have the display right next to the laptop, so don't need the rather long cable that comes with it, I tried a smaller cable from an external hard drive and that works just fine and keeps the clutter to a minimum.

I really wanted to like this product. And add potability to my laptop and 'expand' my viewing footprint for work. How does AOC sell a product in 2018 THAT IS NOT COMPATIBLE with Windows 10? How? The software totally screwed the display settings on my Dell laptop. All I ever saw on the monitor was a flash of the AOC logo.. It never connected to my laptop after many multiple tries. Stay away from this one! It is going back to Amazon tomorrow morning!!

review_title: I used it pretty regularly between then and January 2016
review_body: I bought mine back in May 2016. I used it pretty regularly between then and January 2016. My first time using it in Feb 2017, it started showing me a screen with a picture of a monitor and USB plug... which I presume is an error saying it's not plugged in properly. What's frustrating is that the picture is crystal clear but its not getting data from the computer. I'm not sure if the cord is broken or the tiny plug in the back of the monitor wore out. In any event, it only lasted me around 8 months. I was never rough with it and does not exhibit any symptoms of wear or use. It just suddenly stopped working. I've called EOC and attempted to get technical support but they do not answer their phone and you are put into a voicemail box where it says they will call you. I haven't received a call back yet.
Shockingly bad quality picture. Not sharp, colors seem hazy.

review_title: perfect for an affordable triple monitor setup.
review_body: the picture quality and color accuracy is great, the default color settings are excellent right out of the box. after buying the first one i went ahead and bought 2 more and now i use all 3 monitors for video editing and it works great. i never thought id be able to afford a triple monitor setup but this monitor is perfect for it.

review_title: I love this monitor! (Potato picture included)
review_body: I love this monitor! The colors are brilliant (even out of the box) the monitor turns on instantly at full brightness, my old acer has to warm up after turning it on.
the perfect screen size, really you dont need anything bigger then this. the resolution is great and everything just visually looks nice and the small edge along the sides is also nice.
This was an excellent buy. I was going to purchase this last month, glad I waited it was 20 dollars less this month.

review_title: I like the monitor and you can't beat the price
review_body: This is the second R240H I have purchased.  I like the monitor and you can't beat the price.  With the exception of printers, I have had good luck with HP products.  It does not have audio but I think the speakers on these monitors do not compare with even low cost external speakers.

My  son who takes extremelygood care of all his electronics bought this monitor in December and less than a year later it just stopped working. Not very helpful for a college student. Would not buy this brand again or recommend anyone buy it.

review_title: So far So good! IPS is a great upgrade from the monitor ...
review_body: So far So good!  IPS is a great upgrade from the monitor it replaced.  Colors are vibrant, blacks seem fine to me and no dead pixels out of the box.  Love the thin bezels, so much nicer than the big thick plastic on the last one (yeah that's how old it was).  Fast shipping.  Works for me, love it so far!

review_title: Best monitor you can buy for the price!
review_body: I absolutely LOVE this monitor. With the 23.8 inch size it's really hard to see the pixels. It worked perfectly out of the box, and the thin bezel is awesome! I hooked up TWO to my MacBook Pro 2013 Retina Display. Really easy to setup and it looks amazing. If you have the same model MacBook Pro as me, you can hook up 1, 2, or even 3 monitors to it! Definitely recommended.

Did a lot of research before pulling the trigger with this monitor. I wanted something with a large sleek screen, capable of using a DVID port instead of just the VGA. Great picture quality and color! Perfect size, sleek sturdy base. This was perfect!

Okay so my previous 24" LCD monitor was a Westinghouse I purchased over 5 years ago back when larger LCD monitors were still coming in to their own. I was a huge skeptic of LCD monitors at the time due to dead pixels, viewing angles, and color representation. I had used CRTs my whole life previously and as an avid gamer, and hobbyist graphic designer, a crystal clear monitor was a must have. Pulling the trigger on the Westinghouse was tough for me, but I got it relatively cheap so I took the risk. It did not disappoint! Not only did it have 0 dead pixels, it was clear, bright and colors were not over saturated and gaudy. I grew to love that monitor to death, but it has recently stopped working after many great years of service.

I love my new monitor so much, I might get another one soon.  I bought it to replace an older-than-dirt square-shaped flat screen monitor whose colors were washed out.  I use two monitors and my other monitor is an oldish HP gaming monitor...but I love the new ASUS - crisp colors and no eye strain.  I am not a gamer, so I cannot tell you how Masters-of-the-Really-All-These-Games-Seem-the-Same-to-Me-Universe looks on it, but I do watch videos and there is no herky-jerky-ness.  My son could tell you why this monitor is great in technical terms.  Me, I just really like it a lot and will happily buy another soon.

review_title: Maybe I just got a bad one?
review_body: After a lot of research and reading reviews I decided on this monitor which arrived quickly and was easy to put together. I am using Windows 10 with a GTX760. This monitor strained my eyes, the edges of the text in windows and games looked fuzzy and made it hard for me to read. It just didn't seem as bright as it was supposed to be and the viewing angle was not even close to my other IPS monitors. I tried using both the HDMI and DVI ports, calibrating through the OSD, and the Nnvidia control panel to no avail. I ended up returning it and will purchase another brand. This was the first time I had to return something to Amazon and it was hassle free which was very nice.

I had high(er) expectations for an Asus display. However, for one: DO NOT BUY THIS FOR THE REBATE. At least not here on Amazon. I've done plenty of rebates through newegg and never had a problem with them, but for some reason, those a**es at Asus don't accept the invoice Amazon gives you when you click "view invoice/receipt". If you can get it to work, go for it. I probably wouldn't have bought this if not for the rebate and now I lost $40.

review_title: Good screen for the cost... after some configuration
review_body: This screen is solid. Very spacious, colors are good, sharpness is acceptable.

review_title: A pretty good monitor, but there are annoying problems in the firmware.
review_body: Colors and brightness are excellent (after some tweaking). I use it for photo editing and as an HD TV/DVD display, and it has been very satisfactory.

review_title: but for the price they are fantastic. They look great and I'd definitely recommend for ...
review_body: Had I paid more than $100 a piece for these I probably wouldn't give 5 stars since they aren't adjustable, but for the price they are fantastic.  They look great and I'd definitely recommend for anyone needing basic 1080p capable displays.  They have VGA, DVI and HDMI inputs so they will fit any need.  Only thing to look out for is if you plan to use a flat wall mount you have to get 90 degree HDMI inputs as the inputs face outwards on the back of the monitors.
Just bought a fourth one of these.  I have 3 of them in a triple monitor setup and they are still going strong after almost 3 years.  Just bought a fourth for a friend's desk and it works great.

I purchased this to replace a 19 inch TN monitor that is about 10 YO. I am an amateur photographer and I wanted an IPS monitor to adjust the photos I take. Out of the box I calibrated it using a Datacolor Spyder 3 Elite and I can see some difference in colors and contrast in the Datacolor sample photos vs uncalibrated. There are no dead pixels, stand seems sturdy enough and the only con that I can see is the SRGB color gamut is not 100% aligned with the SRGB colorspace that is in the Datacolor reference. It is represented by a triangle, the green section coming off the blue with the green dot to the right and higher than the SRGB green dot; I guess that means my greens and blues will be a little off. Since I'm not a professional I can live with it.

The 19 inch monitor used in my office died and I wanted something larger to replace it. The price was right and I have some Asus electronics and have found them well made and durable. The monitor is used for office tasks, so I can't say much about color accuracy, but the screen is bright and easy to read. The resolution is good, the colors vibrant and the wider screen much more useful than the 19 inch. My secretary can have two or three windows open simultaneously and see what she needs or can have one window open wide enough that lateral scrolling isn't necessary. Also tall enough to see much more of web pages, text documents, etc without having to scroll as much. I believe it tilts to adjust it to your or your desk height. It has a reasonable footprint, too.  I would buy another one when the next monitor dies, maybe even a 24 inch while the prices continue to drop.

Took about 3 months for the screen to stop working. I took great care of it and always had it in the protective case but it no longer turns on. I reached out to tech support and they asked for a picture then didn’t respond for 3 weeks until I submitted another request and they told me it would be more expensive to fix it than buy a new one. Pretty frustrating that $100 only gets you a screen for a few months. Save your money and buy a more reputable brand with better customer service for when their products breaks.

review_title: The picture quality is terrific for my purposes
review_body: I have had ZERO of the problems that other reviewers have reported. For me it was true plug and play right out of the box.  I did not have to load drivers, or anything; just---plug and play.  I had zero experience of the "5 millisecond lag" that some people reported.  Mouse movement is in precise real time. The picture quality is terrific for my purposes, I can;t see a difference between my laptop screen or this AOC monitor. I have a 6 year old Dell Core i5 with discrete video card, nothing special.  Plugged into the one USB 3.0 port, and was up and running in ~two minutes, time it took my computer to load drivers directly from the monitor.  I do a lot of search/copy/paste work for my job, searching raw data documents (mostly Word, .pdf, e-mails, and internet sources), and copying and pasting or paraphrasing to my document.  This second monitor makes life SO much easier.  I LOVE how compact it is---I have a very small work space, and only have room for a small monitor like this.  I also  love that it is totally USB powered, so I don't have another power cord cluttering up my work space.  The soft cover is fine.  It's nothing fancy, just fine gauge ballistic, but lightly padded to soften jolts, and keeps the screen from getting scratched when packed.  It weighs I think 2.4 lbs, which is nothing.  The swivel back rest stand is well designed, and I think very effective.  I would ordinarily not have bought a  brand that I had never heard of before like AOC, but this company really executed their product to my satisfaction.  I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS PRODUCT.  I would like to mention that I have not been paid anything for this review, or  given anything, nor di I know this company at all.  I just like the product, and think other people would like to hear from a completely unbiased customer.

I could not get the monitor to work on either Windows 10 or Windows 8, even after I installed the driver.  AOC comes on the screen as soon as you make the connection and then it goes blank.  Windows won't even recognize that there is another monitor attached to the computer.  I am going to spend the extra 30 bucks and order the Asus.

review_title: Better than nothing, but only just barely
review_body: What a wonderful concept!

Have purchased several of these monitors for in field use with Microsoft Surface Pro 3's.  There have been a couple of quirks with regard to sleep settings and what not, but a simple unplug and plug of the USB cable would always fix it.  Most have not had any problems.  In addition, we did have one that had a bad mini USB port on the back of the monitor.  The cord needed to be just so in order for it to work.  Any movement and the monitor went off.  Processed a very smooth replacement transaction through Amazon as usual and haven't had any port problems on any others.  It is light weight, comes with a nice case and uses the USB port for power!  Adding a second monitor for in vehicle use in the field has been a big productivity and speed boost!

Perfect for my needs!  I work at home and do not have a separate office space so it's important to have a second monitor that doesn't take up a lot of space. Quick plug in to USB.  I like that there is no power cord to deal with.  Driver online download was quick and easy at DisplayLink. Only once my laptop didn't recognize it, just unplugged and plugged back in, otherwise it starts right up. When not it use it folds flat and can be stored safely in the provided cover.  Very happy with this second monitor.

review_title: 1st day, and is as good as I expected it to be
review_body: It's only my first day of use, but so far I really like it. Yes, the color is a little washed out, but that is to be expected when running solely off of USB power. I bought this device for use during business travel. The one downside is that with it being 17", it is a little long and is a snug fit in my backpack for travel. However, I just discovered that it works well with my current set up using a Targus docking station as a 3rd monitor (uses Displaylink drivers) just by plugging it into the USB 3 slot on my laptop. I could even use my laptop screen as a 4th monitor, if I wanted.

review_title: It's easy...plug and play to any laptop, tablet, Xbox that has a USB port.
review_body: I love this monitor. It's easy to use, just plug into laptop and use as additional screen. I use as a third screen when needed. Works well if you are in any training away from your desk.

review_title: I had one for years so I bought another and this happened
review_body: I bought the "newer model" of the same product.  I liked the stand.  I liked the placement of the USB connection.

I’ve owned other USB monitors including models made by AOC and ASUS. This one surpasses these previous models in many ways. Color is better, viewing angles are better, and the monitor is more responsive than before. Also, this one has on screen controls to adjust brightness, contrast, etc. which is a big plus if you are using with a MacBook Pro because the software is Windows only. Well worth the upgrade.

review_title: good price point for a quality monitor
review_body: good price point for a quality monitor. My only complaint is that the monitor lacked VESA mount points, but that is my fault for not reading the specs close enough. Very lightweight and fairly thin bezels, good clean picture.

review_title: Viewing angle is excellent. Reading news online is not painful as it ...
review_body: I came form an old 20" Hp monitor. It's been about 3 weeks since I had this monitor. Overall it's a big improvement over my old one. It is much easier on my eyes, the colors are bright and vivid. Viewing angle is excellent. Reading news online is not painful as it was before.

review_title: Should be brighter and it isn't Mac OS Compatible
review_body: While this is a great monitor, it is definitely NOT very bright, nor is it MAC compatible. All the drivers on Acer.com are for Windows systems which is aggravating beyond belief.

I really want to like this monitor as the colors look pretty good but the level of backlight bleed and clouding is unacceptable.  Can be seen easily even during daytime scenes in games like Skyrim and the Witcher 3.
Good Things:

I have had it for a month or two and it has performed as advertised.  I was concerned about the fixed height mount but it is no problem since the screen tilts back. It was shipped securely with no problem unpacking and setting up. I had to attach a pair of speakers I already had to the computer as it does not come with speaker(s) and they work fine with the monitor.  It is a good monitor for the price.I would consider five stars after using it for a few years.

Nice display. No complaints other than it hangs a bit lower than my other Acer display. So you will need to check the mounts compared to your other monitor to ensure proper alignment.  This mount hangs about 2" lower than my other monitor.  Anyways nice screen.

review_title: They're lovely and I really love the thing bezel
review_body: They're lovely and I really love the thing bezel. But I bought two and when I have them set up one is slightly taller than the other! Maybe a 1/4 inch? I made sure both monitors were properly seated in their pedestals and tilted in the same plane, but they're just ever so slightly different heights. It's annoying, but not a dealbreaker for me. Maybe it will be for you though, so be aware.

Picked up two of these for a workstation. Very crisp picture. Beautiful colors, bright, sharp, great contrast on text. Love it. The monitor is light, but has a very sturdy base. No height adjustment (seems that feature is rare nowadays), but has tilt and sits at an appropriate height for desktop use, so I'm not sure I'd care about adjusting the height anyways. Great viewing angles. Very limited bleed in the corners when the monitor image is completely black. Highly recommend.

review_title: Love this giant monitor - but it took my eyes a few days to adjust
review_body: I'd been using a 13" laptop as my main monitor for years, so this was a HUGE upgrade. The first few days of using this really hurt my eyes for some reason, but since then I must have gotten used to it. It's a game-changer in terms of productivity; all that extra screen real estate really does make a difference and I can't believe it took me so long to make the upgrade.

review_title: terrific monitor, but be careful about PC video card Scaling Options
review_body: I've only had this monitor less than a week but so far I love it.  I was worried when I first hooked it up because it only has HDMI and DisplayPort and VGA connections on the back, but it came with a DVI to HDMI cable so I used that.  And then I noticed that the picture didn't nearly fill the screen to the edges, nor was it sharp at all but instead was fuzzy.  So it had this big black border all around it.  I did some Googling and it turns out the problem is with my video card driver.  I have an AMD Radeon so I used the AMD Catalyst Control Center software and went to the settings for "Overscaling", or "Scaling Options (Digital Flat-Panel)".  This article was very very helpful: http://www.7tutorials.com/fix-hd-flat-monitors-and-amdati-cards-not-displaying-full-screen-image .  Once I turned this setting all the way to Overscan at 0% the picture filled the screen and looked much sharper!!  I tried a few more tweaks here and there and it's looking awesome now!

review_title: Monitor is EXCELLENT - Rebate program is NOT
review_body: The Asus VS247H-P monitor was something I had been thinking about getting for a while before I finally took the plunge. I'm glad I bought one, because I honestly don't know how I lived without a second monitor before. Currently, I have the monitor attached to a Cheetah Mounts "ALAMLB" wall mount bracket and am using a Twisted Veins HDMI cable, which came with the Cheetah Mount, to run between the monitor and my HP G72 laptop.

review_title: Great Monitor - Straight Out of the Box
review_body: Not going to do a long indepth review here. Thought I'd add to those seeking more basic feedback. Monitor is fantastic. Straight out of the box and without a dead pixel in sight.

review_title: I will not purchase another Asus display and I obviously don't recommend this one
review_body: After less than a day of use I noticed a low buzz from both audio jacks, no matter what cord was used. This was a replacement for the same monitor having the same issue. I opted for a full refund after first trying n exchange. I will not purchase another Asus display and I obviously don't recommend this one.
Great monitors. :) I got 3 of them and put them on a stand, and they work perfect!

review_title: Awesome for the non FPS Gamer.
review_body: These really are great monitors and live up to the Asus standard for excellence. I would highly recommend these to anyone looking for a large monitor who don't necessarily need more than 60 FPS. I purchased 2 of these, but ended up returning mine because these are advertised as capable of 75hz, but I was only able to get them up to 65hz using a GTX980 and displayport cables. Instead I went with the 144hz capable Asus monitors.
Horrible monitor.
I bought two of these for my desk at work along with

review_title: Stuck pixels within 2 days, cheaply made
review_body: Stuck pixels within 2 days, glossy frame gets scratched literally if you breathe on it, seems cheaply made.

review_title: Good monitor, rebate is a scam
review_body: This monitor is large and gives a great picture, very bright and fast response time.  It is much thicker however, than other ultra thin ASUS monitors, even though it is advertised as the same, and it is quite a bit heavier.  I like the true ultra thin models better, and although I am keeping this one, in the future I would buy the thinner, lighter model. Set up is easy, and the VGA and DVI ports are on the back, flush with the back of the monitor, which is a plus versus having them located on the bottom of the monitor, which makes it difficult to connect.  BEWARE that the $20 mail in rebate is a scam, a third party vendor processes these and they claim they never received the documentation and thus cancelled the rebate.  Typical of these types of third party vendors, they pull this scam on all types of products, so don't factor the rebate into your final pricing/buying decision.  You will never get it.

I returned the first one of these monitors because it wouldn't stay on. Amazon sent me a replacement and I figured out that it wasn't the fault of the first monitor.It was the fault of the Manufacturer including very simple instructions. Which did not include information about updating the software in order to make the device work. It was supposed to work "out-of-the-box!" So! I went to the AOC support center and they told me to update the driver(s) and it works very well with my Desktop and my Laptop.

review_title: Monitor is not recommended. Neither is Square Trade
review_body: I've had this monitor for two years.  It gets only light use when traveling.  In that time the USB port on the monitor has broken twice.  The first time it was at 11 months and it was repaired under AOC warranty.  They sent back a scuffed-up replacement.  The second time Square Trade refused to honor the extended warranty I paid for.  Monitor is not recommended.  Neither is Square Trade.
1 Month Update (issues):

review_title: Occasionally screen goes black and disconnects signal. Have to ...
review_body: Occasionally screen goes black and disconnects signal.  Have to unplug and replug back in.  Could never get the image to change from portrait to landscape as advertised.  Excel appeared larger than on normal laptop screen and always needed adjusting.  Several co-workers had same issues.  Decent product for price.

review_title: Not durable at all. Don't bother!
review_body: Used it 3 times with my laptop before lines appeared on half the display  Contacted tech support and was told the damage was not covered.  I really liked the monitor but it wasn't worth $35 per use! Next time will buy another one from a reputable vendor with better customer care.

Great travel monitor, I really like it for under $100, but not sure I would go too much higher than that.  The power over USB is great, but the cord is pretty short and the soft case doesn't have a pouch for it.  I didn't have any issue getting it to work, though I do already have other DisplayLink monitors already running though a port replicator.  The resolution and clarity is usable even with CAD drawings.

review_title: EH - needs power and screen blinks constantly.  I wanna love it but it sucks  Can i send it back?
review_body: Does not work well with Surface 3.  I spent hours, i searched for and down loaded the drivers and the additional software app and upgraded drivers.

I wanted a smallish USB monitor I could occasionally plug into normally headless devices like my music server, which I typically operate through my iPad. This is a nicely styled device that is more or less ideal for my needs. I did not have a plug 'n play experience though. I previously had installed a 16" monitor using a SIIG USB3 to VGA adapter since my PC does not have VGA. After uninstallation, it left behind a component that is not compatible with Displaylink. The Displaylink web site described how to resolve the problem. I previously had a 9" DoubleSight USB monitor and that set my expectations low for USB monitors. That AOC is not bright compared to AC/DC monitors, viewing angle is limited, colors look washed out. Brightness is my main complaint but I guess there is only so much power that a USB3 port can provide. I could see where people who want a portable, second monitor could find this a very attractive option and judging from the nice, included neoprene carrying case, that is AOC's target customer. It does what I need it to do. I would prefer an AC/DC version with better brightness (small monitors are scarce now!). Bottom line: do not expect this to perform at the level of today's AC/DC monitors, otherwise it is perhaps the best of a small pack.

review_title: Drivers for these units don't work as advertised and expected - STAY AWAY FROM THESE MONITORS
review_body: If you are going to use a USB connection you will - as stated in the ad for this item - need a driver provided by DisplayLink.  What is not said is that DisplayLink no longer works with any consistency with Apple's present software.  They've come up with a workaround - it took a long time after the release of the new Apple software,  which shut down the use of the secondary screen.  The present beta driver has worked but only in a limited way - but now again with the newest Apple upgrade again fails to perform as expected.  This is a disaster.  DisplayLink sends out endless missives trying to cover the public relations nightmare of the failure of their software​ but offers few solutions.  And though they continue to promise full functionality, and simple plug and use, they don't have it as of this writing.  It is amazing to me that none of this is mentioned in the ad selling the monitors.

Purchased to use with my surface pro 2 (windows 8.1) which only has 1 usb port, so I also purchased a powered 4 port usb 3.0 hub to use with the monitor. The monitor does not work with the powered usb hub (even with both the usb connections from the monitor plugged in) When trying to use the monitor will flash the AOC logo and then go blank. The display link driver (most current driver available for download )(in system tray) will not load either with the usb hub.The mouse and hard drive all work fine with the new hub.  When plugged in directly to the surface pro 2 usb port the monitor works. However when setting the monitor up I get the warning message "your resolution is lower than 1440 x 1080 some items might not fit on screen"  This is the case and I do not get a scroll bar on most sites, so the text runs off the side of the screen with no way to access it. Overall a very disappointing experience. Perhaps it is just a limitation of the surface pro 2 video. Not sure why it does not scale the browser to make it usable. But I am returning the screen.

review_title: Good monitor for the price point!
review_body: Purchased for use with my desktop computer after the monitor I had died after about 18 years!!!  This one is nice and has worked well through heavy use for the one month that we've had it!  Hopefully it will continue to work well!

review_title: Surprised to find no speakers, otherwise love it
review_body: The quality of the display image is delightful for doing software development work. I spent more than an hour trying to figure out why I could not get sound to come out of the monitor before I found a posting somewhere saying that it had no speakers. What a surprise! It has speaker grills and even an electronic volume control on the menus.

review_title: Beautiful Monitor, Broke at 1 year mark, Bad Service/Support, Good Luck
review_body: Monitor is excellent for the price:
Screen Rez is very clear. Happy with th me choice and also very happy with the price. Uploaded images of what’s in the box.

Very pleased with this computer.  Highly recommend.  the only thing I don't like about it is that there are only 2 USB ports and they are in the front also sound connection is in front too.  I would have preferred to plug in my printer and mouse in the back.
Mine worked great for five months, but now has a flicker.  I would like a monitor that last longer than 5 months

review_title: Monitor itself is great! No dead pixels
review_body: Monitor itself is great! No dead pixels, blacks are acceptable, and it's much larger than i thought it would be!

This has been my go-to 1920x1080 monitor for a while now and I'm quite happy with it.  The power button / menu system is  bit hokey in the dark but otherwise its a fine monitor that uses very little space on the desk.

Came with No Instructions how to put screen stand etc together. Not Rocket Science so I figured it out. Decent screen but Why?????? put it on such a Cheap stand which Locks the screen at a Downward angle that seems Impractical for Any sitting or standing position by the User. I had to  Prop up the Front of the cheap little stand so a Not to Have to Crane My Neck. I would gladly have Paid a little more for a  stand that was Adjustable

review_title: Fair price and does what it is supposed to
review_body: Came out of the box with no issues. No damage and looks fine. This is my second monitor with my other being an Acer predator for running my games on. This does what I wanted it to do and I'm happy with the purchase. Price tag was not bad either. It has no height adjustment so keep that in mind when purchasing. Has limited tilt movement and no rotation. Stand holds well with no wobble. Overall, not a bad monitor.
This is my second Asus monitor in the last 3 years. The first one is still going strong, it was just time for an upgrade to a larger size and better resolution.

review_title: Great Monitor with a Bit of Misleading Advertising
review_body: This is a great monitor. There is virtually no glare, viewing angle is fantastic, and colors look great. The general aesthetic of the case is very professional and stylish. The glossy finish tends to attract fingerprints but it looks fantastic when clean. The 23.6in size is quite large and it is convenient if you need multiple windows up at the same time. I have had a little trouble with the monitor randomly going black for a second or two (while I'm using it, it wasn't going to sleep) but this very well could be a loose HDMI as I move my monitor around a lot. I will edit this is I ever find out which one is causing the problem. Overall though, I am very satisfied with my buy and would definitely recommend.

Although a fast CPU and plenty of RAM and hard drive space are important, the monitor is arguably the most important part of any computer system. After all, you’ll be staring at the screen virtually the entire time you’re using your computer.

review_title: Worst eye fatigue I've ever experienced
review_body: I purchased this monitor in Feb 2016, it's now June 2017 (1 year 4 months). I must have ended up with a slightly different monitor than the other satisfied people who have purchased this ASUS monitor, because the monitor I received is terrible and it hurts my eyes. I tried to tough it out and only use it for a few hours or so every couple of days, typically wearing sunglasses because it's tough to look at this thing without eye protection, but I can't handle this monitor anymore. I have experienced more eye fatigue on this monitor than any other monitor or screen I've ever dealt with.  I can't go more than 2 hours looking at this screen before my eyes hurt so bad that I have to stop using the computer. After a year and a half of this, I'm chucking this thing. I wish I had returned this monitor early on. I'm not sure if I can return it at this point :(

review_title: Good value.  Can handle color and graphics needs.
review_body: First, let me state that this monitor replaced a 8 year old 19" monitor (of another well known well rated brand). It came with a DVI cable, not an HDMI cable.  Luckily, I had ordered the AmazonBasics high speed HDMI cable with it, which works great. I was up and running in minutes. The colors are vivid and clear.  The graphics are sharp and crisp. I'm not currently gaming on this device so I can't tell you of there's any motion blur, etc.  However I will tell you that I can see color I didn't see before in my old monitor (for example, subtle shading differences between rows in a table, and things like that).  As other reviewers have stated, it comes out of the box optimized for showrooms, so it's bright.  If you have a brightly lit room, as I do, that will work fine.  At night, or in dimmer rooms, you'll want to pull up the menu and make some adjustments.

review_title: Great colors and lots of screen realestate
review_body: First impressions out of the box... wow. This is a lot bigger than my old one. I upgraded from an ancient 15" LCD to the ASUS 23" HD LED monitor. What a difference!

review_title: Great for my dorm room, would absolutely recommend!  ASUS did it again!
review_body: I really needed a monitor for my setup, and this was one of the cheapest monitors I could find from a brand that I trust that has HDMI with a suitable size.  When I first got the monitor, it was very easy to set up.  Simply plug it in, and woolah!  What gave me trouble was calibrating the colour.  The colour was extremely whitewashed, and it took me a day to calibrate it to how I wanted it to be.  After getting it set up though, I can firmly say this was a great purchase, and I thoroughly enjoy this monitor.  I am a college student, and this is great for getting my work done, as well as watching YouTube videos shamelessly in my bed at 2:00 AM.

review_title: Great monitor, Little bit of a wobbly stand.
review_body: Like many others, Ive done EXTENSIVE research into monitors before buying one. especially the "Lower end" TN monitors. I am so happy I went with this model.

review_title: beautiful, but for the price would have appreciated a better viewing angle range (READ 1-STAR UPDATE AT BOTTOM)
review_body: title says it all.  For the price, that is really the only comment I would make.  Viewing angle seems very sensitive to me, and I am losing picture quality just because the monitor isn't DIRECTLY ahead and at eye level since I have a multiple monitor setup.
After reading reviews for several monitors, I chose this one.

review_title: Didn't work on my Windows 10 laptop
review_body: I'm a software engineer and I know my way around computers. This thing absolutely did not work with my windows 10 laptop. The OS didn't even recognize it so there was no way to install the drivers from the website. You have to scour the internet to find the software that's included on the CD-ROM they provide but it won't help you either. Manual included is a joke and the website is terrible. I'd stick with a brand that has a better reputation.

Have recommended to my collegues, who have since made many purchases of this item for offsite project work.  Great to travel, fits well in backpack.  Note, the wire gets loose where it attaches, so be careful with it.  Otherwise, great graphic display and everything they said it was!  Great buy for the price.

review_title: works with usb3 but only after finding updated drivers
review_body: As far as USB monitors go, this has about the best price/performance ratio (at least as of Oct '13). Overall it is a satisfactory product.

review_title: Product is completely broken in under a year
review_body: This product started off decently enough. Sure, the relatively low brightness was a bit of an issue, but not a dealbreaker for me. I used it for a while as a third monitor and used it vertically for my code editor. I stored it away once I got another better monitor, and upon bringing it out again, it no longer works. Connecting a USB-C laptop to it powers it up, quickly followed by "No Signal" and then shutdown. Incredibly dissapointed with this product, and now I'm out $200 too. Avoid this product.

review_title: Screen cracks easily- Amazon's return policy is great.
review_body: I purchased one of these monitors and have to say it is not very portable as the screen cracks. After cracking the first screen within about 90 days of the purchase, I blamed myself for not being careful enough. I ordered a second identical screen, took extra pains to protect the screen in my computer bag by keeping the cardboard cover from the original packaging with the screen, being extra careful placing it in my bag and placing my bag on planes when I travelled. The second screen crack after just two flights. This is too delicate a product to travel with. If portable means around the office and not in a laptop bag, then this is a good screen. If you travel, this is not the right screen for you.

review_title: This monitor worked great for the first five months
review_body: This monitor worked great for the first five months, then the connector where the cord plugs into to the monitor came loose and I cannot get it to work anymore. I have been reading some of the other reviews and this appears to be a common problem with these monitors. This is something that should be corrected before they sale any more units. I was pleased with the color and the clarity, and the portability and ease of use, but now it is unusable.

I purchased this monitor June 2016, and wanted to use it for a while before I posted a review.  I spend part of my week working from home, and the other half working in the office.  In the office, there are no computer monitors in the 'hotel space' alloted.  For the record, my requirements are minimal - I just needed a monitor that was clear & fairly bright to spare my eyes the strain of looking at that tiny laptop screen for 8+ hours. This monitor delivers! The USB cord connects the monitor to my laptop and provides power, so I don't have to carry a separate power cord. I've knocked it over a few times, and it's holding up well. I store it in my backpack using the protective sleeve that came with it. There is a glare on the screen, so I'm looking into an anti-glare screen protector. Overall, no complaints. I would repurchase.

I normally don't write reviews but I wanted to warn anyone planning on buying the usb-c model. Make sure your usb-c port on your computer supports displays. USB C requires alt mode for it to support displays and without it you  will not be able to get this monitor to work. Thunderbolt 3 should be fine but if it's not thunderbolt check your computer manual before you buy this monitor. I am planning on returning this monitor and buying the regular USB monitor instead.

review_title: Good Value, I like it.  But Way too much glare.  Has shiny monitor sickness, bad!  Glossy Screen=bad design decision always.
review_body: PROs:

review_title: Great second monitor for home office
review_body: Worked great on my Windows 7 Lenovo X220.  However I don't have a CD drive so I had to go download the drivers for the monitor online.  Make sure you download the driver which includes the auto-rotate functionality.  After the driver install, monitor worked great - plug and play!

Great product for the money. The instruction for hooking it up are terrible. I used both cables to hook it up and you should only use one. Called tech support and they never asked how it was hooked up, returned it and got another and in the meantime a friend checked and laughed about using both cables....how dumb am I...not too if you look at the meager instructions.

review_title: Massive productivity boost as a dual screen monitor!
review_body: Pro:

review_title: Excellent Screen. Very impressed with the picture quality using ...
review_body: Excellent Screen. Very impressed with the picture quality using my HDMI cable that is plugged into my macbook pro. I can do the split screen or just shut the laptop and use it as my monitor with added keyboard and mouse. For the price, this is the best monitor I have seen, and I love the super thin edges. Looks great! Would definitely recommend!

review_title: No such thing as "Zero Frame Design"...
review_body: They are definitely nice monitors - super light and easy set up. I am very pleased with them aside from the fact that the "Zero Frame Design" is a crock. The exterior frame is roughly 3/32", but from the outside edge, in 7/16" is where the picture starts and there is no way of adjusting it to go all the way to the edge of the monitor. So if you have dual monitors, there is still going to be a 7/8" thick black line in the middle of your picture.

I have only had this monitor since November. I use it as an office monitor at home and today it suddenly started blinking and making a noise while flashing very pixelated images of the screen. I have changed cords and tried unplugging it and plugging it back in, no dice. Very disappointed.

review_title: Very impressed with this Acer Monitor!
review_body: This is an awesome monitor and exactly what I was looking for. It's very bright and sharp, and the screen is non-glare which was important to me. Also, the options for cables was perfect for me, HDMI, DVI, and VGA. I'm very happy with this purchase. My only complaint is that it has an external power adapter instead of internal like my old Dell monitor. I'm running out of room to plug in all the adapters. Colors are absolutely stunning! The price was very reasonable for the quality of this monitor.

review_title: ) The screen works great for all of my gaming addictions
review_body: Can I even use the word rugged when describing the quality of a monitor? :) The screen works great for all of my gaming addictions. No white around the edges and the colors are uniform across the whole screen and is very responsive. I like that the blue power button blinks at me when I forget to turn it off when my computer is off :)

I love acer monitors and equipment. I've worked on computers for years and whenever someone asks me I tell them to get an Acer or Asus. I liked this monitor so much I'm seriously considering getting a second one and a dual monitor mount for my desk.

review_title: Monitor looks great and was very easy to set up
review_body: Monitor looks great and was very easy to set up. I love the nearly borderless design. Colors are clear and crisp. With a little color/brightness adjustment, it displays great.

Screens arrived on time as ordered. The image quality is good. Very thin frame side-to-side. Very happy with the purchase ... now I need a new video card so I can run three monitors at once as a single display :o) I would recommend this for others as well as purchase again if needed. These monitors do not have a VESA mount, but who cares if you don't need one.

review_title: Absolutely fantastic monitor for its price that required a good deal of tinkering to get that way.
review_body: First of all, as of Q4 2012, there's no real reason to buy any other monitor if you're floating around this price point. The picture quality here is amazing for the price, the design is minimalist and attractive, bleeding is non-existent (on mine), and it's compliant with whatever that stand format is that lets you mount it.

review_title: Great Picture, Slow Wakeup, Tippy, and a Little Buggy on Mac
review_body: Response time, quality of picture, is better than expected for as monitor at this price point. Problems are that it seems to have a slow wake up time on Macs. I have seen this problem with other HDMI monitors on Macs as well. Other problems are that the on screen me menu does not work...at all. If this does not matter to you, like it does not matter to me, that's fine. The monitor works well without any specialized drivers for Mac...they don't exist anyway.
Asus makes outstanding monitors, including this one.  They are bright, reliable, and include a variety of cables. I have no problem with this monitor or with Amazon at all.

After going over several reviews of different monitors, I decided on this one. For the most part, the reviews were pretty positive. I couldn't spend to much on a new monitor and this one fit into my price range and offered the most for my money.

review_title: Seems great to me -- requires actual performing 4K HDMI cables
review_body: Works well with great image. I am not a wizard at graphics quality or other subtle aspects like video lag.

review_title: What can I say, it is a good Monitor for the money and it has IPS
review_body: It's a decent 1080p Monitor. It works when you turn it on. By default the color was off and tinted quite yellow but some playing around with the color settings menu was intuitive enough to figure out and fix.

review_title: As Perfect to the ASUS VN247H‑P As You Can Get
review_body: I needed to purchase a monitor that is as identical to the ASUS VN247H‑P model as possible, of which I have three of them, and found out this model is no longer made. After purchasing and returning two other models I came across the ASUS VS247H-P. Long story short, this model is slightly larger than my other models; however, it's as close to perfect as I can get. No issues with speed or quality. I am very satisfied with the purchase and overall product performance.

I purchased this monitor because it had a high percentage rating with regards to total number of ratings vs. total number of 4 and 5 star ratings. The one comment that gave me pause before purchasing was by an individual who felt that the "industry standard" regarding number of "dead" pixels was unacceptable (standard five or less "dead" pixels is an industry standard). I went ahead and purchased the monitor. Right out of the box, there were two (2) "dead" pixels on the screen. Now this might seem small and most users would probably never notice the missing pixels, but it so happens I work with 3D models. And guess what, the "dead" or "missing" pixels are right in the middle of my work area! Lucky me!!! Well, I've learned to live with them (the "dead" pixels) so far, but they are an annoyance! There are some simple utilities available on line that may or may not correct the "dead" pixels, currently I have not tried any of them. So I'm giving this monitor three stars only which I think is generous. Beyond the pixel issue, the color and clarity is very good. There are some occasional "flickering" issues but not to the detriment of my projects.

review_title: Premature Failure W/V. clip showing symptom
review_body: This review is for the Asus model VS247H-P PC monitor.

The image on this monitor is fantastic for 1080p, and considering the price and size, even more so. However, the audio output is ABYSMAL. I hooked it up to my speakers via the 3.5 jack, and the sound is tinny and hollow. I daresay even the monitor's built-in speakers give you better quality! This REALLY sucks, because the audio out was one of the main reasons I purchased this monitor. Of course, if you're just planning to use it with your computer, you can hook your speakers to that. But I also plan to use it for console gaming, and the sound quality is just unacceptable.

I was very excited to get this product but became quickly disappointed.  The color is fairly washed out and the drivers that you can get from AOC for a mac do not have the on screen programming or capability to adjust contrast, brightness, etc.  So it is not good for doing things with graphics on them as the picture is not great to look at.
This is a good product, thats plagued by issues.

I LOVE this thing. It worked on the first try when I plugged it in to my Win7 laptop. I did have issues with my Win10 tablet but it turned out to be a needed Windows update. Since then it's been perfect. I have dual monitors for my home office and wanted the same for travel. This does the trick. I also love the travel sleeve that's included.

review_title: Perfect - exactly what I was looking for
review_body: Exactly what I needed, and, great price.  I have a Samsung laptop, and, it works great with it.  I had to download the drivers, and have had no problems at all.  Because of the work I do, I really need to use two monitors, so, when I travel, it's difficult to only use my laptop screen.  Not a problem anymore with this!  Also, I decided to bring it with me, as a backup, for a client meeting.  Great thing I did, because the meeting room with the overhead was unavailable last minute, and we instead had to sit around a table.  Rather than the three other people cramming around my laptop, I was able to plug in this monitor, and turn the monitor to face them.  It worked out perfect!

review_title: I'm not 100% sure if it came with a bad cable or (pretty sure) the port on the screen ...
review_body: The USB port on the screen is so sensitive that if you disturb the cable in any fashion the screen blinks in and out.  I'm not 100% sure if it came with a bad cable or (pretty sure) the port on the screen is crummy.  Otherwise, it's great for when I am traveling and need an extra screen for programming or to throw up an Excel sheet or something.

I love this monitor. I got it to work with my work laptop. Beautiful resolution and clarity. The only reason I didn’t give it 5 stars was because I had a difficult time getting it to work on a windows 10 machine. The drivers on the CD are not the correct ones. Look on the “display link” website for the ones with “displaylink windows 10” in the title.
More than happy with this product  land especially for the price!

review_title: I am enjoying the product A LOT, but it should come with instructions.  Not so plug and play with older laptops.
