review_body: A friend told me about this monitor.  THIS HAS IMPROVED THE EFFICIENCY OF ME WORKING REMOTE. YAAAAY!!! I would have to ding the manufacturer because they don't have any instructions in the box so you have to search the internet to learn how to connect it to a MAC and  PC, if you have problems. It supposed to be plug and play, but I struggled to get it to work with both of my older laptops.  Once I got passed that, it has been awesome to use.  Also, they provided a cover for the monitor. I do not recall if that was advertised, but it was a nice bonus.

review_title: It works just fine, just buy something else if you need to ...
review_body: This monitor only will work when the drivers are loaded up so don't expect to see your BIOS or the start of windows booting up. I use this as the only monitor for a crypto mining rig, and as such it doesn't work well. The time I really need a monitor is when the system isn't working properly, and that is most likely when windows isn't booting. It works just fine, just buy something else if you need to use it for diagnostics.

Nice when it works. Amazon was great in troubleshooting then exchanging the first monitor when it intermittently stopped working on my Win 7 work laptop. This replacement has been more reliable, but still stops being recognized 25 - 30% of the time, which is far too often. I do not have the option to upgrade to Win 10, which is apparently more reliable with this type of USB monitor due to corp IT policy, so will have to shelve this until I can upgrade the OS.

review_title: I like how wide it is
review_body: Very vivid and bright screen.  I like how wide it is; as a lawyer I am usually swapping between three or more different windows, so even with two screens its a bit of a hassle.  With this screen, I can fit two full-sized documents side by side, leaving my laptop screen available for the internet or other programs.

Beautiful colours and angles. Super thin frame looks gorgeous! The only downside I'd point out is that it only comes with VGA cable so you have to spend a couple more $$ if you don't have a spare DVI cable.

I mostly use this monitor as a professional music arranger, so a sharp clear picture is important. With the nice wide monitor I can see a lot more music notation on one page, both up and down and side to side. Wish I had bought one this size long ago. I like to use Rail Europe pictures as a desktop slide show and the pictures come out in beautiful sharp color.

review_title: Great picture but no sound on 2017 MACBOOK Pro with ...
review_body: Great picture but no sound on 2017 MACBOOK Pro with a doc.  No sound is the only reason for 4 stars.  The monitors are extremely bright I’ve turned down the brightness all the way and it seems to better on my eyes and still has a crisp picture using HDMI 4K.

review_title: A good monitor that is a good bang for the buck.
review_body: This is a good monitor. I brought this for work, and it has been working well. The image on the display look good, but definitely a step below from mid to higher range monitors. When purchasing electronics I do think that one has to manage expectations, and for the price you can't get any better. I do think it could be a bit brighter, but this is only a minor flaw. Also, take note that you can't adjust the stand so if you need the monitor to be higher you will need to add a monitor stand which also adds to the cost. Also the bezels are thin, so it makes it easy to buy two for a dual monitor setup. I haven't checked for light bleed as the other reviewers, and to my eye the backlight is even. I do think that after using the monitor for a while the lightbleed shouldn't be a major deal, at least to me it isn't. Overall, I would reccomend this to someone who is on a budget, wants a good monitor and is okay living with the comprises that inevitably come with a lower price tag.

review_title: these are replacing a mismatched pair -- of which one died.
review_body: To me the best features are

Great value at $130!  I needed a dual-monitor set-up and was on a budget, so I opted for a pair of low end IPS monitors.  The monitors are pretty decent and run 75hz well; however, the back light bleed is present in both monitors and pretty horrendous in one.There is height adjustment built in and the stands are nice, but there is a lot of play.  If you bump your desk, they will wobble.

I am really enjoying this new monitor. It has plenty of real estate to open 2 programs side-by-side and they are still usable. It seemed really bright at first, but my 6 yo monitor may have been dying a slow dim death for a while. The only draw back is that I have to use it at a higher resolution than my old monitor. Everything looked so tiny! I overcame this by making my icons larger and upping the magnification on my web browser to 150%.

The Acer R240HY 24" monitor works great for the price.  Color and sharpness is very good.  The stand is minimal but seems solid and well balanced.  Works with my Windows 7 Plug-n-play driver.  NOTE:  I had to manually update the driver, the auto-update didn't work.  However this is a Windows' issues not an Acer issue.  Acer does provide a driver but no auto-install for the driver.  To get the monitor to work in as single monitor or dual monitor took me about 2 hours to figure out.

review_title: This item has a great price, and amazing form factor
review_body: This item has a great price, and amazing form factor.  The bezels surrounding the screen are tiny, making it a very sleek looking monitor.  The stand is also both aesthetically beautiful and sturdy, and the screen is nicely finished to prevent glare.  However, 3 stars is due to lack of color saturation.  I ultimately exchanged this for a samsung product because I was unhappy with the colors, which looked washed out to me.
Really good monitor, IF you can figure out the settings.

If you're looking for an LED under $130, this is definitely the product for you. And it is a large widescreen format. Great value monitor with crisp, high resolution. If you look at the other reviews out there on the bottom-end of the scale people have had issues. I was skeptical but based on the high number of positive reviews took a chance. You have to play with the brightness and contrast settings to set the picture right for you (don't listen to all the brightness "bleed" comments - I think those people just don't know how to tweak the settings (I keep my brightness and contrast both at 55 and it looks great). The base isn't the strongest and it wobbles a little when you touch the monitor, but when it's just sitting there it is totally fine. FYI mine had no pixels out and 2 weeks later had a red pixel dot near the center of the screen for the day but has since disappeared - and I'm not sure if it was the monitor or the video card producing it. Either way the pixel is no longer out and it is an excellent picture. Highly recommend this product!

review_title: Great monitor at an unbeatable price
review_body: Probably the best monitor you can buy for the money. I have two of these set up in a dual monitor configuration, and oddly, the monitors are slightly different. Not just the colors, but the model. The one seems to be newer than the other. They both work flawlessly though, and have very good color and contrast (the older model seems to have deeper blacks). The only reason I'm knocking a star off is because I got two different ones, which does make it a little awkward.

I purchased this monitor after seeing such amazing reviews after nearly 5000 buyers came back to report. I seem to have fallen victim like the rare other poor reviewers. The colors seems washed out and whenever I set the monitor to 1920x1080, the display has a 1.5 inch black border that isn't used. I have left it on 1680x1050 as its the only one that comes close to filling in the monitor. I have updated my Radeon r9 270x video drivers twice and tried countless times to fiddle with the color settings on both the OS and the monitor.

review_title: The screen size (I bought the 27") is wonderful, and the quality (all the touchy-feely nuances like ...
review_body: I have always struggled to pick between the hundreds of computer monitors available on the market. What is the value of 1 ms response time vs a 5 ms response time? How much is it worth to upgrade from 50,000:1 contrast ratio to 80,000:1 contrast ratio? As a general rule, I've given screen size and price the most importance and weighed the other criteria only tangentially.

Just installed it. My first impression is dissapointment. Maybe if I didn't already have his small brother VS247H-P, wich is by all means perfect, I would have a better impression, but I have it to compare with, side by side.

review_title: Graphics are great, text rendering is not so good
review_body: The graphics are very bright and clear, but text font clarity is blurry.  There is a distinct "ghost" image to the right.  I tried it using VGA and HDMI connections; even HDMI didn't help.  To be fair, I've seen this on a lot of monitors, but on a monitor this big, which magnifies the font, it's bad enough to bother my eyes.  If all you're doing is gaming or watching videos, this monitor is probably great.  For programming or working with documents, this monitor is just not acceptable.

review_title: The Big, Bold and the Beautiful
review_body: I had to choose between a higher performing 24" or a theatrical 27" and I go big instead of going home. I upgraded from 2 21.5" ASUS monitors.

review_title: Ignore the naysayers, this is a great monitor at a great price!
review_body: After reading the reviews I was a little hesitant to buy this monitor because, although there were many, many great to good reviews, there were also others that made me doubt whether this monitor was the way to go.

review_title: This is my second purchase of this monitor
review_body: The first one I've had for a year+ and it's still running fine. The main reason I like it is because of all the different connection options. I'm not using it for graphics design, so I can't attest to the exact color representation, but for programming/office work/gaming I can't complain a bit. Even the slight angle since I have multi monitor doesn't change the color. It's actually a bit too bright out of the box, but that can be adjusted.

review_title: Does not support 29.97p frame rate for ATEM Studio HD
review_body: I bought this to connect to an

Screens are great for every day use. Worst parts are the stands which aren't weighted heavily enough such that any slight table movement (such as mundane tasks like typing) will cause the tops to bounce around. The lack of elevation adjustment is also enormously unfortunate.

review_title: Really cheap and not bad, but not great
review_body: I was really surprised to find an IPS monitor this size this cheap.  I wasn't expecting the color to be as good as on my older, more expensive IPS monitors and boy, it's really not close.  It's decent monitor, but don't put it next to a good one or you'll see how off the color is.

I picked this Acer monitor up in 2015 and so far it’s been great. It’s connected to my PC and my Xbox One and I use it for gaming, streaming, school and work. The feature I like the most is the bezeless display. I do wish that it had a normal stand. Since the base of the stand is circular, it sticks out and takes up some desk space but if you have a large desk, it shouldn’t be an issue. If you’re looking for a great and affordable all round monitor, pick this up. If you’re looking for something for gaming, i’d pick up something with a higher refresh rate.

Colors are nice and sharp, although I do not have too much experience with HD external monitors. I really like the minimal bezel, will be buying a second monitor when I build a desktop. Contrary to what was mentioned on the product page, the monitor does not come with an HDMI cable, just VGA. This can be easily remedied with a $6 VGA to HDMI connector. Took a star off as the monitor is not the sturdiest, although this could be a problem with my table as well. Nevertheless, it could be better, there is a slightly noticeable shake while typing and a significant shake when adjusting the monitor settings using the buttons at the base.
I'm using this monitor to type a review right now!

review_title: I work in operations so I dont need super high res imagry
review_body: I use this for my macbook air 11" and it works well. The screen is very slightly fuzzy, but I have not messed with the settings yet. I work in operations so I dont need super high res imagry, If you are a designer you may want to buy the bigger setting, but I highly recommend this monitor.

review_title: Good for the price, has some minor issues.
review_body: Good monitor, but there is some ghosting when playing games so you will see the object's "onion skin" or a light shadow of it when moving a camera quickly. Has some light bleed too but that's to be expected, and the screen does not reach the absolute edges, instead it has about a half inch (maybe less) of black space including the small bezel.

review_title: Good monitor but SO disappointed in Amazon. They want me to pay $18.99 for a part missing from the box.
review_body: I am so disappointed in Amazon. I ordered this monitor and it came without one of the cords - the ac converter. It clearly shows in the product instruction brochure that it is supposed to be in the box.

So the title of my review is to catch anyone's attention. Now that you're here, I'll explain why I want your attention. This monitor is very good (so far). I am typing this review on this monitor and it is amazing but there are some things that I would like to point out. Here we go.

Works well and is very convenient.  Impressed at how compact and light it is.  Very easy to travel with.  Only complaint is if you do not have a CD drive, it's tricky to find the correct driver and get it to work.  Worked flawlessly on my old laptop, but had issues with my new laptop--didn't always refresh.  I seemed to have more issues with this after the computer had gone idle.  Took multiple attempts at downloading drivers and quite a bit of searching online forums to make it work. ...but now that it works again, it's fantastic.

review_title: Used with HP envy dv7 17.3" Laptop with Windows 8.1 for school
review_body: My workplace spoiled me with having two monitors to perform my daily functions. After I purchased my HP envy I was forced back to doing my school work on one monitor. This, of course, was not working for me. At first, I was using my kids 20” LCD TV and the HDMI connection for a second monitor. However, this was just not working (for the kids, lol). So, I jumped on Amazon in search of another monitor but wanted something that I could keep with my laptop all the time. Walla, I found the AOC 16” USB powered monitor.

review_title: Must have for the mobile tech
review_body: Great screen...helps a lot when you do tech work on the road...able to read the onenote and teamviewer into another computer, switch to the web browser to see their firewall, printer settings, term serv...you need the display link drivers, just download them and install and the screen comes up, if you don't then it will just flash and go dark again...5 minute download, works with my mac at home too...the one pic is in the break room of a drs office

review_title: Clunked out after about 14 months of periodic use
review_body: Downgraded from 3 stars to 1.

review_title: AOC vs ASUS --> definitely get the ASUS
review_body: Available portable monitors are limited, after some research seemed like best value onces are AOC vs Asus.

review_title: Not for traveling or moving around at all.
review_body: Are you looking for a second screen to sit on your desk? If so buy a second monitor, not this.

review_title: Works like a charm on Ubuntu 15.10.
review_body: I had some doubts about this product for using it on an Ubuntu Desktop (15.10 Wily Werewolf). I downloaded the latest driver from DisplayLink at http://www.displaylink.com/downloads/ubuntu and executed the binary file it contains. I've got a few warnings, because the driver was intended to be installed on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS, but it worked immediately. No need to restart the system.

review_title: I would like to give this less one star
review_body: I would like to give this less one star.  I read the reviews about the cords not staying in and gave it a chance anyway.  I was using this as a secondary monitor on the go drafting.  The cable would indeed come out on its own.  It is not so much that the cord comes out but that it seems like the connections on the inside are loose.  After 9 months I gave up using the monitor and considered it a waste of $100.  Well, recently my laptop monitor died do to my own fault and I pulled out this monitor to at least have something to see on.  The monitor worked for 2 days (still with same cord issues and then just stopped.  If i jiggle the cord, eventually I get it back on...but then if set the monitor down, it shuts off.

review_title: Completely disappointed in the purchase of this monitor
review_body: WOW!  Completely disappointed in the purchase of this monitor.  The installation instructions, both printed and on the CD, are both incomprehensible and are a joke.  Tried for unsuccessfully several hours to find online support.  Does NOT work with the latest version of Windows.  Do not be fooled by the positive review, like I was.  I wish I would have read all the 1-star reviews before making this purchase.  Not I have to return and find another monitor.  Extremely disappointed.

review_title: Good Monitor / Great Price for those that enjoy two monitors on the go.
review_body: I read a lot of reviews on this monitor before buying.  Here are my thoughts:

review_title: Tough to wall mount. Spontaneously cycles (rapidly) through the inputs.
review_body: If you plan on mounting this to the wall you need to know a couple things. You will need 90 degree cables as the inputs all come straight out the back. You will also need a 90 degree power cord for the same reason. Of greater irritation is that the screw holes for mounting are exactly in line with the power cord.

After months and days of research and decision I decided to pull the trigger and got it. Overall a great monitor! Nice color with sharpness it's a bit tough to see in certain angel but I do have my monitor high. Very impress with the gaming quality and colors! As for the yellowish tint. I had that as well when first open but when I went into setting and saw that it was set to "user mode" which had the RGB at 100%. I select normal and everything is fine. Also, I let the monitor burn in for a couple of hours and never saw the yellowish tint again. I will update if anything change.

Good monitor but bad cable. When you buy this monitor, I recommend that you also upgrade to a better cable, such as the one found here: http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B000ANOZ58?psc=1&redirect=true&ref_=oh_aui_search_detailpage. The cable that came with the monitor lasted only a short time. It is small and quite inadequate. With the horrid colors, I originally thought something was wrong with the monitor, but the new cable solved the problem. So don't discard the monitor if you have color trouble -- just upgrade your cable.

As with anything you buy nowadays, you have to read the good and bad reviews. You have to look at the percentages of each and decide if it's worth the gamble. In the case of the ASUS 248H-P, the goods had a significant majority (the price played a part as well) so I decided to go for it. I read one reviewer who mentioned several clues to a good or bad monitor.  With all due respect to said reviewer, I don't know how accurate those statements are but I will say the monitor I received seems to be one of the good ones based on those clues. As far as function, it works beautifully. The display colors are vibrant and I see no pixel issues at all. I have only had it a few days and only time will tell how good this unit really is. My last monitor was 10 years old when it died for good. It was a Samsung 226BW and I had to have the board caps replaced around 5 years in. For the price I feel pretty good about this one though and I've had good experience with ASUS brand equipment.

review_title: Best Monitor I have  ever owned...
review_body: This is my second Asus 27". The first one is 5 or 6 years old and still works like new. It has  out lived 2 32" TV sets that served along with it  on a  computer desk. It is fair to say one  was a off brand and the other was a high end Samsung. The Asus out lived them both. Plug and  play on  Win  10 setup for dual monitors with extended desktop. Both are running  off 2 computers. a "Daytime" mundane task  PC and a bad boy game PC with a $400.00 video  card. Asus  rocks with stock charts and  dead aliens. I didn't even consider another  brand. Go with what has  proven to work.

review_title: Excellent display; has sound as well!
review_body: High quality monitor used as a computer/ work dual screen and for playing video games.  Great resolution; makes plugging my ps4 into my 55" HDTV feel like a downgrade.  Lightweight and easy to transport when needed.  The ability to adjust screen tilt is nice to have as well.  5 stars if there was a headphone port or usb/ bluetooth capability.

review_title: Ridiculously Beautiful Picture, Illogical Plug Configuration
review_body: This monitor makes my old 17" square LCD, CFL, VGA monitor look like a CRT by comparison. Superb sharpness and contrast, intense colors, no motion blur while watching sports or flash video. Live streaming MLB games in HD are awesome on this monitor; I can make out individual blades of grass, the picture is so beautifully clear !

review_title: Excellent Monitor, flimsy stand (but there is a solution)
review_body: The first one of these I bought was over a year ago for a home office. Job changed so the monitor became part of a multi display home office along with a Dell monitor from years ago.

review_title: Horrible and inconsistent colors, impossible to read
review_body: I was hoping to upgrade from an old monitor that is having power issues, but buying this one was a bad idea.  Blacks are nowhere near black  The display was permeated with a sickening yellow tinge that I couldn't get rid of no matter what I tried.  I even went as far as swapping out several different HDMI cables.  I don't know what the deal is, but I couldn't read anything on it for more than a few minutes without feeling sick.  Text was still impossible to read without nausea even after tweaking ClearType settings for a half hour.  Sending it back.

I needed a 22 inch 1920 Monitor with an HDMI port.  This one fits the need very well and at a very competitive price. The base piece that you mount to the stand is very easy to remove (just flip open a plastic façade and remove 4 screws... and it has a standard VESA mount in the back (I mounted mine on an Ergotron Swing Arm).  It comes with a great selection of color/brightness presets (Splendid Video Intelligence) so it is a snap for a range of applications without needing to sit there and tweak everything.

review_title: Great Monitor for my gaming PC
review_body: Great Monitor for my gaming PC. Has awesome visuals and wide angles as well as FPS, no dead pixels or anything after 3 years. I like the sturdy mount and the fact that you can tip it slightly up or down depending on your viewpoint.

So there are mostly pros on this product but a few cons, first of all right out of the box the monitor was very slick and nice, it comes with a VGA cord and power cord, no remote but what do you expect its a monitor. And heres a list of pros and cons;

review_title: Can't be beat for the money!
review_body: I've purchased IPS monitors from just about every company. While this one is not the best that I am is awfully close at about a third the price of what I'm comparing it to. It's stylish, great design, offers good to excellent display of just about anything you want to put on it. I can't speak to longevity obviously I just got it but I can speak to quality of the display its excellent don't hesitate if you're looking for a monitor of the any type. You won't be disappointed.

I bought this and after reading some of the comments I wasn't sure about it. I bought it anyway and it is the absolute best. There is no need to go buy an expensive monitor when this is abailavle. I did a check on all the colors and there were zero deadspots. The trim around the outside is barely 1/4 of an inch it's great for dual setups. It does tilt and I have not had any problems what so ever with light glaring it's the best monitor available in my opinion.

review_title: I purchased 2 for dual setup and love the fact it "auto switches" depending on the feed ...
review_body: I'm very picky about electronics (ANY and ALL) and to my surprise, after trying about 4 different monitors, these by far were a notch above.  I purchased 2 for dual setup and love the fact it "auto switches" depending on the feed going into the port. (i.e. HDMI/VGA/DVI)  Well done and much better than the VIOTEK 27in and LG 34in monitors I tested out before settling on these...

So far so good. No dead pixels. Great resolution for the price. And this monitor does have speakers, but they suck. So use that however you want. Overall, a great purchase. Will probably buy a second one when i need one..

review_title: Good monitor - no issues so far
review_body: Has been a great monitor so far. I've noticed that sometimes they're a little dark - I have them near a window in my office and even with the blinds/shades, when it is bright the screens can be a little difficult to see. Have had to adjust them a couple times.  I got this to replace an older LED screen and have to say this one is much better.  Would recommend for anyone needing a general LED monitor for their office.

review_title: I have had this monitor for about 6 months. ...
review_body: I have had this monitor for about 6 months. Today the screen started showing flickering horizontal lines regardless of input from HDMI or VGA. I have tried using two different laptops as a connection, so it is not the computer causing it. I also tried separate HDMI cables, and verified it is the monitor causing the problem. I expected a longer shelf-life from Acer than 6 months.

This is a nice monitor. Coming from EGA times, these things never cease to amaze me. Color is crisp, viewing angles are adequate, and the thin bezel and build quality makes this look and feel like a monitor three times its cost.  For average workstation use, get this monitor. You won't be disappointed. Unless you're a graphics designer, or a *nix haxor, but even then, it'll be a reasonable facsimile of what they use in Russia.

review_title: Great for the price but colors are off
review_body: I really like this monitor, it's nice and sleek. Makes my office space look much better.

Though the colors on the screen don't pop and aren't as crisp as my ultra 4k screen on my Lenovo, this was expected when I purchased it. I've only had it for a few hours and it doing it's job as a second source of viewing information. I'm actually going to purchase another one. The screen is extremely lightweight and compact. It fits in a traditional backpack (with my laptop inside of the slot) fine. I may be a messenger bag when the second one arrives, so I won't strain my back.

I absolutely love this auxiliary monitor! It has been a blessing to have two screens with my laptop wherever I go. My only wish would be to be able to adjust the brightness. However, this monitor is well built and works great. The neoprene case and cable are handy and also well-made. Do yourself a favor and get the SquareTrade warranty Amazon offers for only a few buck. They're an excellent warranty company!

review_title: Won't be disappointed unless you want a bigger screen
review_body: Awesome little monitor. Well worth the $$.  I travel frequently and working on a single 12" display on my HP Elitebook was painful.  Works great on Windows 8.1.  This monitor comes with a USB cable that plugs into two USB ports.  I have tested multiple connections works just as well on a single USB 2.0 port.  The display and included case just fits into my swissgear TSA friendly backpack.

I use this monitor for work travel when I need a second screen.  There is some lag when I use it with my Macbook pro, but none when on my windows machines.  Depending on the laptop, it will work with one USB or it may need both.  Clarity isn't bad.  For a $100 travel monitor, it does its job.  I would recommend to anyone just needing a little bit more screen space, but not for gaming or full time use.

Great portable second screen. Just plug it into your USB port and you are ready to go.  Comes with a nice protective sleeve for when it is not in use. Removed one star because it keeps losing connection to my computer making it necessary to remove the USB and reconnect.

This monitor is good value for the money.  It's light and portable and fairly rugged.  The resolution could be better, but it meets our needs.  Our firm does field audits in a variety of locations and all of our staff carry one of these monitors to every audit.  I expect gamers and people that want to watch movies would find the resolution too low, but for spreadsheets and word documents, it works well.

review_title: Good product but pay attention to the specs
review_body: I bought this monitor to position in a portrait orientation, since it's dimensions while standing would align with my 27" primary monitor for a sort of sleek custom look. It's also very convenient because since it's just a USB cable for both data and power, it would plug into the primary monitor's built in USB hub. Worked out good!
I can't recommend this monitor.

review_title: not proprietary like some have claimed
review_body: Using device on:

review_title: I really like it in landscape mode
review_body: I bought this to use with my laptop as a second screen when working.  Prior to receiving it, I thought I'd place it next to my laptop and use it in portrait mode. After receiving it, I realized there were a couple of issues with portrait mode:

review_title: Great monitor, but be aware of PWM.
review_body: Great monitor. Wide viewing angle. There is one gotcha though - if the brightness is not on 100% - the backlight flickers. This is because it uses Pulse-Width Modulation (PWM) to control the brightness. Basically, the LED doesn't dim - instead it turns ON/OFF about 200 times a second with varying duration of the ON phase, to create an illusion of darker image. See for yourself - put brightness on 50% and wave pencil in front of the screen - you will see several pencils like in a stroboscope. This causes eyes fatigue and headaches in some people. Luckily there is a simple solution. Put brightness on 100% and reduce contrast setting to reduce brightness. Test with the pencil again - no stroboscope effect. This might distort the collors a little but it's much better than the headache. And for the price - I love it.

review_title: Dont buy of you are plannning to mount using an arm or flat panel mount.
review_body: What a disappointment.  I bought this monitor to replace an existing smaller ASUS VS238H-P.  After spending time dismounting the smaller monitor from a flexible arm mount and replacing it with the larger one, I found I could NOT attach the power chord since it was partially covered by the mounting bracket.  The SMALLER ASUS monitor had no such problem. . I soon discovered the  VESA  100 mounting holes on the back of the new larger monitor were not centered on the case.  They are 5 mm closer to the lower edge of the monitor.  How hard can it be to put the holes in the middle of the monitor case --or even somewhere NEAR the center?  I contacted ASUS customer service to inquire if this was a manufacturing defect or had they purposefully not adhered to the VESA standard.  All the representative  would ask me was if I had read the manual? The manual says nothing except that it has VESA mounts on the back.  What hurts even more is I have to PAY to ship it back. I generally like AUS and currently own 8-10 of the VS238s and am quite pleased with their performance.  The experience with this product was definitely not what I expected from ASUS

was skeptical about this television due to other reviews that mentioned there be two identical models and which one you got was kind of a crap shoot. Thanks to user Frank A. Hurtado I was able to correctly identify that I had in fact received the "good" monitor.

review_title: Terrible Warranty / Customer Service  -  Works great as long as it's working...
review_body: Monitor worked great for a few months, monitor then developed black spots on the screen above the buttons.  I went over the warranty information and found that there was 'dead pixel' coverage.  I was not sure what the cause of the black spots were and contacted ASUS customer support.  I uploaded a picture of the problem and asked about a warranty replacement.  I was told to RMA the monitor for repair.  Cost bit over $20 to send the monitor via UPS to the RMA center.

I am an avid photographer and have been doing all of my editing on a 4:3, 19" monitor. I have wanted an IPS display for a long time, but the cost had been prohibitive and they were a compromise when it came to video and gaming. When the prices and response times began to drop dramatically, I felt it was time to take the plunge. There are several very good displays in the under $300 range and the decision wasn't an easy one. The Asus 239 showed a lot of promise both in user and professional reviews. The one consistent knock was the stand and that was easily rectified with a fully adjustable Gateway garage sale find ($5.00).

review_title: Size is not what is pictured. Monitor stand is very short.
review_body: I went from a 27" Dell LCD to the Asus because of price and I needed a monitor fast, after 6 years w/Dell (dead pixels.) I couldn't afford another Dell so after searching for a 24" LED, I settled on the Asus. I made a huge mistake in buying this. First, the main photo in the description is deceptive. This monitor is not as wide as pictured. It is a square size monitor, not rectangular as shown. Color calibration is essential and it will take hours until you find your correct personal settings. Once calibrated (search online for free calibration) I found I could not stretch the screen, so I have approx. 1" of black all around. I did not use the recommended resolution because I found I needed a magnifying glass to read the screen. I tried to stretch the screen but Windows 7 does not have that option although earlier versions of Win does. So, in essence instead of a 24" screen, I have a 22". Makes a world of difference if you are working with photos and vids as I do. Now, after calibrating, I went to a friend's new website and was asked if I liked the background color. All I saw was white. Went to my tablet, laptop and phone to check the background and the color was visible on those. Not sure if it is me or the monitor. The stand is very, very short and is only moveable forwards/backwards. I have it sitting on my desk with two thick books underneath the stand. I am 5'2" and if I used the stand alone, I would be looking over the top of the monitor. Not sure why Asus does not make an adjustable screen as it certainly would be useful for visualization. As some reviewers have said, looking at the screen from any angle other than straight ahead is useless. I agree. Luckily this is a very lightweight (almost too lightweight) that I can lift and turn it when working with photos. Had I not needed a monitor in a pinch, I would have said some money and gotten a better monitor. For a basic, basic monitor it's okay. If you work with photos or do heavy editing, this is not for you. I'm lucky I have the laptop and tablet to turn to when needing close-ups or writing docs. Personally, it's my fault for rushing into purchasing this and plan to find out how to return it.

review_title: A  very solid monitor for the price!
review_body: I have been using Asus monitors for years, ever since the purchase of my (then) top of the line Samsung multisynch monitor (over $500 at the time of purchase) failed in the first 3 months and was replaced by a string of lemons, all refubs, most dead on arrival.  I bought my first Asus monitor to pinch hit while those were going back and forth in the mail.  I never got a good monitor from Samsung during my warranty period even though 5,6,7? passed through the house, BUT my Asus is still working.  I have since bought them for my son and daughter.  We are all very happy, and have not once had occasion to call for customer service or repair.

I just received this monitor yesterday. I have been a Dell man for more than a decade (actually every flat panel I've bought has been a Dell) before that I bought Sony and Viewsonic and these where tube monitors, not flat screens *heavy, heavy monitors*.

review_title: while the quick response of tn 1-2hz was not so easy to spot well
review_body: am not an expert on monitors at all, i just wanted an 1080 IPS monitor because everyone praised their colors, but i also do gaming so i was unsure about ips vs TN 1ms monitors, in the end i choose this as many people said the color would be noticeable right away, while the quick response of tn 1-2hz was not so easy to spot
First, I would like to state I was using this monitor: http://www.amazon.com/HP-W1907-19-inch-Widescreen-Monitor/dp/B000OK1046
Nice monitor for the price. Others claim it comes with an HDMI cable but mine did not. I use it for mostly work and text is clear, there is minimal blur, and so far it's been working fine.
Great monitor, very clear and bright. Pretty big and was a great price as well.

review_title: Pixels creating a "smudge" mark with blue tint
review_body: It may just be a faulty one, but in under 24 hours my monitor already has discolouring around the middle of the screen. It's a noticeable blue smudge mark that is definitely there when the screen is supposed to be white. It's not just my eyes. I have taken out the HDMI cable that I use, from my computer and monitor, and swapped ports. I have tried configuring the screen tint and it's still there, turning it off and back on. It's a nice screen other than this issue, but I'm not going to buy another one of these again. The cost isn't worth the risk of it happening again. If anyone else has this issue and has fixed it, please let me know.

review_title: Great monitor, just died suddenly so.
review_body: Worked great for about a year and half, monitor cable port stopped working. Monitor is gorgeous, and works great for pretty much everything, and has thin bezels as well, just didn't expect it to die so quickly.

This really is a great monitor. I haven't had it too long but so far it's pretty great. I recently got a gaming pc and figured this would be a good monitor for my first one as it wasn't too expensive. For the size and quality it is phenomenally priced. Plus with the bezel less design it looks down right beautiful. It's only 60hz so if you're really into competitive gaming then this may not be for you, but for anyone else it is so worth the price.
This makes a great primary monitor along with our smaller monitor for gaming. Color is striking and the monitor is lightweight. Great product at a great price.

review_title: This monitor is fantastic. Very large and the resolution is great
review_body: This monitor is fantastic. Very large and the resolution is great. I use this mostly for working from my home office and it is perfect for spreadsheets and presentations. I imagine it would also work great for gaming and watching movies/videos, but I have not tried it for that yet. I plan on buying another once I get a docking station for my work laptop.

review_title: Monitor is ok. Several dead pixels
review_body: Several dead pixels. Ok quality monitor. Brightness is fine. Viewing angles aren't the best. Only came with VGA cable which is wasteful and useless since it's...you know...not 1991.

I love the no frame appeal.  Such great color ratio.  I was not so sure about the stand it came with as far as being sturdy.  But after I got it put together it proved me wrong.  I am not using this monitor for computer use, but for home security viewing.  It is the perfect option for viewing 8 channels at the same time.  I would recommend this monitor for this use.  Easy set up and install.

We only use this for a light duty home pc but it fit the bill perfectly (cheap!).  Our original monitor crapped out which came with our system after 7+ years and didn't want to go high end as we just don't need it but I am surprised how much better the picture is.  It was easy to intstall, the pc recognized it right away and we are happy with the purchase.

review_title: Great second monitor for a laptop
review_body: This product is exactly what I was looking for to add a second monitor to my laptop! The product is thin, has an easy-to- use stand, and comes with a soft case for traveling. I did need to buy a USB extender that plugs into the wall in order to power the monitor, and the picture is perfect for my needs but is not super sharp.

review_title: I would not buy this again
review_body: I have owned the Monitor for 8 months. The screen will frequently disconnect if you bump the monitor. I called today and said that It has disconnected continuously through out the day. The said "Did you use the disc or internet to download the driver...Oh they are old drivers... you need to update" I said "No the driver will not cause it to just loose connection it is not a software issue it is hardware" Of then you will need to pay for it to be shipped and they will repair it over the next few weeks"... Guess I am going to buy a monitor with better connectors

My place I’m employment provided me with a 16 inch Yoga. I am incapable of doing all the things I want to do on a computer at one time on that tiny screen. This product is fantastic! I am able to extend my workflow over to the second screen. I work at five different sites and serve over 4000 individuals. In order to maximize my productivity and utilize my time efficiently, I could not survive without this product. It does exactly what I wanted to do.
Pretty bad on many levels. The worst part is that it's a hit or miss if it even works. When it does, it flickers nonstop. This happened with both older laptop and newer one.

Bought the screen because had decent rating and price was under $100. After a month of using, I can say with confidence to buy the $150 version. This monitor has a very loose connection in the back. It often disconnects due to the poor placement of the connector. The low resolution also makes it tough to work even when copywriting.

review_title: Really great bang for the buck for mobile student and office work! Not ideal for artists though.
review_body: Gave it 5/5 with the low price in mind.

review_title: My Mobile Office is now a SUPER Mobile Office!
review_body: I travel almost constantly as a cyber security consultant, and spend most of my time working at a computer -- either performing technical work or writing reports. One of my co-workers recommended this monitor as a great addition to my work laptop, and he was absolutely correct! I frequently need one document open while I'm writing another, and the second monitor will speed up my work and make life easier.  It also slips nicely into my carry-on bag and is slim enough that it doesn't hog up valuable space.

review_title: Yes! AOC nailed it with this latest version
review_body: There are some more in depth reviews already, so I will keep this short and sweet.

review_title: Excellent, glad I went with this one.
review_body: I was looking for a portable second monitor, and saw a yahoo news thing about one.  Researched a little and went with this one.  Great choice!  Worked instantly upon plugging it in.  Super-easy to use my DisplayFusion set up to put a separate task bar on it.  I didn't even use the software that came with the monitor, my laptop found it easy.

Although this is a nice monitor, you will have to use a specific Y USB cable (which comes with the package) in order for this monitor to work.  That was the deal breaker for me in this case.  I didn't want to have to use a specific cable to have this powered if I forget to pack this with me.  I would probably keep this if it was more of a USB type A/B cable where those can be found anywhere.

Junk. I bought this and upon setting it up was instantly disappointed. All the colors are off, it has a this yellow tone which makes it hard to detect slight value changes in colors. Changing the settings and trying to play with settings never made it better only bearable. And barely bearable at that. It just has an overall ugly picture.

review_title: For the price?  absolutely can't beat it.
review_body: First out the gate:  i have not had a chance to try out the HDMI port and give you a 'high defnition' review.  as soon as i can do so, i will come back and edit this.

review_title: Great monitor at this price point
review_body: I now have three of these monitors in my office and home.  Two of them are side-by-side and their colors look identical.  WHile I use a NEC color-calibrated monitor for photography, these are very nice monitors for the price and work perfectly for all normal day-to-day non-color critical  applications.  I would recommend them.

review_title: Asus Support for these units is very poor
review_body: Pros: Many ways to connect. Audio out makes for handy port for connecting speakers

I bought three to go with the tri-stand (Ergotech Triple Horizontal LCD Monitor Arm Desk Stand (100-D16-B03)) I purchased at the same time.  It was a gamble that everything would fit properly, but with some research and the assistance of Amazon's Q/A feature, I determined the setup should fit my needs alright.

review_title: Perfect right out of the box
review_body: We have loved this monitor!  We have only had it for about a month so we are still playing with the settings and little features but it is crisp, and has a perfect antiglare, non glossy screen.  We've watched movies with it, homework, kids games, and each time it's been wonderful.  It was fantastic right out of the box and the only thing I am not a huge fan of is that it can shake a little if the desk is bumped or someone it typing really hard on the keyboard.  We actually stumbled on a perfect solution when we got

8.5.2016 - This is my first ASUS monitor.  It replaced a Dell 2007WFP monitor that went out on me.  The ASUS VS228H-P was packaged well.  It included a VGA and DVI cables.  I would rather have it include a HDMI cable, but you can get one for cheap from Monoprice or Amazon Basics.  Setting it up was a breeze.  I calibrated the color and contrast using Windows 7 God Mode.  I like the fact that the monitor has actual buttons for the user interface to adjust settings.  Picture quality and resolution are great.  My only con is that I can't adjust the monitor height.  Aside from that, I am enjoying my purchase so far.  There is a $10 rebate at the time of my purchase.  I don't like rebates, but I can't complain for the price of $99 + tax ($89 w/ $10 rebate).

review_title: It's big and bright, and decent price
review_body: Have to say I just wanted a monitor that could handle a source from my PS3, and my PC with low input lag, and screen blurring. I was looking at few models pricier than this, and I maybe should have went with one of those.

review_title: Great quality, crisp resolution, stable and excellent performance. Excellent for those with eye probelms as well as gamers.
review_body: Great monitor, I bought this as a second monitor, now I have two of these. Sure there are downsides as other reviewers have stated, but given the price and quality and fast response time this is highly recommended, better than many others. Moreover I didn't know about the problems until I read the reviews, like the colors at odd viewing angles, but still that's just being picky because the colors are great. Formerly I have had samsung monitors and they were nothing but trouble. After a year of having this monitor, I bought this second one, so that should tell you something.

review_title: A Great Monitor at a Great Price
review_body: It's a really decent IPS monitor at a very affordable price. Now, I can't even look at a 21" and up TN panel without realizing how sore my eyes are because of the color shift.

Nice display.  The base could be a little stronger.  Just sitting it is fine but when you use the buttons it is a bit weak.  I turn the power off and when I do the whole monitor wiggles around.  Nothing serious just a bit surprising.

review_title: Very nice -- What's not to like about it for a 27" screen.
review_body: Use as primary screen at my two screen desktop.  I had to buy a mounting bracket to mound onto stand but had to do that with other monitors.  Very high quality image and large enough for me to do some large spreadsheets.  What's not to like.

I have been using these monitors as dual monitors for several months now. Highly impressed so far! I have not had any issues with them. Color and quality of the screen is great. Colors are accurate and viewing angle are wide with no color shifting. Response time is good and there is no visible tearing. I use them for gaming and the picture is close to flawless.  Overall would definitely recommend this monitor.
Looks really good and at a good price. Didn't have the bleeding problem everyone talks about.

review_title: Great value for money...perfect for the occasional working at home Day
review_body: Good picture and for me it was vital to be lightweight.. I leave the screen in storage and then bring it out daily to set up on my dining table...I highly recommend. I occasionally work from home and this makes life easier

review_title: ... as a secondary screen for my laptop and holy crap is it gorgeous
review_body: Use it as a secondary screen for my laptop and holy crap is it gorgeous. Easy set up as simply plugging it to the wall and connect it to my pc with an HDMI cord (by the way not included, comes with a VGA cord which can also be used to connect to the your source). I love its large, wide, and nearly bezel-less design. The only feature I wish it had is an adjustable stand for optimal angle and height. As far as the stand that comes with this it's fixed and stationary.

Ordered this as the second monitor for our home office and so far, so good. This one is new enough that there aren't any good YouTube videos on how to attach the base, but I figured it out even though the instructions were vague. This monitor is becoming my favorite of the two we own and I'm really happy with it.

So far so good! I am extremely please with these monitors and in my opinion you can't find any for a better price! The color is amazing, great resolution, awesome borderless display, and the IPS is a beautiful feature. I have not noticed a single dead pixel in the two monitors I purchased. Pictures are before and after of my setup.

review_title: It was but more pixels maybe
review_body: Its just OK, it works fine and does exactly what I expected. I was hoping the resolution would be better but maybe that's the difference between $100 monitors and $400 monitors? The resolution is much less than my laptop so than the only down side.

I bought this for gaming, specifically for the very low input lag, and I was pleased with the performance. The only issue I had was some "discoloration" (the best way I can describe it) anytime there was motion on the screen. After searching through some other reviews here and elsewhere, I read that disabling the "OD" (Overdrive) capabilities in the settings fixes the problem, and it did. I don't know how or if this effects the input lag but it still works great and can't beat it for the price.

I ordered my first monitor and i believed it was defective. Once plugged in, it worked perfectly for about 3 days then all it would do is blink. I requested a replacement which wss shipped out immediately. This time the monitor worked for about 3 weeks then the same defect appeared. It just blinks. I'm returning for a full refund.

review_title: Basic design flaw . . . could probably do better elsewhere.
review_body: USB cable that attaches to the monitor is off. The port in the monitor just doesn't hold the cable under its own weight. So if you mount the monitor and the cable is left hanging . . . it constantly unplugs itself.

If you are used to having two monitors when working, and need to travel and work from a hotel room, this little monitor is perfect. It’s plug and play. All you need is a USB on your laptop. I used it for 10 days while working from various hotel rooms and did not experience the issue of having the cord come unplugged from the monitor as some of the reviews mentioned. It fit in my laptop backpack just fine for carringing on the plane.

It works great! Plugged right into my laptop without installing any drivers. The video quality is ok. Color fidelity is good for business applications but not  for video editing or Photoshop. Video playback is smooth and good FPS but the view angle is very narrow.

review_title: Great portable second monitor but if you need support or assistance be wiry of the company
review_body: Works great for a second monitor on the go. One thing no one tells you is it only needs one usb plug if the USB port provides enough power. If it does not provide enough power with one USB port you need to available to make the monitor work. Just a FYI since it seems no one has mentioned that. Overall a good buy and plug n okay feature. Love the options to adjust brightness and contrast

review_title: Good Monitor for travel, but support stinks.
review_body: Great monitor for the price.  Size is perfect for travel and its light.  You only need a USB 3.0 cable, no separate power which is a plus.  Resolution is very good and the clients love it.
I tested on my HP laptops, MacBookPro, and Chromebook.  It worked on all of them.

review_title: Cheap quality and horrible customer service
review_body: DO NOT BUY THIS MONITOR. It is a little bit cheaper than the alternatives, but not worth the savings in the long run. I purchased the monitor about a month ago for work because I travel every week. I placed the monitor in a case, in my bag securely for a flight. The next day when I went to power it on, the screen was completely destroyed internally and only displays black and white. There is no external damage or cracks and I had my bag on me the entire time. I contacted their technical support and was informed that they don't cover this in their warranty. I definitely regret ordering this product, as it also had very low screen display quality and often didn't work upon connecting the USB port.

review_title: you'd think the driver download would be very easy to find but it's not
review_body: I've had this monitor for a few weeks now and can give an honest review.  The only reason I'm giving it 2 stars is because of the convenient USB-only connection for viewing and power.  Not having an additional power chord is very convenient for so many situations.

review_title: When I originally started using it - I had Windows 7 and I could not get a good resolution (sorry
review_body: I have now used this monitor for over 2 years. When I originally started using it - I had Windows 7 and I could not get a good resolution (sorry, I did not record the display resolution but most likely 1024 x 768). Even so, I liked the ability to use the second monitor on the road and with a lower resolution it made it that much easier to read text/code (I am a developer).

Bought this because i wanted a similar monitor to my VG248QE i bought a few years back and it works wonderfully right next to the old monitor! There are several slight Color differences but I'd expect that from the difference of price! Either way 5/5 wonderful purchase. (Picture shows monitor on left VG248QE on right)

Very nice monitor. Startling! Beautiful color with five easily changed settings; Standard, Theater, Game, Night View, sRGB, Scenery. Very quick setup. However!! No instructions - well there is a QuickStart sheet that tells you NOTHING in about 50 languages.

review_title: Having heard from Asus customer services.
review_body: I got two of this in March of this year since I have been very satisfied with the two I got from last year. However, with the two I got in March, one of them will not come on after the computer went to sleep. In order for it to come on, I have to turn off and turn on the monitor again. I checked on the web and some said it could be driver not up-to-date on the computer. However, when I connect a different monitor of the same model to the same computer, it works fine and the monitor will come on whenever I move the mouse while it is in sleep mode. Contacted Asus support through email back in August and I have not heard anything back from them. I use a lot of Asus products (monitor, laptop and router) but now I have doubt about their customer services should any one of my products has issue.

I've been adjusting the settings for 2 weeks now and cannot get very good colors out of it. Pinks are too orange, greys are too brown, anything approaching yellow and green is radioactive bright and anything close to black is too dark. Tried it over VGA and HDMI on multiple computers and laptops, tried messing with the GPU settings, Windows 7 settings, and downloading profiles from the Internet. I even began to suspect maybe THIS monitor has the TRUE colors and every other display I've used has the WRONG colors, but since buying this I really experimented and took note and this is the odd one out. None of the built in settings or adjustments really seem to address the flaws I see in the color reproduction. The brightness control controls the backlight and not the brightness of the picture, and the contrast control's range is very small. MAYBE it's just me but short of buying a calibrator that costs as much as the display, I don't know what else to try.

I was looking for a new set of LED monitors to replace my 2 Hanns-G 19" HW191D LCD monitors.  My requirements were: LED, full HD 1920 x 1080, and VESA mountable.  My primary use is video editing, and I also do some PhotoShop, so I liked the idea of having IPS also, but that was not a primary requirement.  HDMI was also not a requirement for me but would be nice to have.  I read numerous reviews and considered a couple of other models/brands (ViewSonic and LG in IPS displays).  For the price, the features, the overall good reviews, and Asus name (I have one of their laptops and one motherboard, love them both), I decided to get 2 of these.  I LOVE THEM!  The color is fantastic, the detail is amazing, the screen is very bright (had to turn it down a bit), and it's nice and BIG!  Editing videos with Pinnacle Studio 16 was such a delight on these - details are sharp and clear.  Photos look amazing on them.  NO dead pixels and side-by-side they look perfectly matched (no difference in brightness/color/contrast).  I see no edge bleed and my Windows 7 desktop is a plain back screen...well, it was for a while until I saw how beautiful photos looked as the background, so now I have photo backgrounds.  It's just such a pleasure to look at.  IPS works as advertised, these have a very wide viewing angle (at least very wide to me compared to my last Hanns-G models).  I use the DVI and VGA ports but have not tested the HDMI port yet.  I also don't use the speakers so I can't say how they are (kinda pointless to me to use them when you can get so much better sound from a speaker system, even a cheap one).  I would HIGHLY recommend these monitors.

I'd been struggling for too long with an aging 19" Acer monitor that wasn't really up to the quality I wanted for post-processing my photos. After going on a recent trip and taking thousands of new photos that required some editing, I finally decided to buy this monitor rather than continue to be frustrated at my old monitor. I reasoned that this monitor would be a good buy to offer me a significant improvement over what I was using before and keep within my budget, but I was very pleasantly surprised at just how good the display actually is.
I bought this for my husband. He is an avid gamer and is very happy with the quality of the picture.
I ordered this and tried it out and ultimately went with another monitor.  Not because this one was bad, but because the other one was way better for not too much more.

LOVE IT!!! I was using a 24" Samsung 1080p HD tv that was being used in my room for watching tv and playing my PS4 on but needed a monitor for my new gaming pc so I used the Samsung until I received this monitor. Well all familiar with Samsung screens know that they are some of the most vibrant and richly colored displays out there not only there phones wich we all love but their TV's too. Well I thought there wouldn't be a chance of this $99.00 monitor being able to be as vibrant and clear as the Samsung.... BOY WAS I WRONG! this monitor is 10 times more vibrant and clear as my Samsung with the same resolution of 1080p! the 5 different modes are great for the different color and viewing settings. I have mine on "gaming" and it's my favorite but "sceneary" is also very beautiful to behold. In short, I will be buying another one and I most definitely recommend this monitor to anyone..... you will not be disappointed trust me!!!!

Bought this product on Amazon Warehouse Deals as an used item and have been completely satisfied with it. Till date I haven't been able to find the cosmetic damage that led to this been classified as used.

review_title: Poor video performance and lackluster static image.
review_body: I do not understand why there are so many positive reviews on this monitor.  Very dissapointed.
4.5/5 Stars. Bought this on 09/04/2016. I was using a 21" TN Monitor before this.

review_title: About 3 months ago one of my monitors continued searching through sources and would reconnect but 2 weeks ago the monitor is been going completely out and I took it apart and found out that the power connection was the problem and it would work fine with the backing off
review_body: I bought two of these monitors in June 2017. About 3 months ago one of my monitors continued searching through sources and would reconnect but 2 weeks ago the monitor is been going completely out and I took it apart and found out that the power connection was the problem and it would work fine with the backing off. I put it back together it worked for a week without any issues and it has started acting up again. What is worse i did not purchase the warranty because it isn't supported in my country. Note: other monitor is fine and had no issues.

review_title: This is a very good monitor for the price..
review_body: I have been using the Acer r240hy bidx 23.8 inch monitor for the last 2 weeks now and I am very happy with the results. The picture quality is very good considering the price, I have a set of very pricy enterprise HP monitors at work which do not really measure up . The specs on this with the Full HD display at (1920 x 1080) resolution with a 16:9 aspect ratio is very impressive.

review_title: Great choice for an inexpensive IPS gaming monitor
review_body: Excellent monitor with great viewing angles. Refresh & response times are satisfactory for console gaming. Backlight bleed prevalent, but is known with IPS-type displays.

This monitor is great, looks great, and the edges are clean. The picture is amazing but it's only 60 hz. The screen has a matte finish and doesn't reflect sunlight. It looks great but it does not come with a hdmi cable, or DVI, it only comes with the old smaller VGA cable so check which cable you will need for your pc. (the monitor supports all 3)

review_title: Bought two of them. Had a dead pixel on one monitor. The other was fine.
review_body: Bought two of them. Had a dead pixel on one monitor. The other was fine. The monitors are bright and I haven't had any back-light issues that I noticed. Only had them for a day so we'll see. My Hanspree monitors died after 8+ years so I expect these to last.

Awesome monitors at a great price. Setting them up was a breeze, the color immediately popped much more than my laptop screen. I've enjoyed using them for the last 3 days. No dead pixels, no strange spots-- they're quality monitors and sold at an awesome price

review_title: Delighted!  Should have bought this one sooner.
review_body: I am still saving the box due to other reviews regarding infant mortality.  So far, the monitor is a delight!  A very solid performer.  My old monitor was 10 years old.  No way to say how wonderful this monitor is in comparison.  I am very impressed with the screen going almost to the very edge of the frame.  It was a great buy!

review_title: the colors are great and overall a big improvement over the previous (also ...
review_body: Bought this for my wife, she has been using it for videos, gaming and work. It is very clear, the colors are great and overall a big improvement over the previous (also Acer) monitor (smaller, lower resolution, and had more blur possibly from being 8 years old). Excellent value for the price (on sale).

review_title: Nice having the extra real estate when I am on the move
review_body: This screen is really quite nice.  It has a bit lower resolution than my laptop, so I usually just move my email and chat over to it, and do the bulk of my work on the main screen.  When I can, this works well as a third screen.  It doesn't have any noticeable lag, at least when it's plugged into the USB3 port.  Even though it has two connectors on the cable, my laptop can drive it with just the USB3 and the other one doesn't need to be plugged in.  The ability to rotate it to portrait mode is a nice feature, but I don't seem to use it much.

review_title: Now I am disappointed, the window to return it has passed
review_body: I received the monitor and tried to use it with Windows 10 and could not get it to work.  Our IT dept tried and could not get it to work.  Having to travel for work, I was very excited to have and use the monitor.  Dejected, I realized that I could not use the monitor I just kept it with me until I got home.

review_title: Really good deal for it's price.
review_body: I got not so high expectations and all my negative predictions about this monitors come true. I have 2 of them and use them attached to Ubuntu laptop. And here are the problems I have:

This portable monitor feels light and flimsy but if you don't work at a construction site that shouldn't be an issue. This fits in my shoulder bag without any trouble for easy flights. Since its powered by USB you don't need that extra plug when traveling outside your home country. This doesn't have the best graphics but what would you expect.

review_title: A bit of flakiness now and then, but overall a delightful travel companion
review_body: I'm a two-monitor addict, so when I travel (often) with my laptop (Windows 7 32-bit) it killed my productivity. The AOC fits nicely in my laptop bag (with its thin neoprene sleeve) and helps tremendously on the road. I've had it for about 10 days now and will report back later if my opinion changes over time.

review_title: Just okay picture quality, operates at USB 2.0 speeds only
review_body: This AOC monitor suffers from a bit of the "screen door effect" where it looks like you're seeing the image through a screen door.  Also, I get the message "This device can perform faster... if you connect it to a Super-Speed 3.0 port."  My Thinkpad W510's drivers are up to date, and I manually updated the Renesas/NEC USB 3 chip driver to the latest.  If I use the exact same cable and port with an external USB 3.0 hard drive, it operates at full USB 3.0 speeds, so it looks like the problem rests with the monitor.

review_title: Driver advice for hassle free installation and usage.
review_body: Whatever you do, don't use the driver disk that is included with the monitor if you have Windows 10. Do yourself a favor and go to the website to download the latest version, currently any driver above 8.0 will work. If you do not heed this advice prepare for a very frustrating troubleshooting process in safe mode on your computer.

I really love this monitor. I use it at the office at school and leave it there (I'm a student instructor). So when I get to work I just plug in my macbook and I have so much more real estate. Sometimes I even take it to class with me. As someone who loves monitors (I have a massive four 27'' monitor setup at home) I love having more space to multitask and this is a cheap option. While you need to have the right angle otherwise the screen is a bit too glossy and reflective, I have not found that to be a deal breaker at all. The fact that it can be powered off of a USB 3 connection is such a modern miracle and astounds me almost every time I use it. It is hardy, with a soft case included for when you transport/store it. The stand on the back is very artistic and adds to the overall good feel. I recommend this monitor to anyone who wants a permanent or more flexible way to add productivity to your life!

review_title: Nearly 3 years old and still going strong!
review_body: UPDATE:  I'm just at nearly three years since I bought this monitor. I use it when I'm traveling - just stuff it in my computer back with my laptop.  All the comments listed below still apply.

review_title: Plug + Play (Pixelbook + MacBookPro(USBC). Sturdy Functional Stand.
review_body: This review is solely for ease of use + design. After reading other reviews, I though I would have problems getting this screen up and running (both on the hardware side, but also literally standing up). The newest model must have ameliorated the stand concerns because it is really easy to stand this monitor upright. I had to look at the stock-photos provided on the AOC website but once I did it's actually a simple yet sturdy design. In terms of getting the display to hook up to my laptop and my partner's laptop (Pixelbook, 2018 MacBookPro w/ USBC), it was literally "plug and play". No configuration necessary.

review_title: The graphics quality was superb right out of the box!
review_body: I bought two of these monitors.  I have a dual monitor setup.  My video card is an XFX Radeon HD4650 dual-monitor graphics card.  So when I hooked these puppies up (I used the DVI hookup) the graphics quality was superb right out of the box.  (No dead or stuck pixels, either!)  The only thing I had to adjust was bumping up the resolution one click to 1920x1080 - 60Hz.  I sampled the different preset modes (built into the monitors) and found that I like the standard mode the best for my tastes.

I purchased this to have a second monitor for gaming because it was just about the same size as my current monitor, which is too old to buy an exact replica of. It took some adjusting to get it to work right and set the brightness correctly, but once that was done, it's been pretty smooth sailing. Picture quality is crisp, the colors are bright, and it works well for watching videos, playing games, or doing artwork. The only issue it's really presented is that it will occasionally flicker on and off or won't turn on correctly when I boot up my PC. That can usually be corrected by disconnecting and reconnecting the HDMI cable.

review_title: After a year of use it was worth it, no regrets.
review_body: This has been my main monitor for over a year now, and can say I am really happy with my purchase. I've used this monitor for general use and for PC and Console gaming. This monitor is the perfect for general use and for console gaming. I say that because of the IPS panel, the colors are seriously night and day from a TN panel and I don't feel like I can ever go back to using TN again. If you're more of a hardcore PC gamer this monitor is not for you.

Asus has clearly improved their quality over the past few years. My last monitor was a Samsung, and I was very happy with it, but when I moved, I couldn't take it with me. Now I'm glad I had to sell it because this model is so much better.

review_title: I give it a perfect score. If you can find it used like ...
review_body: I'm giving this five stars because 1) I don't work in a graphic design field and don't require high level color accuracy and therefore I'm not picky, 2) All I require from a monitor is that it turns on and has no damage/dead pixels/artifacts on the screen itself. Since this arrived in 100% working order and 100% cosmetic/functional condition, I give it a perfect score. If you can find it used like I did at $40 less from other Amazon re-sellers, do it. I got a steal on this thing for the quality it puts out.

This monitor checks off all of the boxes that a monitor should check. It has plenty of inputs, viewing is spectacular, and it looks great on any desk. My only complaint (which is very minor, not enough to warrant a loss of a star) is that the stand is beyond flimsy. Anything harder than breathing on this monitor makes it shake and rattle and every time I reach to turn the power off, the monitor almost falls over. Basically, do yourself a favor and buy a new stand for this incredible product.

My monitor was DOA when I received it.  Would not power up at all.  Amazon quickly shipped another one when I put in the RMA and the replacement arrived the same day I shipped out the original.  Kudo's to Amazon and their RMA process.

This is a good monitor for the price.  It is very bright and I use it as a second monitor.  There are a couple things that I wish it would have, but since it is pretty cheap, it is clear why it doesn't have them:

Great  monitor for the price. Got this (and not a 27") as its the largest size that nicely fits on our computer cabinet (replaced an old 19" square LED monitor). Looks as nice as the more expensive ASUS 24" monitor (VE248) I have at work. Cant really notice any diff in the 23.6" (this one) vs full 24" display (VE248).  Stand is not rock solid as noted by others (the VE248 is a little more stable) but as I don't bump it it stays in place fine. Sent off  the rebate and got a response ~ 1 week later  its been received/approved and to expect the gift card in ~5-7 weeks (w'ell see if that actually occurs). Overall very pleased.

review_title: Great colors, I use flux to make the colors ...
review_body: Shipping:

review_title: I love how slim the edges are
review_body: Been months and I'm typing on this screen as I write this review. I've had no issues with it and the picture is something else! Definitely a refreshing upgrade from the old one. I love how slim the edges are. The screen is almost TV-like.

review_title: These are really amazing monitors for the price
review_body: These are really amazing monitors for the price. Clear, vivid, etc. I actually returned the Amazon order because of a bad power supply and found three refurbs on Walmart for $100 each. They accidentally sent me 3 for the price of one though. So Three of these monitors for $100.

These displays work like a charm. There is no noticeable pixelation or ghosting during low to mid-action gameplay and the color saturation on these panels is quite nice for the price bracket they exist in.
Gorgeous monitor with a great price! I love the edges on this and the picture is very smooth and vibrant. I have no complaints with this monitor as it works perfectly to fit my needs!

This is an amazing monitor. It has a stable base and it is easy to put together. I use this monitor with my gaming computer and it works flawlessly. if you're looking for a good quality, well priced monitor; then this is the best choice. Since it is an ISP monitor, there will be light bleeding when it is completely black but while I'm gaming there are rarely completely black scenes.

review_title: Good looking but very bad image ghosting
review_body: I have three of these monitors in surround. I am a pretty serious gamer and I wanted these monitors for the thin bezels and anti glare screen. All was good when I got them and set them up. Man do they look nice! The stand is pretty high quality and the screen in very thin. On first boot they were bright and decently colorful. Not as good as my old one, but for the price not bad. I soon noticed that the color was not the same on all monitors. one of them had slightly less bright whites, and one had whites with a slight tint of yellow. This was mostly fixed with some adjusting in the settings. So far these issues are easy to look over since they look so nice and nothing beats having three identical monitors. However they are not that great for the one reason I bought them for: Gaming. These monitors have SERIOUS image ghosting. If you don't know what this is, its when the pixels leave a shadow behinds moving images on the screen because they cant change color fast enough. This adds very noticeable white and black shadows in every game even the desktop. Coming from a higher quality (now discontinued monitor) these do not perform very well in that regard. The pixels are very slow. Even textures with little contrast get blurred when moving forward.
Clear, bright picture. Easy to install.

It is a great Monitor for its price with a good picture but it does have a few issues. The base is not adjustable and causes the monitor to lean a bit towards you and mine does have some black light bleed on the bottom right corner but minor. If you are looking for a good budget monitor this one will work fine but not if you need a top quality monitor

review_title: Great desktop monitor for use with laptop
review_body: This is a really nice monitor.  Has all the input types one could ever want. I use the VGA connection with my laptop which provides a nice clear stable picture.  Awesome monitor for the size and price.
I've bought over 20+ for users and everyone loves them. The thin frame makes it easy to get the monitors close together. The picture quality is very good as well.

review_title: Coolest, most useful tech gadget I've bought in a long while.
review_body: Excellent - I love this thing. A 1920 by 1080 secondary monitor for my laptop that fits nicely in my laptop bag.  To me, the picture quality is excellent, and I'm not seeing any lag.  Watching some music videos right now as I type - not what I bought it for, but I would definitely notice if the audio and video were out of sync.

review_title: Great Monitor - If only it had lasted longer than 6 weeks......
review_body: Initially I absolutely loved this monitor.  It is lightweight.  Easy to setup.  The picture quality is great for using on the go.  However, the cord setup is awful.  Within 6 weeks of using it the cord connection no longer worked.  It became very loose (probably because of the weird angle it has for plugging it in).  Unfortunately, it lasted just long enough to be non-returnable.  The only reason that I gave it 2 stars instead of 1 is because the monitor would have been great, if it had lasted longer than 6 weeks.  Don't waste your money on this one.  : (

review_title: OK product, horrible service from manufacturer
review_body: Product worked well for about 2 months when the picture pixelated and stopped working. They said they could not honor the warranty because I had damaged it, but it never moved from my desktop. Incredibly disappointed!
