This was just an ok purchase for me. I work from home and have limited space and I often have to travel, so I thought this would be perfect. Upon opening the box and inspecting the monitor it looks like I was sent a refurbished item because there are scratches on the back of the monitor and some sticky substance on the front of the monitor. Lord only knows what that is! Also, the display is just ok...Nothing to write home about. I will keep it b/c I don't want to go through the hassle of trying to send it back but Best Buy has this same monitor at the same price...I wish I'd done some shopping around before purchasing this item but Amazon is the go to marketplace right! ~A little Disappointed

review_title: but that wasn't the best option, since we only have one TV
review_body: I needed an additional monitor for my laptop. I am a CS student, and my laptop's screen wasn't cutting it. My other option would have been to use my TV as an extra monitor, but that wasn't the best option, since we only have one TV. I am limited on space, living in a small house, so I needed something that I could store when not in use. This is the size of my laptop's screen and it works out great. I place it next to my laptop and use it to displace notepad, or jgrasp. The price was excellent as well.

In theory, this monitor is exactly what I wanted: a relatively inexpensive, portable monitor that I could pack in my suitcase to take on work trips. My favorite feature was actually a small one -- the stand was angled to work well in both portrait and landscape modes. It worked out of the box with my Dell XPS 13 laptop (running Windows 8.1 Pro) using the included USB 3.0 cable. But it didn't take long for a fatal flaw to surface... The cable sits rather loosely in the back of the monitor and the angle isn't ideal with the movement of the stand. It almost immediately started losing connection upon the slightest movement of the monitor. Then one night it just stopped working entirely. The monitor will still get power from the cable, but it just shows an image indicating that it has no image signal.

This monitor is a POS.  I hate myself for buying it twice.  They both died.  The first one had a screen issue and it went funny on the screen, but it turned on.  The second one has a short and it will turn on just long enough for me to see the AOC logo and then it shorts out.  SAVE YOUR MONEY.  I should have believed the other reviews. I hate this product and I want to bill them for my time spent trying to make it work.  GARBAGE.

review_title: Driver problems galore and poor instructions
review_body: This product wasted a lot of my time and created havoc with my PC. At first glance this product looked well built but was considerably heavier and thicker than what I had imagined from the ads. It is really a tough call to say if I would want to travel with it. The set-up instructions on both a printed piece of paper and on a disc are a joke with virtually no helpful information. I had enough sense run the program that installed a PC driver but it took a long time to finish. I was planning to use this as a 3rd monitor....but to my surprise it killed my second monitor connection totally. It just became a black screen. A visit to my control panel was unable to restore it. The image quality on the USB monitor is as others have remarked....poor for anything but documents and printed matter. You can only view the monitor if viewed directly in front of it...any deviation and it disappears or distorts. To restore my PC I had to use the device manager to delete two display drivers installed from the disc. On top of all this, I found that no drivers are available at all for older Mac and PC operating systems. Check before you buy. Sending this product back.

review_title: Love it!! Great portable USB monitor that's easy to setup and has nice quality. Highly recommend!
review_body: Love this monitor!! I am a freelance tech worker and am used to working with multiple monitors at home. I need to be able to get out of the house sometimes to work in a coffeeshop, but it's so hard once you're used to two monitors. I've only been using it for a week now but so far no issues. It was very fast to connect and setup and has great quality. I now plan to keep it constantly connected at home as a third monitor and it's already saving me time. If it holds up longer term, I may get another and will definitely be recommending to others.

I spent 45 minutes setting it up. There isn't very much information online about how to get it to work, but I finally got it to work after downloading drivers and a program called displaylink. I tried to get it to work on a different computer to no avail, and now it doesn't work on any computer. I just can't have this happen at work. I wanted it to improve productivity not to carry it around wondering if it is going to work or not. For reference, I tried it on Lenovo's T540p and Carbon X1 that run on Windows 10.

review_title: The worst monitor I have purchased to date!
review_body: I have worked with technology for four decades - before CGA. This has got to be the worst monitor I have ever owned. The contrast is horribly off and not correctable via user controls or system calibration - Blacks are a terrible gray. Lowering the brightness to darken the blacks results in washing everything out. Colors on pictures looked artificial - over saturated. This monitor has been returned.

I've had a dual pair of 20" Asus LED backlit monitors for years and they're still going strong. But I decided it was time to upgrade to a dual set of 23.6" Asus LED backlit monitors. Both monitors arrived in mint condition with brilliant colors. I have really fallen in love with Asus monitors because they've never failed to deliver superb quality for a great price. I've owned other brands in the past and all of them broke or became extremely dim after just a couple years. Since I ordered these monitors together, I didn't have to do any color calibration. They matched perfectly out of the box.

review_title: This monitor is probably the worst monitor I've had since the invention of the flatscreen
review_body: This monitor is probably the worst monitor I've had since the invention of the flatscreen. My 7 year old off-brand LCD looks better. The colors are awful; blacks look gray and the screen is WAY too bright and everything looks washed out. It literally makes my eyes hurt after using it. I was hoping I would get a good monitor based on the ratings, but upon reading some of the other reviews, apparently I got one of the bad batch with the black handle box. Very disappointed. I expected more out of ASUS based on the brand but the poor quality of this monitor will make me think twice about buying their products in the future. Returning this and getting a different monitor from a different company.

Decent monitor at a good price.  Took a star off for the hoops you have to go through to get the rebate.  Then, it got denied because something didn't match up and they wanted me to re-submit the bar-code and something else again to verify the purchase.  YOU GOT TO BE KIDDING ME ASUS!  I don' think so Lucy!  Either give me the rebate you offered with proof of purchase or not.  You will need to submit three different doc's to get your coin from them.  Sheesh.  You know ASUS, this kind of negative PR just frustrates customers.  It makes you look bad.

I was nervous about getting one of these bc of the few negative reviews on color quality/dead pixels, but I decided to take a chance since it matched my other 21' ASUS from 5 years ago (which is still running strong mind you). Been using it for a couple months and I've had no issues - wonderful color quality! But you HAVE to adjust the colors when you first get it. It's not hard, just do it.

I recently bought this as an identical replacement for one that recently died. (My set up is using two in dual screen mode).  The one that died was around 3 years old and did die suddenly.  Screen just went dark and sudden smell of a short.  Still I highly recommend these very affordable monitors.  Fast refresh, great form factor, etc.  I do notice a bit of difference (some vignetting in the older of the two running now) & in brightness of whites.  However, I've always used a color calibration tool to get them to match so it is easy to get the old and new monitor to match.  This issue isn't likely that noticeable for most users, but in my case I do a fair amount of content creation and need color matching between monitors.  This usually pushes content creators toward higher end monitors, but as an avid gamer I wanted the high refresh rate as well.  As long as I take the time to calibrate the monitors (I use an old Spyder3), I find these are a good compromise for my needs.  This set up works well enough that i didn't hesitate to purchase another one when the oldest one died.

I've had two of these for slightly less than a year. Best purchase I've made in a long time. These are perfect size, very large but not too large, for computer monitors. They are amazing quality, really simple to take the bottom stand off if you want to mount them or travel with them, and easy to remount back on. The screw holes in the back are covered with little rubber pieces so that the back still looks flush and you don't see them unless you're using them for mounting. The monitor has very easy to understand controls in a convenient location (bottom right) to control things like power, brightness, etc and a little blue light indicating whether it is on, off, or it turns orange if in standby mode. Perfect quality image too, and it's had a bit of abuse of the last 10 months (I've hit the monitors or gotten substance on them) and it does not appear to have taken any real permanent damage.
I purchased 2 of these along with a

review_title: Good product  dont count on the rebate!
review_body: Screen works wonderful.  It did not arrive in 2 days instead was 4-5.  Turns out it was postal error though and that is really quite rare.  This was supposed to have a 20.00 rebate which I consider as bogus.  The form they require you to fill out seems to go in circles, has a calendar  to enter purchase date that does not work.  I believe I bought this amazon prime on September 14 yet the date on the rebate would not allow me to use it.  Calendar was set for August and would not move forward to Sept.  I think I got by all that crap with emails and have had to remove shipping labels and print another form.  Sent all that in and will have to wait I don't know how long to see the results.  My best advice is do not count on the rebate, seems to me to be some legal form of fraud.

review_title: Large screen at a good price. Minor con but could be a fluke.
review_body: I own several of the 23.6 inch screens. (I know sometimes amazon compiles all reviews from different sizes into one review list)

review_title: It was not as bad as of now
review_body: So, I've been able to use it for 8 months; however, after that 8 months it started shutting down itself. I just experienced this issue a few days ago. It was not as bad as of now. A few days back, it only dies like once or twice a day. Right now, though, it keeps dying each time I turn it back on. This monitor was good for how long it worked at its price.
This monitor is great, nice quality and it was cheap!

Excellent monitor. At this price point the monitor is da bomb! Color is fantastic even in a sunny room. Viewing angle is really good. No bad pixels. Only small minus is no VESA support but I do not need that. Very happy with it.
Great monitor for general use. I bought two monitors for my home office. Only complaint is the two monitors do not have the same color. One is has a brighter tint than the other. Not a big deal.

Great quality for the home office. The monitors are light weight, the quality of the picture is fantastic, and the size is perfect for side-by-side reading. I received these monitors in 2 days from time the order was place to arrival at door. Both monitors came packed together in a larger box and in excellent condition.
Great monitor for the price. Bright and vibrant picture with a very thin bezel. I do wish it was vesa compatible but I didn't get them for myself so I can't complain.

They look nice, the edges are nice and thin (not something that I thought that I would like when I bought them), and the colors look amazing. As my first personal computer monitors (I ordered two), these are awesome. My only complaint is that I wish it had another HDMI port.

Great monitor.  I bought 2 so my wife would also have one.  Beautiful screen, easy, easy, easy on the eyes and that's important to us as we are older.  The only minor problem was pressing the base into the back of the monitor and I used a 4" C clamp to quickly do that.  If you have strong hands this should be no problem for you.  I can find no fault with this monitor and quite the opposite it is excellent in every aspect for my use.  This along with the SSD for my laptop are the best purchases I've ever made for my computer.

I was a bit skeptical that this monitor would be as great as people were saying, but it is. The light bleed isn't really an issue like others are saying. It is a solid monitor that looks great and is easy to assemble. If you want it to be VESA compatible, this adapter (

review_title: Great monitor, but wish it was adjustable in height
review_body: It's a good monitor but one thing I wish it had was adjustable height. In terms of clarity, it is fantastic and the quality of the material is superb. Haven't used it too much other than to do work as a second monitor, so can't say much about the accuracy in color. As a second monitor for work, think this is a good deal, but probably only if you don't mind not being able to adjust the height. You could probably get away with it by stacking packs of paper... But that's kind of janky.

review_title: It has been extremely useful as I have become used to working with two ...
review_body: Colleague had one of these screens and I decided I had to get my own. It has been extremely useful as I have become used to working with two computer screens in the office. I can now work more efficiently at home and on the road.

review_title: This is a great product...for home or work.  Travels VERY WELL!!
review_body: This is a great product.  I actually bought 2.  Fits perfectly in my work backpack, and I'm able to travel often with it, hence enhancing my work when away from home.  I have recommended this to my fellow workers and direct reports.  Several have taken me up on the advice.  This could not be easier.....unless of course, it was Bluetooth.  Oh well.  Maybe next year.  Still, I do give this product high marks.  I'd buy an even larger screen, but it wouldn't travel well.  I am considering adding one or two to my existing duel screens at home.  I'll let you know how that works out if I do it.  Keep up the great work.

review_title: Had to perform some DIY mods
review_body: Used a trimmed down clipboard back (after removing the clip part from an 11x17 size clipboard) to place fully over the monitor (i.e. covering plastic border surrounding the screen) before placing into the soft case. Have never had a problem with screen cracking or getting marred, scratched, etc. while packing or storing. Regarding any reviews of the 16" or 17" models where the cable shifts or barely moves and affects the connection in the back, I used a couple of the adhesive-backed Cable Clip Organizers (search Amazon "cable clips") to line up the cord and make sure it stays straight once plugged into the backside connector and it has yet to give me problems there. However, I do have a persnickety Dell Inspiron model laptop (of which I will never get another one). I use this laptop frequently with the USB monitor and I have found that I will have to plug, unplug, and replug a time or two for the laptop to properly sense the monitor and stay connected allowing the monitor to boot up and stay connected. Once that is achieved I have no problems from there on.

review_title: THIS MONITOR IS A GAME CHANGER, BUT MAKE SURE YOUR COMPUTER IS USB-C CAPABLE
review_body: This is the most amazing thing I've ever owned (USB-C version). It is the perfect size, so slim and light, the case's magnetics hold it on securely and lock into different positions seemlessly, the picture is perfect, but he USB-C connection that allows for video & power transfer is the key to what makes it so truly amazing. 1 cord into the computer is all it needs to be a full, perfect dual monitor. I use it when i work from home and on the go. Perfect solution if you don't want/have space for a "permanent" monitor anywhere.

review_title: Great monitor for the price.  Well packaged and easy set up!
review_body: Very easy set up.  My Surface Pro 3 recognized it right away. Did not need to run the driver which came with it on CD.  Also came with a nice cover and case for traveling.  I had been looking for another monitor to work with Surface Pro 3; this was the perfect option.  Ok so the monitor display is not the best for graphic design or high end visual work....but it definitely fits the build for my need for another monitor.  It's amazing how far we've come today in terms of portable, on-the-go technology!

review_title: Do not let this ever touch your VR machine.
review_body: Got this for my mobile desktop vrsetup. I wanted a simple primary monitor so I wouldn't have to be dependent on having a monitor or tv where I take my setup.

review_title: Does the job, but not great
review_body: For the price, this is pretty good.  I bought it for long days of hearings I sit through for work, as I've seen other people with similar monitors.

review_title: Need to download 3rd party driver that is not mentioned anywhere!!!!!
review_body: Extremely upset with this monitor! Nowhere in the manual or literature says anything about having to download a third party driver! I even tried the online tech support and chatted with an Amazon rep who determined I had a defective monitor. They sent me a new one and I had the exact same problem! After downloading the driver that came with it, I would plug it in, get the AOC splash screen and then NOTHING! I read through all the one star reviews and that's where I learned it required the third party driver from Displaylink.com!!!!! I learned a valuable lesson......read all reviews! I usually just base my decision on the majority rating, no more of that! Very angry with this thing!!!!!

review_title: For the price and functionality is provides great value. 2
review_body: Quick Thoughts after traveling for 2 weeks with the monitor.

NVIDIA users beware! Driver conflict between NVIDIA and DisplayLink (driver required to use this monitor).  I'm not sure how or why but NVIDIA control panel will be missing most options, and can only be restored by turning off or unplugging the AOC monitor.

review_title: Gorgeous Display! EDIT: Used to Be
review_body: EDIT 2: This is getting put at the top because I think it's the most important thing you should know about this monitor. When I originally made this purchase, now 3 apartments and 3 years ago, it was one of the best ways I spent my money. It still is, really, but I bought a 2nd one as a dual monitor and they are NOT AS GOOD ANYMORE. Asus is using a different screen tech that is not near as good as the old. It has awful viewing angles and bad color accuracy. As others are saying, it looks very yellowish out of the box. I've been calibrating and re-calibrating and changing color modes for the last few days since I got it and it just physically isn't able to match my older model. I think I finally got it to where it's less noticeable and made the other monitor meet in the middle, but I'd advise you to look elsewhere now. Asus took this great monitor and trashed it, making other options extremely attractive.

review_title: the monitor is still in perfect condition. Having had such a good experience with ...
review_body: Formerly in 2009, I purchased my first HD monitor, it was a 21.5-inch ASUS VH222H. After six years of use, the monitor is still in perfect condition.

review_title: If you do not like glare, do not buy this monitor
review_body: If you do not like glare, do not buy this monitor.  If you think you'll get nice viewing angle, DO NOT GET THIS MONITOR!

review_title: We are both very pleased with these monitors
review_body: I bought this monitor a couple years ago for myself and recently purchased it again for my cousin (birthday gift). We are both very pleased with these monitors. The size is perfect and the quality of the images are crystal clear. We are both gamers and this monitor has held up to some really brutal demands. Like I mentioned, I've had mine for a couple of years and the quality of the picture is just as brilliant as it was when i set it up on day one. I couldn't be happier! For the money, I don't think you can do any better. I highly recommend.

review_title: Great picture and size. A must buy!
review_body: Upgraded from an old 19" LCD display to this one. I absolutely love how much more desktop space I have. This monitor allows me to have multiple applications running and not have to minimize them all to see what I'm doing.

I spent a lot of time before buying a led LCD monitor and looking for something in my price range was hard to find but this completely fit the bill over all great buy the only thing I would have liked to have had it come with is a hdmi cable instead of a VGA as VGA is a dead technology no one wants to run a analog signal anymore so why they include that is a waste of money is my opinion they do provide a nice FBI cable however I believe it's what they call a single double I believe works same as hdmi where it also provides sound if I'm not mistaken but overall the monitor is great works awesome on my asus computer and the picture with my gtx 660 is pretty recognize able does have a little drag side to side in high end games like cod or battlefield but what do you expect on a 60hz monitor if you aren't looking for drag look for a 120hz or even a 240hz but your not gonna find it under 200.00 with the picture quality this has or the size to price this has. Over all great monitor buying a second one for my brother to replace the laptop screen he broke.

review_title: I didn't hope to like it this much
review_body: Received this today. Was concerned about the chance of receiving something with some disappointing pixels. No issues. Love it.
EDIT: It’s been four months and I still haven’t seen a dime of my rebate.

Very good monitors! I ordered 2 for an upgrade to 2 19" monitors I had. First day both looked awesome. However, about a week later, one of the 2 monitors i got developed a stuck pixel. I've tried various utilities to get rid of it, but to no avail. I'm not returning it as it's just 1 bad pixel on the lower right hand side of the screen and am hoping in time it works itself out. It is bright white so i know it's not a dead pixel (which would be black). I have these 2 monitors hooked up to an Intel NUC system. The Intel NUC has 1 mini displayport and 1 mini HDMI port. I had to get a cable from HDMI to mini HDMI for one of the ports, then a regular HDMI cable with an adapter from HDMI to mini-displayport... works great! Colors are very sharp.
This is the seventh ASUS monitor I've purchased, and the previous 6 were all 23.6" or 24" models.  I bought this one for my video game crazed daughter.

It was performing good as usual for the first month or so, after that the monitor started acting a little off, the picture would start blinking on and off like crazy until one day the panel just fried. I did some research for the warranty outside the U.S and it stated it had 2 year coverage on the listed countries. When i contacted my support representative they refused to cover my repairs with the warranty even though their page states the opposite.

Has very nice modern sleek look.  Very satisfied with the color saturation and brightness  have used everyday for the past six months as my everyday work screen.  Makes my other monitor at home look terrible.

Monitor is fine. They do not have mounting locations for a desk mount so you’re stuck with the stand or buy $20 piece to support the mount. Seems strange that’s a pretty universal mounting location that wasn’t added. The menu system also sucks but most monitors do

Bought in when I bought the Acer Aspire TC.  Good resolution, stand could be a little better.  I think if I did it again, would have gone a little bigger.  Otherwise, worth the money I spent.  Just remember it doesn't come with an HDMI cable, so order one if needed at the same time.

review_title: i love it, The Matte screen allows for no glare
review_body: I've only had this monitor for a few days now, i love it, The Matte screen allows for no glare, 27" really does make all the difference, i'm still planning on having a duel monitor setup in the future and the zero frame of Acer makes it so easy to just add one later on, and honestly it's very well priced for the quality of this monitor, i bought this monitor to use on my gaming rig i'm building and i can't wait to see what this has got when it comes to show time, one also great feature i like is that ability to accept VGA, DVI, and HDMI allowing you to use what ever fits your needs, good job Acer keep up the good quality products

review_title: This is a gorgeous 1080p monitor at a really good price. Good color and brightness
review_body: This is a gorgeous 1080p monitor at a really good price. Good color and brightness. The display is practically borderless along the sides and top. At nearly 24", the size of this display is just about perfect at standard viewing distances for desktop computing. The price point is good for what this is.

I bought this about 4 months ago, and since the beginning it has had one big issue. The menu in the bottom right of the screen (just above the buttons) opens up and stays open, covering about 15% of the screen constantly, making it difficult to game. Pressing the buttons doesn't do anything. I gave it 2 stars because it is still a great monitor, with thin bevels and good performance it does the job. Would appreciate help with menu problem.
fast graphics, like the extra cooling fans and my last one got hot and would shut down in serious use.  still learning all the things it can do!
Graphics are great for a cheap machine. You can tilt, but not raise up. I missed that tidbit in the description and the one downside of the machine.

review_title: I love it. I'm not a gamer so for regular ...
review_body: I love it.  I'm not a gamer so for regular browsing the screen is a fantastic value.

review_title: Stops working as soon warranty is expired.
review_body: I have had this product for about a year and originally it worked great. However, over the last few months, it has been frustrating to use. My unit has the USB 3.0 Cable - A Male to Micro B cable like this:

Out of the box and operational within about 10 minutes. A couple of things for the first timers -- remember, Windows users, that you have to actually move the screen in the Resolution Control panel to the actual physical location you have the new monitor configured on your desktop. I'm projecting with this device at a resolution of 1366 X 768 and it is awesome. I've already had some drawings open while reviewing the specifications -- something I used to have to jump back and forth on the same screen. How about having a live meeting up while you're looking at the agenda that was emailed to you? I can't wait for that convenience. This is a pretty good product for the price point!

This monitor is simply great! I’ve had it for a couple of weeks, and I’m quite pleased with its build quality, look and performance. Yes, yes... the piano black finish will prove to be a fingerprint magnet, but it looks very nice nonetheless. It’s also worth mentioning that the neoprene sleeve That comes with it is really a nice touch. It’s thick enough to shrug off minor bumps, and it looks pretty sweet considering it’s a throw-in. I look forward to using it to house my display whenever I have to take it out of my studio. Buy this monitor if you’re looking for a great little inexpensive 2nd display for home or travel! I love mine! 😎

review_title: It is so disappointing to see a potentially great product so poorly executed
review_body: Very chintzy build. It is so disappointing to see a potentially great product so poorly executed. As others say, the cable (which is detachable from the monitor for no reason at all) falls out of the monitor all the time. If it manages to stay in, it wiggles with any slight movement and you lose the connection. Within just 2 days of use, my monitor went from working nearly fine (though it all still "felt" like junk and my intuition told me to return this product ASAP, before it breaks 3 days after the allowable return timeframe) to not working at all (well it does turn on occasionally, just long enough to flash the AOC logo then it craps out--a good reminder for me to NEVER AGAIN PURCHASE AN AOC PRODUCT!)

review_title: Do not purchase if you have Windows 10
review_body: I was very disappointed with this monitor. It works sometimes and does not work other times. If you have Windows 10 it will work on and off for a brief time and will completely stop working at other times. When you connect it to your computer it will light up with an image that is telling you to plug it in even if it is already plugged in. I tried with three different computers and a friend of mine also tried to do a bunch of different things to get it to work. If I was not in a place where I am unable to send packages back, I would have returned it and asked for my money back. Right now, it is only a paper weight.

its light weight, installed easy, cord is just long enough if you need to put screen on the opposite side of where your 3.0 usb is located. as one person said, the colors are washed out but its no worse then 2 out of 3 of my laptops. its typical of a replacement screen for your laptop. usually about $40, add in the plastic case, usb connectors, employee's , packaging ect ect.. im surprised the company is making any money. this is a good deal. survivability.. will have to wait and see.

I been having problems with this since I received it and thought that maybe my Windows Surface Pro did not have enough power.  I've been able to get it to work intermittently with a USB HUB, but finally figured out that it was the connector at the Monitor base that will not seat correctly.  I can tape it in place and that helps, I'm about to go get some duct tape.  The problem is I figured out what was causing the issue 1 day after the 30 day warranty, and I didn't use my American Express.  So I'm stuck with a faulty product that was a problem since I received it.

review_title: Pretty good. First one was defective.
review_body: The first one of these I received was severely defective. It lost power and turned off about 10 times per hour. I received a replacement and the second one is better but still not perfect. It looses power about once per day.

review_title: All good things can come to an end
review_body: I loved this monitor and the flexibility it gave me because I travel for work but then as I owned it for just about it year it just stopped working. I tried new cables and bringing to a repair place and they said because it was the connection point had just failed and due to the way it is constructed would cost more to fix than it cost for a new one. As much as I liked the product I will not be buying a new one each year. I hope they can fix this make it last more than a year and I would consider buying a new one.

review_title: If you can get this to work, it'll probably be awesome.  Be prepared to return it.
review_body: The second I touched this monitor, I loved it.  I'ts the perfect size and weight. I loved the way the magnetic cover/ stand worked.

review_title: Lots to love, little to complain about!
review_body: I've had this monitor for a few months now and I must say, it is a good monitor. Not great, but good. Decent colors. Good frame rate. I love the fact that there is virtually no bezel. The stand is on the cheap side s be careful.

For the price that I paid for this monitor I have no regrets.  It has a crisp look to it. I looked at local stores to try and find something but the cheapest monitor I could find was $180.  I don't use this for gaming so I can't talk about that.  This is my second monitor I use for my laptop.
I treated myself to this monitor and I’m very happy with my purchase, the quality is great, I love that there isn’t much of a frame around it, it was really easy to set up.
I ended up buying two of these screens after I liked the first so much, super thin and very nice displays.  Great buy for the cost.

beautiful color, great resolution, and price for the size. Love the base as well. Had an issue with the first monitor I got having a blue hue towards the bottom corner. As always Amazon took care of it, new monitor is perfect, works great with my main laptop via HDMI. No issues and would recommend to anyone! Will update over time if issues come up!

Never has compatibility issues, bright clear colors, excellent for gaming, and the resolution is fantastic. Very sturdy, rarely feel like I might break it accidentally when moving it somewhere. Only complaint is the stand cannot be removed from the rest of the monitor once installed the first time without breaking it.

Love the picture, sharp, crisp. such a thin bezel I use this with a dual monitor setup alongside an Acer D240H which has been a great monitor but it just looks clunky beside this one, may have to buy one more to match them up.
Great monitor. I use two for work and gaming. Very clear, good response times.

review_title: Buy it, its worth it, even kicks out others a lot more expensive
review_body: Just WOW!!!! i have seen screens that goes from 3 times the price of this thing or even higher and this screen is magnificent, perfect imagine quality, almost no edges, huge size on a tiny solid bezel. you just can't go wrong with this.

review_title: This is a great monitor. It looks good standing still
review_body: Arrived on time and installed. This is a  great monitor. It looks good standing still. The clarity and colors are great. The response time was what sold me, it is virtually flicker free. Would buy again..

review_title: Works on Arch Linux on Dell XPS 13
review_body: I purchased this to be able to have a second display when I'm doing work. I have a Dell XPS 13 so it's a little bit big but that's only a minor complaint. On my XPS, I'm able to power this device with only one USB port.

I originally ordered an ASUS MB168B+, but it had made a sound that was giving me a headache so I decided to return it.  The Asus was had a resolution of 1920x1080, which was good for video, but for text I had to increase Windows DPI scalling to make it reasonable to read.  This resulted in blurry text.  15.6" is just too small for a 1920x1080 display to be reasonable.  The 1366 x 768 of this monitor is great.  The built in stand is nice, although it does make it much thicker than the Asus.  It is also nice that it was cheaper than the MB168B+.

I never considered an external monitor for my laptop then I saw one listed in the SkyMall catalog during a flight.  I did some research and this one looked pretty good.  I downloaded the software onto my laptop and updated it then plugged in this monitor and BAM, it immediately worked.  I extended my desktop onto it and just like my three monitor desktop, it worked great.  At some point during the installation, a message came up that the auto rotate function would not work - a Win 8.1 limitation??? - but the first time I rotated the monitor, the image flipped.

review_title: I really wanted to like this monitor
review_body: I really wanted to like this monitor. It's slim and light weight. The colors weren't great but that's what I expected from a usb monitor. The problem with this display is the viewing angle. You can be looking directly at it and notice the colors become saturated at the edges. Tried playing with the limited settings and it looked better but I cannot overlook the inconsistent screen color.

review_title: Great second monitor for the laptop and Surface Pro 4
review_body: Great second monitor for the laptop and Surface Pro 4.  It's lightweight and comes with a carrying case. Easy to install drivers from the setup CD.  Because I am using an old HP Elitebook which has USB 2.0 I had to plug in the both of the USB adapters into the USB hub I have and it worked!!!  On my Surface Pro 4 I do have USB 3.0 and I only needed to plug in one of the USB adapter and it worked!!!

review_title: Nice second display for a laptop.
review_body: This external USB powered monitor is really terrific - well built and it comes with a nice case (although I wish there was a pocket for the USB cable).

I very much like the form factor of this product, including the fact that it's VESA compatible. However, it is not compatible with my new-ish Windows 10 Surface Book laptop. It *does* work on a few older gen laptops and I even took it into Microcenter where they were able to get it going with a few other machines, plug and play no problem. I've scoured for updated drivers online but no luck. I'm hoping PCRush (the name of the company behind this listing) can find and send me updated drivers soon, otherwise I'll have to send this in for a return in order to meet the return window.

I loved it at first. It worked really well and made my computer work so much easier. It is light weight and easy to transport. About 6 months into owning it the connection became very loose. I have owned it a little over a year and now it wont read the connection at all. It is an ok investment and I do use it almost every day. I also work on the road, so a lot of starbucks shops. It might work better for someone who just uses it as a second screen and does not need it to be so "portable"

review_title: Works Great-- Unless You Are Using Nvidia Surround
review_body: The quality and speed of the display is impressive for something connected over USB 3.0. The drivers also install automatically without any effort on your part. You wouldn't want to use this as a main display for gaming, but as a secondary display that would allow you to look at a web browser or maps it's fantastic.

review_title: It is light and easy to carry anywhere I need to
review_body: Waited 3 months to write my review just in case it stopped working.  It is still functional.
Great monitor for every day use.

review_title: I liked this monitor so much I bought two
review_body: I liked this monitor so much I bought two!  Great resolution, colors.  I use it as a second monitor with my iMac and it's great.  I did buy a little stand to put it on..  Prefect.

review_title: Has amazing picture quality and great color to the images as ...
review_body: Has amazing picture quality and great color to the images as well as great definition. Is the perfect size for computer monitor in my opinion.

review_title: Great picture. I bought two of these and it ...
review_body: Great picture.  I bought two of these and it does almost look like one long screen when the two screens are place next to each other as the bezels on these screens are real thin. These work well with my surface dock and Microsoft Surface Pro 4.  The black frame is classy and looks good in my home office.  The price for the 23.8 inch monitors was really great as well. No issues as of yet. I would buy these again if needed monitors in the future.

Had this just over a year and out of the blue the edges started flickering and burned in the image, but only to the edge. Even when I unplugged the hdmi cord I could still clearly see the chrome bar. Amazing monitor for the cost, I was actually about to buy another one to match it. Acer says they have a 3 year warranty on monitors so I'll see what I can do tomorrow...

I bought two of these monitors.  The blacks are so washed out, makes text reading tough.  I tried to adjust the brightness down but there was no effect on the blacks.  Even in a bright room you can see the screen bleed, nothing like most reviews implied.  Really disappointed in this model monitor and would not recommend it.  Replaced them with a BenQ model with VA screen type instead of IPS, way better blacks and super nice colors.

I wanted a new "gaming monitor" for the new game called Overwatch by Blizzard. I already had a gaming laptop, an Asus G73JH and just wanted a modern more big display. After researching for a week I came to the conclusion this was the best monitor for under $200. The 4ms/hdmi/and beautiful IPS display made it all to easy to buy. It sits on my desk right next to my 17.3" laptop. I couldn't be happier buying my first monitor!

review_title: Screen is Great, Bezel is Great, Stand is Okayish
review_body: Looks great, was a great price, and I LOVE the slim bezel around the edges. I use this in a dual monitor setup and the slim bezel really does make a different. The desktop mount seem a little flimsy, and there is not height adjustment which is annoying.

It's a decent monitor for the price and does the trick.  It does seem to emit a high-pitched squeal that is rather annoying if you work in a quiet environment or are sensitive to such sounds.  I reacted negatively to the sheer size of it at first since it was a huge increase over my previous monitor and found that it increased eye strain and eye fatigue but that's more a function of my adjustment period than the actual quality of the monitor.
Very nice monitor. The size is perfect for my desk. It's definitely an improvement over the "tiny" monitor it replaced. Happy with this purchase.

I bought 1 and it was working good. Then I bought another and it lasted 5 minutes before the display quit showing a signal. So I returned an got another. Same thing, so then I just ordered a different brand and that is working fine.

ASUS is my go-to for screens and laptops. My $500 ASUS laptop still beats my brothers 'gaming laptop' for performance and speed. My point is, if you want quality go for an ASUS. This is the second screen of theirs I have, the first is the same size but with a slightly different stand and frame. Both are decently priced and sturdy, with clear image and a user-friendly menu interface. Easy to put together and well-packaged, with the safety of the screen in mind. The screen has a blue light in the bottom right corner to indicate when it's powered on, which turns red when the screen is off but plugged in. I trust these screen with my cheap wobbly desk to not break if anything bad should happen.

First of all, the price is great for this quality of a monitor. It's only 1080p, but what do you expect after the television industry went and ruined high-res monitors for us geeks? Anyway... The screen itself is great. It's an LED LCD monitor, so it's very bright (a little too bright on arrival, but with a little tweaking, it's awesome). The colors and contrast are very good, and especially good for the price of the monitor. It's also very durable, and I've had absolutely no problems with this monitor so far. Having multiple inputs is great for anyone with a PC and gaming console (I have my PC hooked up with a DVI-D cable, and my PS3 is connected with an HDMI cable), or any other device. It's nice not having to switch cables with multiple devices anymore. The monitor also tilts nicely, and is easy to turn on it's base (the screen itself doesn't move separately of the base, but the base is very easy to move on a smooth surface), yet stable and reliably stationary. I really like this monitor, and plan on purchases at least one more in the close future. I recommend this to literally any user, consumers and gamers alike.

Excellent monitor. image is awesome; big with great contrast and color. mine required no calibration out of the box. response time is very nice and i experience no ghosting or tearing on the games i play. i also like the fact that the buttons on monitor are REAL buttons that make a satisfying 'click' when you press them; none of that 'touch' button BS that so many new monitors have now. multiple hdmi inputs is a nice touch, as is the addition of a display port and a vga port for legacy support. built in speakers are what you expect and i don't really recommend using them unless you're in a pinch; really its nice that they even included them at all, just don't expect them to equal even modestly price external speakers.

They shine so bright, which most people really like, that I almost had to wear shades. I have sensitive eyes though so I just quickly turned them down to 60%. One thing that I really like the most besides the picture is that for adjustments is that they actually have a proper number of buttons and the menu is initiative so no need to pop open a manual. The viewing angles are solid and just as good as my more expensive Samsung. The bases are solid, but I would feel better if they were a touch heavier and wider and if the little lock in tab was more noticeable as I assembled both without it getting locked in and had to take them back apart, which took all of 30 seconds. I use them for work, with lots of Excel and number crunching and looked at them for about 10 hours straight with no eyestrain. I will be looking into their bigger brothers when I go to upgrade the monitor on my gaming rig. The only other thing that I would prefer and besides the bases why I am knocking a star off is that the connectors come straight off the back instead of pointing down so if you are thinking about wall mounting or pushing them as close to a wall as you can you may want to consider that.

I needed a second monitor and this wide screen ticked all the boxes.  I should have bought one long ago.  The VS239H-P is brighter with a higher contrast than my old 19" NEC 4:3 flatpanel which was excellent in its day (paid 600 bucks), so I use the VS239H-P as my primary now.  The wide screen is wide enough for two side by side apps if you don't need the full width for a single app or browser.
Good screen with no dead pixels, and colors are amazing.

review_title: stuck pixel on the brand new monitor
review_body: I picked up this monitor VS247H-P based on the high reviews. I received the package yesterday, but found a stuck bright dot immediately. It's a bright green dot in the middle of the screen, which makes me feel so uncomfortable. I tried several software based repaire tool, but they didn't work at all. Seem the monitor doesn't have zero-bright-dot warranty, I don't know how to do with this bright dot..

review_title: It's nothing fancy, but it works well. I ...
review_body: It's nothing fancy, but it works well. I purchased this as a display for my home security DVR, so I'm not doing anything really taxing with it. I have it wall-mounted above the workstation in my home office. It has plenty of inputs so I can also use it as an auxiliary display for my workstation and laptop. I have noticed that it tends to render grey as more of a light steel blue (similar to other reviews posted here), but that is not a primary concern for my application. Decent inexpensive display.

review_title: Weeks of searching... the perfect monitor!!!
review_body: After weeks of searching for a great monitor under $200, I stumbled across this one although my heart was set on a AOC thin bezel monitor. Being the best selling monitor on amazon means something, so I decide I should go for this one. Boy am I glad I did! The monitor arrived and after reading reviews about dead pixels I checked every square inch, perfect, nothing just a gorgeous IPS gloss finish display with a 1.5 cm bezel. I unpacked the monitor and was greeted with: a VGA cable, DVI cable, Power-Cable, the monitor and some paperwork. I plugged in the monitor and immediately blown away, a 1080p display with the best viewing angles I've ever seen on a monitor! Wow!

review_title: The area where you plug in the USB is poor quality. The logo appears on the screen and ...
review_body: This monitor works for a little while and then it stops working. It has something to do with the connectivity in the back of the monitor. The area where you plug in the USB is poor quality. The logo appears on the screen and then nothing happens. Then occasionally it will work again. Barely used this monitor since I purchased it for this reason. Will not be buying from this brand again.

review_title: great deal for the price - but i do not recommend using with a Mac
review_body: I use a MacBook Pro and while downloading the driver for Macs was easy enough on the AOC site, not being able to control the contrast or brightness on the monitor became a big problem.  Within an hour my eyes hurt and I had a headache.  The monitor was too bright and seemed like it was vibrating.  I messed with the display options/tried to download programs to control external monitor brightness, but nothing worked.  You can't even calibrate properly without being able to control the brightness/contrast.

review_title: I was terribly annoyed with the poor build quality of the usb ...
review_body: A bit unclear why this product was reviewed so well. At this point, there is an internal crack in the monitor after 2 months of light use.

review_title: I give the display a B+ and customer service an F
review_body: The video quality is simply okay. Mac software is not optimized, but it does work. My biggest complaint is the cable that came with this display can not be touched while connected, or the signal will drop and display powers off.

review_title: My very first return to Amazon
review_body: I will give this product a 2 star rating. I have read both positive and negative reviews on this product and my experience may not be the norm. Personally, it did not work on two of my PCs. So I decided to return this item for a refund. For those with win10 be especially careful,  as this product's drivers crashed my PC after installation (endless loading black screen). I was able to recover by rebooting into safe mode and recovering my PC to an earlier history save point prior to the install (as even uninstalling the drivers still gave an endless loading screen). Buy this product at your own risk. I will add that the product did work with both PCs in the sense that it powered on. However,  it never produced any type of display for either PC. I used both a laptop and desktop (one win10 and one win7) to no avail.

review_title: These are great! One cord and done
review_body: We are on the road alot for work!! We were packing up monitors and carrying big totes around with us. It took up so much space. These are great! One cord and done. I have a Macbook Pro and all I did was plug in the USB and it came right up. The screen quality is way better than expected and it sooo easy to travel with. We have taken it on flights as well. I can't say anything bad about it.

review_title: Writing the review as a photographer - Summary: It's alright
review_body: I've got this monitor sitting next to my main monitor, which is hardware-calibrated for accurate color. In just a few words, the AOCs color looks like total crap. They've injected the monitor with a lot of excess blue to make it appear sharper and more vibrant. Television manufacturers do this to try to get in edge on competition while on-display in the store. The difference is that with TVs and non-DisplayLink monitors you can neutralize those artificial colors after you buy them. Not so here. This monitor cannot be calibrated, nor can you truly adjust the brightness (you can download programs that overlay some grey on your screen to mimic lowering the brightness). SO. If you have the option of a non-usb powered monitor instead of this, go for it. If you need it to be USB for portability, it's pretty decent at getting the job done. Just don't think about editing photos or doing any color or contrast sensitive work on it.

review_title: Good idea but failure rate of devices is too high
review_body: Thought these would be a great solution for road warriors needing occasional extra screen.  Had good success with the first unit, but the second to units I ordered failed almost immediately.  They will not stay powered up on any device I connect them to.  The PC recognizes the device outputs video to it and then the AOC screen will blink or black out.  I can hook up the original one I ordered and it still works fine.  Failure rate is way too high to give anything but the lowest rating.

Pretty good while it lasted.  I treated it well and was careful.  It is supposed to be portable, really one of its main design criteria. Nevertheless. the connection between the screen and the connection cord seems to have failed and has a lot of wiggle in it.  Now, when I plug it in, I get the AOC logo for a second or two and then nothing more.  Very disappointing.  (Also, it worked pretty well while it lasted although I could never get it to automatically switch from portrait view to landscape view just by turning the monitor.)

review_title: It has some nice features, the stand is great
review_body: It has some nice features, the stand is great, comes  with a neoprene pouch and y split usb 3.0 cable so you can use a separate power supply. The picture is OK, I wouldn't use it for photo editing, video or games, but does just fine for text. The case is godawful glossy black plastic, the screen is gloss to, just looking at it will live prints and it will look dirty all the time. Glare is also an issue.

review_title: Super good looking and great display!
review_body: Love the sharpness and clarity of the display. Great colors although not the best in market but for it's price, I'm not complaining! Great as a work monitor or for casual home use.

review_title: Great monitors for a cheap price
review_body: I bought 2 of these to replace my old 2 monitor setup.

review_title: Big, bright and crisp solution for remote log in.
review_body: Replaced a 19 inch I couldn't read when I connected to my office from home.  Bigger text but I think the increased brightness an crispness were a big part of the improvement.  Strictly use it for office and simple graphics programs.

review_title: Very bright and crisp graphics. While the monitor can ...
review_body: Very bright and crisp graphics. While the monitor can tilt, the downside is that it cannot be raised or lowered.
Bought to use with my laptop as I'm away from hom for long periods,
I have enjoyed this monitor for games, video streaming and work functions.  The only real knock is the lack of a vesa mount.

Great screen. Arrived on time as usual. Sharp images and nice colors. I linked to my laptop using the AmazonBasics High-Speed HDMI Cable and it works great. Much easier to work on this than on the 13 inch screen computer of my laptop.
I love the display, it has some amazing color and contrast! As an extra, I enjoy the Eco mode because it modifies brightness and color depending on the time of the day.
Incredibly wide, good picture screen. Almost like having two screens in one if you tab out (separate) your windows.

Excellent monitor.. Arrived quickly and in excellent condition.. Very sturdy base, and beautiful display.. It is very light and has excellent response time..  HDMI, VGA, and DVI slots allow for flexibility in which cable you'd like to use.. I don't experience any problems with the backlight like others do but I never have my screen set to display something solid black like they seem to..

Initial thoughts, from unboxing to first hour of use... the built in handle at the top/back is much appreciated, and comes in handy during unboxing. For its size the monitor is light enough to handle easily.

review_title: Great if you want a wide angle monitor/screen
review_body: Should have bought it earlier.  And the rebate...makes it sweeter.  If you connect VGA and another different source HDMI you can select which to view, even if it requires moderate button pushing to navigate the menu.  But it is intuitive.  This monitor also puts out much more light than my 19 inch Dell.  So.......my dark work in the wee hours of the morning is much more illuminated (not always a great thing).  I was tempted to go for the bigger one (I believe it was 27 inches) for about 100 more dollars.  I'm glad I didn't.  This one is big enough for me.

review_title: I will simply say that these monitors are one of my favorite purchases on Amazon.
review_body: Let me say this - these monitors (I bought two) are fantastic.  I got them on sale plus with a $20 rebate each.  When taking that all into account, these were a STEAL.  The color representation is fantastic in SRGB mode which is what I use for my setup.  I do Photoshop/Illustrator work on a regular basis and these make the work even easier.  They do NOT come with any sort of speaker, so be aware that if you plan on using them you will need an external sound source.  Not a big deal as most monitor speakers are low-quality anyway.  You could always pair them with

review_title: Perfect for a dual monitor setup
review_body: I bought two of these to create a dual monitor setup to replace my single 23in monitor. Happy I went with the 21.5in vs the 23in as it would have been too wide to work at a 2 foot distance. Saved $$!! The monitors look great - I am using a dual dvi nvidia 256 card and the video is crisp with excellent monitor response time. Contrast is awesome. Cant go wrong with this monitor!

review_title: Picture so great you will realize there were colors you never knew even existed
review_body: I'm not really an expert on monitors so there is not much I can say spec wise and all that. I just did a bit of research looking for the most recommended monitor for gaming. This was the one that seemed to be recommended most. Apparently it is often the one used on official tournaments as it looks great and the price is reasonable.

I bought this monitor because in addition to being budget priced, it is one of the few with HDMI input as well as DVI.  For its overall quality the price point is spectacular; i.e., it is a really good low budget monitor, and on that count, faulting it for not having other bells and whistles is just being fatuous.  Resolution is supported from 640x480 to 1920x1080, which should satisfy anyone.  While there are only 4 inputs: HDMI, DVI, VGA, and headphone, the color is good, with a number of settings that allow you to adjust to taste, if not for total color purity, and it is bright with an unusually good viewing angle, not that that is terribly critical for a computer monitor.  Set up is trivial.  The stand may not be super strong, but is totally adequate for almost any desktop, allowing adequate tilt/pivot (at least for my purposes), plus you have standard screw receptacles if you want to use it for a wall mount multi-monitor configuration.  It is very light and very thin.  Note that it does not incorporate a USB hub, which I suppose might be a factor for some buyers.  One thing I particularly appreciate is that it uses a conventional power cord rather than the custom power supplies I've encountered with other monitors.  This just may be the best monitor value out there at this time and as such deserves a 5-star rating.

I've been using this Monitor a couple of weeks now, and so far, I'm well satisfied with the picture quality.  There are six (6) different settings available for the "Splendid" mode, which offers a wide range of preset adjustments; I use Splendid often; I love this feature!  Speaker quality is OK considering they're monitor speakers; no real complaint here.  The only problem that should be noted is that when using the supplied DVI/HDMI Cable, the monitor looses sink when the computer is coming out of sleep mode.  The only way to get sink back is to re-plug the monitor or reboot, however, this doesn't happen with an HDMI/HDMI connection.  Since the computer I'm using this monitor with doesn't have an HDMI port, I rated it three (3) stars because of the inconvenience.  Overall though, this is a decent monitor.

review_title: Bright Display; but blacks is gray.
review_body: I ordered a new unit of this monitor to replace the defective identical used unit that started turning itself on and off randomly after 2 weeks.  I was satisfied enough at this size and price to give the model a 2nd chance.

review_title: Great monitor, after a few tweaks.
review_body: This monitor is perfect for my needs. Unfortunately the first one I received had a dead pixel right in the center, but amazon replaced it and the new one I received has worked just fine thus far.

I bought two of these from Amazon Warehouse deals. I use these primarily for editing photos. I'm not a gamer so don't know how they would perform for that.  They are set up as a dual monitor system.  The colors are incredible and the IPS feature is great! Connected with a older video card that supports dual monitors. (ATI Radeon 2400 PRO 256mb)  Text looks sharp and clear. The colors, contrast, brightness, etc. look exactly the same on both screens. AWESOME!! The first thing I did was to make sure I had all the latest drivers for my video card and also reset the monitors to factory settings. This was necessary considering the monitors were sold used. By the way, they still looked new without any signs of use. No dead pixels or anything else. I've never had any issues buying from Warehouse deals. I also have another ASUS 23" monitor that's been in use for a few years. Still going strong. Love ASUS quality. I'm not a Pro photographer, but I'm impressed with the image quality these monitors produce. I'm sure I'll need to calibrate them but from what I've seen with some recent prints, they look good out of the box. Because of technology, the IPS feature has been made more affordable. If you do your research, these monitors may not be true IPS but they do the job very well for the price.

review_title: Wouldn't work with my HD laptop. When plugged in ...
review_body: Wouldn't work with my HD laptop. When plugged in, you had to click the mouse about 2 inches away from what you actually wanted to click on. Either that or you could change the resolution on your screens which makes everything on your laptop teeny and everything on the portable screen so big you can't even see anything you have open on it.

review_title: Really do like the monitor for what it is
review_body: Really do like the monitor for what it is, a GREAT portable monitor that you can throw in a bag. Fantastic for road warriors. I want to rate it five star but just can't due to reliability. Have bought four of these, one out of the box would not work (Returned), one has started repeatedly failing used maybe 20-30 hours (Will Return), one works fine (20-30 hours) and one still sits in a box. UPDATE 03/23: Replacement monitor works great and I've found that using USB 2.0 creates no problems compared to using USB 3.0 at least on this Lenovo W540 laptop. Changing rating to 4 from 2.

review_title: Good second screen for presentations, etc.  NOT for high res presentations or the like
review_body: I bought this for some added portability. It's ok on win 8.1, for some reason on the new 10 it's not connecting, so I'll wait to see if the driver updates shortly which I'm sure is the likley cause.

review_title: Works great with Macbook and PowerPoint.  A couple other apps.... not so much
review_body: I bought this monitor so I'd have a second monitor when making PowerPoint presentations on my MacBook Air.

review_title: Monitor Worked for approx 10 hour! Totally bummed
review_body: Loved my 15 in aoc monitor so much. It was stolen so I purchased this refurbished one in December. I hadn't used it until this past week. Worked well for approximately 10 hours and now will not stay lit up. It flashes on 2-3 seconds and turns off. From what I am reading on Google looks like this is due to an aging capacitator. Really? Unfortunately there is no recourse since I hadn't use it within the Amazon return policy. I haven't had any feedback from aoc.

Just got the monitor and have to say WOW!!  I do have to say though that I tried plug-and-play even though instructions said to load drivers 1st, didn't work.... YOU HAVE TO DOWNLOAD THE DRIVERS.  If you don't have a CD/DVD hit the AOC sire and you can download them  I did get an error that there was a software incompatibility (running win10) but after reboot for which I was prompted there were no issues.  Plugged it in the USB and was good to go.  Screen is nice and bright, it is thin, it has a built in stand that works great and it comes with a carry sleeve.  Id you're looking for a portable monitor this is it.  It is even good enough for desktop so if you want to decrease cords I'd certainly buy another!!  I don't write a lot of reviews... this was a great buy!

Nice little additional monitor.  I used it for over a year til I didn't;t need it anymore and had no problems with it. In fact, my cat knocked it off the desk and the back popped off.  I thought it was done, but I popped the back back on and it still worked like a charm.  Screen resolution not quite as clear as my MacBook Pro but was definitely adequate.

Very nice external monitor. I would have liked a little higher resolution but works perfectly for pretty much everything I need. It is very slim, very lightweight and still fits in the laptop bag next to the laptop. Reading the reviews, I kept the cardboard for the sleeve and use it to protect the LCD screen from impacts when it is in the neoprene sleeve. I am careful with the USB cable that plugs into the monitor as I also read that it tends to flex at the port that is in the back where the stand folds out. I may add an adhesive clip where the stand comes out to keep the cable from flexing at the port. I love it and wish I had bought one sooner. Great picture and has not let me down yet.

review_title: Decent portable monitor, limitations when using with Apple OS X
review_body: Decent monitor, but Apple MacBook Air support is limited.

Not durable.  I put it in my brief case.  I guess my notebook was against it - screen is now cracked and the monitor is in the recycle.  Absolute waste of money in that neoprene case....  The picture was not the best - it was ok - but I'm sure there are better options.  I own several AOC monitors for work (4) but this portable one was a no go.

Really crisp image, love the thin bezels, easy to set up.  Three of them in a semi-circle is great.  No easy VESA mounting option, but it's just sitting on the desk and the height seems just fine.  Lower refresh rate hasn't really bothered me playing various games on a GTX 1070.

Good monitor, good color and pixel count.  use it for gaming, editing, and watching stuff. Screen does not reflect things behind you, so can be used in a larger variety of lightings. Stand is strong, but screen has no built in mount to be mounted anywhere. The mount adaptor is cheap, however, and ultimately this monitor is worth what you pay, especially since it is cheaper than the competitors at the moment.
I bought this for my office - I spend much of my day in front of the monitor, and this one is very pleasant to use. I thoroughly enjoy the narrow bezel.

review_title: Really sharp monitor with excellent choices for connecting to the PC
review_body: Really sharp monitor with excellent choices for connecting to the PC. Since, we have only had it for 2 days there isn't much to say about its reliability, but we have had no problems in the past with other Acer monitos.
Good Price. Good Quality. Great for office work. Not sure about gaming. I don’t game. Big big beautiful monitors!

review_title: It works fine but when I plugged in speakers I guess it ...
review_body: It works fine but when I plugged in speakers I guess it wasn't getting enough power draw or something and the screen would flicker on and off randomly, while you're gaming this is probably the most annoying thing ever.

This was a birthday gift for my husband he loves it. Games and movies show up well and it's quite durable. He travels a lot and it's taken a couple of tumbles, but it's still working just as fine as when we bought it.

review_title: While the resolution and sharpness could be better, this is a fine quality monitor for the ...
review_body: While the resolution and sharpness could be better, this is a fine quality monitor for the price. I do gaming so if I used this only for business and streaming/watching videos i would rate 5 stars.
These were recommended by my IT dept and am very pleased with them.  I bought two of these over a year ago to have multiple screens simultaneously and have not had any issues with them..

This is a great TV. I bought it for my yacht - so I needed a smart tv because there is not cable running through the boat, but there we have internet. This is the smallest smart tv I could find. Awesome. Hung it up and works great.

review_title: After returning the first, Im pretty happy.
review_body: Overall this is a decent monitor with a few quirks. The colours are nice, the speakers are decent, and the build quality is good.

This is the largest monitor I've owned to date.  I almost didn't buy it because I wasn't sure it'd fit in my arrangement here... And realistically it doesn't, but it's worth it.  I have an HP 20" LED to my left, this 23.6" Asus in the middle, and an ancient Dell 15" 4:3 LCD to my right on top of my tower.  This thing, I'm almost sad to say, makes my other monitors look like trash.  I knew it was going to be nice but the colors on here are so vibrant it makes me want to turn off the other two if they all are showing just my wallpaper.

review_title: Not great as a main display, okay as a secondary
review_body: I had this monitor for a over three years now, initially to be my main monitor. I have notice when there movements on the screen, the image seems to flicker and at a closer look at the screen they seem to be a faint checkerboard pattern similar to unused space in a .png image. Bought another monitor to replace it and used this one as a second monitor.

I bought without realizing it didn't have a displayport input, but it's a decent screen for the price, both of the screens I purchased had at least a couple dead pixels so that's a little annoying. If I was using them for something more than just work I would probably return and get something different but for the price they work fine.

review_title: first impressions: Good monitor, but you need to mess with it
review_body: Right out of the box the color was ugly, really washed out, and didn't look very good at all. I spent about 30 minutes adjusting all the settings, and it ended up looking significantly better (preset theatre looks the best to me, I wish i had noticed the presets before doing it all myself, it ships in standard mode, and it looks very plain.)
So I got this monitor a good month now, And I'll say it's a pretty good piece of work, but everything has a flaw, and I haven't seen this one before, at least on other monitors or in reviews.

review_title: An Excellent Computer monitor from ASUS, A Name You Can Trust
review_body: I have been building computers since the 286 processor, and down through the years ASUS has emerged as an excellent provider of computer peripherals and equipment.  ASUS motherboards are among the best, so are the DVD drives, Video cards, and the monitors.  This is a very good monitor at a fair price.  We purchased this for our office desktop, and it makes reading data so much easier.
Update Oct 28, 2016:

review_title: First two hours of use, but am very happy with it.
review_body: Setup and adjustment is quick and easy. The monitor looks good with a shiny jet black plastic stand and frame. Some reviewers complained about graininess caused by the anti-glare coating on the screen, but I find the picture sharp, clear, and easy on the eyes. Also, I'm a serious amateur photographer, mainly of birds, and I find the color just fine. However, there are several choices of video mode: STANDARD, THEATER, GAME, NIGHT VIEW, sRBG, and SCENERY. To my eyes, STANDARD mode renders the colors and contrast best, especially with high definition photos, with sRBG a close second. The screen was a bit too bright for my eyes from the company, but that is easily remedied. Using the adjustment controls is fairly intuitive. Good thing because the user's manual is just about useless in how to adjust the screen.

review_title: not perfect, but can't beat the price.
review_body: not perfect, but can't beat the price. I got this as a secondary screen for a surface book, so I also got the adapter. (more on that later on that specific item review)

I purchased the AOC as a travel monitor to use while working. The product worked great at first but after about 2 months the problems began. There were connectivity issues and then it wouldn't connect at all. The only reason I'm leaving one star is because the first bout of customer service was beyond amazing. Once I lost all connectivity, I contacted AOC customer service and I had a new monitor within 2 weeks.

review_title: It works beautifully. OMG AOC take note
review_body: I would give no starts if I could. I received my monitor and before setting it up, i threw the box away. big mistake. I set it up, nothing. Tried to download the drivers from the internet b/c my laptop doesn't have an internal cd/dvd drive. internet wasn't helpful. Called AOC and got voice mail in their support center. Guy called me back 28 hours later and told me what to do. it didn't work. i went & bought an external cd/dvd drive just to download the drivers that came with it (another $50 for the drive). Still nothing. looked on line for other users who had the same problem, tried their solution & nothing..

I have only had this for a week. So far, so good. It is very useful. My main use for it is as a second screen for my laptop at school and when I am working on school stuff in the school library. For that, it works great. Given the price, you shouldn't expect this to do more than that. It does have some lag, but it doesn't make a big difference for reading text. I would not rely on this for high end video watching or gaming. I love how portable it is. When I get home from school, I just plug it into whatever machine I need to use it in my house. I have also tried using it with USB 2.0 and it works. Also, I have not needed to use the second USB connection yet.

I like this monitor a lot. It looks great, has pretty decent build quality, and is extremely handy for either running a second screen on my laptop to increase productivity, or to set up in small meeting rooms where projectors aren't practical.

review_title: Missing driver download CD it comes with is useless. Monitor is thin but faulty.
review_body: Product comes with a driver on a CD which is as good as useless for most laptop users anymore. The drivers are easy enough to find online. But to get your computer to recognize the monitor you must find and download the driver from a website which is a little uncomfortable as I worry about getting a virus on my computer. The company does not have a link to download the driver on their website for this model but they do have them for other models.

review_title: You get what you pay for!
review_body: I would highly recommend to NOT get this monitor. The back port is poorly designed and any slight movement with the connecting cable will disconnect the monitor. The monitor crashes at least once a month and I have uninstalled and installed the actual driver for it every time. It is a consistent problem on both laptops that I am using (Windows 10 & 8). Add another $50-$80 and buy yourself a higher quality monitor - unless you want to deal with the same frustration I've been dealing with.

review_title: This arrived at the perfect time, work from home day with the work ...
review_body: This arrived at the perfect time, work from home day with the work laptop...I'm used to two, if not three screens at the office, so I was ecstatic to test this out.  It's light (about the same as my work Lenovo/IBM laptop).  So far so good (it's only been a day), but considering the need for another screen when travelling, I would recommend this monitor, it will fit in a woman's traditional large bag along with he laptop & other stuff we cram in there.

I purchased this monitor to replace the older version that doesn't have as slim a profile.  When the cord stays connected, the produce works as expected.  The problem is the cord falls out of the plug randomly and every time I move the monitor due to poor design. Several people on my team bought this monitor after they saw mine; all have the same problem. I've stopped traveling with this monitor and went back to using the previous model.  Not worth it; wait until AOC fixes the design flaw.

review_title: Messed up my display on the Surface Book
review_body: this monitor installs the crappy display link which messes up the resolution settings on my surface book. and even Dell. The display of the surface book 2 became terrible after these drivers. After which I removed the drivers and the surface book came back to original resolution.

Came quick and was simple to set up.  Resolution was perfect immediately upon starting it up.  Make sure you load the software first then plug it in to your computer.  If you read the manual it tells you that.  I work from home and I am loving this monitor. My computer was supposed to dock on my HP doc and when my new computer came it didn't have the docking port.  The USB doc was going to be the same price as this monitor and now I can take it all with me.  I like using my laptop keyboard so this all works out for me.
It's a great monitor with good color reproduction.
Be hard to find a better IPS display in this price range. It has a great picture and a ultra thin bezel. I'm using it mostly for music production running a DAW Reaper.
I have to return this due to the top edge of the screen monitor flashing with light bars, it doesn't just "glow" as said on the description! It's look good and good display details screen otherwise.

Screen is amazing. Easy to assemble. No dead pixels, and the controls are easy to figure out. It's a very sleek monitor and the thin bezels are very nice. Would highly recommend, especially when it went on sale for $129!
This is one of many Acer monitors I have purchased over the years. I never cease to be amazed at the brilliance and clarity that Acer delivers for the price.

review_title: Great display as I am using it for school work ...
review_body: I am impressed with this product.  I purchased 2 and have no complaints.  I was looking for thin monitors for small desks and this monitor fit extremely well.  Great display as I am using it for school work along with gaming.

I have had the monitor for 2 years now and it’s still amazing. Picture quality is beautiful for gaming as well as watching movies/shows. For the price, it outperforms most of the higher priced ones! Beautiful pictures highly recommend!

Bright, colorful and clear! I bought this as a primary monitor so I could do graphics/photoshop work and some light gaming, and it's great for the price. I had to put a book underneath the stand as it's a little short and you can't raise or lower the screen itself, but that's not a huge inconvenience. I bought an HDMI to micro-HDMI cable for another 5-6 dollars and was able to easily drive it with my laptop.
beautiful picture, excellent ease of use, very professional appearance, works great for gaming, business use and movies.
