review_title: He's very satisfied with purchase Large screen
review_body: Gift for son... He's very satisfied with purchase

I'm very happy with this purchase. It comes with a three year TWO WAY shipping warranty should anything go wrong. I read some reviews about dead pixels and almost did not purchase. I have no dead pixels and no light bleed problem.

review_title: Great display for the price. Works well with 13" Macbook Pro
review_body: I use this monitor in tandem with a 13" Macbook Pro with Retina display. That is probably the reason for my rating of 4/5. I'm really used to the clarity of the display on my MBP, which the display doesn't reflect despite being HD. Nonetheless, I love the size of this display and it was so easy to set up and connect to my computer. It makes using a laptop for work that much easier.

review_title: Exact same model but honestly the original one has slightly better color. I really can't get it to match ...
review_body: I picked this one to be a twin to the one I bought a few years ago. Exact same model but honestly the original one has slightly better color. I really can't get it to match even 95%. I do get some flickers from time to time (I have tried different cables and ports).

review_title: ... this up as a cheap stand in for a better monitor, and it does it's job well for ...
review_body: I picked this up as a cheap stand in for a better monitor, and it does it's job well for the price.

I have to say that i compare this monitor to my old one that i had which was a NEC opticlear which was 7 years old but a great monitor with good colors. It is a bright screen and it will definitely light up a room, but i believe if you tone it down like others have done on this product review you will lose some color saturation. I do not mind the screen brightness, but other than that, the button to control the screen is in an awkward part of the the monitor which is a pain because of where they are located but are labeled.

Great monitors for the price! I have four of these and very happy with them! Not one dead pixel on any of them, very low latency and nice 1920x1080 HD resolution. I share them among two PC's and a laptop through a switching configuration and makes a very convenient arrangement for my work, play, and HD movies too. Fast delivery, packed well, no damage (assumiing your delivery driver isn't throwing a "Hail Mary" of course!). I have been an ASUS fan for a long time beginning with their motherboards, so I was very pleased to see these work out too! I have an Amazon Prime account and got fast delivery and good service.

review_title: Owned for 6+ months, no problems whatsoever
review_body: This was my first monitor I ordered from Amazon.
I purchased this monitor for gaming-- the big feature was the 1ms ultrafast refresh-rate.

The display is beautiful!  When I set it up side by side with my old system, the difference was amazing.  The whites were so bright that it made the Acer I was using look yellow.  The image is noticeably crisp and there were no dead pixels or light bleed issues.  I am very pleased with it!

review_title: Pretty darned good for a cheap 24" monitor
review_body: I've only had this for a few hours, so we'll see how it holds up.

review_title: Great price to extend your workstation
review_body: Been using this for a few days. I got it to dual screen multiple text/data documents or browsers. I've even used it to watch movies while working on emails on my laptop monitor and it works great. The only con, is as others have mentioned, the resolution is surprisingly low (but I knew this going in) for being an updated model. It's perfectly fine for text documents and casual movies, but if you're a stickler about this type of thing it may drive you up a tree.

review_title: This monitor drives me crazy and I wish I would ...
review_body: This monitor drives me crazy and I wish I would have returned it when I was hemming and hawing in the 30 day period. The connection between the cable and the monitor is sloppy in two ways. 1) the cable falls out with the slightest movement 2) the location where the cable goes into the monitor is poorly thought out, causing the cable to be jostled if the monitor leg is moved at all. Drives me crazy every day.

review_title: It works but it looks a little dim
review_body: It works but you are going to be a little frustrated if you are using it with your MacBook Pro. Going from looking at the awesome Retina display of the Mac to the somewhat dim AOC display is disappointing. I use mine as an extended desktop and it just isn’t a high quality experience, but it isn’t that expensive either.

This was a gift for my daughter for Christmas.  She loved it and said it worked great, that is until yesterday when it died.  We're beginning the process of trying to get it fixed/replaced since it has a 3 year warranty.  Will update this review if/when we have a final resolution.

review_title: I like it more than the similar ASUS monitor
review_body: I like it more than the similar ASUS monitor, even though ASUS is lighter. AOC has a better stand, and, first of all, better contrast/bightness. But apparently not adjustable contrast/brightness when used with MAC (as I was informed by the support at AOC). But still, quite OK readability, even though the contrast might be better.

review_title: Great little monitor for a good price
review_body: This thing is great.  It comes with a nice neoprene travel pouch so it is easy to move around.  it is light enough to take with you.  I am a developer and take it between work as needed.  i tend to use it to check JavaScript and HTML that i am developing, so i can have my code on 2 monitors and make sure that i didn't break the webpage as I code.  I am not sure that it would work well with things that had a high refresh rate.  i noticed YouTube videos were not totally smooth but the montir was plugged into USB 2.0 at the time.  Video may be smooth using USB 3.0

I can certainly appreciate the utility of this product as a laptop screen extender. It's pretty light and the setup was easy after everyone's help locating the DisplayLink software. After that it's pretty much plug and play. But I tried to use it as a secondary screen on a 21.5 inch iMac. The AOC screen is painfully bright, eye searingly so, and you really can only change this by adjusting the angle of the screen. It's a shame that there are no other screen adjustment control (you also can't calibrate it easily, should you want to do this).

review_title: Works for me, although less than wonderful on a Mac
review_body: Works well as portable second screen for software development, on Mac MBP with OS X 10.10.3 and Win7 in virtual machine.  Driver for Mac is limited; it does not give a brightness control, and although it does not support auto-rotate, you can change between portrait and landscape by the rotation control (Standard for landscape, 270 for portrait) on display preferences.  Default brightness is adequate, although next to Mac Retina display it looks washed out.

If you have to travel with your laptop and need that extra screen space, this is the ticket.  Works great!  Make sure you install the software first, otherwise it will not work.  It's nice having dual screens when you are away from your desktop docking station.
Trouble finding mac drivers? Google displaylink osx usb, click the link that says "DisplayLink USB Graphics Software for Mac OS X"
Arrived in 2 days in perfect condition.  Easily installed and set up.  Very pleased with this monitor.

Couldn't believe the deal on this. Pairs well with my Surface Book even though the Surface Book doesn't scale well on a second monitor with some apps. The monitor itself is totally worth the money. I'm very happy! I wouldn't suggest for a premier second monitor but for work, school work and some light gaming it is great.
Very affordable and produces a nice looking image. This is not new LED technology, but what the heck.

When my Dell finally bit the dust, I chose this one.  It certainly performs well and I use it daily.  The non-glare screen makes it easy to read even with several lights on nearby.  Bright and full-color display.  The only border wider than 1/4" is the bottom.  It almost disappears when lit up.
I've been using this monitor for about 4 months and love it. I'm using this as a monitor with my notebook computer and it's perfect for my work as a photographer, editing photos.

review_title: Nice monitor, wish I paid attn
review_body: Nice monitor, wish I paid attn. to aspect ratio though was expecting 16:9 this is wider and not as high
I've had this monitor for 6 months, and so far it's worked great. You're not going to find a better monitor at this price. The colors look great, and the IPS screen has a nice and wide viewing angle.
Picture is great!!  I️ knew it was a great monitor when after setting it up the IT tech called the other IT techs to take s look at how nice it was, and what a good price I️ got it at.
Dead out of the box.  Return was easy, but being a present, we had to go to a - gasp - brick and mortar store to replace it days before Christmas.
This puppy is beautiful! I know that I have the best looking monitor in the office. The blue light filtering is THE BEST feature as it reduces eye fatigue.  Best monitor I have ever had.

review_title: Well worth the purchase. High quality F A S T image rendering.
review_body: As noted by previous reviewers in game display may appear washed out, blacks appearing more gray than black. Image quality however once on screen display is adjusted can be acceptable. At 1ms this display unit shows zer0 ghosting/trailing. This unit for myself was utilized in a Win 10 environment, windows detects as a plug n play generic monitor (not Ideal) but works out of the box. Others have complained about the base not feeling stable, I feel confident base is stable enough.

I bough one of these monitors about 4 years ago and loved it so I decided to buy two more to do a 3 monitor setup for gaming. I notice that my older model had a hue discoloration and after messing around with the settings I was able to get them close enough but not really. I ended up buying another new one to keep the scheme going so these are great except with the hue issue, so I would suggest buy all of them at the same time or if you have an older one buy one around that manufacture date. Other than that the monitors are great never had a flickering issue or dead pixels. I had mine currently for the last 2 years and I still have the old one but not with my current set up.

I think that this is a really wonderful monitor.  It has a really nice display, in my opinion the colors seem to be quite accurate.  Obviously being 23.6 inches it's quite substantial in size, which is also very nice.  At work I have two $500 hp 24 inch monitors, and comparing those to this one, I can't really find much of a difference in terms of the quality of the picture.  In fact, the profile of this one is slimmer than the hp ones (but it does lack the usb hub that those include, so it's not really a fair comparison).

review_title: Despite its super high contrast ratio
review_body: Despite its super high contrast ratio, I was unable to set up this monitor to my liking - everything just looks washed out (my browser looks off-white and the text looks grey instead of black). Also, the stand is terrible - the screen sits at a slight angle (the right side is tilted down slightly) and it keeps wobbling back and forth as I type this. The base is a fingerprint and dust magnet; I have a lamp with a similar glossy black base and it's not nearly as bad looking (I've had the lamp for months and just got the monitor last week). I suppose with a lot of fine tuning and a new stand (another $35 at least) the monitor would be workable, but I decided to get something simpler instead.

I was researching a 25" or better monitor for my PC and this one has had some great reviews both on AMAZON and elsewhere. Once it arrived I was amazed how lightweight the monitor is, and once connected to my HD6870 via HDMI I was blown away with the brightness and clarity of the picture! I play Star Wars The Old Republic and the graphics are flawless - no shadowing or any other effects - the monitor arrived with zero dead or misfiring pixels. If I had the money to buy 2 more I would have a full 3 monitor system with these - ASUS knocked this one OUT OF THE PARK!

Overall, not very impressed.  This is the 2nd ASUS monitor I have, I have the VE228  as well in a dual monitor display.  The colors on this monitor suck, plain and simple.  Every time I sit down I think it looks too red, too washed out, too green after I adjust the red, the colors are not consistent at all, and the brightness suffers because of it.  Meanwhile, the other ASUS monitor I have that's 3 years old is exactly what I wanted this one to be.

review_title: Fantastic monitor, warranty policies at ASUS need work
review_body: This monitor is great! Out of the box the settings are ok, but with a bit of tweaking in "Theatre Mode" this monitor really shines. The colors are vibrant and clear and the response time is fantastic playing PC games. It fit perfect on my desk but if you could adjust the height it would be a big plus. Not having a height adjustment isn't a big hit on this monitor though.

review_title: An inexpensive, brilliant display for gaming
review_body: My wife and I got two of these screens a few months ago, to use as docking screens for our two Lenovo Y510P laptops. We needed a screen that would take our laptops to the next level when at home (where they are connected with keyboards, logitech mice, sound system and so forth). This screen fits the bill completely, and at a price that is so far unmatched for the performance.
This is a good monitor for the price.

review_title: Pretty good...just a couple things wrong...
review_body: All-around, this is a pretty good monitor. The picture is great and I love the different pre-sets. I also like that it has physical buttons along the bottom, so I don't bump them all the time, unlike the touch-buttons on my old monitor. I give it 4-stars for a couple of reasons...and perhaps I'm being a bit generous, I don't know. The first reason is, when it came out of the box. the top panel above the screen was loose and wobbled. It worried me a tiny bit at first, but now it's just become something I'm used to. The second reason is more what takes away the star. Within 2-3 days of having the monitor, the headphone jack moved around or broke inside so that you can't plug anything in there anymore. Very disappointing from a brand I've grown to trust over the years. As for the headphone jack, I just use the one on my computer and am fine with that :)
The took a picture of the delivery.

review_title: good for everyday use not for intense graphic, thin and portable
review_body: my window 8 Samsung laptop works well with this on USB3.  It is  just plug and play.  This thing draws power a bit so I had to plug in directly can't go through an usb expansion hub else the hub has to be self power to have enough juice to power this device with one USB for screen display and one usb for power.  All in all it does the job and very easy to use.  No brightness/dim adjustment, no sound (have to use your own laptop sound).  The color is a bit bright and wash out but I am not using it for graphics just simple everyday stuff.  It is very portable thin with easy adjustable stand. For the price it is well worth it.

I have had this screen for just about 2 years to the day. The product is made a bit flimsy but it is nice, lightweight and works the way it was intended. I have traveled with this and back and forth to work with it and never had an issue. Today I was using it, went to open a window and accidentally knocked it over on the table and the screen cracked! i bought it 10/14/14 and it broke 10/8/16. So its out of warranty and broken. I am not complaining because it is a good unit. I would just recommend better protection for the screen. I am surprised it hasn't broken sooner. But I would recommend, just handle with care.

review_title: Good portable monitor for Windows 7 laptops
review_body: Good portable monitor for the price for my work computer with Windows 7.  Can not find a driver for another computer with Windows 10 and the AOC website is pretty useless for this.  I found it to be a bit cryptic with respect to downloads.  It is easy to get to the monitor's manual and some advertisements but that seemed to be the extent.  Good resolution and view on the monitor.  It turns a laptop screen into a work station so that I can now easily use and create spreadsheets, illustrations, and presentations.  It slides into it's case and fits in my back back.

It's fickle getting it to work, and the screen has a constant buzzing to it.  Thankfully I only use it at my home office 1-2 days a week for a second screen.  If I needed a dual monitor setup with this thing every day I think the buzzing would make me crazy, and the periodic disconnects would make me smash the thing.

review_title: I took it on one trip and the resolution from my Macbook Pro 15 was poor, not as good as the primary display by ...
review_body: I returned this unit....very rare for me to return anything. I took it on one trip and the resolution from my Macbook Pro 15 was poor, not as good as the primary display by a long shot. And then it froze and stopped working, so rather than reboot/troubleshoot I just gave up as the reward was not worth the effort. Nice portable package, the addition of the sleeve and the cable is nice, no problem finding drivers to download and it all came up easily. My requirements are just a little tougher than what this unit can provide so I'm going to invest in a proper secondary HDMI LCD panel for travel.

review_title: Forget installing a video card for dual monitors - this is the total ticket!!
review_body: This AOC / USB powered monitor is GREAT!! After installing the included software driver, all you do is plug it in to your USB and instantly you now have dual monitors!  No more installing a second video card or a newer card that outputs to dual monitors. This works with desktop PC's and laptops. My wife uses this every day and she is an IT pro working in the healthcare profession. She plugs this into her laptop so she can have more screen space for applications. She has used this for six months without any problems whatsoever. I highly recommend this for anyone that wants or needs to extend their desktop to a second monitor.

review_title: Had to return but not due to product defect
review_body: My laptop (a Lenovo T440p) lost its screen imaging (blank screen when powered on).  I was hoping that this would be a suitable substitute until I either repaired or replaced the laptop.  Unfortunately, I was not able to get an image on this remote monitor, which suggests that the video card is fried in the laptop; no reflection on the remote monitor.
Turns on, then off.... cannot get it to stay on for more than a flicker. Looking for a new monitor now with my iPad as I can’t use computer.

review_title: This is a great Monitor for travelling
review_body: This is a great Monitor for travelling.  It took a bit to get the software correctly loaded but once that was done, it worked like a charm.

Great monitor for the price. The thin bevel design is really great, gives the screen a lot of pop. Yes there is some bleeding, but it is not very noticeable. The IPS is fantastic, and the brightness levels are more than sufficient. As someone who uses solidworks a lot on their laptop, this monitor has been a significant asset.

review_title: Good monitor, but no mounting holes for swing arms
review_body: I was irritated with this monitor because I had to spend another $30 on an adapter so I could use my dual-monitor arms instead of the default stand.  It works fine and looks great, but those mounting holes should be standard on all monitors.

Cant believe how great they are the Matt Screen and border-less edges!!!! The colors are rich and blacks are crisp! They are a vast improvement to my Vizio and the fact that they are fairly priced it was an easy buy for me. I would recommed this to anyone looking to get a secondary or even primary monitor heck even both. It works find and have yet to have any issues.

I bought 3 of these and they look great next to each other. It has a VGA, HDMI and DVI but no display port. but that's ok my card doesn't support display port. There are adaptors for that when that comes up in the future. Monitor is a very good buy and so happy I chose this brand. Display is great for amazon prime videos and hd movies as well. Highly recommend it
Purchased to replace a similar Acer monitor that lasted seven years with constant, 24/7 use.  Happy with product, but base of monitor required some assembly which I wasn't expecting.

review_title: Best value for the money in "budget" monitors
review_body: Even though a family member already had two of these monitors (so I had seen they were quality firsthand), I did a lot of research prior to buying one for myself, when I had to replace a monitor that died on me.  This came out to be the best quality for my budget (without jumping up to the $300+ monitors) - IPS was important to me and the color quality doesn't disappoint.  The frame is very thin on the sides which makes it easy to have a multiple-screen setup with a few of these monitors.

review_title: Price makes it a good buy
review_body: Not the best monitor I've seen, but for the price it's well worth it.  Just a few years ago I never thought it would be possible to find a 24" flat, hi-def computer monitor in this price range.  No complaints.

review_title: I bought two and one of them works like a dream and the other has problems when I ...
review_body: I bought two and one of them works like a dream and the other has problems when I start it up. I changing the power and hdmi cable and it still has trouble.

review_title: ... have 2 of these monitors and they are really nice. Big and bright screens
review_body: I have 2 of these monitors and they are really nice. Big and bright screens. Now I don't do any online gaming or anything, mostly web surfing and work stuff. But I would buy again. Great value for really good product.

This screen met every expectation I had. It provide exactly the maximum size I could accommodate and has the smallest trim edge I've ever seen in an economical monitor. Well balanced and sized. I couldn't be ahppier.

This monitor seems to be manufactured by different companies even though they have the same ASUS branding and model number. I ordered two of these monitors and one had the colors spot on with those on my laptop display while the other had washed out colors and reds appeared orange. I couldn't fix the washed out colors with any of the settings provided by the monitor nor manually changing the RGB parameters on the monitor and my NVIDIA settings. I promptly decided I couldn't deal with that and I returned the monitor with the washed out colors and received another one without any hassle. Amazon was great at sending me another monitor as fast as possible without any gimmicks. The two monitors I have now are great and colors are the same. I noted differences between the two monitors with the same model number. I will describe the good monitor first and the bad monitor second. The images will also be in the same order.

review_title: Underwhelming and clunky... Like a monitor from 2009
review_body: This monitor operates more like a TV than a monitor. The screen settings are near impossible to get right to see text well, and the way they offer the settings to change views lock certain settings from being able to be edited... It makes it VERY hard to get the colors right, as well as make sure text is clear in games or other uses.

review_title: Sensational Monitor For Gaming and Movie Watching
review_body: I couldn't be more happy with this purchase. This was an upgrade from a Vizio 22' t.v. I had laying around which I initially was using as an "in between" monitor after my old one died. I ended up using the Vizio until I found something I felt comfortable dropping money on. After researching, I went with this model.

This is my first ever widescreen monitor, so factor that into my enthusiasm. This monitor is actually wider than my keyboard. The colors are sharp and clear and I feel like I could work comfortably from across the room. I know that this is far from the largest or finest monitor available - but this one cost less than $140! What we're talking about here is VALUE - and I feel like I got a lot of bang for my buck.

review_title: Inconsistent and Splotchy Backlight Ruin an Otherwise Good Monitor
review_body: Colors on the monitor look great...but the backlight is super inconsistent and splotchy. I uploaded a photo of a white screen...and the lack of consistency is super noticeable on all websites with white backgrounds. Hopefully just a lemon, but something to look for.

review_title: Great, but a little wobbly! Works for MacBooks.
review_body: I bought this as an external display for my macbook, and I'm happy to report that this monitor works fantastically. :D

review_title: The colors on this monitor are not good
review_body: I bought this as a second monitor even though my first one is an Acer. I am returning it due to the color on this monitor being extremely annoying. When using these monitors in a dual setup, this one looks yellow compared to the Acer I originally owned. I googled around and played in the menus for probably an hour adjusting every color setting possible and it still looked like the whole screen had a yellow tint to it. I hope that it's just my display that looks like this and not every one that is shipped.

review_title: If you're coming from a Retina Macbook and you are on a budget, this more than works.
review_body: I just received this monitor today, and will update if anything chances. But I wanted to quickly write for people that, like me, have a 13" rMBP and where on the fence because of the awesome quality of Retina Displays. I can attest that, while of course not as good as the screen on your macbook, this is a pretty good looking screen quality-wise, so you won't feel like coming back to a non-HD screen. I'm using my Macbook in Clamshell mode and can't really say I miss Retina, and the jump in size is oh so worth it.

review_title: This Purchase Was Long Thought Out
review_body: I must have read every customer review of at least fifty to sixty monitors, both from here on Amazon, and several other online retailers, before hesitatingly ordering this one (VS247H-P). I say "hesitatingly", because a monitor is (or can be) a very scary thing to order. What with all of the horror stories about "dead pixels", and "stuck pixels". I was very scared to order any monitor online. But, living in a rural area inconveniently located far from any brick and mortar electronics retailers, I chose this route for convenience, and a fair price. I was not disappointed!

Very easy to put together and hook up, very happy with the size.  However I had to take off a star because of it's brightness.  I have my desk under a loft bed so it's very dark, and this screen is extremely bright.  I turned down the setting to 0 brightness, put it in theater mode, messed with other contrast/saturation/color settings, but it's still a lot brighter than what I'm used to.  Maybe once I get lighting under my loft bed it'll make a difference.  So basically if you're in a constant dark environment, it will be very bright.

Was a little leery about a budget monitor, but I took a chance and so far I'm very impressed. I have this set up in my office mainly for work with an extended desktop screen. Hooked up one through vga and one through dvi and the picture is pretty damn clear.

review_title: Great monitor for a budget oriented buyer
review_body: Great monitor for a budget oriented buyer. Eventually I will get something a lot bigger and more expensive but for now this one does the job. Colors are pretty good, a little on warmer side.
An excellent monitor for a great price! It is nice and large so that I may have multiple things open at one time, making work a great deal easier. Highly recommended.

review_title: Good monitor if you don't want to mount
review_body: Love these monitors.  Great resolution, nice form factor.  Only quibble is that they are not VESA compliant but you can buy an adapter.

review_title: image quality, build quality, dead pixel, backlight bleed
review_body: Pros:

review_title: Good monitor, but not mind-blowing. Read for perspective of someone going from a Dell 1080p LCD from 2010
review_body: Good, but not fantastic.

review_title: Very nice monitor for the price
review_body: Very nice monitor for the price. The only thing I can nit-pick is the screen adjustment buttons, which are not too user friendly.  Still, after a while, I got the screen set-up for my tastes, and I am quite satisfied.  It works well in the HDMI mode.  I would recommend it.

review_title: Make sure you have a VGA port or buy an HDMI
review_body: I like the monitor, it fulfills its intended function.  But, I wish that I had known that it only comes with a VGA cable, not an HDMI.  If I had know that I would have ordered an HDMI at the same time. It is easily remedied, but requires an additional purchase.
This monitor is exactly what I needed. It is easy to set up, basically plug and play.The picture is clear.
Great monitor for the price. I wish back-light could be dimmed more, but other than that this thing works great!

review_title: Not Compatible with HP Laptop and no install driver available online
review_body: I received this monitor and it is thin and lightweight.
I was excited to purchase a USB powered monitor and not have to deal with all the different cords.  I purchased the monitor a little over a year ago.

review_title: The idea is AWESOME. When it works it is AWESOME
review_body: This is my second AOC Monitor. My prior monitor screen broke during trial when I dropped it (attorneys will understand).

When it did work, it looked very clear. But the driver that operated crashed every 3 minutes, the screen would freeze, it would cause my graphics drivers to crash, if I was in a video game it would freeze it, until the drivers for the monitor reset, then everything would come back fine. The drivers/program that operates it is called displaylink, and it is quite honestly the most terrible software I have ever dealt with. It took me about 2 hours just to get the screen to be detected, apparently you have to download a displaylink full registry cleaner, run it. Then  leave the monitor disconnected while you install the drivers. Then reset the pc, then once it's back on, plug in the monitor and pray that it comes on and if not, repeat process. I was tired of it crashing all my other drivers. It's a cool idea but it really needs better software to manage it.

review_title: Perfect for Use with a Mac Mini
review_body: I have been using a Mac Mini as my desktop computer, but when it became obvious I would be traveling more, I had a choice: buy a brand new laptop or purchase a portable monitor. I went the portable monitor route and couldn't be happier. It's incredibly light and fits perfect into my Caselgic laptop case (http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B000EIXX52/). Yes, the USB port is in a slightly inconvenient place, but that's a very minor quibble. There is no brightness control, but I haven't really needed it. I have only had one program that I have been unable to use with it -- Screenflow 4 -- because it require the GPU. Otherwise, it's been great.

review_title: Works so well for my portable system, it ought to have a personal name!
review_body: I am using the AOC e1659Fwu 16-Inch USB-Powered Portable LCD Monitor (Latest Version) monitor with my ACER ASPIRE ONE 722-0427 net book which has an 11.6" screen with a native resolution of 1366X768. This computer has three usb 2.0 ports. I loaded the drivers as recommended in the online manual (I recommend you download this manual from AOC before you make a purchase to familiarize yourself with the features and the download process). During the download and installation of the drivers pauses or apparent "final points" in the installation should not distract you. Just make a cup of tea and listen to a recorded book. I did not time it but I would guess the entire process took about 20 minutes so. Do not become anxious or impatient. Just sip tea for half an hour. When you reach a pause or or apparent end point in the process, wait a couple of minutes before taking action.

review_title: More value than the actual cost!
review_body: Now I gave this 5 stars because it fits the bill so well and so affordably.  I use it for a Mac mini for a portable music playback system.  It is not a HD display and there are very few things you can change about the display but consider what you are buying.  I'll be buying another for a similar system.  Download the drivers cuz it doesn't just plug and play (for me anyway on OSX 10.10.7)

review_title: Great image quality, works perfectly on my MacBook Pro 13.
review_body: Works perfectly on my MacBook Pro 13 out from the box. Image quality is awesome and using the cover as a stand is a plus. When the cover is actually covering the screen, don't expect it to stay put. The magnets will keep it on place, but in a back pack it tends to shift a bit.

I needed a portable monitor so that I can switch it around easily to work with my laptop. This fits the bill. Works fine with Windows 10 on an HP laptop. You do need two USB outlets for it (at least I do) but that's not a big deal.  Very easy to set up, just plug it in.  easy to use as well.  Pleasantly pleased.

review_title: but the replacement monitor was just as bad (According to Support cannot adjust)
review_body: Blue, blue the screen is blue

review_title: DO NOT BUY. Switches video presets and covers screen.
review_body: I ordered this monitor three maybe four months ago, and it was working well. After that time however it began randomly switching through visual presets. I tried factory resetting and power cycling and even as I type this it is still switching between modes with a message covering the center of the screen. After a quick google search I found that others have experienced this problem as well and that ASUS customer support was no help, even after sending in for warranty maintenance they still had the issue. DO NOT BUY this monitor unless you want something to keep dust off your desk at around $100.

This monitor has been a definite improvement for me.  My previous monitor was adequate, but I had a great deal of difficulty reading text with it when the text was small or had a thin font.  This monitor's text is very legible for my eyes and the colors a rich and well saturated.  I don't notice any unevenness anywhere on the screen.  Overall, I'm very satisfied with the quality of the monitor and the price.

review_title: Item from Amazon Warehouse is Like New
review_body: I have an Asus 24" monitor already and wanted to add a 2nd so that I could have dual screen display for work. So I saw this item listed on the Amazon Marketplace as "Like New" at a decent used price sold directly by Amazon Warehouse. So I decided to take the chance and ordered it. It arrived on time and the monitor was still covered in the plastic that protects the bezel so it does look brand new. My only complaint is that the base comes in 2 pieces held together by one screw. When the monitor arrived, I noticed at the screw was missing so I couldn't put the base together to set the my monitor up on my desk. Though not really that big of a deal because I went to the local hardware store and got a Metric screw to replace for like $0.50, it was still pretty inconvenient of Amazon to ship me the monitor and forget the screw. So 4 stars instead of 5. So far the monitor is working as designed. No dead pixels and it matches my older 24" monitor very well despite the fact they're different model numbers.

I purchased this monitor in October 2014. From the beginning, there were blurred pixels, but it was bearable, and it was too much trouble to return the monitor. After about a year of use, a solid gray arc began to appear along the bottom of the screen. The gray space has slowly grown to include gray bars and circles all over the screen, making it unusable. I don't like that I need to buy a new monitor so quickly, not only because of the cost, but now this is another electronic device added to the junk heap.

review_title: Good price, but almost an extreme amount of light bleed.
review_body: I purchased this monitor as part of a shift at home from laptop computing to desktop, and this allowed me to move from one monitor to two. This monitor was being added onto a Dell S2409W that I had purchased several years prior.

After reading the reviews, I went ahead and bought this monitor for my Late 2013 13" Mac Book Pro. Currently, the monitor is setup with the HDMI feature, I had a cable and hooked it up to the computer. This leads me to explain why I gave the monitor three stars. The DVI port on the monitor is broken, and it will not work at all with my computer. This doesn't bother me, as my current setup wouldn't use it, but if I did want to use the monitor with the DVI port, I wouldn't be able to.

review_title: Good for regular usage, not so good for gaming
review_body: For average usage like my college work the monitor does great and video editing it does a fantastic job, has great color to it and overall a good monitor. But while playing games it has issues, for example when i play Counter Strike the monitor lags. When i switch to my older HP 6ms 1440 screen there is no lagging. So either my monitor is messed up or this is not a good gaming monitor. What i man by lagging is that when just walking in CSGO it doesn't have good fluency when seeing an enemy it is very hard to zone in on them because it gets choppy.

I bought this HDMI Monitor to replace our old VGA monitor when we upgraded to a new mac mini. The picture is sharp and the colors are bright. The stand can adjust tilt, but not rotation, which is fine in our case. The settings are handy and the menu is simple to navigate. The sound is nice and clear. We have not had any connection issues, even when we have used it to connect to our BluRay player, PS3, apple TV, and WiiU. The only drawback is because its black, it does collect a noticeable amount of dust almost instantly. Otherwise, this is a great purchase, and well priced!

This Asus VS247H-P 24-Inch Full-HD LED-Lit Monitor  is truly plug and play.  There was nothing required to set it up other than plug it in to the computer.  There were no dead pixels or problems of that sort. The screen is nice and big and bright.  It was well packaged and delivered very quickly.

For the money, this is an excellent HD monitor. Great resolution and clear picture. It lacks vertical height adjustment but a thick book solves that. The adjustment buttons are not friendly but once everything is adjusted, you don't need them. Delivery was quick and the display is quite satisfactory.

review_title: Excellent monitor! Perfect brightness in 'Standard' mode
review_body: Excellent monitor! Perfect brightness in 'Standard' mode. Very good color representation. Extremely thin bezel, great viewing experience. 'Circle' stand is pretty cool/unique too. I've owned a number of Acer monitors before, they rarely disappoint. Highly recommended.
Not as bright and bright as I expected. Tiny fonts that I have not been able to increase in size.

Bought as a portable monitor to connect to my laptop when on the road for a 2-monitor system. Using a small wireless keyboard in front of the monitor so it works like a desktop, and the laptop monitor becomes the backup. The monitor and power supply are both light weight and this has been rugged so far.

review_title: It's an alright monitor for the price. The blacks ...
review_body: It's an alright monitor for the price.  The blacks are a bit gray when compared to others, and the screen seems to "tear" when it doesn't on some others I have.  Still, I'd say it was well worth the price.

These are great monitors super sleek looking and the picture is fantastic. There is no "blue hue" like some people complain, there is a setting that can turn this off. My only gripes are that it does not adjust height wise only tilt and you cannot mount them. Otherwise they are excellent monitors.
A little too much light bleed.
this is a good cheap computer monitor , thin bezels great screen what more could you ask for ....

review_title: Good company and good product but human error again seems to of been a problem.
review_body: Actually arrived with small dent on side of screen seems to of veen mishandled otherwise great product. By a great company

review_title: It's okay. It's a monitor and it works.
review_body: It had a yellow hue to it that eventually cleared up or I just adapted to. Also no matter how hard I tried the stand wouldn't quite lock in place. It is close and it's far enough back I'm not worried about it but still.

It's a good value. Good picture, but not great. Clearly not a gaming or high graphics monitor. It has good port options. It does have some minor issues, like having to scan through all the inputs again whenever my machine wakes up; but that's what you pay for.

review_title: Excellent Product. Excellent Warranty Support! ...Buy a hard sided case.
review_body: I purchased this monitor and for the most part have been extremely pleased.  Function and picture resolution was fine and it worked well.  Light weight and easy to use.  However,  even though I kept it in the carrying case provided and carried it in a padded bag designed for computer equipment, after only using it 4 times when I went to use it there was a small crack in the display and it no longer worked.  I contacted AOC and Romeo in the warranty department was very helpful and after a few emails was able to provide a replacement unit for me.  I highly recommend this unit and my son just purchased one as well for his CAD classes in college.  A word to the wise, buy a hard sided case if you are going to be travelling with it.

This is an outstanding device for the "road warrior".  I spend about 50% of my time on the road, working in the hotel at night.  At my office I have two more monitors which I've become very used to.  Now, in the hotel, I can have a second monitor which simplifies my tasks.

Honesty, I love this, took a little to figure out how to get the screen up since I found no directions in my box, but I am very happy with this purchase. It allows me to extend my screen outside of my dorm room and in my class room, not to mention the fact that the screen is super light weight, has good reception using my weaker usb ports and has beautiful graphic quality for my needs. Love it so much I bought a second, now I can have a good set up while working on my different assignments for class, no more delays due to insufficient screen space when shuffling through file folders or reference images.

Installation could be difficult for those who do not know how to manually find and run set-up. The greatest disappointment, 5 days in, is the male usb cord not staying in position. The screen will go black in a matter of seconds due to loss of connectivy and you have to hold it in just the right position to make it work. Is this functional? Not at all. They need to figure out the connectivity issues. With that being said, I have ordered another usb for $5+ to see if that will make it functional. If it doesn't work, I will return this screen and try the latest ASUS USB monitor.

My in job I have recently started traveling more often.  I normally use 2 monitors at my office, so I wanted to see what I could take with me on the road.  I have been very happy with the purchase of this monitor.  I think the biggest downside is that the resolution is quite low compared to the modern laptop today, but I have used it for videos and e-mail and all kinds of things and I have never had a problem with it.  I guess the other complaint that I have is that the sleeve that it comes with is REALLY tight, so it is a little hard to get in.  None of these are deal breakers, so I would highly recommend this item!

review_title: Do not buy if you have a Mac with the ...
review_body: Do not buy if you have a Mac with the latest MacOS, as it has issue with its current driver. I am still waiting for an update.
I didn't care for this.  Returned it.

The USB cord that connects the monitor to the laptop does not stay connected at the back of the monitor. The cord becomes loose and falls out.  I have only had this monitor for 3 months and it is just useless. This is the worst item I have ever bought from Amazon and the worst product experience.

I wanted to like this monitor but it just didn't work in my setup. I bought it to use as a second monitor in my home office. I also bought a mounting arm and mounted the monitor in portrait mode next to my main monitor.

review_title: After a couple months of occasional use, when I ...
review_body: After a couple months of occasional use, when I plug in the usb to my computer, the monitor doesn't work. I had to unplug, and plug back in a couple of times. If luckly, I made it work in my 5th or 6th trial. I think it might be a connection problem? Not sure, but surely not what I expected after 10 something uses.

review_title: Best value for size and functionality.
review_body: For the size and capabilities, these have been the best value in displays I have found. I have been replacing my users' old and failing displays with these for about 6 months now. Presently I have purchased and installed 20 of these displays and not one has had any issues. These are all being used in a business environment where clarity and picture quality are an important factor. These displays excel over any we have used in the past for color consistency, clarity, contrast and overall capabilities. Color consistency between displays is top notch as we have them installed 2-4 displays per user, it would be quite apparent if issues existed. Connectivity capabilities are robust and have performed flawlessly. These are now my 'go to' selection as we need to replace more displays, I regularly keep 2-4 in stock as spares ready to install as needed.
I bought this screen for my video editing computer, since I needed a good quality LED widescreen for working with Full HD footage.

I ordered two of these at the same time a while back. I've noticed now that one of them has a small white spot (usually only visible when viewing darker screen) on the bottom to the left of the Asus logo. The monitor that's messed up is what I use for my PS4 and occasionally a PC game. The other monitor I use equally as much but I use it for looking at everything while I'm streaming. I guess it's a 50/50 chance that you get a good one. I'll probably have to replace it soon because it's driving me crazy to see it every time a black loading screen comes up.

I have had this monitor for a year now and it works just as well as the day it came in. During that time I have had my tower and a subwoofer right next to it on my desk (along with 7 satelite speakers) and I have never seen an ounce of flicker or interference. No bleeding either. The computer and sub sit behind the monitor facing outwards so that all the wires are coiled between the three devices and the wall. Bathed in that mini electromagnetic vortex, the monitor still works perfectly, as it should. The colors are so incredibly vibrant that you might even want to tone them down a bit in the settings. When I hook up my laptop (14 inch Latitude E6420) and they sit next to each other in dual display mode, it makes the laptop screen look like a dusty old oil painting by comparison. The stand is indeed wobbly, so it will wobble a bit if you're a fiddler and you like to put your feet on your desk. It's never going to fall over, but it will dance slightly like a dashboard hula girl if you bump your desk.
I am coming off of an Acer 23 inch which I am now using as a 2nd monitor.

This is a double WOW!!  My old monitor was the very best available about 14 years ago but it had become less bright over time, I just did not realize how much.  I had purchased a new desktop a few months ago and thought it just must not produce a very bright screen, wrong!

After buying this and a dual monitor desk mount I but the monitor up hooked it up and set my pc to extended desktop. . . ten seconds later I was turning my old monitor off and switching back to single monitor (this one), the old monito was so dark and (even though it is 21") very small compared to the ASUS VS278Q-P.
Purchased 11/28/12. In use w/Samsung Series 3 Chromebox.
** Rebate received. Thank you ASUS customer service. **

review_title: Really big monitor for expansive workspace
review_body: I really like this monitor and 21.5 inch is very big and I hook it up with my Lenovo y580 laptop via VGA and using it for my graphic design, 3d digital creation, and video editing. I did notice that my Lenovo y580 has a blue tint and has vibrant colors because it's a glossy screen vs this matte screen LED asus monitor which was washed out and doesn't have the blue tint; I wonder which monitor has the correct color? This is going to be difficult if you're working in the print industry and accurate colors is a must.

Very nice monitor. Only issue I have with it is the lowest brightness setting is probably a cheap laptops highest setting so it can suck for night time use but the quality is great looks very slick in my studio and I will be buying another one!

My 3-year-old daughter jumped on it and it did not break.  Using right now with my MacBook Pro for a few months.  I use a HDMI to connect.  Great picture and really good price.  Quality is proven after surviving my daughter!

review_title: Awesome monitor, only comes with VGA adapter.
review_body: Picture quality is awesome.
Bright, clear and vibrant picture. Easy to assemble and connect to any device that connects either through HDMI or VGA. Highly recommend to anyone in need of a new monitor.

The monitor is amazing!! I couldn't be happier. It is the perfect 1080p gaming monitor, exilent picture and love the no glare would recommend this monitor to anyone wanting a nicely priced 1080p monitor

review_title: My eyes have adjusted but my Samsung 2220wm from 2007 had a better picture.
review_body: The screen works as it should. My only problem with it is that no matter what I do, playing with monitor settings or computer settings, there is always a gray tint to the picture. The white is too bright and the dark is too dark. None of the settings correct this (gamma, brightness, contrast, etc.). My eyes have adjusted but my Samsung 2220wm from 2007 had a better picture.

review_title: Two thumbs way up! Highly recommend!
review_body: I've had this monitor for a few months now and I absolutely love it! Vibrant colors,crisp HD & No screen glare. I use it almost daily to play my PlayStation 4 on which doesn't tie up my living room tv. Two thumbs way up! Highly recommend!

review_title: For the price I'm sure it's adequate. But if ...
review_body: For the price I'm sure it's adequate. But if you think you're getting a screen with clear resolution...this is not the one. I guess you'll have to spend another $100 or $200 more for a screen that doesn't appear blurry.
I've had two of these for about a year and I love them. Very bright, and I like that the stands are easily removable.

review_title: Just add it to your cart!
review_body: Looks much better than in the pictures - and a steal for the price. Has a nice matte finish w almost no bezel. Occupies little space on the desk, I had quite a few monitors before - dell 24", hp 23 x1, have a benq 24 at my work place - all good but this just looks the part; classy.
Disclaimer: I got this discounted through Amazon Warehouse deals.

review_title: Stand seems sturdy enough, I don't need any radical tilt settings
review_body: The image is sharp with no dead pixels.  Stand seems sturdy enough, I don't need any radical tilt settings.  Came with a vga and a dvi cable, nice touch.  I used the dvi cable be aware that has no sound is transmitted through that cable to the 3.5mm earphone jack on the back.  I believe only the  hdmi connection has sound.

I bought this for my recording studio computer as I needed something big so I could clearly read all the small buttons, dials and knobs that are shown onscreen. I've only had this monitor for two weeks, but so far it's really nice. I just plugged it in and my PC found the driver and off we went.

review_title: Beautiful monitors for the price (23.6" review)
review_body: I've had a dual-monitor setup running for a few years now, until one of them decided to not work anymore, so I was stuck with a small 14 inch monitor until I decided to take the plunge and go all the way and buy two of these so I could go back to a dual-monitor desktop and ditch my older monitor. These aren't the be-all, end-all of computer monitors, although they are very nice for the price. The colors are nicely represented (although there is still some color bleed in the darker color levels, mainly black, as is with most cheaper monitors) and can get very bright. They are very clear and both arrived with no dead or stuck pixels. I usually use one to play games and another to watch movies or tv shows at the same time and they work very well in that aspect. Games look great in 1080p on these monitors, and movies look great as well. I wouldn't expect 100% clarity or 100% accurate color representation but they work very well again, for the price I bought them at. The bezels are on the medium/larger size although I do like the style they give off. The stands do get dusty easily but are also very easy to clean off. They also take three or four seconds to wake up from sleep, but that doesn't bother me as I usually don't let my computer sleep very often. This works great as either a single or dual-monitor setup and is well worth the money.

I bought 3 of these monitors and noticed some inconsistencies. I bought my first in mid-2013, and noticed it had a purplish tint to it. I thought this was just the way the monitor was made so I ignored it. I bought my second recently, and immediately noticed that it looked very different compared to the older one. The color and brightness were much better in the second. Realizing that the monitors looked very different despite being the same model, I decided to purchase a 3rd to go along with the second, and give the first away to a family member. The color and brightness of the 3rd pretty much matched the 2nd, as expected, but unfortunately it came with a stuck pixel in a very noticeable place. So, out of 3 purchases, I got 1 monitor that I would recommend and 2 that I wouldn't.

Purchased 4 of these for a multi display to be use with my bucket list PC.  All units powered up immediately with no issues.  Have not connected to the PC as yet but I don't expect any problems.  Like the variety of connection possibilities.  I am using the HDMI ports so I could use the audio jacks on the monitors if I wanted.  If anything changes, I will update.
I love this monitor, so much that I am ordering another. I run dual monitors and this is by far better than the other LCD I have on my desk and by far the best clarity in a monitor I have ever seen.

While glossy screens tend to make images more vibrant, these are for a work from home set up. I was not building the room from scratch and desk position and overhead lighting were set. I bought these (2) specifically to minimize glare and reflections as I work on and from spreadsheets and other sources and file electronically. These are fantastic for multiple column spreadsheets and are even pretty good at displaying 4 half screen documents or websites on the dual monitor setup. The negatives are adjustability related and entirely off set by the price. At least in my case. Connection for VGA, DVI and HDMI makes set up a snap.

Bought three of these to use in an eyefinity set-up. Like most others, no dead or stuck pixels on any of them!!! Owned for about a month now and use them a few hours a day. I'm coming from an older version of this monitor and was glad to see the quality has been maintained since then. I found the stand to be sturdy. The bezels are pretty thin and I can't really notice them when playing games in eyefinity mode which is great. There is however one downside to these monitors as I've read in a few places, the "white wash" effect is really apparent. Whites are bright white and don't really show detail, so if your an intense gamer this could pose a problem. I don't mind too much seeing as these monitors are only $120-140 each.

review_title: even for a cheap monitor, this thing feels cheap.
review_body: I understand the reviews for a cheap monitor, but this thing is CHEAP!
I tried several monitors before this one, and this is by far the best.

review_title: but I couldn't get the auto-pivot feature to work even after installing the recommended drivers a few different times
review_body: The screen works okay as a second monitor, but I couldn't get the auto-pivot feature to work even after installing the recommended drivers a few different times. The monitor's brightness/contrast isn't quite what I prefer and I have also found no way to adjust it, even using the Screenbright app. AOC's manual and online documentation is not helpful at all. I am running Windows 10 Pro on a Macbook Pro, so maybe it's just me. I am a software engineer and tried to get this to work for 2 solid hours and finally gave up.

review_title: Not a bad product but not built to last
review_body: I purchased this about a year ago and it worked well for about 6 months. I like the portability, ok screen and the fact it rotated to portrait view which was handy for reviewing docs. Working with 2 screens is very efficient in drafting legal documents, reviewing materials and taking notes or working on accounting books and records.

I like this monitor. For people who want to travel with it, it's perfect. I bought it to supplement my desktop monitor. It sits on top of my corner desk next to my AOC e2243 Fwk. I'm going to get another one to go on the other side of my big monitor. I might even get two bigger ones. I don't like how it sits too low though. I'm going to mount it to the wall to where the top of it is level to the top of my big monitor. The USB cable is kind of short though. I have it plugged in to a USB 3.0 hub since my computer is on the floor. Works great!

review_title: Wonderful extra screen, great for travel, crummy stand.
review_body: After 4 months, I love this puppy. The cover is a great cover but a crummy stand - flops over easily - but I didn't buy it for the stand. Vibrant colors, sharp images. SO convenient for working hard while traveling. Adjustable screen brightness comes in handy. I'd make the same purchase again! Of note - drains my laptop battery fast, but as long as you can stay plugged in, you can work with this thing indefinitely.

review_title: Does Not Work With Macbook Pro
review_body: Does not work with my macbook pro. Yes, it's a fairly recent model, and yes, I installed the mac drivers from AOC's web site. The monitor receives enough power from the USB port to turn on, but is never detected by MacOS, and just shows a black screen after its power-on splash screen. I will be returning it.

review_title: Perfect mobile addition for dual screen addicts!
review_body: Fabulous option for mobile computing.  Took a couple of reboots to get everything installed and running correctly,  but perfect now.  I'm using Dell Latitude E65 20 USB 2.0 for connectivity (only need the one port)and it is working GREAT.  For Home Office,  I have laptop screen and secondary monitor - now have third screen to put chat and other apps.  Very pleased so far.  It is supposed to auto shift from landscape to portrait,  haven't figured that out but manual charge to that setting is very easy.

review_title: so it is pretty light. But decks and excels seem to be ...
review_body: This is just an OK screen. I've used it for a couple of months since I bought it. The picture is really grainy. I usually travel with it, so it is pretty light. But decks and excels seem to be stretched out a lot. Haven't had any issues with the screen cracking or anything. I do like that it came with a sleeve, which is pretty thick. Overall, if you're looking to just work off of it, as a second screen, I would recommend it.

review_title: Not stable out of the box; some legwork required
review_body: For me, the product wasn't stable right out of the box. It started up fine once plugged in, but mysteriously went black after an hour or so. A few extra steps were required...investigate USB controller's specifications and identify the appropriate update; install all the optional updates to Windows 7 (I didn't bother identifying the extraneous updates).  A bit more work than I hoped for but it seems to be stable now.

review_title: Works well for the bare bones purpose, but could be improved
review_body: I really wish that I could use something like my Retina iPad as a second monitor but there are no options on the market of that caliber. I considered using software that would allow me to use my iPad as a second monitor but all the issues of lag and underperformance led me to consider a USB portable monitor.
Price was right. Travel well in my roller case. However it was shipped without the HDMI 3 cable. Cables included did not work with my Lenovo laptop and new cables had to be purchased separately.

review_title: With great pricing comes a lack of accountability
review_body: First monitor I've tried after my two previous Dell U2412M monitors; have a nice, bright stuck pixel in the center of the monitor from the moment I plugged it in and the warranty says this is fine.  Maybe that's supposed to be typical, but I'm unimpressed and will go back to my Dell monitors next time.

review_title: Long term, what you may want to know?
review_body: I have had this product for two years and have not had any major complications. Every now and then, my LED back light will begin to present color strangely. This means that my webpages, videos, and pictures can still be viewed, but not in the original color. When this happens, I power off the monitor and power it back on. Then, my colors return to the original. I may have done this four times in the last two years. All in all, I still believe this is a good buy and perhaps it may be a part of the Blue Light Reduction feature on this monitor.

This monitor is really nice. I just got it today and the image didn't match up with the physical screen size! The manual told me nothing useful nor did the downloading the bigger online manual from Asus' website. PANIC!!!

review_title: Price is right and it does the job!
review_body: For $140, this is exactly what we needed. It gets five stars just for being affordable and working. Here's a couple nitpicky things I'm not crazy about:

review_title: No surprises, it's a simple monitor that just simply works. Love it!
review_body: So far so good. The image looks great, no dead pixels. The viewing angles are great, thanks to the IPS. Plus it has actual monitor buttons on the bottom, I love that. It has one of each: VGA/DVI/HDMI ports. It also has VESA mounting holes on the back too. No speakers built-in but those suck on just about every monitor anyways.

Recently purchased this monitor and very satisfied with the overall quality of the product. Using it currently with my development workstation station Dell Vostro 270, connected via HDMI cable (much more convenient than D-Sub or DVI-D).

I have absolutely no problems with this monitor. It replaced a seven year old one when I got a work at home job that required me to always have a working monitor. I figured the old one was about out of time so it was a good time to replace it even though it was still working. (It's now stashed as a spare should this one ever blink out on me.) It works fine, the image quality, color, and everything I need is fine.

review_title: first monitor in a while, great choice
review_body: So throughout highschool and college I've always used laptops. It was just easier to carry it around. Recently I built my own rig, and decided to pick up this monitor because of the price and the ratings. I don't have a ton of experience using lcd monitors but I can say this is a good one. There were no dead pixels upon arrival, and the colors are bright. I do use photoshop a lot to edit pictures and stuff and can see everything clearly. Mainly, I play games. Diablo III, Skyrim, Dishonored, Borderlands 2, Black Ops II all look beautiful on this monitor. Everything looks crisp. I don't have any issues with response or lag. 24" monitor is perfect for what I do everyday. As previous reviews have stated, the monitor can be shaky on the stand that is provided. However, if you have a solid desk that won't be constantly shaking upon every  movement then this isn't a problem AT ALL. I have a sturdy desk and my monitor doesn't move unless I accidently hit it while reaching around it. This is seriously worth the buy, and comparing to the monitors that my friends use, I think it's worth every penny.

I bought 2 of these for my computer, and also have an xbox hooked up to one. Out of the box these things are great. Very sharp, very bright, i had minimal leakage on the edges, not that i even notice. One thing though, that the colors are on the "cool" side, but you can adjust them to be warm, but i actually like the cool settings better. The input switching seems kinda crappy. When i had my dells, it auto switched from HDMI to DVI when i turned off my xbox, but these just go dark, so you have to manually switch back to DVI. I've been using these for a couple months now, and am really happy with them. The only downsides are no adjustable stand, and no usb on the monitors.. but hey.. i didn't buy these for those items, i bought it for having great resolution, and it has totally helped relieve eye strain. I also play halo 4 on these and it's fantastic. It's what most gaming venues use.

review_title: Black out flashes or black until power on and off
review_body: Blacked out or flashed on and off. Changed video drivers, changed monitor settings (Standard, graphics, movie). Slight improvement but still fails. Power off and back on would stops the problem for a few hours.
I love this screen.
So far amazing value and no back light bleed issues like I have seen from other people. Thin and light with a good stand for the price range. IPS panel brings nice colours and brightness
This is GREAT monitor; especially for the money.  I had purchased a ViewSonic VX2457-MHD 24" 2ms 1080p FreeSync for same price a week before and this Acer blows it away.  Friendly out of box too.
I use this as a second monitor for my MacBook Pro. I can't believe the quality for the price. I highly recommend this for office use.

review_title: otherwise they are very good screens!
review_body: screens work well only issue is they have no mounts on the back to attach to the brackets for a screen desk mount stand.  otherwise they are very good screens!
Ordered this for a second monitor and it has great resolution. easy set up.
I installed this for a friend with an older computer and it worked out great!
Let me start off by saying I love this monitor. The colors are vibrant and gorgeous, everything looks sharp and clean, and the thin bezels make it amazing looking.
My Raspberry Pi, Raspbian gui looks great on this monitor.  So much better than on a 8 year old Samsung Monitor/tv.  So glad I bought this Acer.

review_title: It fits nicely in my laptop bag and is pretty lightweight so ...
review_body: This monitor does what I need it to do for the price. Right out of the box it works with my work computer - no weird software or drivers to install. The sizing of the windows you're working in can be a little funky but I'm sure there is something you could tweak to fix this in the settings; it isn't a big deal so I haven't bothered with it yet.

review_title: Great on a PC for travel
review_body: Worked great for a year while I used my travel laptops and PCs. Connected to my new MacBook; it doesn't function. I downloaded the Displayport drivers as suggested but it is still not working. I get the logo flashing on the monitor and then a menu flashing on the laptop but no amount of reloading/restarting has worked-anyone else?
Pros:

review_title: Great monitor, but not a fan of the soft ...
review_body: Great monitor, but not a fan of the soft shell stand. I ended up buying a 3rd party stand for the monitor. Would also be nice if there were mounting features on the monitor.

I have a mac, and getting this to work is VERY roundabout.  No brightness or color control software available, so its stuck at its native settings.  To use the software, you have to install via the CD (Most apple products no longer read cds...) or open an EXE file, which macs can't do.  Will change my review if the company responds with a logical and simple way to fix this. Hoping they do, because it seems to have promise. Otherwise don't say mac compatible when macs can't function with it!

review_title: A must have for dual monitor functionality on the go!
review_body: Great second monitor for when I go onsite with clients or just want to work from somewhere else. Screen quality is not the best but it gets the job done. It comes with a carrying case which is great. This is going to be a lifesaver as I cannot work with just one monitor. I am using this with my Dell insporion laptop.

review_title: I love it! I work from home sometimes
review_body: I love it!  I work from home sometimes, mostly in  spreadsheets, and after using two monitors at the office, I had to get a 2nd for home.  My daughter who is very tech savvy said she wants one now because this AOC e1659Fwu is better than the one she is using.  Totally worth $90

review_title: I have been waiting for a monitor like this for awhile
review_body: I have been waiting for a monitor like this for awhile. Middle tier, great for mobile editing and gaming, or for casual browsing without needing to bust out the whole laptop. The AOC 17 inch runs at 1600x900 resolution, which is perfect for 720p gaming,  utilizing the extra screen for non-preview workflow, or sitting back and watching a movie while this rests on your lap. There is only one stipulation that follows when purchasing this, and it's very minor. Be sure to purchase a USB 3.0 extension cord for the extra length scaled to your preference. You will need the extra length. ENjoy it if you are strongly considering purchasing. It is worth the investment.

review_title: Extra Monitor & Real estate for your laptop and work
review_body: Awesome product once you get it to work.  It took me a little while to get it working, but awesome once it works.  I am using it now.  Love the size and quality.  It just does not work smoothly on the set up.  Took me 3 hours to get it working with IT support.  Not a problem now...love it for work travel and working with the customer now.  I would buy it again, maybe have two to increase real estate if I had another port to plug it into. I wish I could just plug another one into this one since I have no more USB ports.  It does not work when the laptop is not on AC power for some reason.

review_title: Nice second display for my laptop.
review_body: Nice second display for my laptop. I use this pretty much every weekday, and sometimes on weekends. I plug this into a USB 3.0 port and the output is good. I wish the output was a little higher resolution, but given that I don't have to have a separate power supply, I'll live with it as it is. The kickstand works well. The monitor can be rotated to get to portrait mode - for those long documents you really don't want to read. I've been using this for three or four months so far without any issues.

review_title: Awesome, Awesome, Awesome, Affordable IPS Monitor
review_body: Wow I am very please with these monitors.  I purchase 2 of these together and I could not be more happy.  I am not a graphic designer or a gamer so i cannot help in that department but i scan say these are wonderfully clear an crisp viewing monitors and the colors match perfectly.  I agree with some of the reviews that out of the box they are way too bright.  I have them set on the sRGB option and I love the look for typical working.  I do a lot of autocad and revit drafting and I do not feel any eye fatigue after a long day of work.  I am very glad i went for the IPS panel.  My brother got some 24" TN panels for a little cheaper and they do not even compare to these.  The viewing angle are incredible which is great when others are viewing the screen either standing or sitting from the side.  I do wish the plugs had a slight angle down or something because I have them really close to the wall but that is a very minor detail.  I am very happy with this purchase and hopefully these will last me a long time.  Thanks ASUS for making an affordable IPS

review_title: Decent monitor at a great price.
review_body: It looks great on my desk, and works nicely for anything from word processing and web browsing to 3D modeling (Blender FTW) to Kerbal Space Program.

review_title: The best step below a 4K, G-Sync or 144Hz display
review_body: These obviously do not have the latest bells and whistles like newer top-end displays, just the regular 1080p @ 60Hz. However the color production is excellent, and the pricing is fantastic. This is probably the best get if you want prototypical 1080p monitor and am not looking to spend lots of cash, but pretty soon these will be obsolete as 4K, G-Sync compatible and 144Hz monitors become cheaper. But for now, these are the best buy for 1080p at 23".

review_title: They work just fine. The only issue is that they will not ...
review_body: We buy several of these monitors as a "second" monitor for our laptop employees. We use Apple laptops so we're using an HDMI to Thunderbolt cable. They work just fine. The only issue is that they will not automatically recognize that the input is HDMI so you have to make the selection via the button on the monitor, and you have to slightly press and hold the button to get the selection mode. Good video quality, decent size, reasonable price point.

a year ago i bought an Asus ml series monitor and it was amazing quality, the vs series is even better! everything is really bright, crisp and clear, i do however have to turn down the brightness if i plan on using it for extended periods of time. my main uses for this monitor is gaming and multimedia, the pc version of borderlands 2 looks stunning on it, better quality picture than all of my friends' monitors.  the design is quite attractive, sturdy and noninvasive and fits in well with my other equipment.  port selection was a key feature i was looking for as i use dvi, hdmi and vga frequently. extremely fast shipping, within 20 hours after order it was on my door step. this is my 3rd asus monitor all my others are still working perfectly

review_title: Wonderful monitor, problems with triple monitor configuration
review_body: I can't say anything that hasn't been said. I ordered one of these from newegg last year and wanted to do a triple monitor setup for work and playing some games so I bought two more of these guys. The monitors themselves are fantastic. Very sharp, no dead pixels, and just solid monitors. 3 for 3 is pretty good.

I was looking for an upgrade of an older monitor which I realized was not presenting text in a very sharp fashion.  I saw all the positive reviews of this monitor and went ahead an bought the monitor.

review_title: Nice, low weight monitor, has a quirk most won't need to worry about
review_body: Excellent visuals, versatile and multiple sources for input.  Very light weight.

review_title: best for computer, slightly less great for xbox1
review_body: HDMI ports don't adjust correctly to the size of the picture sent from Xbox 1. The picture size fits just outside the bounds of the screen.

review_title: Great Budget Monitor For Whatever You Need!
review_body: Going four months now, and it looks great. Nice and bright, and the colors are nice. I'm no expert, but I'd say it's a heck of a great monitor for someone who wants something high quality, but doesn't want to break the bank. I've been gaming on it without any issues to speak of. With both my GPU's on, I'll get tearing, because it seems the refresh rate is 60Hz, so that's expected.
I normally am not an acer fan, but this display is nice.  We have several Dell brand monitors at my work, and everyone begs for this monitor instead.  The picture is great on this!
Great monitor. Super thin. Excellent color quality and very fast graphics.
Nice size for bedroom viewing, it was easily mounted on the wall. Crisp picture even on old fashioned antenna.

This monitor ghosts terribly, especially evident in Lego Star Wars. If you look at the red cup in the attached photo and at the cape of the character center-screen, you can see just how terrible it is. Also has some pretty heavy backlights bleeding.

Fine IPS monitor for the money.  The monitor has an input selection function so one can input 3 powered PCs to it on HDMI, DVI, and VGA and switch among them.  The controls of the monitor and its various on-screen settings are not well designed and they take some time to master.

I wouldn't have bought an Acer, but the positive reviews made me reconsider. I love this monitor. I'm glad I got the 23.8-inch version. I had thought about going for 27, but 23 just fits better on my desk. For most jobs, the resolution is crisp.

review_title: Nice quality Monitor, Packages well, Easy set up
review_body: This is one of 2 monitors ordered.  It did not arrive as quickly as the other monitor, but still arrived before the new PC so we are happy with it.  It was protected by the packaging and had easy set up instructions.
After less than a year of use it is starting to turn off the screen randomly.
It's nice and does the job. For HD though it's not as crisp as I would like.
I know next to nothing about computer monitors, so I hit up a friend of mine, who has a decent PC gaming set-up of his own, and ask him what he thinks about this monitor.

I have a Macbook Air 2013 running OS X 10.8.5 on a USB 3.0 and experienced many of the same issues other reviewers of Macs have stated. I downloaded the most recent DisplayLink driver and plugged it in, but the screen showed an image indicating I needed to plug in the smaller Y USB plug, which I found disappointing because the Air only has 2 USB ports, 1 on each side and the USB Y cable provided cannot reach both. Also, the description states that 3.0 should be powerful enough with only 1 USB port to power the screen, but this was not so in my case. So I purchased a USB 3.0 hub and plugged it in and it worked!

review_title: The AOC 17" portable monitor works great. It is very lightweight and has a great ...
review_body: The AOC 17" portable monitor works great. It is very lightweight and has a great screen size. I also like the fact that you can use it in Portrait mode (vertical). The screen comes with a case. However, I did not see that anywhere on the listing, so I bought a separate case that I now don't need.

review_title: It does what it's supposed to
