review_body: I like this monitor. It's light, looks good, just plugs in the usb port, install the driver, and you're good to go. I have had it slip off the desk and crash to the concrete floor twice with no problem. My only complaint is that it will not auto rotate with Windows 10 Anniversary update, forcing me  to roll back the update. When that problem is solved, I'll probably get a second one.

It was great at first. I took it on one work trip and used it for 10 days. I came home and put it away. Today I took it out of it's case to use it. The USB on the monitor itself is faulty. It won't maintain a connection and actually falls out. I just checked the order and the return window closed on March 31 and the product maintenance window closed on April 30. Great. Basically I paid to use this monitor for 10 days in March and that's it! Off the electronics recycle center I guess.

review_title: Good, but not great with a Mac
review_body: Very convenient for travel, but not perfect.  With my Macbook I don't need to use both USB connections, which is good because the cord between them is too short to reach both sides of my Macbook.  Also, it doesn't seem that you can use the portrait layout with a Mac.  Further, my bluelight filter (F.lux) does not apply to this monitor, so the blue-white light starts to bother my eyes after some time.

review_title: The monitor worked awesome for 3 months now has completely quit working
review_body: The monitor worked awesome for 3 months now has completely quit working.  I came back to Amazon to see about getting warranty support and the support ended 2 months after purchase.  Unless someone can help me find warranty support, buyer beware.

review_title: Don't buy if you have a MacBook Pro
review_body: Worked fine on Windows with extensive setting up an driver installation. Wouldn't work on Macbook Pro 2015. Talked to AOC support and they claimed it likely won't work because I'm on a newer version of Mac OS. I've sent it back.

Easy to setup and use and has a convenient carrying case. It works great and has made my job so much easier when comparing different files. The only issue I have with it is the driver is only available on the CD provided. The computer I am using this with does not have a CD drive. I couldn't find the driver on-line so I had to copy the drive set up from the CD to a thumb drive to be able to install it.

review_title: aoc has always produced excellent equipment, some of my favorite crt's were AOC
review_body: i could not have asked for more out of a USB powered 17" monitor.

review_title: The fact it only needs USB for power and display data through one connection is excellent. I purchased after seeing a coworker w
review_body: Works perfectly for traveling with a laptop.  It is a little on the thicker side but still fits in my Timbuk2 TSA-friendly bag that butterflies to go through security.  The fact it only needs USB for power and display data through one connection is excellent.  I purchased after seeing a coworker with one and the same has happened when other colleagues have taken a look at mine.
Let me just say its probably been about a month now, so I've definitely had the monitors for a while to give them a proper test.

review_title: Some Pros and Cons on a Well Made Monitor
review_body: This monitor has worked amazingly these past two weeks. The picture is great and the response time does as promised. I've used it extensively on Dead Space 2, Battlefield 4, Skyrim, and Bioshock Infinite on ultra-high quality and have not been let down. The default color schemes are well set and the menu to change them is a little awkward but relatively easy to use. I see in the product description (and some reviews) that light bleeding occurs or can be an issue. I have yet to experience this problem.

review_title: Nice resolution and price but manufactured crooked so we had to put pads under it to level.
review_body: Love the monitor but it was manufactured crooked!  It was a xmas gift for my husband and was annoying that Christmas day when we went to put it in as a surprise for him to come down to that we had to scamble to find a way to place felt pads under one side because it the tolerances were not precise. As for resolution and so forth-great!  It could use some kind of adjustable up and down but for the price point, is ok.  Wasn't worth boxing it up to exchange for another but we did have to go out to buy some rubber pads to place under one side so that it would be level-that is a flaw in quality inspection for sure.

Great full HD monitor from a trusted brand at a great price. Picture looked good, the colors were accurate out of the box and the matte screen meant that I didn't have to deal with glare or seeing my reflection in the monitor. Worked great connected via VGA to an older HP laptop, and via HDMI to my Macbook. I could easily switch between the input modes with a push of a button on the monitor.

review_title: The monitor tilt didn't work the monitor was either tilted all the way down to the front or all the way back (no adjustment) I w
review_body: I didn't have much expectation. All I wanted was a solid monitor, but as soon as I started using it things I expected a normal monitor should do aren't what I expected.

review_title: Bright, easy to adjust, just right!
review_body: This is the 2nd Asus 24" HDMI monitor I've ordered in 10 years.  The 1st one finally died from a warn power switch.  Love the color, depth, real black back ground.

My experience with this monitor so far has been very good. The first thing that made me happy was the vibrant color and the details in pics, movies, and games.I watched Avatar Blu Ray and was really taken aback by how much sharper everything looked. Resident Evil 5 and Doom 3 are fast moving games and they looked great. The sharp pictures and color along with the clear black on white text is kind of similar to the quality on my dads $1,000 dollar Mac panel. I know that sounds hard to believe, but its true. Now for the cons. It has a little back light bleed on the bottom of the panel. Its only noticeable at certain times, 98% of the time its not even there. The second issue is viewing angles. At certain angles from the side of the monitor it will get cloudy and lose its definition. It has some slight viewing angle issues. It might have some settings that can fix that, but its not a real big deal to me when considering the price. I really don't want to spend hundreds more on a monitor so I can view it from every conceivable viewing angle. The third thing that could have been better was the stand. The stand is a bit flimsy as other have stated, but its not an extreme issue if your desk is solid and stable. I'm coming from a Dell '17 digital flat panel and I'm seeing much brighter whites and better blacks without any pixelation or distortion. The price point and features of this monitor made it a excellent buy for me.

review_title: Strange sound comes from the "nonexistent" built-in speaker?
review_body: I thought this monitor comes without built-in speaker until today. I left it on when I went out, and was shocked by the music it sung loudly when I opened my door. After I figured out that it is the monitor other than any one broke into my door, I woke the computer by pressing my keyboard, then the music stopped. Since this monitor is used for pure word processing, I never even add any speaker to the whole computer unit at all. So it is my first time to hear it makes any sounds, some strange songs I have never heard before. I then played a random online video, no sound. Plugged my earphone into the desktop, no sound. Plugged my earphone into the monitor, strange music again, which is totally independent from the video I was playing and showing on the monitor! After I finished writing this review, music stopped and my earphone is back to silence again. My question is, where does this music come from? Is that some virus thing? Plus since obviously this monitor does come with built-in speakers, how can I activate it?

I was not impressed at all with this monitor. First my screen would turn off for no apparent reason. I don't know if it is a faulty power cable or what. It was rather very loose and not snug. 2nd mine came with dead pixels that were very noticeable on the top of the screen. I had high hopes for this monitor and it was a big let down. The colors were horrible. The blacks had a faded look to it as it seems washed out. I tried to mess with setting to fix the color but it just never looked good. Sent this bad boy back to Amazon. Now to try another gaming monitor.

This monitor has sharp colors and wide viewing angles. There were no dead pixels and the monitor is easy to set up. It comes with VGA and DVI cables. There is also a single HDMI input as well as a 3.5mm audio output.
Great monitor.  Use it with a laptop to expand the display footprint.

review_title: Looks great especially compared to my older LCD which was only ...
review_body: Exactly what I wanted from a new monitor.  Looks great especially compared to my older LCD which was only 1680x1050.  Brightness is perfect as well - colors are vibrant without messing with my eyes.  I have it hooked up over DVI and haven't had any problems with regular PC use, video games (Division looked a ton better on this monitor), or when watching movies.  For the price, I've very happy with the purchase.
Its wider than our previous one which we like.  So far so good, hope we get many years of use out of it.

review_title: good high response time. can see it when playing games
review_body: good high response time. can see it when playing games. However the viewing angle isn't good (which is my biggest thing when reading text) and colors are ok. Kinda wish I went with ISP.
My first LED monitor, scared me on how bright and crisp it is, but there are settings to control that especially at night. I love it!
Great monitor for a great price.  I feel like a have a big screen to play my games.
Good monitor for the money. There are better monitors out there but you will pay more for them. If you just need a basic monitor and nothing special this will do the job.

review_title: Only had it for 3 days and it has a ...
review_body: Only had it for 3 days and it has a couple white spots. And it gets extremely hot after being used for 30 minutes
never a huge fan, but yesterday it just randomly died out on me so is now entirely useless.

review_title: Great picture at a great price
review_body: Only thing that could improve this product was built in speakers

I'm an accountant and when I got a new job, they did not provide me a second monitor.  I lasted 6 months before I went totally nuts and had to search for an efficiency monitor on my own.  So glad I found this, because it's so light and compact!  Perfect for traveling and the screen is clear and exactly what I needed for my job.  It's not the best resolution or brightness, but it gets the job done, especially when I only use it for spreadsheets and to open a second Quickbooks.  Easy to install and connect for a non-computer person like myself, and it comes with the USB cord and protection sleeve.  I don't game or stream movies on this so no input on that, but for simple tasks, it's fabulous being very cost efficient and portable!  Maybe I'm overhyping it because I get easily excited over simple things due to being an accountant, but this has made my life easier and I'm ecstatic!!

review_title: but it works beautifully with my new one
review_body: The monitor didn't work with the original laptop I had from work, but it works beautifully with my new one. Two monitors makes my work a LOT easier, and this monitor allows me to have an extra monitor when I'm not working at my desk with my stationary monitor. I like the fact that it just plugs into a USB port and doesn't require an additional power cable.

Worked great until Windows 10.  Now brightness can't be controlled and it's too bright to look at and you can't flip to portrait.  This is a known problem that was reported a year ago to the DisplayLink software.  I just reinstalled the software and no change.

I use my USB monitor all the time when I'm on the go. Resolution is not great but for a second window for debugging code, putting up spreadsheet or anything else like that this is perfect. The ability to change orientation is a major plus for coding or documents. Hooks up to my Surface Pro with one cable, came with a sleeve and makes me the most popular guy at the coffee shop every time I whip it out. I use it frequently at home too for times when one monitor just isn't cutting it. I love this little device.

I marked this down because I can't get it to work as a plug and play on my work laptop notwithstanding some of the comments. Super sad. My son was able to make it work on his laptop however by just plugging it in. I guess I'll keep it since it works fine - just not for me. (I do not have administrator rights to download to software so I really was hoping it would work for me bY just plugging in. )

This may be okay for some users but it screwed up my desktop 'spaces' and dock on a macbook pro. The resolution is not that great and kind of blurry. If you really need a portable second monitor, this might work for text applications. But, if you are doing serious graphic work. I would be wary.

review_title: Big white blurr in center of screen.
review_body: Less than 60 days of ownership the screen went bad. I have taken good care of it during travel. It's unbelievable I can't return and I have to beg my office to let me get another brand.  Not made well. Very disappointed.

Since it's one of the only USB powered monitors available, and I needed it for traveling computer setup, and it works, I like it.  Cons:  display is not very bright, so in a well lit room it's a bit of a challenge.  It is also a bit finicky when booting up...can't see the usual boot up stuff on screen, and then suddenly POOF, it's there.  Travels well, nice protective sleeve.

I have had this monitor now for a while and use it often.  The monitor picture is good for what I need.  The problem with this is the cable going from the computer to the monitor.  The computer side is a standard USB, which is not a problem.  The monitor side is a small proprietary connector that does not fit well.  I have to move and maneuver and adjust that cable for several minutes before I get a picture any time that I want to connect the monitor.  Once I finally get a picture, if something happens that moves the cable or the monitor, I get to start all over again to try to get the picture back.

I bought this monitor so that I could have a second monitor when I work remote. I was very happy with the purchase until about a month ago when it stopped working. When I plug the monitor into my computer the AOC logo will repeatedly flash on an off. This appears to be a connection issue. It seems that the USB-C port is not robust. Ive seen numerous reviews that are similar where customers love the monitor (as I did) but it becomes worthless after a couple months of use when this issue begins happening. Not worth buying for such a short life span.

I purchased this item at the first of the year (2014) to upgrade my old 19'' monitor in conjunction with purchasing a new computer also. The video is very good, the size is much nicer and the quality appears to be quite good thus far. It could however be a little more user-friendly. There are very few instructions written in English and the user is left to figure out how to use all the adjustments without any help.

review_title: Nice monitor, just a little tilted
review_body: Overall, this is a great monitor.  Out of the box, with no adjustment whatsoever, it was fine, for me at least.  I love the additional screen real estate over our previous 19".  We have no dead pixels.  The cords stick out rather than going down, but since I don't have a wall mount, that doesn't bother me.  This monitor is a champ in every way except for one.

review_title: Good Monitor; Rebate is a LIE
review_body: Overall I like the monitor. It has a slightly thicker bezel than the VN247H-P that you unfortunately can't buy anymore, but it's decent enough. The display is very clear and it's been very reliable with daily use.

review_title: Great Price without having to use a rebate. Excellent quality with outstanding picture and color saturation.
review_body: I purchased two of these monitors for my office/home computer.

review_title: Beautiful display, perfect size, just one small flaw
review_body: I really like this monitor. Currently I have it as my main monitor and my old LCD Hanns-G is my secondary. Standing side by side it's very easy to see the difference in quality. Of course this monitor is much much more crisp and clear. The image is gorgeous. I actually prefer watching Netflix on this monitor aside from my Vizio LCD television because of how beautiful the picture quality is. The only thing that I don't like about this monitor is it's glossy finish. When I read other reviews on this monitor, a few of them mentioned that it was not a glossy monitor so that was a bonus to me. I failed to look closely at the pictures of the product. This thing WILL attracted fingerprints like there is no tomorrow. It's easy to wipe clean, just a pain in the rear-end to keep clean.  I despise glossy finish anything as far as electronics go. I never understood the appeal of it. Yeah it looks good in the store, but when it's at home and people are putting their fingers all over it, it just looks dirty and awful.

review_title: My first computer monitor was an Asus and I loved it. I don't think you can go wrong ...
review_body: This is a decent monitor for the price. Still, I have been spoiled by my Dell 2340M's. They may not have the connectivity that this does but the Asus can't compete with their image quality.

review_title: Great monitor with unusually terrible on-screen controls
review_body: I don't have much to add that other reviewers have not already said. This monitor looks much better to my eyes than the Samsung TN panel it's replacing. I have not experienced the problem that some other reviewers have reported with the monitor not waking up after sleep. Mine seems reasonably well calibrated out of the box (though admittedly, I'm not a graphic designer). I went through the Windows 10 calibration, and the only thing I changed was the brightness (it defaults to an eye-blindingly bright 100% brightness).

Awesome display. Nice colors, worked perfectly right out of the box. Be sure to purchase an HDMI cable separately since this unit does not come with one. Or get a DVI-D to Mini Display port adapter if you prefer to connect via Mini Display Port. The stand is definitely shoddy and wobbly. Every time I bump against the desk, or walk around the desk, the vibrations/ movements cause the display to sway and shake. The stand/mounting mechanism is simply not the highest quality, but... the price is right for what you get! All ASUS monitors seem to have the same crappy stand. I'd pay $10-$20 more for a properly rigid display stand.

review_title: Great Quality Monitor for gaming and everyday work!
review_body: This monitor was a gift for the boyfriend and with the rebates you can not go wrong with the price!  This is his third monitor in his office.  His first one is older second is the exact one and then I purchased this to help enhance his set-up for his birthday.  He loves it and I will mention this because he researched the brand when purchasing the other one like this but this size is the highest and best quality for gaming hence the reason we did not go with the larger one.  He uses it for work games etc so it is very versatile and has a great look and crisp clear screen, otherwise we wouldn't have 2 :)  If you are looking for a quality monitor it is worth the investment.  We purchased the first for around 200+ and the second with the rebates a lucky $140 so as you can see it is worth the price and investment if we were willing to stick with the same brand.  I hope this helps!

Love it so much I bought a second just like it. Bought this a year ago and it still is showing vibrant coloration. Deep colors, and ability to be very bright as well. I would recommend looking up online how to properly configure the coloring on the monitor however, because the factor default settings on this monitor are to have the brightness and color saturation turned up to 100. It can be very straining on the eyes, especially if you're sitting close at a desk. I prefer the brightness turned way down and my recommendation would be to set it that way using an online guide. Google provided me with a few good links to use.
Nice size for first gaming setup.  Great color and resolution.  Like the stand not taking up much desk space.

review_title: So far so good on the two Acer Monitors I purchased
review_body: So far so good on the two Acer Monitors I purchased. I bought these for my home office - and the size and colors the Acer projects are very  good quality.

review_title: Acer R240HY bidx 23.8-Inch IPS HDMI DVI VGA Monitor.
review_body: One of the best monitors I have ever owned. Light weight and has excellent contrast and color.
I like the thin bezel and the screen is very clear and bright. It comes on quickly  which is good. It does not have a speaker but does have an audio out plug for powered speakers.

review_title: Great monitor at a fair price.
review_body: Ordered two of these my home office, my work requires multiple monitors. Pleased with them.
I love it so far. It was delivered quickly, was easy for setup, has a superior picture and is perfect for my usage. I may have to but another one to have to beautiful monitors to view at my desk.
Great monitor for the price. Fantastic color and resolution.

review_title: I'd love to get a second one
review_body: Absolutely love  this monitor. I still have to figure out how to have it shutdown with the pc, but it's not bad at all.

review_title: Good bright colors. Looks sharp and clear.
review_body: Got this as a 2nd monitor.
Using the HDMI connection, this monitor is big, bright, sharp and very colorful. Excellent picture quality!!

I love this monitor. It's exceptionally thin, easy to transport, and has clearer resolution/quality than my laptop. A big plus is the range of angles you have to play with; great for standing, sitting, stationing the monitor above your primary screen or to the side.

review_title: NOT for users where color accuracy/white balance is important...
review_body: Overall, it does what it says and it performs well.  However, there is one caveat: DO NOT buy this if accurate colors are important to you.

review_title: Waste of $97.  Stopped working after 47 days.
review_body: Stopped working after 47 Days.  17 days after return policy.  No way to contact seller from Amazon.

review_title: does not work with most PC's, no SurfacePro's
review_body: Simply doesn't work. Requires strictly a USB-C to USB-C path. Since most PC's and even the SurfacePro 4 don't come with a USB-C connector, and ABSOLUTELY NO COMBO OF USB A TO C NOR DISPLAY PORT TO USB-C NOR DISPLAY PORT TO HDMI TO USB-C WORKs with this display. It ONLY seems to work on limited number of Mac's (that have built-in USB-C ports). I was disappointed that Amazon's web recommended a USB 2A to USB C cable as that was NOT correct. The stand/cover and its magnets were equally useless. This is a terribly engineered product and solution.

review_title: The first two times (in the first week I owned it) worked fine. When I went to use it again after ...
review_body: I've used this monitor 3 times in the 6 months I've had it.  The first two times (in the first week I owned it) worked fine.  When I went to use it again after owning it for about 6 months, the screen was grey and no images showed.  It's just been sitting in my office.  It hasn't been in anyway mishandled.  I have so far found no way to resolve this, and unfortunately it's [ast my time limit to get a refund.  $100 wasted!

review_title: Great monitor with a terrible connection
review_body: I was really excited about getting the product in and being able to instantly have a 2nd laptop screen for traveling through work. The monitor works great when the connection actually holds. It seems that every time the cable is touched it disconnects and reconnects. COMPLETELY FRUSTRATING when you are trying to get work done.

I have a Dell Latitude E7450 laptop and purchased this monitor hoping to use it while traveling. When trying to install the driver is said its incompatible with my graphics card (Intel(R) HD Graphics 5500) and after searching online it sounds like there is no way to get it to work. Would be nice if there was a way to determine full compatibility before purchasing.
I hesitate to give 1 star because I never truly was able to use the product (yet the review system forces giving stars).

Works perfectly with Windows 10 on a few low-powered computers at home. Refused to work with my Windows 7 desktop due to some sort of conflict with my AMD video card's driver. Also the installation process made a dog's dinner of my Intel USB stack, which I had to rebuild from scratch. Shockingly it works well under Ubuntu Linux 15.10 on a very low powered MSI CUBI003BUS device. Downloaded drivers, ignored the warnings about the different kernel and voila ! I will try my MAC next...

review_title: The monitor itself is nice. Sometimes when I lift it on the right ...
review_body: The monitor itself is nice. Sometimes when I lift it on the right side though I hear a crack as if the plastic is breaking. No actual break, but it's worrisome. Also, the sleeve it came with was sewn way tooo tightly at the opening which makes it very difficult to get in or out. Screen itself is clear and bright. So happy I purchased this finally.

For the price, I'm pretty happy with the monitor.  The colors look nice, it's bright enough, lots of settings, I play games and movies on it with no issues.  Definitely not pro-grade, though.  On all black screens, you can see the light from the edges very clearly (the images goes from gray on the sides to black in the center).  The stand is really wobbly and not confidence inspiring.  It sometimes has trouble turning back on from being put on standby by the PC; sometimes turning it on and off works, sometimes I have to unplug it from the computer and plug it back in (though I'm willing to accept that this is a Windows issue and not a hardware problem).

When I ordered this monitor, I read as many reviews as possible. After a few days of research, I decided this was worth the money, and made the decision to buy it. Now I had never bought a monitor online before, following advice from people more experienced in the matter. The monitor arrived, and I promptly hooked everything up to test it out. I found no dead pixels, and the packaging material was study enough to withstand anything that a shipping journey may throw at it. Now for the review!

Nothing but problems with this monitor. I've previously had Dell monitors and never had an issue.  I read the reviews before I bought this monitor, and the reviews seemed okay, but I have had nothing but problems.  It keeps losing the HDMI signal.  I don't think that I should have to unplug the HDMI cord to use my computer.  I will never buy another ASUS product again. Just a waste of money --no wonder they have 24/7 support they need it!!

review_title: Great screen for its price point
review_body: I've had this screen for a little over a year and a half. It's not the most "tricked-out" monitor you can find, but it does an awesome job for a really low price. The screen is matte, which is what I prefer (some people might not). I think glossy screens end up with too much glare and reflection and it actually hurts my eyes. Matte screens are a bit duller in color but I'm ok with that, the colors look great regardless. If you're looking for a more technical review, refer to the top review. But in terms of normal every day use, this monitor is great!

review_title: Good display, had a problem initially that was easily fixed
review_body: Have not had any problem since I ordered this 5 months ago. No apparent dead pixels and the display is good. It took some getting used to and manipulation of the various settings, but I eventually got it at a good saturation level.

review_title: Just hope you never need customer service...
review_body: As others have mentioned, Asus customer service is horrendous! I had this monitor for a year and the backlight failed. Since it was within warranty, I contacted Asus and they issued an RMA. I asked them to pay for return shipping and honor their Rapid Replacement cross-shipping guarantee. No luck there. They told me I am not eligible for return shipping, which I don't understand because I shouldn't be responsible for paying to return a faulty product that isn't even halfway through it's warranty period, and they don't have any additional monitors in stock. Really? There seem to be a lot of them in stock to sell on amazon! I'm throwing this monitor in the trash (or rather finding an appropriate electronic recycling location) and buying a different brand. I'll never buy Asus again.

The screen looks great and is super easy to set up. The critiques that I have about it is that the screen wobbles side to side a lot, even with very little movement on my very solid desk. The second issue that perhaps I just haven't figured out yet is that the screen is tilted to the right. I removed and installed the base twice and the screen still tiles a little bit to the right. Great screen but the wobble and the tilt are going to drive me crazy. I will most likely have to put a soft rubber block under the right side of the screen to keep it from wobbling and hold it strait. Other than that, you get a lot for what you are paying!

review_title: Good but doesn't wake from sleep automatically
review_body: The monitor looks great and works as it should except for one issue.  When my computer screen turns off when I'm away from it and I come back to the computer, the monitor will not register my computer.  I have to push the button next to the power button, which searches for connections before I can use it.  all other monitors that I've used would automatically turn back on when I'm back on my computer.  I'm not sure if it's something that I haven't configured properly or if it's just this monitor.

review_title: The wobbly monitor stand is extremely distracting
review_body: The stand is incredibly wobbly for this monitor. It shakes with every keystroke on the keyboard and is really distracting. The monitor display itself is OK, not bad for a monitor at this price, but the colors are not incredible like some of the other reviews seem to suggest.

I opted to save a little money and purchase this monitor from Amazon Warehouse as Used - Like New.  It was well worth it.  The monitor was in perfect condition, still in its original packaging.  The plastic protective film protect from scratches was still on all the pieces.  The only thing that made it "used" was that the original manufacturer's box had been opened and resealed.

review_title: but otherwise a good cheap monitor
review_body: Brighter corners on dark backgrounds as others have noted, but otherwise a good cheap monitor.

review_title: Love the size but it goes black for a short ...
review_body: Love the size but it goes black for a short period of time and I did not have a problem with my other smaller screen.  Great color, love the size, the price but it does cut out from time to time.
Daughter needed a new monitor.  This one looked good for the price.  Extremely thin.  She hasn’t complained yet about the picture/resolution/screen.
makes your setup look amazing, just that the stand makes the monitor a bit shaky if you hit or bump the table. no noticeable problems so far.

Love this item, been using it for almost a year. Not sure why I have yet to switch to a monitor that has volume. Easy to use it is perfect. I don't know why the reviews kept saying it wasn't loud enough.. They need to clean out their ears..
Very nice bargain and very good monitor.
Needed an extra monitor for work and this fits the bill.  I didn't want it too big.  Easy to put together.
PROS:

Solid, entry level gaming monitor. The color is great. My only negative would be the input lag makes the monitor difficult for competitive gaming. All my story games work just fine with no noticable lag.

review_title: IPS Minimal backlight bleeding (not noticible unless looking for it in dark scenes) Low price Relatively good UI for adjusting s
review_body: Pros:

review_title: It is easy to update but still a little annoying
review_body: I am used to working with two screens but travel a lot for work, so I needed a portable second screen. This product has done the trick in terms of funcionality. However, a few things could be improved on:

review_title: It will be fine for that purpose
review_body: Bought the monitor for work travel so I wouldn't have to work off my laptop display all day.  It will be fine for that purpose, but probably wouldn't be happy with it for day to day use.  Can't get the rotation to work and the brightness is static, I can't change it on my Windows 10 operating system [and it's not very bright].  Very lightweight, and included carry case is great.

review_title: This has been a great second portable display
review_body: This has been a great second portable display.  It's as good as any standard 1920x1080 desktop display.  It's extremely light and fits in my computer bag nicely right along side my laptop.  I have a 4K laptop so you have to understand when using along side one of those that your resolution won't look at clear.  It's really slick though with zero setup; just plug and play!

I've bought 3 of these & they all work fine, have to be set up with the CD that comes with each, also each comes with a nice padded case, how ever the only hookup wire (usb) could have been longer at least for my set up, and you have to be right in front of the screen to get the best picture 25/30 degrees off center & the picture blurs.

review_title: The left side of the screen has a thick 2-3 ...
review_body: The left side of the screen has a thick 2-3 inch color line, which you can not see information on that part of your scree, other than that I think the product does what it should do.  I purchased a warranty but I have had a difficult time getting them to respond.

Took a minute, literally to find and install drivers, but be prepared for lack of plug and play; no biggie tho. Love being able to USB this display on my laptop. Use it primarily to display interface while working in PhotoShop and manga studio. I am a hobbyist, constantly on the go. The sleeve it comes with has protected screen thus far (4 months) shoving into the front pocket of my laptop bag. Also great for photo slide shows of vertical shots, as stand holds either mode, and unit supports it, which laptop will not do. Also with one HDMI out, a viable option for 3 displays. I haven't had a need for that, only tested to see that it works.

I bought this last February and after almost a year, it still works great. It's light, portable and perfect for travel. It is very basic and I can't get the auto-rotate to work either but changing the settings when needed is no big deal. If you are looking for something to watch movies or game with then I wouldn't recommend this due to the resolution but it's fine for work or school and great for the price. Just plug it in to your USB port and you are good to go. The case it comes with is really just a mesh sleeve but the screen is so slim it fits in my laptop bag without any problems. Would definitely buy it again.

Purchased about 8 of these and had issues with over half.  The usb connection on the monitor seems to be the biggest issue.  Have tried multiple cables so can confirm it's not the cable.  Have also had flicker issues with one and another would just go black in the middle of using it.  Definitely would not purchase again.

review_title: Does NOT work with the latest version of Windows 10!
review_body: Beautiful, portable monitor that does NOT work with Windows 10, no matter what others have said, even after downloading the special "crowd sourced" (or whatever) driver for the latest version of Windows 10.  After spending more than two hours identifying, downloading, and installing the supposedly correct drivers, all it did was briefly flash the AOC logo and then present me with a black screen.  So disappointed!

I was so excited about this, but only 2 months in, it completely stopped working.  When you plug it in, the screen shakes and goes dark. You also need to download a driver to install if you don't have a CD drive, which was a bit confusing.

review_title: Nice picture, but tilts to the right, one dead pixel, and very shiny bezel/base
review_body: I purchased the Asus VS228H-P monitor recently.  As a few other reviewers noted, the monitor is tilted to the right.  The right side is lower than the left, and I had to shim the base with a couple pieces of thin foam to level it out.  I'm willing to bet that a lot more of these monitors are tilted, but most people just haven't noticed because they're not very attentive to detail.  I've looked at the screws and molding of the plastic pieces, and some of it probably needs to be redesigned with tighter tolerances to fix the tilt.

I really like this monitor.  Mine has no dead pixels.  I love the 1080P versus a higher resolution because I have this display three feet from my face and the text on the screen (emails, web pages, documents, etc.) is still nice and easy to read.  It's wide enough that I can open two documents side-by-side without any need for scrolling or reducing the magnification level.

We purchased this monitor in early September and in early November it developed a green vertical line from the top of the screen to the bottom.  We are not eligible to return it evidently so after 2 months of light use, it is annoying to view.  Beautiful picture on the screen for two months.  Very disappointed with the quality in such a short time.

review_title: Perfect for the computer in the spare bedroom...otherwise buyer beware...
review_body: I hate leaving poor reviews...I really do. So much for viewing angle and any modicum of color value. I was very excited to receive two VS248H-P monitors yesterday. After removing the stands and installing the VESA hardware i had the perfect triple monitor setup...not! Take the overwhelmingly positive reviews of this item with a grain of salt. Massive color shift in two out of two units even when viewed dead-on. In a multiple monitor set-up like mine it's just maddening. The images tell the story.
Short version:

I love this monitor. I bought 3 of them. First monitor, there were 2 blue dot on black screen. I sent it back and got the new one later. Another 2 monitors had no problem. The monitors are the perfect size for my work (Web Design). The monitor is anti glare which is very good for me because I wear the glasses. However, I need to set the correct gamma and scaling option for HDMI port which are normal adjustment. I really like the monitor has 3 display outputs and one head phone port. Overall, I am really happy with the monitors.
I got this as a basic monitor for my guest computer. I honestly wasn't expecting much for under a hundred bucks. But I was surprised to see the quality and razor sharp resolution this monitor brings.

Needed a second monitor for home. I got a bad piece. Flickering red dots/lines showed up. Brightness/Contrast buttons did not work. Ordered a replacement that works fine. The base on the first piece is different from the second one that I got. Both are a bit wobbly though. Meaning that if you are hitting the adjustment buttons below the screen, you have to hold the monitor with your other hand and do it to stop the wobble. Can't adjust height, which is a shame. Have to stick in text books below it to raise the height.

I like this monitor for the price!  Size is great for my setup - not too big and not too small.  I had it connected to a MacBook Pro Mid 2009 laptop with 8 GB of RAM running latest OS X build (via Mini Display Port to HDMI) but it didn't play nice with NetFlix - got a lot of stutter and jitter so I connected the monitor to my Mac Mini also with 8 GB of RAM running 10.6.8 ( via direct HDMI to HDMI) and it does a great job playing NetFlix.  Don't care for the glossy bezel but I do like the matte finish screen which is great and colorful.  Took some playing around to get the screen looking the way I want in terms of color, contrast, etc.  I have standard mode on and used the built in OS X Display Calibration to tweak to my liking.  I still don't like the way fonts look on this monitor - I am open to suggestions on how to make them look better.  The monitor wobbles despite firmly screwing in the base but I can live with it - you can always buy a vesa mount.  Even better deal with $20 mail in rebate before end of August 2013!  Am thinking of getting a second one.  All the positive reviews are true on this one.  Yeah, there is some light leak and bleeding around the edges  but nothing too off putting - I can live with it - all my LCD TVs and Monitors have this so what can you do?  Thankfully no weird spotting or discoloration or dead pixels so far.

I was hesitant to buy this based upon warning from others about backlight bleed. I expected some, considering it's an edge-lit monitor and IPS has doesn't do the best blacks in the panel world, but now I am very pleasantly surprised.
Great panel at a good price. Two years after purchase item is still in perfect working order. No dead pixels. If you are looking for a good monitor that won't break the bank, this is it
Buttons underneath the adjust monitor don't work well.  Couldn't adjust brightness at all -- broken.
This is a great monitor. I had no problems putting the stand on & it's been working perfectly. Great color & resolution.

You can't beat it for the price. The bezels are tiny and the screen looks amazing. The blue light reduction is very useful. Only downside is there are no Vesa mounts. With these tiny bezels I really would have liked to mount it.

review_title: I just needed something that looks good and gives me plenty of desktop space to work
review_body: I'm not a monitor geek.  I just needed something that looks good and gives me plenty of desktop space to work.  I use this mainly for word processing and watching lots of youtube videos.  I love the fact that there is no glare on this monitor!  I liked this monitor enough that I bought a second one a week later!  I use them both for a dual monitor setup on my laptop.  One uses HDMI and the other uses VGA.  I've had them now for about a month.  I'm very happy with my purchase.
Very nice product just what I expected. Was nervous about shipping a monitor, but everything worked well just like all my Amazon purchases. A good value.

review_title: ... 23 bw monitor that has developed LCD panel issues like horizontal reddish lines on the right side of the ...
review_body: I purchased this monitor to replace an HP 23 bw monitor that has developed LCD panel issues like horizontal reddish lines on the right side of the screen and image burn-in.  That monitor was a 1080p IPS LED backlit monitor just like this one, but is a 23 inch monitor instead of a 24 inch monitor like this one is.
Picture is faded and soft.  I guess they choose resolution instead of a vivid experience.
Been using that mon for 1 month already , and im thinking about to order 2nd one to replace my OFF MONITOR ! Such a high quality ! and good price ! HIGHLY RECOMMEND !
I bought this to add it to my MacBook Pro and the image is superb!

review_title: I bought two of these units and never have been ...
review_body: I bought two of these units and never have been able to get the right color rendering on the display.  It came with a disk for the driver, but it didn't work.  I eventually found a driver online, but the screen display was washed out and blue.  This weekend, I traveled to my daughter's home who is also using one and she was able to help me load up an MS driver that worked, but the picture is not crisp, out of focus, and the color rendering is not right.  I decided to send it back, but just determined that my return window and the support window have both expired.  Can someone help me determine how I can get some help to get it usable or how I can return it since I'm unhappy?

review_title: Most Helpful Tool in my Bag
review_body: This has been a life saver on so many occasions! I often work away from an office and the double screen has increased my productivity away from my home office. I have also found it useful when sharing information. it easily allows me to present information without everyone crowding around a laptop screen. It really does not weight much and does not add a lot to my laptop bag. The set up was extremely easy and I have also allowed clients to use it when they are in need of another screen. It seems everywhere I go, someone is requesting more information and where to purchase! This has been a great product

Let me just tell you, I LOVE THIS MONITOR. The price is amazing, the quality is pretty good for a monitor of this pice, and I am just so so pleased. It  makes gaming, streaming, and chatting with my twitch stream so much easier. I would buy 10 of these if I could. If you're considering this monitor, do yourself a favor and get it. Seriously. It's awesome!

review_title: really a great buy. I could not be more pleased
review_body: really a great buy. I could not be more pleased. Very simple to set up. The only thing I would recommend to make it better is an on/off switch as it does not go off by itself unless you set the computer to sleep. Nice size, sits up on its own, just plug in the usb and its ready to go. I will probably buy more in the future. I love that I can switch computers to so easily and without buying an adapter.

review_title: Love this. Had an older AOC 15" that finally ...
review_body: Love this.  Had an older AOC 15" that finally gave up the ghost after more than 5 years of hard use on my business trips at remote sites.  This newer version offers better resolution in about the same amount of space.  Yes, videos and other applications can be played on it.  However, the refresh rate and other specs are slower than the true laptop monitor.  So it is mostly used for extra application/web working space in my case.  But Netflix, YouTube and the like work just fine on it.

review_title: Love it, but not for Linux
review_body: So far, this has been a great monitor.  I also bought the 1649 because I can't really take advantage of the usb 3.0 capabilities with my old laptop, but this is a lot slimmer than the 1649 and has a better stand.  Go for the extra 30 bucks and buy this one even if you only have usb 2.0; this one is much more portable.  Only problem for me is I can't get it working on my Linux laptop, so for that  I bought the Gechic one-lap which is powered through by usb but sends data through a regular hdmi or vga connection.  The gechic is much harder to view.  In portrait mode its almost impossible to find a viewing angle from which none of the dark parts of the screen image appear as a slight negative image.  Black text on a white background comes out ok, but large dark areas have a weird, negative-like quality which gets dramatically worse when viewed from an oblique angle.  This made me appreciate the AOC 1659 even more.  The big question is: will it last?  I've only had it two weeks.
1) Item does not work on ios devices

review_title: So far it works fine and has a nice stand and case
review_body: Just set it up today for my husband.  So far it works fine and has a nice stand and case.  The setup was a huge pain if you don't have a disc drive to load the software on to your laptop. There were no instructions for how to find the drivers on the internet.  The website provided no longer works.  I had to search for a while and find the drivers and the instructions were not obvious.  Thankfully it's working now though.

review_title: Everything about this is great EXCEPT it requires you to install its drivers before ...
review_body: Everything about this is great EXCEPT it requires you to install its drivers before you can use it. I think this would've been THAT MUCH BETTER if I could just plug it in and start using it as I bought this mainly for working remotely and it was a pain to find one of our techs to allow me the permissions to install the proper drivers onto my work laptop.

review_title: Did not work with an almost brand new laptop
review_body: This didn't work for me with a new Acer Swift notebook.  Seems AOC should write bug-free drivers.  Also, the drivers software came on a CD-ROM disk with instructions that the software could be downloaded from the WEB also, but the drivers weren't on the AOC web site.  Since I have a newer model laptop without a CD-ROM drive a had to bring an older laptop back up into service to copy the driver software (which doesn't work with the monitor)

I'm giving this monitor 4 stars and should give it 5, but I do NOT like the widescreen high resolution monitors in this small size. It gives your neck a workout as you scan your eyes back and forth and some of the print even at medium resolution (1600x900) causes me to squint. Otherwise, the monitor is great. I haven't had to make any adjustments to it at all with the exception of the clear type font adjustment that makes the print easier to read. It tilts easily, yet is on a sturdy base. Actual measurements are 20"Wx15.5"Hx8"D (includes the round pedestal). The height can be adjusted. The height of just the monitor is 12.5".

review_title: Pleasant & customizable LED Monitor for Gaming and Graphic Design
review_body: Have only had this monitor for several weeks, but it definitely exceeds expectations! My older monitor was an HP vs15 from ~10 years ago...that I kept hanging on to due to its color accuracy and how easy it was on the eyes (for reading, hours per day).
I love this monitor. I had a hard time committing to buying an HD monitor, because they all seem to have mixed reviews. A lot of the specs go over my head, but I'm glad I settled on this one.

review_title: The instructions are all but useless
review_body: If you don’t have some knowledge about monitors, the instructions are all but useless. The monitor “wobbles”, as others have noted. Other than that, it seems to be a good monitor at a decent price, we or I will see.

review_title: In part because I'm closer to my monitor but the clarity and sharpness of this IPS monitor is awesome. I did have to add separat
review_body: My previous monitor was not IPS technology, so I wasn't sure if there would be much difference.  I'd been using my 40" Samsung flat screen television as a monitor, but when I moved my office I wanted something small for my desk top, but with plenty of screen space to stack windows all over it.  This turned out to be a huge step up.  In part because I'm closer to my monitor but the clarity and sharpness of this IPS monitor is awesome.  I did have to add separate speakers, since I was no longer passing sound through my television speakers, but that was a minor sacrifice, particularly since this monitor was priced so economically, compared to other IPS monitors.  And this is no off brand either.  Asus is a top of the line manufacturer, which is why I was surprised they had such an economical model in their line up, as they are typically priced on the high end.  Five stars for ASUS bringing economical high quality for those of us on a tight budget.

review_title: Sharp and Clean Picture, Great Price, Three Inputs.
review_body: This monitor is hooked up to the HDMI port on a new Mac Mini and doing an excellent job. It gives an excellent picture with the Mini's limited graphics hardware and provides options to attach other computers to the remaining jacks on the back. I use a Windows 7 desktop on the DVI port and occasionally hook up an old Windows 98 Compaq laptop to the VGA connector. All three inputs give a sharp picture (or as sharp as a Trident Cyberblade laptop with 8 megabytes of video memory can put out for the VGA).
I got 3 of these..  and as the picture shows NO VESA mounting retainers were inserted in the product!  Even though is cliams VESA and shows them installed in the picture.

Great quality display for this price range. Solid color reproduction, contrast, and brightness; the image on my older Acer monitor looks sickly when side-by-side with this one. I calibrated this monitor with a Spyder4 Pro and it looks fantastic (see Spyder analysis below). Plus, it's a matte screen, no horrible glare. Response time is perfect - I never see any ghosting or artifacts.

great monitor  hi def is flawless have used VGA and the HDMI inputs text is  super sharp has an audio out in the from of a 3.5 mm jack for the HDMI  input. i use VGA for my PC and the HDMI for my xbox sound from the output is great.

It's been well over a year or two and I am still loving this monitor. The display is so crisp, clear, and very bright! I play video games and make art and this monitor is absolutely perfect for both. Being able to tilt it to my liking is lovely since me and my boyfriend like different angles. It has different display settings for if you're watching a movie, playing a game, or just the standard setting for basic use. Best monitor I've ever had and I'll be sticking with Asus brands from now on!

review_title: Excellent IPS Monitor with Accurate Color!!!
review_body: Excellent IPS monitor. Makes a great companion monitor to my 27" iMac 5K Retina.
Great monitor. Make sure to use connections that came with monitor. I first tried the connections from my old Acer monitor and had problems. In my experience, this is very importsnt.
I bought two of these and put them on my office computer. Duel screen instantly installed and they look great. I am impressed by how thin they are. What's next, painting it on the wall?

review_title: A great second monitor for my imac
review_body: A great second monitor for my imac. It's light enough to use with my sit/stand desk and worked right away without fuss out of the box.
Worked fine for 2 months.  now it says cable not connected.  In standby mode and will not move off that.
Good monitor for the price. Some games I cap at 59 FPS because they tear over. Not sure if it’s the monitor or games since it’s not everyone.

Excellent value here.  I was looking into a workstation monitor, but I prefer to have 2 so I needed one on the cheaper end of things.  I got two of these for $250 and they are worth much much more.  The display, particular the colors, are so vibrant.  Crisp, clean look to them.  No downsides at all.

A lot of the reviews are read were negative because you can see some light around the edges, where you might have black bars from watching a widescreen movie. This is to be expected from a backlit monitor. Quit your whining. Great monitor. Great buy.

review_title: Black border around edges, not edge-to-edge display
review_body: It shocks me that hardly any of the 1000+ reviews mention this, but this monitor, while it produces an outstanding image and aesthetically looks really great with the nearly edge less bezel design, doesn't actually display an image that fills the entire screen.  It goes all the way to the bottom, but there is about a 1/4" inch black border on the left, top, and right sides of the screen - the image does not display beyond this point.  You can fiddle around with your monitor position settings, your video card's overscan settings, etc all you want, but you will not get the image to display all the way to the edge.  I have included a picture which shows the issue...

review_title: It's a good looking monitor with lots of options for inputs
review_body: It's a good looking monitor with lots of options for inputs. The only thing missing is VESA mount compatibility, but at the price point, that's a rather minor complaint.

review_title: Pretends it's on, but really it doesn't work.
review_body: I bought two of these a while ago, and one has been great but the other...not so much. It had some dead pixels about a year in, and now won't work at all. The ASUS logo flickers and the screen goes black. The blue light indicates the monitor is still on, but I Can't do anything - including even changing the input source or anything like that. I've tried multiple cords of each type, and multiple computers. Works great with one monitor, not at all with the second.

I never had any intention of buying a monitor without seeing the picture. But after building this computer and having good experiences with other ASUS products, I was confident that this monitor would be just fine. It turned out that this monitor was much more than "just fine".

This is my first flatscreen. My old 80lb CRT finally died. This one had the specs I wanted and it had the brand reputation of Asus. Yes this does have a matte screen and it does not appear to be a add-on label. The only con I will give it is the default settings are WAY to bright even on "night-view Mode" Simply turning those down to a manageable setting, solved that.

review_title: Full HD with Good Standard Features
review_body: I decided to give this monitor a review after almost 3 months of use. So far...

review_title: Good product at a fair price
review_body: Good product at a fair price.  My wife's desktop monitor died.  The monitor itself was OK, but the power supply was intermittent.  So I checked with my son who is an IT manager for a large government agency and he recommended ASUS monitors.  Reviews were great for this model so I bought it.  Easy to set up with on screen prompts and it looks great.

review_title: Good for dual monitor setup; faulty VGA cable
review_body: I bought these monitors so I could work from home, they were a decent price and I needed a setup that would accommodate one HDMI port and one VGA port on my docking station without converter cables (converters didn't work). I had to supply my own HDMI cable, but the VGA cables they sent with BOTH monitors didn't work with the docking station. I switched it out with one of my old monitor's VGA cables and was able to get them set up. Resolution is great, price was grea, beware if the cables.

I decided to buy (2) of these right before the end of 2012.  They were on sale, and there was a $20 rebate per monitor.  For $139, and with all of the other great feedback, how could I go wrong?  Answer: I didn't!  I love these things.  They're thin and light, so they were easy to mount to my new quad monitor stand.  I'm currently sporting (2) Dell 19" above them, but it's safe to say their days (in this system) are numbered.  Asus extended their rebate (to end of January 2013), I'm I'll very likely snag (2) more of these bad boys.  Note: I'm not a gamer, so I can't comment on their speed, but the colors are accurate, there's good depth to the display, and in my case, all of the pixels were lit out of the box(s).  If you're thinking 24", this is your monitor!

review_title: and the sound is pretty bad. The speakers on the monitor are worthless ...
review_body: As others have said, colors seem washed out.  I think the brightness comes from the factory way too high, and bringing that down helps.  I am using the headphone port to connect this monitor to a larger sound system, and the sound is pretty bad. The speakers on the monitor are worthless as expected, but I did not expect the sound passing from the HDMI cable to the headphone jack to be so lousy. We had a TV we were using as a monitor before, and the sound passing through was excellent using the headphone port. Also this monitor is not as clear at the pixel level as I had hoped. It is better than using a TV for a monitor, but not a beautiful screen up close.

review_title: Excellent buy for a flexible input IPS monitor solution
review_body: Pros:

review_title: Problem not so much with monitor, but with ASUS Customer Service
review_body: I recently bought an Asus VS247H-P 24-Inch Full-HD LED Monitor, but sent it back due to really bad customer service (1. no phone number to call with problems; 2. long wait for email tech-help; and, 3. when customer service did get back to me via email, the advice was unhelpful - I had, in fact, already tried everything they suggested and wrote that in the email I sent). To make matters worse, when I tried to find the customer service number, I clicked on the link for US service and was taken repeatedly to a blank page or error page (regardless of which browser I used). The problem I had with the ASUS was that I could not get the correct screen resolution - everything was distorted. There were no driver disks included and my computer (Dell Dimension E310 - yes, I know, it's old) only recognized the monitor as a generic monitor. After being frustrated with ASUS and not willing to spend weeks trouble-shooting, I sent the ASUS back (and Amazon was AWESOME in refunding my purchase the DAY I DROPPED THE PACKAGE OFF TO BE SHIPPED!).

review_title: A little finicky, but a solid investment
review_body: I was looking for a second monitor but didn't have a second VGA port to plug it in to. After some research, I came across this monitor. I was a little skeptical on the quality, but once I got it working, I was impressed. It was a little tricky to get it working. First, for me at least, I did need two USB ports to power it, if you have a USB 3.0 port, you might be able to get around that.

This can't compare with a regular desktop monitor.  Just remember that it is for caring around to give you more real estate for you laptop.  This isn't a gaming monitor.  Movies on it are acceptable but my laptop built-in monitor seems better.

review_title: Plug and Play with Windows 10, Glossy screen
review_body: Only thing I don't like about this monitor is the glossy screen. If you are using it in a well lit area, you will get annoying reflections.  Otherwise it's plug and play.  Plugged it into laptop with Windows 10 and about a minute later the monitor displayed a mirror image of my laptop monitor.  Did not have to install anything to get it to work.

review_title: This monitor is great if you need to have a 2nd monitor while ...
review_body: This monitor is great if you need to have a 2nd monitor while on the move. I work from home and can basically set my office up in my living room. If I need to get out of the house it is light enough to take to a local coffee shop. I recommend this for anyone who needs a nice monitor​ that can be set up and tore down quickly.

review_title: Would give it 5 stars except for one extremely annoying feature, the auto rotation of the screen
review_body: Would give it 5 stars except for one extremely annoying feature, the auto rotation of the screen. I use it as an external laptop monitor in a vehicle for the large map displays and every time I hit a bump the screen orients itself in portrait mode. This feature is horrible because I cannot find any way to turn it off. Due to this, the monitor it pretty much useless for me.

review_title: Works really well, but be careful of the driver installation
review_body: I use this with my work laptop that is running Windows 7 64 bit.  When I first installed the USB drivers the monitor work on the first try.  Then there was a message that popped up saying I didn't have the most current drivers and to click to go out and get the latest.  That was a mistake.  Not only did the monitor cease to work, but it took several reboots to uninstall the drivers.  After reloading the drivers that came with the monitor again I didn't allow it to upgrade and it has been working just fine since.

review_title: This is a perfect solution to needing a second screen for a laptop
review_body: This is a perfect solution to needing a second screen for a laptop.  It's the same size as the laptop and enables you to work more efficiently without having to switch back and forth between screens on a single display.

This never worked, the information contained in the box doesn't even acknowledge windows10 as a valid operating system. The box it was shipped in was weak and the product cannot even be returned in it.

review_title: it works great.. using it for a 3rd monitor on ...
review_body: it works great ..using it for a 3rd monitor on my MSI GT70 2PE Dominator Pro 890 ...but I am having driver problems trying to get all three monitors to work while gaming ....maybe I need just set it up for the laptop monitor and this one only ....it may have something to do cause it's all USB powered and played ! ...and it may be interfering with my other monitor that is VGA and 120VAC powered ! ...but I will still keep it cause it fits inside my MSI Dragon Back Pack with the computer and all my goodies with no problem ! even got a Hauppauge TV Tuner and was watching my local TV stations on it ...while I was surfing the web on the laptop monitor !

Good product, lacks of brightness and contrast controls but if you investigate you can find "ScreenBright" app. First you will need to install the most recent Display Link drivers, after these steps, it was great!

I have two of these for my home workstation (mac). They are very nice. I can't say much about their suitability for gaming or movie-watching, but for work and general computing, a good choice for the price.

review_title: Seeing some screen bleeding but that's fine i knew when i bought this monitor it had ...
review_body: color, connectivity, and vividness are all there. Seeing some screen bleeding but that's fine i knew when i bought this monitor it had some bleeding, the monitor works and runs great! Ill keep everyone posted!
Great picture easy to set up! Works amazing other than the speakers. The audio is horrible!

review_title: which still I was willing to deal with because of how bad my old monitor was
review_body: Haven't had any issues with it so far.

Good colors, good response time. Overall a solid monitor. My one gripe is that it goes black for about 2 seconds whenever the screen flashes to black even briefly (such as alt-tabbing out of a fullscreen application)
nice monitor for the money. clear and bright, does the job.

This is a great monitor. I love the display quality and the size. The only problem is that it has no speakers and thus the 4 star rating. I use it for my xbox as well as my laptop display. Besides that everything else is awesome!

review_title: ... the monitor is about a 1/4" which is much better than most I've seen (nearly bevel-less)
review_body: The border between the screen and edge of the monitor is about a 1/4" which is much better than most I've seen (nearly bevel-less). Great quality and great settings/customization

review_title: Good screen, but no VESA mounting holes
review_body: I really like this screen, but there are no VESA mount holes.  I cannot use this on my monitor arm as I originally intended.  The screen is edge-to-edge, bright with consistent colors.  I dinged 1 star for the lack of industry standard vesa mounting options.
great monitor for the home office, great colors, easy to adjusts to your likeness, no complaints and would purchase another would as needed.

review_title: Awesome Monitor! 1 failed after 13 months, but then awesome warranty service!
review_body: I bought 2 of these and received them both on time and in flawless condition. No dead or stuck pixels. Although I don't have any color calibration equipment I am very pleasantly surprised at how well these monitors perform when running through a few online monitor-calibration web sites. I am upgrading from a Samsung Synchmaster 2232BW and this monitor outperforms or equals in every respect. Also, both of these monitors display colors/brightness/gamma extremely similarly right-out-of-the-box, so there was VERY little tweaking needed for me to get them to match up.

review_title: Wrong size 24" but still really good
review_body: My old Acer 24" has died.  I bought this to replace it.  Everything is great.  Much better picture.  WAY better actually.  They give you BOTH DVI and analogue cables.  And the power cable.  I just dont remember getting both.  I think I had to buy the DVI cable with the Acer.
Very upset with my monitor stopping working after only a month and a half of use. Very disappointed

Only complaint is I think I had a dead/dying pixel right in the middle of my screen. Not sure if it's worth shipping it back, but UGH RIGHT IN THE MIDDLE. I say "dying" because it's not as bright after the monitor has been on a while, seems more noticeable on startup. That might be my imagination though. See the green dot under the word "on" in my terribly blurry pic (screen is really sharp, just failed at getting an accurate pic in that respect).

review_title: So far so good. Love having 2 inputs...could have three
review_body: I bought this because I needed something with an HDMI input. This not only has that but I can easily switch between VGA, DVI, and HDMI with the touch of a button on the front of the monitor. I have my security system DVR and computer running to this, so if I want to monitor my cameras I just hit that button and presto, there they are. I was worried that since the security system is running 24/7 the monitor would switch to whatever input was sending a signal, happily this is not the case. You could have 3 things hooked up to this going to each input. Picture is great, very vivid. I do not foresee having any problems with this monitor, but if I do I will update my review

Honestly it's a good moniter, but as many people have pointed out the moniter wobbles at the slightest touch. But I haven't had an issue with it yet. If you have pets or kids I'd recommend getting a different stand or a mount for it. Because if you're gaming or working on a spread sheet and they bump your desk the moniter will wobble for a good 10-15 seconds. The colors quality is fine if you are a normal person like me.
For about 5 years now I have run a 4 monitor setup of identical DELL 24" LCDs.

review_title: Tilts to the right...otherwise it's good.
review_body: I like the way this monitor looks. However, I have the same issue as someone else described. My monitor tilts to the right. I've tried to screw and unscrew the stand a few times to no avail. I kept the monitor because it would be more hassle to return it. Instead, I just slip a piece of folded paper under the stand to even it out. It's a shame.

Ordered three of these to create a surround of mounted monitor. I've not had any color issues with these monitors and currently have them all mounted on a stand.  This monitor is VERSA mountable and come with platforms.  The platforms are optional on the monitors although the stands do not come off.  Also, these monitors do not have sound functionality which means you'll have to buy speakers separately.  I would recommend these monitors to anyone!

review_title: Love it with a slight problem
review_body: I'm a photographer and decided I needed a desktop machine again as well as my laptop.  I got this because of the reviews and the price and really love it.  It took me quite a bit of work before I could calibrate it to my printer but the end result is very satisfactory.  It was way too bright and yellow but that can be adjusted. Unfortunately I have to return it for a replacement.  The connection to the power supply is faulty and with any movement it'll shut down and it takes lots of jiggling before I can get it to connect again. I didn't see any other problems of this nature so figure mine is a fluke, so keeping my fingers crossed that the next one won't have that problem.

Seems like a decent portable monitor. The issue is compatibility with the USB driver software. I am not a techie, but spent a great deal of time trying to resolve the issue. The AOC support folks were very helpful, but could not resolve the issue. Tried to load the USB drivers, but was told it was not compatible with Log Me In driver. There may have been other compatibility issues as well. If you are interested I would suggest trying to download the displaylink usb driver software from the displaylink site prior to buying the monitor. If you are able to download then you should be good to go. The monitor itself is lightweight and I liked the stand. disappointed I could not use. Not sure why there would be a compatibility issue with the USB driver, seems like a major impediment to future sales. Be warned, when I did download driver from enclosed CD it crashed my computer and I had to do a reset. If there is a compatibility issue, better served trying from Display Link website, it will not download if there is an issue.

review_title: I feel like this could easy have used an HDMI by-pass as ...
review_body: The only problem I really have with this is when you're trying to use it as the only monitor on the machine. Especially if you're formatting that machine. Doesn't quite work for that. I feel like this could easy have used an HDMI by-pass as well.

In my home office, I have two external monitors connected to my laptop. The workflow in my business is much easier on my eyes and brain with three screens to view multiple documents, browser, eBook contents, and email from clients. And I want to mention the only way I was able to set up TWO external monitors with my laptop is because of a previous purchase - an external video card made by IOGear. Highly recommended if your system cannot support two external monitors.

review_title: Works Great with my Microsoft Surface Pro 4
review_body: Downloaded the drivers from the Displaylink website.  Plugged it in and it worked!  Easy-peasy!  I was concerned the USB output from my Surface Pro 4 would not drive the display.  Not a problem.

review_title: Problems with: Bootup/Bitlocker, Duplicate mode during gaming, NVIDIA Control Panel
review_body: This display is certainly portable, and seems to work fine even when plugged into a single USB 2.0 port. However, even when I plug both of its plugs into a USB 3.0 port, it continues to experience several problems that greatly diminished its value to me:

review_title: Great for work. Portability a major plus.
review_body: A great easy additional monitor. I use this to add a second screen to my laptop or all-in-one when I am working from home and need the extra screen. The one plug set-up means I can carry it with my laptop. No need for power. Perfect for what it is. Very light weight. Plug and play. Would definitely recommend for work purposes. Not sure how it would be for any serious video viewing or gaming but for my purposes this thing is great.

review_title: The screen was easy to install and worked great for the firs couple ...
review_body: I was really looking forward to this screen as I travel a lot.  Since I always need to handle multiple documents at the time, a second screen is essential.  The screen was easy to install and worked great for the firs couple of months.  Then after that, it would only turn on once in a while.  I noticed it was because the plug in the back was very loose.  So always adjusting it became the norm.  Then I experimented with some double sided tale to keep it place.  But every couple of weeks or so, I'd have to change the tape.  But now, it doesn't come on at all.  When you buy something like that you expect to use it for more than a few months.  Very disappointing.  Since I need the additional screen, I'll have to get another.  This one is beyond the return date.  But I will take my chances with another brand.

review_title: I bought this to replace another AOC monitor that I ...
review_body: I bought this to replace another AOC monitor that I had had for about a month and it cracked and I could no longer use it. I had this monitor in use for about 2 weeks when the cord used to connect it to my laptop broke. After emailing the company 2 times with no response I finally found a phone number to call. They gave me a link so I could purchase a replacement cord online. I finally received the cord, I plugged it and now this replacement monitor is also cracked at the bottom and can no longer be used. When the first monitor cracked I thought I must have done something to crack it. When I ordered the replacement I ordered a cushion sleeve to place the monitor in to protect it. I have babied this monitor so that it would not crack. Now that it has cracked the same exact way the initial monitor cracked and I have been extremely protective of the monitor I would definitely say it is a design flaw. Very disappointed.

review_title: Awesome screen for someone like me who travels 90%
review_body: Awesome screen for someone like me who travels 90%..  Brighter than I expected and good resolution. Definitively a good idea to opt for the 1080 version rather than the slightly bigger screen with lower resolution.

review_title: Good product except having to troubleshoot them occasionally due to ...
review_body: Bought three of these for my supervisors at work. They sometimes stop working after software updates and I have to reinstall new drivers (mac) from the website. Besides that they are light, have minimal cables and a decent image. Good product except having to troubleshoot them occasionally due to the driver issues
Bought 2 of these. Very crisp picture, sleek design, Great price!

review_title: Monitor continues to flicker even after flickering videos/graphics are not being displayed anymore
review_body: the colors are very good. The thin bezel is very nice when having multiple monitors next to each other. One problem I found is flicker burning. If a portion of the screen has an image with too much flickering such as flashes or rapid changes between very dark colors and very bright colors then that section of the monitor will continue to flicker for long time. Very bad quality screens. also ghosting is an issue but it is IPS screen so ghosting was expected.

review_title: Great product, could use a minor change
review_body: I haven't had any problems with the monitor, and it looks great for the price! My only complaint is that the monitor sits on the connection to the base, instead of physically being connected. I have almost dropped the monitor a few times, and have had the base drop out while moving it.

Less than 1 year after purchase, the screen has an LED failure and continues to have a yellow tint.  (No matter how many changes to the picture settings.)  Otherwise, picture quality was perfectly good until then.

review_title: I didn't expect it to be as good as it is
review_body: For the price that it is, I didn't expect it to be as good as it is. Thought it would just be a mediocre 1080p monitor, but boy was I wrong, I overclocked it to 75hz and it is just beautiful, the slim bezels, the angle views. My only complaint is the glossy body (not the screen) which is a fingerprint and dust magnet.

review_title: These monitors are really good; much better than the HP's that the Acers ...
review_body: Our company just bought several hundred units.  These monitors are really good; much better than the HP's that the Acers are replacing.  .

review_title: Have been quite pleased with this monitor
review_body: Have been quite pleased with this monitor.  The HDMI input is nice.  Picture quality is great, and I like the energy star rating.  Also, has a speaker plug on the monitor, so can plug in there or back of computer.  Reviews were good and for the price I've been happy with this monitor.
