Awesome monitor, love the thin bezels and elegant stand and finish of the display.

review_title: so great quality for a cheap monitor
review_body: It has no ips bleed. I had a $1500msrp ips panel with alot of blb, so great quality for a cheap monitor.
nice viewing monitor
I have been using this monitor for awhile now, not a single pixel went out. The picture is extremely clear. Has various options to choose from for viewing ex Gaming, Movies, Surfing Web.
Great for the price.

review_title: Don't pay much, don't expect much, didn't get much.
review_body: I initially got a pb258 from asus and could not get the color/brightness/contrast right. So i returned it and got this because its like my 2013 asus 28" monitor. Sitting side by side you could tell a huge difference. The only difference on paper was one was 1" bigger and my old one doesn't have DP, only HDMI. The problem i had with this monitor was the ghosting on the letters. When i started Steam i could hardly read what games i had because everything was double. I didn't have high expectations from such a cheap monitor but i do expect to be able to at least read the screen! I returned this for an asus PB278Q 1440p and its absolutely awesome!

Great Monitor. I needed another monitor to use with an existing 22" monitor. I chose this and it has worked great. I've always like Asus products and this is no different. I has a nice picture but just wish you could move the monitor up or down vertically so I could match the height of the other monitor. There are a number of them out there that offer this feature. I had to craft a wooden box for the monitor to sit on to get the heights to match.

This was my first monitor for my first build and  it's perfect. The stand isn't flimsy in my opinion like a lot of other people say but if you bump into your desk it will move. There's never been any fear that it was in danger of wobbling off the stand or falling over.

review_title: These are some really nice monitors. We purchased 3 of them
review_body: These are some really nice monitors.  We purchased 3 of them, one for each of the other members of my family (we all have our own computers) and they really look nice.  The only two problems are: 1. You MUST set up the NVIDIA control panel settings to output CMYK rather than RGB or the colors look very flat and grayish.  Once you have it set up right, they're gorgeous... and 2. There's a bit of edge bleed through, where a black screen (such as a screen saver) shows a bit grayish around the edges. It's a somewhat slight effect, but I was surprised considered this is an LED monitor.  But the size for the price, and the excellent refresh rate when gaming, definitely worth 4+ stars.

review_title: Colors are excellent. I use this for gaming purposes (Skyrim
review_body: I've had this monitor (VS248H-P 24") for a few months now, and the images are sharp, crisp, and there is no flicker. Colors are excellent. I use this for gaming purposes (Skyrim, iRacing, etc) and it works great.

review_title: They don't transition from one input to another easily, but I primarily use them on just my ...
review_body: They don't transition from one input to another easily, but I primarily use them on just my work laptop, so it isn't that big a deal. They are pretty sharp for such low-end cost displays.

review_title: excellent quality, easy to setup, sturdy, for a great price
review_body: Purchased this item on April 21, 2014.

The monitor broke after six weeks, a few days after the warranty expired.  (This is the second computer-related item I've bought from Amazon recently that died just beyond its returnable date.)  As another reviewer wrote, Asus customer service might as well have been a pre-recorded message for all the help the tech provided. The basic message was, "Wow, too bad."  I'm done with Asus.

review_title: A great addition to your mobile office!
review_body: Just received my monitor from Amazon. Hooked it up, installed the software without a hitch. Product worked right out of the box. Adjustments that you would usually find on the monitor itself can be located in your system tray and adjusted via on-screen interface. No fumbling with buttons. Hooray! The monitor auto rotates just fine.

Love this screen for work. I travel all the time and this is light weight and slim and fits right into my briefcase and durable. The full HD is great and the thing is durable. I work allot with spreadsheets and presentations and have a bunch of apps open and this is great. It was delivered on time, but be on the look out for it because it is delivered in the original box, you don't want to give someone the opportunity for a five finger discount. I would and have recommended this product.

This has literally changed my life I love this product I use it all the time it extends my desktop on my older Apple laptop and I cannot even explain how amazing it is it’s so inexpensive I love it so much highly recommended. There is literally one cord that’s it.

I purchased this monitor for the sole purpose to have system monitoring applications visible at all times, both at work and on my gaming PC at home. This device delivered. Personally my only grip about the device is the viewing angles. A side note, related to the DisplayLink drivers required for this monitor and virtually all USB monitors, SLI will not work while this monitor is plugged into your system. There is a driver conflict which causes issues during full screen gaming on your Non USB monitor. DisplayLink has been aware of this for years and cares not to address it.
I have a mobile clinic, in a rv type truck. I used this instead if a regular monitor for the energy savings.

I am an auditor and every time I have pulled this out and used it while traveling for work someone has come up and said "I HAVE to get one of those!"  An excellent option if you need extra screen space while working on you laptop.  Very simple setup and install.  Lots of options for positioning (use either screen as your main screen, set up with extra screen to left or right).  Seamless transition of mouse from one screen to the other.  Highly recommend!  Great gift for college students who are enrolled in online classes.
One of the plugs doesn't work and it has difficulty staying connected. The price is much too high for the quality.

Can not recommend this enough. While working at a public accounting firm they supplied the older version of these which were dim and not good, so I was hesitant to buy this but needed another screen. The updated version of this is fantastic. It is just about as bright as my ultrabook, not grainy unless I jam my face against the screen, auto rotates when the screen is rotated, and is very light. It does come with a neoprene sleeve so if you were going to buy an additional case like I did, you don't need to. The cable I hear is junk and did not bother using it and purchased another on amazon for 5 bucks. If you need a dual screen and are not relying on it for art type projects, you will  love this updated AOC screen.

review_title: Great monitor that gets the job done (but there may be a caveat)
review_body: This monitor does what it needs to do, nicely. The display is vibrant and crisp, with decent resolution. Refresh rate is good...no noticeable lag or stutter when I'm using the monitor as extended desktop, even when I'm playing 1080p videos. Build quality is good. The included pouch is handy for travel. No external power required, it just plugs into one USB port and you're good to go. I loved this monitor but unfortunately must return it because of the Displaylink driver.

review_title: Definatly not designed to be mobil
review_body: If you are looking for a display that is portable DO NOT BUY THIS ONE. My first trip to use the display was at one of my accounts, it was embarrassing!  Alter bragging about the neat new tool I had found. I thought this would be the ideal way to sit across a desk and review the data with my account and both have our own screen to view. When I brought out the AOC e 1659Ywu display monitor from it's travel case, the monitor image was a series of blobs, broken. It traveled in a roll on travel case placed in the protected area I would place my laptop. DO NOT BUY THIS ONE

review_title: It reverts to dim screen and there is no way ...
review_body: It reverts to dim screen and there is no way to stop that and the product literature is of no help.  If Acer see this they can call me with instructions to deal with this.  307.763.7219  .I am about to buy another one from HP.  This is a real frustrating POS.
Great monitor. Value oriented IPS screen that's great for casual.

review_title: Great monitor that is large and sleek
review_body: This monitor is wonderful.  Works as intended every time.  I love the large size of it; it is large, yet sleek at the same time.

review_title: It is not good at good.
review_body: I bought this product in July. The color of the screen is too bright so that it hurts my eye when I read texts. Now the screen's HDMI port is broken in August. Not a good product at all.
Acer rules for good value and quality.

review_title: I bought two of these monitors for the new Asus ...
review_body: I bought two of these monitors for the new Asus desktop computer I purchased on Cyber Monday in 2015 due to all of the positive reviews. Not to mention, Amazon stated that this monitor and the PC I bought were frequently purchased together. No brainer, right? Wrong.

review_title: Almost perfect for the price if only it had VESA mount.
review_body: Very thin and attractive monitors with nice picture and minimal bezel.  Just wish that they had VESA mounting holes included. This is the only monitor I have bought in the last 8 years that does not include it.
This monitor has wasted countless hours of my time.

review_title: I got 2 and I use them to work. ...
review_body: I got 2 and I use them to work. I bought them because of the blue-light filter and the flicker-less technology.
Unfortunately, I had the monitor for roughly a day before deciding to return it.

I must say this is my second Asus monitor and I love it. The picture is clear and the resolution sharp. It is a tad bright out of the box but another reviewer here posted their settings and I took that and tweaked it a little. Overall I am very happy with this monitor and I would buy it again.

review_title: HDMI is weird. Also, rebate sucks.
review_body: something is odd with the HDMI, as my computer won't wake up from sleep. Works OK with DVI.
I will make this short and sweet. There are already tons of lengthy reviews for this device.

Other reviews warned of problems with the colors out of the box, I was using the HDMI port and while they were slightly off, as soon as I changed the settings to one that fit my environment (Theater looked best for me) it was excellent.  I had considered other monitors for about the same price at places like Costco etc, but I always seemed to have problems with dead pixels in the past.  Not this time.  It is also a very sleek design and looks great.

review_title: Own 3, would buy again if needed.
review_body: These monitors are good for a decent setup. I have three of these sitting on an Ergotech arm and they look good. I personally like to have all the same monitors, and these did the trick. They are not too expensive, nor are they extremely cheap. Be wary though, these screens will tear if you are running games at over 60FPS. I have to 980ti's in my computer and that is way overkill. A simple GTX 970 will do these monitors wonders

this would get a better rating if the viewing angle was better.  the specs are quite inaccurate.  i have 2 of these flanking my main monitor, and these 2 are swiveled into portrait. the problem comes as i move my face closer and farther away, the images on these Asus's becomes noticeably brighter and darker.  if horizontal, the side-to-side viewing angle is fine.  but the way i have them installed, my side-to-side becomes the monitors up-down.  and it really is pretty bad.  doing graphics and video  i have to restrict my main monitor for the detail work, and have lesser pieces on the sides.  ones that don't have to do with image, color, correction, enhancement.  but they work and are cheap, so go for it if you just want it for your main monitor.

Open and honest, I am not happy with how much tinkering was require to get this display to a clear, vivid picture. As many reviews state the colors are horribly washed out. I read many reviews of people posting their color, brightness, and contrast schemes to little avail. I did settle on one set, and later found the "digital vibrance" setting in my NVidia cards control panel. Once adjusted I was taken back by the amazing colors achieved.

Finally decided to buy 3 monitors and after a lot of research (and not wanting to spend on IPS), I bought these.  Powered them all up, made adjustments to the screen settings, and everything looks great!  I ran a pixel test on all three, and thought I had dead pixels, but took some light compressed air to the screen and noticed it was just a speck of dust - all three were perfect ZERO dead pixels; I consider myself lucky. Even if there were any dead pixels, you cannot blame Asus as the standard for LCD manufacturers is 3 or less dead pixels per monitor.  [If you are hard up on a single dead pixel, go buy a professional series monitor with a zero dead pixel policy and empty your pockets of a lot of $$$.]

This monitor is completely awsome for the price. I bought it originally to use with my Xbox 360 through the HDMI port. it works really well and with the 3.5mm audio jack in the rear I can even hook it up to my speakers or headset. The image is pretty good not the absolute best but its very good for the price. 1080 looks pretty good. I did notice that up close the pixels are a tiny bit noticeable but that could also be my very sensitive eyes for that sort of thing. the colors looked pretty vivid and where not over saturated. Also the viewing angles are pretty good. I eventually got a new computer and hooked it up alongside my Xbox and it says in the description that you need a VGA to DVI cable that is included to run DVI. Mine came with a DVI cable instead so I plugged in my computer and it works using the DVI cable plugged into the DVI port so the description is slighly wrong. also I found the volume in the settings but nothing comes out which could just be that Im using an Xbox or there may be no internal Speakers. I also noticed that the stand and the way the monitor sits it is kind of wobbly but not to bad. Overall this montitor is very good and I would recommend it to anyone who wants a HD monitor without spending to much money

Extremely easy assembly (1 screw), Has a fantastic picture, movies and games look wonderful. very fast 2ms response time so no blur in even the fastest on screen action. Colors are vibrant. Has several preset picture levels (Splendid, Brilliant, Games, Theater, Sports, etc...) plus every setting is user adjustable to get it just right for your tastes.

I don't know how I got anything done at work before I started using 2 monitors.  It makes work life so much easier and more productive.  The only problem was when I work away from the office.  So, I decided to order this LCD Monitor for those times.  My typical works tasks involve, web browser, IM, e-mail, spreadsheets and other documents on Windows platform.  The display for me is clear, bright and easy to read.  I like that the stand allows me to change the viewing angle as needed.  I also like the at the stand is designed so as not to interfere with the cable.  It was easy to set up and the case it comes with is a nice addition.  I feel it gives the display that much more protection in my bag.

I recently received this product as a birthday gift and I am very impressed with the monitor so far.  It is light-weight and easy to swap between computers, the display is sharp for my needs, colors are crisp and bright.  I primarily use the monitor as a second screen for my all-in-one desktop PC (HP Pavilion 23 - AMD A6) and my older laptop (Toshiba Portege - Intel Core i3).  I chose this monitor because while my laptop has an HDMI out capability my desktop lacks that option and as a computer programmer I find it very useful and productive to have a dual-monitor setup.  Since this monitor operates over USB 3.0 it was the only solution that would accommodate both computers without the need for extra equipment/dongles.

I was going to return it when I first got it and screen was just too bright, there is no doc to tell how to adjust it, then I checked the other comments, some said it is not adjustable. I submit help request form on their web site. And the support send me a pdf to show how to adjust the settings. Just right click on the display manager icon on the system tray and select this product and settings, then you see the screen that you can adjust brightness.
Did not work but company would not replace.

I absolutely love this monitor!  It is well worth price.  I travel all the time and this monitor travels extremely well.  I have yet to experience any issues with the cord as described by other reviewers.  The only downfall of the monitor is I cannot figure out how to adjust the brightness.  It is a little darker than I prefer, but nothing I cannot live without.  The screen is huge for a portable monitor and I love that fact.

review_title: getting a replacement will not be so easy. Other than that
review_body: Only negatives were the Windows 10 driver did not come with it.  I had to download it from their website.

Fantastic for travel if you need a lot of screen real estate to work.  Easy to use but eats up a lot of USB ports - even if you have a 3.0 port which is what it says you can use without a second port to plug into. More detents on the stand height would also be nice as the single locked in height puts the screen at an inconvenient angle.

Absolutely love this monitor.  Light weight, easy to move from room to room and travel with. One difficulty... I use with my work laptop which does not allow CD's to download and I was only able to find an outdated driver online.  It still works though.  I would definitely recommend it.  It was recommended to me by a colleague and now several of us have one.

review_title: I have had it a few months and it will ...
review_body: I have had it a few months and it will no longer work and I guess I am out of my 1 month return window. When I plug it into any computer it just flashes and makes all other screens flash as well. It renders the computer un-usable. DO NOT BUY THIS!!!

This was a life saver on a recent trip. My only complaint is the USB connection in the back of the monitor is very sensitive. It comes disconnected if you bump or move the monitor. I wish it fit tighter. Otherwise I love it.

review_title: Non Functional and not good warranty service...
review_body: I have never left a review on anything but this screen was TERRIBLE!! It did not work when I received it to take on a trip so I didn't use it and didn't try it again until the return period was over. On 3 different computers it only flickers and will not show anything. I contacted the manufacturer and was told I could send it back to be repaired. The cost to mail it back to be repaired was $20 that the company should have been responsible for considering I have only had it a month and a half.  I will never purchase this brand again.

review_title: This screen is pretty great to be honest
review_body: This screen is pretty great to be honest. It comes with a small protective case and it fits in my computer bag. Really nice to have a mobile office.  I have an older macbook (2011) so I was worried the drivers might not work, but I downloaded them and it fired right up. The image quality is good for the price point, but not amazing. Perfectly adequate for the work I do, which is word docs, spreadsheet, emails, and stuff like that. I would probably not get this for photo or video editing - but if you do that for a living you know that already.

Exactly what I needed.  Obviously not as clear or bright as my main laptop screen, but more than adequate.  The carrying case that came with this model sealed the deal.  As other buyers have noted, the USB cord is a little short, so you are going to be restricted as to which side of your computer you want to set this screen up on if you only have USB 3.0 on one side of your system.  Still a great product however...even with a few quirks.

review_title: Don't Buy It! You Will Regret It
review_body: Could never get the resolution right. It no longer comes on, though the computer shows it connected, and the screen flickers. The cable port in the back appears to be damaged. It was a loose connection from day one, but I thought it was a design element, so worked with it. Portability is nice, but it really is just a cheap piece of crap.I've written off the $99 as AOC comes up with a million exceptions to what is covered and they don't pay for shipping back and forth under warranty. Amazon only offers a month to return it. So out a hundred and devoted to making sure no one makes the mistake of buying an AOC product.
Need an extra screen on the road? This is it!!

review_title: Great when it works, but it work suffice for the long term
review_body: Great when it works, but it isn't something that would suffice for the long term.
Bought this as a portable auxiliary monitor to use when working on my laptop while traveling. Returned it because there was some mouse lag (delay when moving the mouse around the auxiliary monitor)

review_title: I think it was a great investment for the price
review_body: My only issue was related to instal as it requires CD access to install and if I don't have my portable drive I never would have been able to use it. It's also a little bigger than I had thought but it fits in my work laptop and the quality is solid. I think it was a great investment for the price!

review_title: Anyone else's mouse cursor get stuck?
review_body: I love the extra screen!  The only reason I am giving 3 stars is because my mouse cursor has been getting stuck when using my second screen.  I haven't researched why this happens yet.  I may try to see if using an actual mouse instead of my laptop mouse pad works better.  If I can figure it out and my mouse  cursor stops getting stuck, then I will definitely change my rating.

I like the monitor and its convenience. I use it for a second monitor when I'm traveling and it works well with that. Sometimes I pack it im my backpack next to my laptop. Sometimes I put it in my luggage sandwiched between clothes.

review_title: Good quality, excellent price. Most pleased with this purchase.
review_body: Performs as expected in terms of size, resolution, and sound. Not a fancy monitor, but a great deal. I use it for work, because it allows me to display two documents blown up to the size of a letter page side by side. I also use it to watch high-definition videos and for computer gaming. The monitor is, of course, plug-and-play. Note the availability of various ports as listed in the product description by the seller.

review_title: Great cheap monitors that can be used in multiple monitor ...
review_body: Great cheap monitors that can be used in multiple monitor setups.  Buyer beware:  I purchased two of these to be auxiliary monitors around an Asus VG248QE monitor and bought a triple monitor stand.  These have roughly the same dimensions as the nicer Asus monitor, but the VESA mounting holes are just slightly off so that the two monitors are about 0.25" higher than the VG248QE in the middle.  Definitely still a fan of Asus monitors and these work great for what they are: cheap yet reliable monitors.  If I was willing to fork over more money or had a use for 144Hz refresh rate on my auxiliary monitors, I would have just purchased two more VG248QE monitors.  I hope going forward Asus does their best to line up VESA mount holes so their same size monitors can be mixed and matched as I have done.

review_title: Really great monitor and awesome price
review_body: I recently purchased a higher end 24 inch Asus monitor as my main monitor, and I was looking for a decent secondary monitor. I originally purchased the HP Pavilion 22xw, but promptly returned it when I discovered it was not VESA mount compatible. I ordered this monitor with pretty low expectations, but I was pleasantly surprised. The color quality is actually pretty good, and I haven't had any issues with out. It is easily mountable, my only (minor) complaint is that the bezel attracts thumbprints like nobody's business. All in all, a pretty good buy!

review_title: Is good, but I had to make a couple of adjustments for it
review_body: I had two identical monitors and this was a replacement for one that failed. When I started it the first time I got a black border of about 3/4 of an inch all the way around. The responders to questions on here said that was a limitation of the operating system or my video card. The ASUS has a higher resolution than my existing monitor and side by side the difference was noticeable but not significant. I backed down the resolution of the ASUS a couple of notches to equal the other one and the border disappeared. This is acceptable to me. What is more noticeable is that the white on the ASUS is much brighter than on the old one which actually looks dingy and yellow like old laundry. It bothered me enough that I was willing to buy another ASUS but Amazon had raised the price by $13 already.

review_title: Solid monitor, no problems after a year.
review_body: I've had this monitor for over a year now, and decided now is a good time to write a review after giving it some good use.
This is quite a good monitor for the cost. It is light an thin and even has an easy hand tightening system for the base to make it easy to detach and transport.

Great picture at a fair price. Very happy with this monitor. Update 11/24/17 I ordered a second one not quite a year later and the new one I just received has a much richer color, a little disappointed that the first one wasn't as nice. My advice order your monitors together so they will match, and on my first one a blue dot appears and disappears but overall I wont change my 5 star because I do like them even they don't match.

review_title: Decent monitor, good price, not happy with the color rendering
review_body: I bought this monitor to connect to a Surface Pro 3 (i5) using a mini-DisplayPort to HDMI adapter. At first the color rendering was all washed out and playing with the various controls I couldn't get pictures looking as nice as they did on the Surace Pro screen. I looked up a few web sites on how to calibrate a monitor but it shouldn't be this much work - I'm not a professional graphic artist. The best I could do was to put the monitor in sRGB mode and delete the calibration profile from Windows. I got used to it after a day or two.

review_title: Unbelievable image quality for the price but the stand sucks.
review_body: I recently commited to this monitor during my adventure to build a gaming PC and let me just say, I'm still amazed by it. There were no issues with shipping or processing with Amazon Prime and the monitor came in perfect working condition (no dead pixels). The display on this screen blows my old 20" Dell monitor out of the water in terms of color and image sharpness. Games and videos are mesmerizing thanks to this screen and my GTX 660. I'm not an expert in any technical sense when it comes to graphics and all, but I know it looks damn good. I honestly can't wait to spend hundreds of hours in front of it.

review_title: The quality does not look "HD" at all and I'm overall annoyed and upset with this product
review_body: This monitor had input connection issues with my desktop, a very noticeable yellow tint on every display setting, and dead pixels. The quality does not look "HD" at all and I'm overall annoyed and upset with this product. I don't think I'll ever purchase an Asus ever again. I really shouldn't have relied so heavily on the positive reviews.

A great product especially if you are on the go. Does not need a plug outlet just a USB from your c ok computer and the screen will start up. I have noticed that I do have to unplug and plug the monitor in a couple of times as though the m ok nitro isn't catching. I bought an additional USB cord and still am having this issue. But otherwise it's a great product.

Really nice extra screen. Even planning to buy a second 1. I edit films, so even tho its not that big of a screen. Its enough. Bright. And you can even use it in portrait. Super response. Comes with CD, but for me plug and play did it.

This is a replacement to my last one which I accidentally dropped while rushing out the door :( This newer version is so much more slimmer though and sturdier as well. Quick and easy to install. I love that I can change so easily from Portrait to Landscape view depending on where Im sitting and how much room I have around me.

review_title: Good screen-customer service not so good
review_body: Screen is fine but the cord was fried when I received it. My company’s IT department verified it. I need another one and would like the seller to contact me.  2nd request.

review_title: Cheap cables can cause display flicker
review_body: Cable female jack on monitor bends easy. Cable was bent as well. Just be careful with it. Get the more expensive models if you can.

review_title: USB C cable gets loose and video keeps getting interrupted.
review_body: I really liked the form factor, the convenience of USB powered monitor, video quality etc. But in few days the USB C cable connection got loose. Any slight disturbance including typing on key board cuts of the video. I tried to purchase a cable on both on Amazon and Mono price, but couldnt get one with USB C Video.  Unless I find an HDMI to USB C adapter, this monitor is practically useless. I had seen some other reviews reporting same issue, so it is not just for me.
"CASE" is simply a protective sheet w/ magnets at either end. Stays put more or less to protect the screen, but NOT to act as a stand as pictured. VERY disappointed

review_title: Decent affordable product, a few complaints but not enough to return :)
review_body: I have the new iMac and had to download the drivers to use this. It works fairly well; however, I can't leave it plugged in all the time. If I turn my computer off, I have to have the secondary monitor unplugged before turning the computer backon, or else it does something to my mac's startup and it won't start up correctly. I have it turned vertically and for my purpose of having edits and copy on the monitor while I'm designing something on the main screen, it works just fine. It was affordable and looks nice. I just wish It didn't mess up my startup and I could leave it on... or that it had an on/off switch.

review_title: Great new piece of equipment for travel
review_body: I use this when traveling to boost my productivity by having a second monitor. Although it comes with a protective sleeve, there is not a lot of protection for the screen. I usually travel with a piece of hard cardboard cut to fit the screen and slide it in my notebook bag. I found that it works better to have it plugged in to the PC before you power-up the PC, otherwise it might go through the flashing image cycle trying to sync. It rotates the image when you change the orientation. The image is clear enough to read a PDF manual at normal resolution.

review_title: Works great and is so beneficial for presentations
review_body: Works great and is so beneficial for presentations. You can watch one screen while presenting on another using PowerPoint. Also, great to have 2 monitors when travelling - once you go multi, its hard to go back.

review_title: Nice fit, easy to mount, and looks great
review_body: I picked this up to use as part of a docking solution with my 15" MacBook Pro - just to have a larger screen available when I need to have the extra screen space.  I specifically chose this monitor for the size, it's VESA mount compatible, and uses HDMI.  The headphone port in back was a pretty nice bonus, though, so now I can have my external speakers plugged in somewhere without needing to have multiple cables running to my laptop.

This monitor is amazing. Right out of the box, the picture was spot on. I rummaged around the controls just to see what was offered and found even more amazing features. I settled on Theatre mode although I could have left it right where it was. The 24" size sure makes a difference from the 23.6" size. It just fit into my computer desk. Asus always makes good products. I have a laptop made by them that is also amazing. Well... before I get too chatty, I just want to say you can't go wrong with this monitor
Have ordered five of these for an office and they work wonderfully, the oldest being 1 year. Low eye strain after 8-12 hours of use with good contrast, brightness and color levels.

review_title: Reasonable image quality, very poor build quality
review_body: The Good: Inexpensive (among the cheapest on the market), reasonably good image quality (especially for the price). Matte finish. No dead or stuck pixels after 2 years.

review_title: Great full HD monitor on a budget
review_body: I purchased this monitor because of the great reviews it got on Amazon and because I've had good experiences with the Asus brand. So far the monitor has not disappointed. It offers a big screen, great visuals, and a fast response time all for under $150. Being so cheap, the monitor does sacrifice some features such as certain connectivity options and physical adjustment ability. However, if mostly what you're looking for in a monitor is great image and don't have hundreds of dollars to splurge on a top-end model, then I highly recommend this one.
I have ordered 5 of these up to this point. 2 back in 2015, and 3 more just a few weeks ago.

Came in perfect condition, crystal clear picture and no issues whatsoever. Great monitor. The only trouble I had was more of an operator error than anything, but apparently there are some presets on the monitor which can cause the gamma to bottom out during certain display times, particularly when the lighting of the game, movie, what have you, is low, such as caves or dark menu screens and so forth. I'm not sure if this is the monitor alone or the way it interfaces with certain video cards. Either way, you can customize the settings on the monitor or pick a different preset and the issue goes away. Given that I'm not losing any utility at all in light of that, still definitely a 5-star worthy monitor.

review_title: The display is fine and working nicely
review_body: I have this monitor for more than a year now. The display is fine and working nicely, but I faced the following issues and found that lot of others have faced the same thing.
I love how well this monitor works. The colors and details are amazing. Setup was a breeze, though the instruction manual is not the best.

review_title: Unsuitable for graphics works due to uneven brightness.
review_body: As this monitor apparently uses just a single row of LEDs at the bottom of the screen, it suffers from the old LCD-monitor problem that the screen is much brighter at the bottom than at the top - hence unsuitable for graphics works. What saves it from receiving only a single star is that it has brightness and contrast adjustments (although they are inverted). When both are cranked all the way up (the "standard" setting), the uneven brightness is less noticable;  however, this practically requires sunglasses to prevent snow blindness - no kidding!

review_title: Great once I got driver from other website
review_body: Very convenient once I figured out the driver. Driver from AOC website doesn’t work with Windows 10. You need to download driver from displaylink.com for Windows 10 compatability.

review_title: Nice add on for the heavy duty traveling consultant
review_body: This is a handy portable monitor for the person on the go.  I consult and have carried a full size monitor with my laptop for years.  This isn't quite as nice as the big monitor, but definitely a lot more portable.  It works well with just a USB connection for both power and signal, and is a little bigger than a tablet.  A definite plus to the consultants traveling equipment bag.

This is such a lightweight sleek monitor. I use it for teleworking and need an additional screen. Easy to install and setup. Now my husband wants to share it. Lol. No way!! It comes with a nice sturdy neoprene sleeve.

review_title: It's an excellent addition to my portable computing gear
review_body: It's an excellent addition to my portable computing gear! The quality is good. The resolution is lower than my laptop, which causes things to be disoriented when dragging from one screen to the other. The drivers came on CD, which most newer laptops don't have. Locating the correct driver on the internet was troublesome it took three tries to get one that worked correctly. Otherwise, I'm very happy with it.

review_title: Great little monitor for PC Works alright on Mavricks
review_body: I've used this on both.  For PC this is a perfect little monitor.

Brilliant idea, this one just wasn't bright enough for me. I have to use a Macbook for a coding course and the screen is very bright, so to look back at this one with its dullness was that much worse. But it's a good product. I bought the Pro versus (although I feel the same way about it, not bright enough).

I like the bigger screen (17" & 1600x900).  I was using a Lenovo LT1421 prior to this.  An extra monitor for my laptop is critical for the work I do.  Also seems to run just fine on just 1 usb 3.0 port on my HP DV7.  I regularly use it in portrait mode for viewing docs.  It's almost full size for legal docs.  The overall thinner dimension from the previous versions is nice too.

review_title: Convenient to carry and useful for work
review_body: Convenient to carry and useful for work. The monitor screen makes working so much easier. I had no idea the larger screen would make such a big difference. It enables sharing with my colleagues who were quite impressed! As a matter of fact, at least one plans to purchase his own screen.

review_title: Superb 2nd Monitor, Easy USB Plug In
review_body: Ordered the AOC 16 inch monitor for use with a laptop.  Easy driver installation.  The monitor has a kick-stand and adjusts to several angles, so it easy to place on most any flat surface.  I'm using it on Windows 7 and it works flawlessly.  I've used it for more than 3 months without any issues.  It comes with a slip-cover case which is easy to remove. If you are looking for an affordable and reliable 2nd monitor, that will also mirror your desktop so you can use it for presentations to small groups, this is the one to select.

Great asset for traveling consultant!  Very easy install and easy carry. However, it seems to interfere with the Lenovo solid state laptop sometimes.  Once in a while, after hours of use, it just freezes and cannot recover without a full system re-boot.  I'm not sure whether that's caused by the AOC or the Lenovo laptop. (Running Window 8.1)  I have two Lenovos and it does it with both.  This started after about 4 months of continued - 8 hr / day - use.

review_title: Worked fine for the first month.......now goes on and off randomly while in use..... :(
review_body: It's ok.  Would have liked an instruction book with it since i'm not very techno.  Picture is nice.  Just taking some time getting use to the elongated screen.
I bought a VS228H-P to replace my dying Samsung.

I absolutely love this monitor! It's very affordable and offers great contrast and colours! I use it for gaming as well as doing school work so for my needs it works out perfectly. It has 1 HDMI port, 1 VGA port, 1 DVI-D port I think and an adapter which is also DVI-D I think.

To date, I have purchased three of these for three different work stations. The fact that I keep buying them should say something. This is a good value for a IPS panel monitor. I have one on my home work station, where I do graphic arts, websites, photo and video editing and rendering, and two at a miniature railroad club where they use them for photo and video editing and rendering.

I am SOOOO happy I bought this monitor.  IMPORTANT NOTE HERE: I have a new laptop that just has HDMI input and came pre-installed with Windows 10.  I bought and returned not one but TWO monitors that did NOT work with this new combo.  One just would not adjust to anything but a stretched image, the other was just a VGA connection and did not work with a VGA to HDMI adapter.  This Asus has an HDMI connection and it was absolutely PLUG AND PLAY with a beautiful picture, auto-adjusted to size immediately, has easy to use buttons under the monitor for easy adjustment.  Can't say enough nice things and it was so inexpensive.  Would recommend to anyone!!

review_title: great monitor, gaming on this was perfect
review_body: Impressive quality, really loved this monitor. Right from the box it gives you directions on how to put up the whole thing. The monitor provides a lot of settings to perfect your brightness. Gaming was a lot better on this new monitor i bought, very happy that i bought my 24 inch screen that i did not want to peel off the plastic. Reccomand it!

It appears to be a good monitor.  I was initially confused about the VESA mounting holes, which was important to me.  Yes, there are threaded holes for VESA mounting.  What may not be so obvious is that they are covered by small rubber inserts that must be removed (using a paper clip or sewing pin).  These inserts look like they are part of the back cover, so it initially escaped my attention, and was ready to send the monitor back.  After I use the monitor for a while, I may increase the rating.to 5 stars - we'll see.

review_title: What a great monitor! It has been a few years since ...
review_body: What a great monitor! It has been a few years since my last monitor since I have adopted my Laptop as Primary.

review_title: slightly disappointed at color saturation but still a great deal
review_body: slightly disappointed in the brightness of the colors on this display. it seems i have to put the display in "game mode" in order to really see anything, but that kind of washes out all of the colors with "whiteness" or brightness. i hope a customer-service person from Asus is reading this and can get back to me.

review_title: This Is A Great New Generation Monitor
review_body: My new employment requires that I have a second monitor on my computer. After researching currently available monitors, and because my PC is an ASUS, I purchased this one. Not only am I pleased, I am amazed. My experience with computer monitors goes back to 1970 when it was a big deal to have a single monitor attached to the giant mainframe computer. No keyboard, just a monitor echoing what was printing on the console.

review_title: good but not all it says it is
review_body: nice monitor in general however it does not allow screen rotation as advertised. at least in my situation, where i cant use the CD drive because im running it on a macbook. the drivers on the internet i found don't see seem to work either and are organized terribly on the website making it hard to find and difficult to ensure your even using the right one. Aside from this I would be willing to give a higher rating if only I could get this feature to work.

Great quality monitors. I ordered two of them and have enjoyed the high resolution. Also, one of the monitor protective cases came damaged, but when I contacted AOC customer service, they shipped me out a new case immediately.  They let me keep the damaged case. Too bad I don't know how to stitch on the damaged velcro area because it would be a handly extra case.  Thank you AOC for superior customer service.

review_title: I travel a lot and have seen colleagues with a ...
review_body: I travel a lot and have seen colleagues with a second screen.  After 5-years of procrastinating I finally did it and purchased this second screen.  Wish I had done it sooner.  A bit of advice after you plug it into the laptop, go for a walk and give it time to download the driver and set up the screen.  Did not have anything on screen to let me know what the laptop was doing and it took almost 5-mins for the screen to lite up.  After the driver was installed, it now pops up immediately.

review_title: Works as intended as long as primary monitor is same refresh rate
review_body: Although it did what it was supposed to one thing I did not know was if your primary monitor is higher than 60hz it will cause problems with lag on both monitors. This is essentially useless for what I needed it for. I CAN find another use for it but I did now know about different refresh rates and such.

review_title: Monitor itself is great. Easy to use
review_body: Monitor itself is great. Easy to use, is light weight and comes with a protective sleeve. Not that you MUST download drivers for it to work. If you're planning on using it on a work computer that requires admin rights you'll be out of luck.

review_title: it was awesome! The problem is that after setting it up ...
review_body: Working remotely and being a grad student, a second monitor is a must for me. I bought this monitor and for the first couple weeks, it was awesome! The problem is that after setting it up and putting it away a few times, the cord started to become loose. The real issue is in the location of the port for the cord-- it gets tangled with the stand that comes out from the back of the monitor. I have tried to tape it onto the back of the monitor so the cord doesn't move, but even that didn't work.
This was exactly what I was looking for. Clear picture,  mobile and allows me to use two monitors any time and any where.

I bought the AOC e1759Fwu 17-Inch Ultra Slim and I gotta say, it was money well spent. It worked as expected and you cant beat the price. I only have 2 gripes. The hardware drivers are a bit wonky on Windows 7 (and not to mention hard to find) and the viewing angles are worse than I had expected (even for a TN panel). Otherwise, I love this product. It has seriously improved my workflow, especially the portrait mode ability.

Loving this thing.  Using it at home and on the go. The portrait view is great for viewing my code.  It's amazing light.  The screen quality is OK but, it's not fair to compare it to my Laptop screen. I am also using it to mentor some students and with the screen duplicated and the three foot USB cable I don't have the issue with 6 people trying to look over my shoulder.  The stand looks like it wouldn't be very stable but that's not the case.  It's very stable in both landscape and portrait.

review_title: plug n play and portability but lacking high resolution
review_body: resolution, plastic construction and feel, and attracts finger prints.

review_title: Great all round monitor, amazing quality!
review_body: Bought two of these monitors due to the low price.  One came in good working condition while the other had a vertical line of blue pixels running across the screen.  Amazon was notified and immediately sent a replacement. First thing i did was used Windows calibration and now this monitor looks amazing. It is fairly priced when compared to similar 1080p monitors in this size range (23.6 inches).

review_title: Nice little monitor with lots of options
review_body: This monitor is performing better then expected. I was going to send it back but a friend offered to by my old 22.5" so I figured what the heck, sold him that and kept this one. Glad I did.

review_title: Perfect monitor for dual / multiple screen setups
review_body: So, I wanted to give myself some time with the product before I wrote a review.. Note: this is a review for the 22-inch model. Recently it appears that the reviews for this product have combined for all monitor sizes. I've had my first one for about 6 months now, and just purchased a second one.
I had two mismatching monitors and decided I wanted matching ones for my new pc setup.  I bought these based on reviews and here is what I found:

review_title: Great for the price,no horizontal stand movement though :/
review_body: Beautiful display,especially for the price. Sits perfectly on my desk with a sturdy stand (which has a useful amount of movement up and down,around 6~ degrees,BUT there is literally no horizontal movement,instead you must move the entire stand if you want to move the screen,BUT this wasn't the reason why I bought it,so I'm very happy with this product.) Exactly 1 stuck pixel,red if your curious,I'm just hoping that after a while it'll start working again.

Well, there are some good things and some bad things, as always. First, the picture how it comes is washed out and faded. I was extremely disappointed at first, but once I changed the settings, it's gorgeous. I prefer a glossy screen, which this isn't, but for the huge price difference it's a very worthwhile sacrifice. One very large quirk of the screen itself is it's astounding ability to hold onto finger prints, no matter how hard you try to get them off. It can take a lot of effort (don't push too hard, or you may damage it!), but eventually, the marks will come off. I'd still recommend never touching it, and leaving it out of the reach of small children who don't know better. The build quality of the display itself is excellent, but the stand leaves much to be desired. That's not to say it won't last or doesn't serve it's purpose, but it can be VERY wobbly. If you're sitting still, it's not a problem, but otherwise it can be very obvious (when sitting down at your desk or changing position, for example). For the price, however, it's very much worth the money, and I'd absolutely (and am planning on) buy it again.

I use this screen as an external monitor to my laptop.  I use it for both productivity and entertainment.  The screen easily switches between different inputs and has a variety of settings for adjusting its appearance.  It only tilts back and forth, and only a limited distance, but that is sufficient for my needs.  It did seem to have one dead/faulty pixel on arrival, but I didn't feel like that was enough to return it and get a new screen.  The pixel may not have been dead, only faulty since it seems to have fixed itself after a few weeks of use.  I have the monitor for at least half the day usually when I am working from home, so it gets pretty good use - probably 4-5 hours at least everyday.  I don't use the speakers on it since I have external speakers, but they sounded pretty good for being monitor speakers.  Movies look great on it.  Overall, great value for its price.

review_title: lacks auto sense of signal but...
review_body: The only complaint I have is there is no auto sense for signals. For example, if the monitor is set for HDMI and but instead you plug in a Display Port - well - it won't work until you manually plug in a HDMI input, bring up the Menu and change it to Display Port...but in truth it's not that big of a deal since once the computer is set up. I mean, how often do you change your video input? Good monitor. No complaints.

For the price it's hard to give it less than 5 stars, but it barely lost that top rating because I wish it would swivel side-to-side, not just up and down.  It's also fairly wobbly & shaky at the slightest movement, but it's ok for me as my work surface is typically pretty steady.  The 3 inputs on the back are nice (VGA, DVI & HDMI).  Finally, it's the wide 16:9 or 16:10 aspect ratio (I can't recall which) makes it seem a little smaller than the 23.6" it actually is, and doesn't really feel any bigger than the 21.5" it replaced.
Prologue stuff:

review_title: ... different sites and having only 1 screen was getting annoying. Works excellently
review_body: Purchased monitor mainly to use at work since I have to travel to different sites and having only 1 screen was getting annoying.  Works excellently. Good picture quality- even played a HD movie on it to test.  I usually connect it to a USB3 hub that also has an Ethernet adapter and 1-2 flash drives. It works on both my Windows 10 laptops using built in drivers, but it's still recommended to install the DisplayLink drivers first to get all display mode options.

Fantastic little monitor. I use this for my voice chat program while gaming as a secondary monitor. Looks good for the price. Even has vesa mounting which is rare on this size and type of monitor. Good looking screen and housing. My only complaint is …where the hell is the power button… really I cant freaking find it. Would include a pic of it setup but amazon is being a pain about the pic.

review_title: Super lightweight for ease of mobility (I guess that's a ...
review_body: Fabulous product! Super lightweight for ease of mobility (I guess that's a good thing as this would be its primary market). I like the fact that the cable that comes with it gives you back the USB port it takes. I plugged it in and it was ready to go. I use a PC laptop and I am on the road constantly...this will make my work on the road as good as work at home. The dimension is a tiny bit funny to get used to, as it is very wide and not real tall, but it doesn't take much at all to adjust and I love it!!!! SO glad I made this purchase.

review_title: Very disappointed. Literature indicated that the drivers for Raspberry Pi ...
review_body: Very disappointed.  Literature indicated that the drivers for Raspberry Pi were already released and when I received them I learned that only drivers for Pi 2 were out with no drivers for Pi 3 in sight.
Works great, Good resolution, lightweight.  I travel with this and it fits in my metro bag and doesn't add much weight.  I'm using Windows 10 and it auto configured without any issues.
I travel a lot for business, and honestly this has been the a worth while investment for me.  I only have one small computer lap top screen when I travel, so this definitely helps.
Awesome product for quick easy USB Monitor. Picture quality isn’t too bad but could be better. I have notice it is a little grainy on some things.
I love my portable monitor!!  Everyone who sees it also comments and some have bought one as well.

review_title: After a while I started having issues with the mini ...
review_body: After a while I started having issues with the mini USB connection in the Screen terminal, I tried using other cable but is not a cable problem. Now I need to be careful and as soon I have the screen attached to my computer I can not move it or I loose the signal and I need to tweak it again

Works perfectly plug and play on my Windows 10 laptop, which only has USB 2.0 ports. It says it needs a USB 3.0 port, but I learned from other reviews that this was not the case. Excellent value and excellent product.

review_title: I like this monitor, but there's one flaw
review_body: This monitor is awesome in all aspects, except that it is very susceptible to forming water spots.

Needed an IPS monitor to replace a broken Apple Cinema Display, bought this one, using it w/ a Macbook Pro for photo editing.  Great monitor for the price; there are higher end monitors but they also come at higher end prices.  I have to say I prefer this monitor to the Apple display.  The Apple Display was infinitely sturdier and better constructed, but frustratingly few settings (on/off and slight brightness adjustment - that was it).  The ASUS VS239H-P gives you an incredibly wide variety of settings, and with some tinkering you will be able to get the perfect settings for whatever you need to do.  Comes with VGA, DVI, and HDMI inputs.  The main complaint from everyone is that the display stand is a bit wobbly, and it is, but treat yourself to a work desk that isn't from IKEA and it won't be an issue.  When attached to the stand, the monitor does sit low, (3 & 1/2" from the stand base to bottom of screen) but I stacked some books under it and now it's not a problem.  (Since you are dying to know, those books are "Hitchcock's Films Revisited", "Writing for Short Film", and "Roots.")  If your desk isn't a cluttered disaster like mine this might not be an issue for you, but I need my monitor to lord high above my plastic Nintendo figurines.  Anyway, a few weeks in now and very happy with it, picture quality is absolutely fabulous. I will revisit this review after I've put some serious time in.
The monitor arrived quickly and without any dead pixels. So far the marketed 1ms response time has lived up to my expectations. I've noticed no ghosting and the quality on the screen is very good.

Good budget monitor - not the best colors or options, but it is great for the price $90 at time of purchase. Sometimes these can be bought refurbed (I purchased one refurb, one new) and I can't tell a difference. Kids use the brand new one for everyday stuff (games, learning, web browsing, videos), and I use mine as my second monitor (web, music, data, etc)

review_title: 50 shades of black (or maybe some gray)
review_body: I purchased another one.  The one on the right I purchased about a year ago, and the one on the left about 3 weeks ago.  I'm not sure if my camera caught it, but the right screen seems to show more black in color as opposed to the left, where it seems to have some shade of gray.  I spent the entire day trying to adjust the available adjustments with no joy.  I'm not sure if I have to put some hours into this for the true black to show up, but it looks a bit cloudy.  I'm certain it is the screen because I have move that chart on the left to the right and the color pigment will change.  Any idea how to fix this?

but i had to send it back 2 times for different reasons. the first one, 1/4 of the screen died. the second had multiple dead pixels. lets hope the third one is a charm. asus rma is awful. they wouldn't help me with a 3 month old rma and told me to go back to amazon. amazon being nice helped me out but that wasn't their responsibility. im not liking asus as of late. they need better quality control.

review_title: Great Value for What You Get
review_body: For the price, this monitor is a great value. I use it only for gaming and streaming on my XB1 at the moment until I get my PC built, so its purpose will change to everything but gaming, which my gaming monitor will replace it for. You might want to fidget with the picture settings in order to get an image that suits your liking. I personally prefer using standard mode. The picture is quite nice for the price point. I don't recommend using the headphone jack, as the sound quality is rather poor for my taste. Separate speakers will be your best bet.

good bright monitor. I'm not sure how competitive this is with its peers But I suspect it's price will make that a non-issue. Price is why I bought the thing.  Anyway, this offers brighter and higher contrast than my 5 year old monitor. 24" is quite wide. That's the other reason I bought it. I'll go as far as saying this monitor is king at the $160 price point.  The gushing reviews strike me as a bit overblown, though this is a striking unit.

My old CRT finally gave out after 20 years.  Even though it was an energy hog, the 64 million colors was worth it.  This was quite a change.  After trying different settings, I'm happy with the colors now.  For the price, this is a worthwhile monitor to purchase.

review_title: It looks like someone who smokes used this monitor for 17 years then shined it up but couldnt get the dingy color out
review_body: I picked this monitor out to use as a second screen for gaming and streaming. It was a birthday gift from my mom. I wasn't impressed with the clarity, the height of the stand, or much of anything for that matter. I would never have purchased this item had I known the dingy yellow color from monitors in the 90's pervaded the dark ages and made its way to 2014. I did everything I could to try to correct the color, but I could never get the whites to truly be white. I am sending this back and buying another samsung. I was really disappointed because Asus is supposed to be such a good brand but this monitor felt cheap and looked very cheap next to my samsung.

It was purchased for travel and it does not travel well.  You would think the a "portable" monitor would be more durable.  This monitor was placed (in it's neoprene case) next to a laptop (in it's neoprene case) in a computer roller bag and the pressure on the screen caused damage.  If you purchase it and intend to travel... find a hard sided case so that no pressure is applied in the area of the screen.

review_title: DOES NOT WORK WITH ALL USB C DEVICES
review_body: I have other USB displays from AOC that work great However this display seems to be using the Display port/HDMI function of usb c Which not all USB C ports support. This display works great if you have the right hardware to support it as i tested with a friends laptop but as my laptop does not support it i cannot give it a good review.

review_title: Nice extra screen for traveling and working from home
review_body: Purchased for having an extra screen when I am working from home. Works well but does not work with MAC but luckily the work laptop is windows.

Love this thing!  I do a lot of computing on the go and this thing is perfect. It fits in my backpack right next to my laptop. An added bonus is it works plugged into any of my usb ports. Not just my 3.0 port.

Great product for the money.  As some other reviews noted, the graphics are dull.  That's the best way to describe it.  Not near as sharp as the laptop and the colors are a bit washed out looking.  But fits the bill perfectly.  If you want a cheap second monitor, this is it.  You do need to download a driver to work with Windows 10, but I followed the directions and it worked perfectly.

review_title: Design is good, monitor is portable and light - but for Mac - that's a tricky one
review_body: Design is good, monitor is portable and light - but for Mac - that's a tricky one

I bought this as a second monitor for my laptop. Works very well being powered off a USB. my computer located and loaded the software without any issues. It would get 5 stars but the unit seems very light (too light perhaps). If it continues to work well over the next 6 - 9 months I will be grad to up it to 5 stars.

Great portable monitor. Excellent, bright sharp display. I use it as my second monitor with my older 17-inch HP Pavillion laptop. Super light and thin for travel - fits in my backpack with my laptop. Very easy to set up and use. Just plug into a USB 3.0 port. Very nice padded case included. Very happy with this purchase! Best image is with screen more upright than at the full angle of the folding stand on the back. No complaints at all with this monitor.

review_title: It worked great for 13 months and now when I plug it ...
review_body: It worked great for 13 months and now when I plug it in the AOC screen shows and then it goes black.  I'm not sure what the issue is, but it worked great and then just stopped working just after one year of use.

review_title: Not plug and play, but gets the job done.
review_body: Don't like that you have to install software before this monitor works. Kind of defeats the purpose of having a portable monitor as you have to have a regular monitor plugged in first. Otherwise it is great. The stand comes in handy.

review_title: Excellent monitor, shame about the stand
review_body: The monitor is excellent - no on/dead pixels, the color rendition is good enough for most photo-processing applications. I'd give it five stars based on value for money and the image quality. However the stand lets it down. The monitor tends to rock at the slightest provocation, and we had to return the first monitor we received as the stand was bent (I read other reviews reporting this problem). The original monitor was about 5 degrees off horizontal.
I bought two of these monitors to update my computer station.

review_title: For $99 its more of a Meh quality
review_body: I think I was duped (again) by Amazon's rating system. I wanted to order another Acer monitor but Amazon recommended this Asus monitor instead. Amazon had 4.5 stars for this and for $99 and Amazon Choice, then what can go wrong buying it? I got it today and hooked it up and the colors are a little washed out and harder to read than my Acer monitor, but for $99 what should I expect. Three stars... I should have spent the extra $40 and ordered the Acer monitor that I have now.

As a community producer for a local public access television station I produce around 100 broadcast programs yearly and began setting up production at home to for editing and transmission to the local station wirelessly.  Favorable reviews and a good price were my first reason to buy.  I edit with Final Cut Pro Ten and love the look from this monitor.  It has been wonderful spending time with the brilliant colors and razor-sharp definition.  Using this monitor just feels good.  I'll be adding additional monitors soon and this will be my choice.  Unfortunately last weekend the monitor went dark and I had to scramble around locally for a temporary substitute.  I'm happy to report that a replacement is on its way and dealing with Amazon was easy.

review_title: A cheap monitor for slap-dash work
review_body: It's a cheap monitor and I knew that going in, so I didn't have wild expectations. Those expectations, however, were the right ones. The colors are flat and strange (but not obnoxious), the resolution is okay. That's all. I didn't need it for display purposes, just as something that would put a computer screen in front of my face. For that it works fine. If you are doing graphic arts work, design work, or anything else that requires decent calibration and a true-to-life display, you definitely should look elsewhere. If you need a cheap monitor for a slap-dash application, this definitely is your pick. As they say south of the border, ni bueno, ni malo.

The only reason I won't give the monitor 5 stars is as others have pointed out - the mounting is pretty weak.  It is a little top heavy and connected to the base with just one screw.  The brightness is quite good and I have not had any issues with any fonts - all are very clear.  A second reason for deleting one star is the extremely poor Asus documentation that came with the monitor.  It is in about 14 different languages, in very small font, and not well organized.  Fortunately, I had only to connect the HDMI cable to the computer and all came up running.  Not sure what I would have done if that was not the case.  I certainly think a major computer manufacturer should be able to do better than Asus did with the documentation.

review_title: Great monitor for a great price.
review_body: Purchased this monitor to replace an older monitor, and for the price this product is absolutely outstanding. So far I have had zero issues with it, but will update once I have had the product for a while longer, though I really expect no issues. I have owned other monitors by ASUS with no issues as well. I would certainly recommend it to anyone.

review_title: Really bad quality monitor, reviews are deceiving.
review_body: Pros:HDMI, VGA Input, Viewing Angle Adjustment,

I purchased the ASUS 24 inch monitor to replace my old 17 inch monitor. My brother purchased a 21 inch version of this monitor and was raving about it. After doing research I found this was the best monitor for the price, plus I could one up my brother's monitor. Had no issues with the monitor after setting it up. At this point I have had the monitor for a few years and it still works great, as well as my brothers 21 inch version. It's possible there are better monitors now but this was well worth the money

I love this monitor so far! I've had zero issues, it was shipped and received in good condition. Also, the image/screen quality is very high and I would recommend this for anyone. I use this monitor every day of the week because I work from home 50+ hours, am learning Ableton music production and have many instances of managing multiple applications at once.

This monitor is a horrible product. The monitor hasn't worked from day one. The USB driver is very cumbersome and doesn't work well with plug and play like this monitor is designed for. Additionally, the unit is cheaply built and the connection  to connect the monitor too the computer is lose. So after working through USB DRIVER issues the actual chord being lose caused the display not to come on. I emailed AOC twice in the last couple of weeks with no reply. Save your money!

I love this monitor. I am actually using it now that I am typing this review. It is a wonderful addition to my gadgets and I love it. I attach it to my laptop and it helps me to be more efficient at work and at home. I really do not know what I did before dual monitors became available and I am in no mood to find out. All I can say is that having a mobile one is genius. It is light and comes with its own bag to protect it. It fits into my laptop bag so I can carry both to work. The price was also right for me.

review_title: Two monitors, same model, two different connectors
review_body: I purchased two of these monitors, same model, same company, ect.  Each monitor has a different usb connector for the back of the monitor.  One has the standard style usb and the other is a USB 3.0 SuperSpeed A to Micro B.  The lack of consistency is very frustrating.

review_title: This (outdated) driver can't run on Windows 10.
review_body: Item is non-compatible with Windows 10.  AOC driver downloaded from their website for this model is dated 9/26/14.  My computer was unable to recognize it with Windows 10.

Been using it a few months without issue. I did have an older laptop running Win 7 that I had to manually install drivers on, but not a problem. I've traveled a few times and all has gone well. My wife liked it so much she got one for herself. As of now I have nothing negative to report.

Bought it as a gift for my husband. He mostly uses it at work to split his laptop screen. He loves it says its exactly what he needed. Light weight easy to carry. The fact that it comes with a case is a nice touch, makes it easier for him to transport back and forth to work. Overall good purchase.

Can't beat this for the price! While it is not for high def graphics it works really well for any Microsoft Office products. Fonts were crisp and clean lines. Yes it is glossy but a glare reducer fixes that. I did need to intsall the driver for Windows 7, but was easy and fast.

review_title: I wanted it to use with my work laptop but the screen is small and my eyes are getting bad because of age
review_body: The monitor is light weight and came with a case for protection.  I wanted it to use with my work laptop but the screen is small and my eyes are getting bad because of age.  The monitor provided the size I needed to be portable and large enough for me to see.

I have actually purchased two of these.  The first one lasted more than a year, but was broken during travel due to some excessively rough handling by the airline of my checked baggage.  The monitor actually still works; however has a cracked screen.  Promptly ordered a replacement and can not imagine life without it.  Primary usage is business forms and documents.  I use it full time in my office and on the road.  Resolution brightness are great.  Although the cable has two USB connections, I only have needed to use one.  Absolutely recommend for anyone needing a travel monitor or a primary with USB connection.

review_title: Connected easily after downloading the Display Link driver from the website ...
review_body: Connected easily after downloading the Display Link driver from the website for my MacBook Pro. Nice stand. I was not satisfied with the resolution (my oversight for not looking at that before ordering). I also had an issue opening VMWare fusion for Quicken Home & Business when the monitor was connected. I was able to open VMWare if I disconnected the monitor and was able to connect the monitor again once it was running. I am returning the monitor for a higher resolution one.

review_title: great monitor made by a top company a second one is in the future!!!
review_body: this monitor still looks amazing despite it coming out in 2011(i think). i did have to turn down the brightness to 50 though it was at max by default. the stand only has wobble when you touch the buttons even while i type out this review i dont notice it. so heres my pros and cons

review_title: A nice monitor by a good company
review_body: I use it as a 3rd monitor for streaming. The picture quality is very good, clear and readable texts. I dont really use it for anything other than that so I cannot attest to gaming on it. Asus is a great company though and I believe it would suit most peoples needs just fine.

I’ve had this computer monitor for close to a year now, and I haven’t regretted buying it one time. The screen quality is crisp, clear, and easy to maneuver in the menu features. I would recommend adjusting the picture quality to what you are presently doing on the computer, i.e: watching videos, playing games, etc. The adjustment of the screen with the vertical swivel in the back is smooth, it’s not hard to move around and maneuver if you need to like some other screens. Overall it does what it’s supposed to do, and does so with a very nice quality image and good craftsmanship. I would definitely recommend this, especially if you're looking for a good gaming monitor like I was.

I do a lot of visual work and I need HD quality with accurate calibration. This display was perfect size for what I needed and the price was very wallet friendly. Plugged in my Mac Mini and everything looks great. The display looks slightly matted which I prefer. I don't like a high gloss shiny look. Also don't care for an overly bright display that hurts the eyes. This display is perfect for my preference. It's very thin and being black in color, goes with any setup. The hand groove in the back is a nice touch to for when handling the monitor. The screen can tilt to adjust your view. No problems or concerns.

This monitor is outstanding for it's price. I bought it through Amazon Warehouse deals so only paid about $145. I bought two and they are amazing for what I paid. It have a 2ms reponse time and 1080p resolution. SOLD! Great for gaming. I play a wide variety of games (League of Legends, StarCraft, World of Tanks, Eve, Assassin's Creed, emulators, ect.) and have never experienced ghosting or delays between my mouse/keyboard/gamepad inputs and actions on the screen. This is a great monitor for people wanting to jump into dual monitor set ups for cheap and not sacrifice quality. Vesa 100 mounts so they are compatible with almost any mounting system.

review_title: This is a fantastic monitor, but you should know
review_body: This is a fantastic monitor, but you should know:

review_title: Best monitor for your money. Not a thing really killer wrong with it.
review_body: I bought this back on August 25, 2012 and I have used it ever since, ranging from an Xbox 360, to my desktop and laptops when I needed it, to currently I using it for my Xbox One. I've had it for this long and the only problem defect wise is that there is one tiny dead pixel after such a long time using it.

review_title: Delayed HDMI signal detection at power-on
review_body: I bought this monitor to use in a coffee table arcade console I'm building.  A number of people recommended using an IPS LED monitor since the monitor will be mounted face-up in the table and people will be viewing it from a very low angle.  I picked this monitor based on good reviews and reasonable price and am generally pleased with it with one exception.  I am plugging all of my arcade components into a single power strip so that everything can be turned on and off simultaneously via the power strip rocker switch.  The "brain" of my arcade is a Raspberry Pi (running PiMAME) which uses HDMI for video.  The problem I have encountered is that when I power on the monitor and the Raspberry Pi simultaneously via the power strip, the HDMI input on the monitor does not seem to respond quickly enough.  A short time after power-on, the monitor reports no HDMI signal found and meanwhile the Raspberry Pi comes up with no video output. I tried another HDMI cable to be sure that wasn't the culprit but same result. I then switched to using the DVI port on the monitor, together with a DVI-HDMI dongle and this works fine i.e. the monitor's DVI signalling seems to respond much faster and I immediately see the boot messages from the Pi.

I am not a computer expert so I am not going to be writing any kind of technical report here.  I needed a screen for a new Mac Mini that I just purchased because I was NOT spending $1000 on a screen.  I am crazy about new purchases so I did a lot of reviewing of the reviews on different screens.  About 95% of the reviews are great but I did see some notes about "dead pixels" when they received their Asus screen.  I don't really even know what "dead pixels" are but I can guess that I would notice if I had some.  There are zero problems with the display on my monitor.

I purchased this monitor while it was on sale for around $120. It's a visually pleasing monitor. It arrived on time and in perfect condition. The packaging was well put together and there were no scratches on the product. The stand is sleek and is thin at the bottom. I prefer this so I can put things on it without a problem.

I freaking love this thing.  I take it with me everywhere on business trips.  It is light, compact, fits into my carry on, my brief case, or even my large suit case (obviously).  It sets up nicely on any hotel desk.  Only recommendation is to get USB cord extenders to give you flexibility on where to put it.  Maybe even bring a portable USB port, as it requires to USB inputs, the extra one for power.  Everyone in my office has been buying this now.

review_title: Super flaky - some days it works
review_body: Super flaky - some days it works, some days it does not. No reason, no changes. I've called support and give up. It's now just a pain to carry around and it's useless. Don't buy.
This works great for school. It is cheap, and I can move it around easily and bring it places. It is great that it powered by USB so I don't need to move the extra cord and find an extra outlet.

We actually purchased this to use with his small work laptop when traveling.  We absolutely loves it for a portable monitor.  As always, the price on Amazon beat any local stores, so we purchased it here and it arrived in two days so we were able to use it right away.  There are no cords or plug in as it's USB powered which is great when traveling.  Absolutely perfect for a monitor to use for work when traveling.

review_title: Unreliable monitor and manufacturer does not care
review_body: I bought the monitor in March 2017. I didn't even use it July and most of August. When I tried to use it at the end of August all I saw was a modern art display on the screen. AOC technical support said it was a physical problem (of course) and not covered under their warranty. So I am out the $149 I spent on the monitor.

I was somewhat skeptical when buying this monitor but I am thrilled with the performance.  I travel quite a bit and the slim and lightweight size is great.
