Despite seeing reviews about damaging easily I have had no problems.  The carrying case it comes with helps to protect it when on the road.  It is so nice to merely plug in the USB and not have to deal with plugs.

review_title: Best to leave it connected and not use it as a portable screen.
review_body: Worked for a few days and stopped showing any connection.  Might be good if you never unplug it but I tried to use it as a remote screen for work installs and it just was causing more issues than I needed.

review_title: The product description lists a HDMI input, however there ...
review_body: The product description lists a HDMI input, however there is only USB.  Additionally, the driver does not work with Windows 10 Creators Update.

Note: using with 2012 Macbook Pro - As others have mentioned, the color profile can't be adjusted on a mac. But, it works fine for it's purpose. The screen will also go black for a second every once in awhile, perhaps a couple times a day. Unsure if this is a power issue as I have it only plugged into 1 USB port instead of using both.

from the very first time I got this product it's been trouble. After installing the driver, the LCD will only display the company name & go blank. I even tried using both USB cords to have it connect to my laptop; but no it won't come on.

Got this monitor a few days ago and it is a huge upgrade over my old non-widescreen monitor.  This unit is very bright, colors look fantastic, and blacks are really impressively black for an LCD.  I'm really happy with my purchase.

review_title: Quality Monitor with a Fantastic Picture
review_body: Having recently built a PC for gaming/multimedia, I was looking for a quality 1080p monitor to replace the older 720p flat panel TV I'd been using in the meantime. I chose the Asus brand because of their reputation for quality, but I never expected to get this good of a deal on this good of a monitor. It was on sale for $139.99 w/ a $20 mail-in rebate and free shipping. I couldn't pass that up, and once the monitor arrived, I was glad that I didn't.

I use an Apple Thunderbolt display as my main monitor. I was looking for a second monitor. Based on reviews I picked this one. Unfortunately, the one I received had 2 dead pixels, extremely poor colors/fuzziness (even after numerous adjustments) and on top of all that the monitor (although secure on the stand) wobbled significantly every time my arms moved on the desk. Returned to Amazon.

I bought this because I decided it was time for a widescreen monitor.  So far I haven't found anything wrong with it.  The colors are fantastic, although I'll admit I use it for basic office work and Internet browsing.  I use Windows 7 and it works great with that.  I like being able to see a number of pages at a time.  And of course it's nice to see as much as possible of a website.
I have used different brands  like Dell, Acer, Lenovo, however ASUS has manufactured a lot of great devices lately such as Tablets, laptops, etc. So I decided to give this monitor a chance.

For quite awhile now I have been using a ViewSonic VA2323wm (23" LCD, 5MS, 1080P) at work, and a Dell 18.5 Ultra Sharp (18.5, 5MS, 1080P) and HP/19e (19" 5MS, 1080P) on two of our computers at home. I was happy with each of them until this ASUS was unpacked, set up, and running. Now I will spending as much of time as possible in front of our new ASUS. The difference between it and the contenders is immediately obvious. The picture's sharpness, deep blacks, crisp whites and solid colors are superior to every monitor I have seen, including my own . Considering that irrefutable fact, perhaps the most amazing thing about this monitor has to be the low price.  Seriously, I would never have hoped to acquire such magnificent performance from a "used", or even a new monitor for under $150.00.

review_title: Lets just say its fantastic for 1080p gaming
review_body: This is the second one I purchased for a dual monitor setup. Lets just say its fantastic for 1080p gaming.

I replaced my Samsung monitor with this Asus and have been extremely impressed. I chose this monitor partly because it has several connection options. It comes with HDMI, VGA and DVI connections. The picture has bright whites and dark blacks. You can read this screen from almost any angle. The monitor is a little bright in a dark room and I had to tune down the brightness slightly. It displays video fantastically as well as HD pictures from my DSLR. One complaint I had with my old Samsung was that my system didn't like togo to sleep. I would hear several "new hardware" sounds from Windows when my system went to sleep and when it woke up. This monitor installed seamlessly. My system recognized it automatically and installed all the drivers. It came up in the highest res possible and now my system sleeps like a baby and comes back to life quickly. I would order this again without hesitation.

Monitor arrived in seemingly good condition; the box wasn't beat up, and the monitor and all the components had no scratches or dents. However, once I hooked everything up to my computer, the monitor refused to turn on. I tried all the different video cables and a spare power cable, but nothing worked. My guess is I'm just one of the few unlucky people that got a defect, but it's still irritating none the less.

This is a great monitor which has all the bells and whistles that people are looking for in these days.  The only downside is that the package doesn't include HDMI cable, which I intended to use.  As far as picture quality, brightness, resolutions, and etc..., this is probably as good as Samsung or other leading brands if not better.

I originally loved this monitor so much I bought 3 more as gifts.  When mine stopped working because the plug in the back stopped connecting.  I ordered another one thinking it was a fluke.  The two I bought for myself, as well as one I bought for a friend all have the same issue with the plug rendering them useless.  What started out as a great product, became useless junk in a relatively short time.  If the manufacturer would fix this issue, this would be an amazing product.

review_title: I'm very disappointed in this product
review_body: This is the second one I have.  Put the first in my carry on and the screen had a cracked look to it.  I assumed I did it and ordered another one.  Second time traveling with this one (carried on plane) and its cracked again.  Will NOT purchase another one.

review_title: A great value for mobile productivity.
review_body: Good quality at a great value.  It works great with my Chromebook, just plug and play.  Allowing me to take my work on the road.

review_title: I really like the size and the support stand in back folds ...
review_body: I really like the size and the support stand in back folds flat to make it easy to carry cart it around. I wish the up to date drivers were online instead of on a disk.

review_title: too thick to be very portable
review_body: Too thick to be all that portable. It's thicker than any of my laptops and won't fit in some of my bags if I have a laptop as well. Works ok otherwise.

review_title: DO NOT RECOMMEND Stopped working after 4 months
review_body: DO NOT RECOMMEND

review_title: This was a disappointment to have the monitor so limited
review_body: I wanted to use this monitor as a second monitor for both my MacBook Pro laptop and my Mac Pro desktop. Unfortunately, this monitor will not work with my desktop computer (at least as far as I could figure out so far). This was a disappointment to have the monitor so limited.

review_title: For a monitor thats less than $100 its great!
review_body: Bought one of these for use with my photo booth setup. Light weight and being usb powered it's one less power cord to hook up.
Love this 2nd monitor!!! With just one simple USB connection and no need for a separate power supply, simply a great addition to any laptop for $130!

review_title: Works great. Had some confusion on set up when I ...
review_body: Works great. Had some confusion on set up when I positioned it on the left side of my computer and the mouse wanted to go right to move onto the screen. Moving it to the right side solved the problem. There is probably a way to set it up to work on whatever side you want it to go on. A word of caution - it runs off the USB port power which means extra duty for the laptop battery.

You can't get better than this monitor!! For price of this monitor you get a deal and picture quality that many other brands would ask more for.  It comes with great preset options to automatically adjust picture settings for what you are doing on the monitor, ie looking at pictures, watching a Bluray, gaming, and many others.  I couldn't ask for a better deal on this monitor.  I don't know what people are saying about the base not being sturdy enough I took a chance and disregarding those comments and went with this monitor and my choice couldn't have been better.  This base is great, I don't know what type of desk or table they are using with this monitor but I have a nice quality desk that I have it on and it never shakes.

Not a bad monitor for the price. Its not the greatest picture but Im not a gamer nor video editor. I am mainly using it for educational and work. I guess thats why pictures quality doesnt matter to me. If you are a gamer, you can see a slight delay in picture quality.

review_title: Very good monitor, but can't they make one with an adjustable stand
review_body: I bought a similar model 2 yrs ago, but really there is very little difference.  The monitor works great and is easy to set up.  The colors are just right with just some minor tweaks.  Yes, you can buy better monitors, but you'll be paying much more.  For most typical users a monitor like this will work just fine.

review_title: Asus rebates are a scam. Do not purchase products made by Asus.
review_body: Let me state up front that this is a decent, inexpensive monitor that is adequate for general use. It's only 1080P, so it's not suitable for a lot of gaming, or precision graphics work, but it's fine for basic photo editing and the color rendition is accurate. There are several preset color profiles built in that can be used, depending on the source material and time of day. Based on the quality of the monitor alone, I would probably rate the product at 3 stars.
I wanted to get a 2nd monitor for the [home] office computer.  Original is also an Asus 24", older model.

review_title: Very nice and a steal for the price!
review_body: Very nice monitor haven't had any issues with them. They do have a good sound if you choose to use it as a TV as well with gaming on the other inputs. They have a really solid clarity and dont need to be at a certain angle for any glares. No tearing or distorted pixels  frame freezing or anything of that nature as of yet and i have had this for a few months now.

review_title: Very nice monitor with an Aesthetic flaw
review_body: Let me start by saying that functionally, this is a very nice monitor.
I got this monitor to match the one I purchased previously -- it works exactly as my old one did.

review_title: Great Screen, Very Happy, Awesome Warranty
review_body: I am very happy with this screen. I bought one as a gift for my parents this past winter and they have not had any issues with theirs. Later, I bought a pair for myself and have also not experienced any issues. The image is crisp and clean, colors are displayed nicely, and I haven't found a dead pixel on either of the three I've bought.

This is my first Amazon review so please be gentle!  I'm not going to get into the technical aspects of this monitor that make it great, nor will this be a wordy review.  I am a gadget geek to start with so I knew what I was getting in to but I wanted to write the review from the perspective of a typical user and to cater to the average attention span.

It broke and the insurance from Square did not cover it. They are frauds and now I don't have a screen to use and no help from the manufacturer to replace it either. I will never purchase another one again. AOC or Square trade. They both suck.

review_title: I got it to work remote and broke on first trip.
review_body: The picture says it all. The screen was in his protective pocket  and on my backpack. I don't know if I got a lemon but this is my experience.

So I have been using this for all of 15 minutes and its working well.  Easy to set up, installed quickly with Windows 10.  I travel 40 weeks a year, so I will update this review in a few months to let you know how its going, I am a little nervous about the plug issues people have been having but for $100 its worth it even if only for 6 months!

review_title: Will need to return. This flashes AOC and then ...
review_body: Will need to return.  This flashes AOC and then goes dark.  I have downloaded drivers, rebooted, tried everything I can think of.  When I went to AOC's web site they wanted my phone number.  Right.

review_title: fits perfectly in my laptop bag and provides a great additional screen for work
review_body: bought for work since i travel and require double screens.  it's not heavy, fits perfectly in my laptop bag and provides a great additional screen for work.  Great for travel since it's portable and lightweight with its own protective sleeve and connection cords.  The only negative is the connection cord - not the best placement on the monitor for stable connection - sometimes will easily come out if I move the cords.

review_title: DisplayLink not compatible with other graphic displays
review_body: DisplayLink is not compatible with any other graphic displays, so basically you will only be able to use this monitor on your USB port. I bought this monitor to use when traveling but have larger monitors I use when I'm at home, the software is making me uninstall the graphic displays for the monitors I use at home in order to use this monitor while traveling. For this reason I would not recommend this product. two thumbs down.

review_title: Why Can't they fix the USB Connection?
review_body: The USB ports on the back of all these AOC monitors suck. This is my second Monitor model and while the connection is a little better than the previous one, it still is loose and requires you to move your cable around to get it to activate. It does work after you mess with it and it's cheap so I'll give it 2 stars instead of 1. If you expect things to work without hassle, buy a different brand.

review_title: Great picture, works with any usb computer i have ...
review_body: Great picture, works with any usb computer i have tried with so far. Make sure you install correctly to get best results. I travel for work and this baby slips right in my backpack and take it on the road with me. Very durable and everyone wants one when they see it. At airports i am constantly hounded by people on where to get one!
This is my second screen and the second one worked for about a week and now every time I connect it to my laptop it just blinks on and off. I have tried everything.

review_title: Sleeve does not protect screen from damage
review_body: I've had this monitor for about 3 months.  I travel with it for work.  While traveling I keep it inside the sleeve and inside of a rolling computer bag.  The monitor somehow still became damaged and AOC would not cover the damage.  I also purchased the addition insurance which would not cover it since it should be covered by the manufactures warranty.  If you do purchase this monitor, I suggest you place it in a steel box.

review_title: Not the best, not the worst...
review_body: I got these on Black Friday at a pretty deep discount. They're ok. I don't feel like the graphics are as great as they could be. The color is a little washed out and they're not very crisp. My wife isn't as picky as me and will probably inherit them... I'm kind of sad because they were such a bargain. But then again there's the old saying "I can't afford to buy cheap tools"...

I purchased this IPS monitor since Asus seems to make a good IPS screen per CNET reviews. The screen itself is great, good viewing angles and very clear. I use this as a multiple monitor to expand my desktop for work and do not watch videos or play games on it, so the perceived "slowness" of IPS monitors wasn't a concern of mine. The video processor software I have through Nvidea makes using this monitor a snap with my laptop as I plug it in after using the laptop elsewhere. My only complaint would be the wobbliness of the monitor on the stand, which I was aware of from other reviewers but did not think would be a problem. It really isn't a problem most of the time unless I really jostle my desk but at some point I plan to get another monitor and use a VESA wall mount for both which will eliminate the problem. It is worth noting that the other few monitors I was considering from other manufacturers with nearly identical specs did not have VESA capability.

review_title: One of the best, cost effective, 24" monitor choices
review_body: When you're looking for a very good quality, inexpensive 24 inch monitor, you really can't go wrong with this one.  Good construction quality, very nice screen, and multiple cable options make this a very attractive choice for multi-screen systems.  I have four of these deployed at the moment, and the users love them.  A very nice product by ASUS.

review_title: A monitor that fits my needs
review_body: This is a great monitor.  I like the size and look of the pictures/websites.  I have a very specific location this or any monitor can fit into.  Most of the dimensions are in metric, which caused me to have to do extra searching for US standards.

I ordered 2 of these, about a couple months (maybe 7 months) apart and they were completely two different colors. One was blueish and one was yellowish. i was really disappointed only because i was using them as dual screens and looking at them side by side they are 2 completely different shades! i even swapped the plugs to see if it was my videocard and it wasnt. returned the newer one and received another, same color. i had to manually try to adjust both so they could match. Really annoying. Anyway, it still has great color and detail as individual screens. Next time i would buy screens together at the same time to prevent this.

Just got mine yesterday and hooked it up.  Had to turn the brightness down a lot but I like that it has a few "modes" you can toggle through.  game mode, theater mode, standard, etc.  I can keep my darker setting for my work stuff then toggle to game mode and kill some damn aliens trying to invade Earth.  Very pleased!  I was using a Sony LCD 16" square monitor so this is the same height but with another say 2 or 3 inches on each side.  Movies are bigger now and life is nice.  No dead pixels, no problems, light weight, easy install...  my ONLY gripe and it is a small one is that the shiny plastic surrounding the viewing space should have been FLAT, not GLOSSY.  The gloss finish reflects any bright lights in your room.  I intend to fix mine, though. :)

review_title: ASUS VS228H-P 22-Inch Full-HD 5ms LED-Lit LCD Monitor
review_body: I did a lot of studying via the comments earlier buyers made of this product and came to the conclusion that this was the product I wanted. The 22" is a good size for my desk. I really like that the screen is matte, thus there is no glare. This was also one of the reasons for me buying this Asus Monitor. I was a little confused about the cables and as I took the monitor with me outside the country, I bought an extra HDMI cable as I could not remember if my laptop had a VGA port, which it turned out to have. However, as i often disconnect my laptop to take it with me, i really recommend that customers buy the HDMI cable, as it is  easier to disconnect.

review_title: Asus VS247H-P Full HD LED-lit Monitor
review_body: I bought this to replace an old 20" Apple monitor that still works but doesn't have HD.

I've had this screen for a month and I've decided to write a review about it. This screen is super slim, but takes up a lot of room left to right. I went from a 19" LCD to this 24" LED. So if you're going to have two monitors, you may need a bigger desk. This is for any 24" you get.

This monitor works great! I've had it for more than 6 months now with no complaints. I use this monitor for my computer, console video gaming, and movie watching, so I really put it through it's paces. I love the different modes (Game, Night, sRGB, Scenery, Standard, and Theater), and the stability of the stand in all angles. The only thing I've noticed is a slight blue haze around the outer edges when the onscreen image is black. Its probably just the backlight bleeding through but it is slightly noticeable. All-in-all this is versatile and reliable monitor that is well worth the money.

I bought this to set up a my work station for when working at home.  I was unsure of the quality since it did not seem relatively expensive.  I was very surprised and pleased to find it is so portable.  As I transitioned from working at home to an off-site office, I've just kept it nicely in my car and bring it to any office space for work.  Being a non-techy person, it was an easy plug in with a driver update and I did find a need to get a power usb hub so that there wasn't a delay between my work laptop screen to this monitor.  I'm thinking of getting a larger version of this for another part of hour house.

review_title: If you're on the fence, get this USB powered monitor!
review_body: Several guys at my office have this - or a variant - to increase productivity during some long strategy meetings that we are often in. I ended up buying this for my wife when she went into the hospital on bed rest so she could continue to work productively - and so that I could use it when she got home. :)
Given that this is driven via a USB port this is a great addition to the road warrior's equipment pack!

I'm very happy with this purchase. I bring it with me whenever I travel as my second monitor. It's small and light enough to make it easy to travel with but big enough to do the job. Highly recommend to anyone that needs an extra monitor when they travel.

This product is a waste of money and caused me nothing but aggravation and computer issues.  It doesn't work when you plug it in.  After downloading the driver software on 2 different laptops, it DOES NOT WORK!  All of my monitors go black, including this one.  So I can't get to a windows screen to uninstall this piece of garbage or to try to fix the display!  Be careful!  I can't believe everyone else seems to have no problems with this.

review_title: I travel a lot and It's ultra lightweight and slim for great portability. My business presentations are clear and visible ...
review_body: I am an accountant and bout this monitor to attach to my laptop for team presentations. I travel a lot and It's ultra lightweight and slim for great portability. My business presentations are clear and visible from a wide angle. This is perfect for the frequent traveler using photo frame applications or presentations with dual monitor setups on-the-go. This is the perfect solution for the frequent traveler who needs to pack multiple displays, as it easily fits into a backpack or the carry case that comes with the USB monitor

review_title: Missing parts, possibly refurb (sold as new)
review_body: I know this monitor itself is very good.  I had one before and it was very useful.

It has worked perfectly so far.  I bought this to use as a spare monitor when working remotely my old one went out.  My employer doesn't allow administrator access to machines, but the driver installed automatically and with no trouble after connecting via USB.  I didn't need to use the supplied software.  I'm on Windows 7 so I can't respond to any of the concerns mentioned with Windows 10.

review_title: Not very bright... Kind of dim. But it works!
review_body: The colors seem washed out and dim. Like an iPhone when you turn the brightness down to save your battery. But it does work! It's lightweight and thin. It fits into the laptop bag and it helps. My hope was to use it as the primary monitor but it's too dim and washed out so I need to use it as a secondary monitor.

Works great, a bit of a learning curve for use at first.  As others have stated, there is not a direct download for Mac users, but I used the link off of another review and downloaded the necessary driver.  After a bit of playing around I have the monitor up and running, it works great and is super clear.

review_title: Good monitor at a good price
review_body: Monitor arrived in great condition.  No dead pixels.  It comes with a VGA cable, DVI cable, and a power cable.  It assembles to the base stand in about 15 seconds.  I connected it using my own HDMI cable.  It looks great.  It has a few preset color modes: sRGB, Standard, Scenery, Cinema, Gaming.  They all look a bit different but are nifty.  Haven't decided which one I like the best for regular computing.  The menu is kind of hard to navigate but that's pretty standard on monitors.  It has a three year warranty which is awesome.  I'm using it in a triple-monitor configuration with two Acer 22" LCD monitors and they are very close to the exact same size.  I will eventually replace the two LCD's with two of these ASUS LEDs.  I strongly recommend it for the price.
Amazon's speedy delivery is as good as always.

review_title: - Excellent image - Excellent price - Almost no heat output ...
review_body: Pros:

Other than extremely unclear written directions in whatever languages they were, it works well. Using the DVI-D input at the moment with Windows 7 Pro.  It also has VGA and HDMI inputs. I went to the Asus web-site looking for an Asus driver (no install CD came with the monitor), thinking maybe that works better, but couldn't find any. Using a generic Windows 7 driver at the moment. The brightness variation controls on the front right bottom are very easy to use. The screen tilts forward or back. You can't raise or lower the screen if that is important to you, but the height was fine for me, and the tilt feature may accommodate that need anyway.

I got three of these for 5760x1080 eyefinity. I was very impressed, extremely bright may strain the eyes a bit lol, but the image quality is fantastic. Eyefinity on the other hand did disappoint me. I would go for a Big Screen TV over eyefinity for PC gaming. The added display on games are stretched and unimpressive, the middle monitor does look better at 5760x1080 vs 1920x1080, but the side monitor display is unimpessive.  I got Sceptre 50 inch at $475 by the way and works great. The monitor never suffered from input lag while play any games like Crysis 2 and Battlefield 3 at completely maxed out settings both 5760x1080 and 1920x1080. Best bang for your buck 1920x1080 IPS monitor out there.
This is just a wonderful monitor, especially for the price. I use it for editing photos with Photoshop, and also for gaming.

Great monitors, we're using them together on my wifes computer for a dual monitor setup.  No dead pixels, images are bright and vibrant.  No light bleed around edges.  Only issue is that the stand is not adjustable vertically (knew this before purchase) but the one is 1/4" taller than the other on it's stand!  I don't mind them being fixed height as long as the height is consistent!

review_title: Best Monitor I bought in a long time I bought 4
review_body: Great crisp bright picture, colors are prefect with a little fine tuning mounts on vesa 100x100 I have XFX tri stand and a celien mount for the fourth monitor The LED backlighting is vantastic love energy uses compared to my LCD HDTV/Monitor Samsung which I replaced for these. i bught ASUS headsets and never bought ASUS products before and I was please with the headset I decided to try out their LED 24 inch monitor and I am so happy with my purchase. One flaw but ASUS was very quick to fix it one of my monitors was bad and they shipped it free ad set me a new one replacing it and it's runs as great as the other three and try matching 4 monitors with colors and backlighting to match it was a job but it was done. I love ASUS products andI will continue to buy and reconnmend them to anyone

I purchased this product about two weeks ago primarily for gaming and I am happy to report that it is an excellent display.  The price point worked for me and I decided to take a shot on this product since it had many favorable reviews.

Video works with no problems, but the sound doesn't work. We bought six of these and two bigger ASUS screens as part of our Public Charities' our lab upgrade. Dissed ASUS over the main board not producing sound, and they said it was the main board's fault, HOWEVER the problem was not the ASUS main board rather it was the ASUS screen.
Plug and Play!  Works great with a Lenovo ThinkPad.  Great picture and resolution.  Just plugs into a USB. Light and easy to pack in a suitcase

review_title: The 5ms response time is great for just about anything I could ever need it ...
review_body: The color and sharpness are exactly as expected from an ips screen. The 5ms response time is great for just about anything I could ever need it for. Great size for mobility but light and thin. Flawless operation so far. I'm very pleased with the performance for the price. I know $200 seems expensive but I feel that I'm getting what I paid for.

review_title: One star, will not hold up under normal use.
review_body: I bought this monitor in August in 2015 so I have had it for over a year now and I use it three to four time per week.  I would not recommend this due to the usb connection in back of the monitor.  It started to get a short in it after just a few months of using it.  Now it take a lot of messing with it to get it to come on and it goes on and off sever times wile using it.

review_title: The monitor stopped working while on a business trip, ...
review_body: The monitor stopped working while on a business trip, which is what I purchased it for.  I was careful in travel to protect the monitor and kept it with my laptop as a carry on item.  The monitor worked well the first two days after travel to the location, but by day three it stopped functioning as if it it had been dropped (it wasn't).  I plan to cuntsct the manufacturer because I would expect a portable monitor such as this to be tough enough to withstand a short business trip.

I would buy this product again.  I thought the picture was good enough, which is to say I'm not one to nitpick over every pixel.  I thought the coloring was fine and I felt like it would serve as a light and easily setup second and/or third screen option. I felt the price was fair for the quality.
Best things:

review_title: One of the best purchase decisions I've ever made
review_body: One of the best purchase decisions I've ever made! I love this, especially when I have to travel for work!

review_title: Great screen (once you figure out how to set its ...
review_body: Great screen (once you figure out how to set its brightness), which works equally well in landscape and portrait mode. Fairly light, and the stand design is a great feature compared to similar products. No issue with the USB connection or lag. The addition of a carrying pouch is a nice addition (although it doesn't seem to protect against much besides dust ...).

I won't go into techy land depth here, but this monitor is very valuable if you travel for work like I do. The resolution is fantastic and I don't experience any lag; all this with a non-3.0 compatible laptop... Would highly recommend. Fits in my laptop bag (albeit snugly) that also carries my 15" laptop. (I bought the Skooba over the shoulder laptop bag, if you're wondering, and that is also highly recommended.) Monitor was basically plug and play with a cord that is long enough to go around to the other side of my laptop. I really like that you can easily adjust the angle of the monitor (depending on how much you want to slouch in your chair). I think this is the best bang for your buck as far as portable monitors go! Although when I purchased from Amazon it was only $129.99. Good luck!

review_title: Ordered a laptop monitor, got a broken laptop in the monitor box.
review_body: I purchased this item for my daughter in November.  She took the first semester of 2018 off so she didn't unbox the monitor.  She opened it today and what she found was a broken Toshiba laptop not the monitor.  It is packaged in the monitor box but we just got totally screwed.  It was over $100 but the return and support window is closed.  What do we do?

review_title: Very good monitor at a very good price.
review_body: I ordered this monitor yesterday (Sunday) and it arrived today - free shipping, no Prime.  That's amazing.

review_title: It's okay. Hard to calibrate, apples to apples
review_body: Can confirm what others have said: It's clearly not always the same panel inside, just seems to be the same dimensions and housing. I was somewhat disappointed. I this same model from 4 years ago. The new one I just ordered is sitting next to the old one. I've done some color calibration, but the new one just doesn't look like the old one. I actually prefer the old one. I might return this and just get something larger.

Initially bought this monitor for a budget build which worked great for 1080p gaming. Bought a second 970 for SLI which then became overkill for this monitor. This monitor is great for gaming and everyday computing and I highly recommend it for low end systems. For price to performance ratio, you really can't beat this monitor.It comes with one VGA, 1 HDMI and 1 DVI port.

review_title: Bigger than my old monitor, but takes up less space.
review_body: The work space for my desktop is limited with the two printers, scanner and other non-essentials so the size of a monitor was a concern.  This monitor is larger than my old monitor but because of the lower stand it fits with room to spare.  It can also be adjusted for what you're doing at the time and is clear as a bell.  I highly recommend this monitor.

Good price and the perfect size for my use.  I purchased two and have them sitting side by side on my desk.  I use these for work and for home.  With the multiple inputs I can easily switch between my work and home computers.  Having dual monitors makes my job much easier.  The picture quality is good for the work that I do, including using Office products and Photoshop.  I also use the HDMI input for a Tivo Mini and the TV picture quality is good as well.  Built-in speakers may have been handy but I connected the Tivo Mini to my PC speakers and the sound is probably better than any built-in speakers.

review_title: So far I have been very pleased with this monitor
review_body: So far I have been very pleased with this monitor.  I am an avid gamer, and the screen is crisp, with a great refresh rate.  It's MUCH lighter than my last monitor. Mine had no stuck or dead pixels, and arrived in perfect condition.  I've used both a DVI and HDMI cable with it, and both worked excellent. (Though you might have to update your video drivers for the DVI to work 100%, this is a card issue, and not a problem with the monitor.  If you're not obsessed with 120hz refresh rates, this monitor will work great for you.
Works great. I already had one of these, and bought the second for dual displays.

review_title: I wish I could give this 5 stars...
review_body: I have to say, I absolutely love this monitor. I use it for photo editing and gaming. It's actually so great that I was about to order another one when I realized that Acer never sent my rebate. I competed all of the paperwork and mailed everything in within 30 days of my purchase and they never contacted me. I plan on calling Monday morning to try and clear it all up but until their customer service dept comes through on their end of the deal I can't give this a positive rating. It's unfortunate because the product is very good.

review_title: Edit: Great packaging and delivery time, still some color weirdness
review_body: I received this monitor so fast after placing the order.  When I unboxed it, I found no defects, no scratches, and all of the promised parts.  When I plugged it in, I did what probably everyone does: I played the most vibrant, high-definition videos I could.  The first thing I looked for were dead pixels.  Everything one of them seemed to be in working condition.  Then I started comparing it to the other monitors (and LED TV we use as our primary monitor) and found that the picture was not quite as sharp, and there was a yellow tint to it.  I had been reading the reviews for different monitors when choosing one and remembered someone having a similar issue to this (I believe the display name is M. Chang).  He purchased the same model as one he prviously owned, and noted that the new one had a yellow tint.

review_title: Great Monitor for a Great Price!
review_body: I love this monitor. I have purchased several of these recently for my customers. I also use the HP 24" that are slightly cheaper. I can tell you that without a doubt, these are better. I love having all three ports (DVI, HDMI, and VGA). This way I don't have to order a special cable from amazon in order to connect it up. It also looks great. For the price, it can't be beat.

I have had this portable screen for about two weeks. Initially, it worked great and was everything I wanted. Now, when I plug it in, the welcome AOC screen will pop up, but then the screen goes black. I am hoping that this is a defect and the new one they are replacing it with will be better.

Great portable monitor!  I've had this now for several months and it does everything I need.  Has a good HD screen, works like a charm.  The set up was not without problems - the CD that came with it did not have the right drivers.  If you buy this, contact the company directly when you set it up.  Once I figured it out - no problems, which is why I'm still giving it 5 stars.
Best one out there. The USB-C version only works with USB-C. The ASUS one keeps dying on me. Yes, I have 3 (4?).

Love this extra monitor. Nowaday every and all work is done on a computer. For my small business it's very helpful to have an extra monitor to display documents. Excellent product. Excellent price and service.
Great monitor really like it. Cons the stand isn't that great and the provided cable is a bully mess.

review_title: It works great! Just need the right power!
review_body: I really like the product but it is sometimes difficult to use with a Microsoft Surface Pro. You must use the Surface charger USB to provide sufficient power to the monitor. That isn't such a big deal but it seems to make the monitor have issues with staying on. It blinks constantly when I hover my mouse on its screen. In the future, I will try and get a monitor that is matched more effectively to my power output. However, when it works, it is awesome.

review_title: I love the size and weight
review_body: I love the size and weight, but since day one the plug is loose and most of the time it is not working because of the plug.
Good to travel with. Light weight and good padding in cover. Great picture. Exactly what was needed for plug and play.

I love the monitor. Problem is it breaks very easily, and then when it breaks they tell you it's not covered under warranty. That makes you either buy another one or find a competitor, which is what I think I'm going to have to do. Very dissatisfied with the customer service and warranty

review_title: may work for some. certainly not for apple users
review_body: Sent it back same hour I opened it. doesn't work well with apple computers. The USB screen does not allow video playback while attached as it is not up to standard playback rights something-something. Pain in the neck. long story short. if you have a mac its is not worth it. Brightness is low, Resolution is low. This seems like a good idea but​ this is not the right product.

review_title: Decent, as long as you're not looking for perfection
review_body: I encode videos and bought this because I needed an HD monitor to view them properly. I've fiddled with the settings but the color is still less saturated and too bright in comparison to my old monitor sitting next to it. So far no major problems but it does look like the bottom left corner of the screen is a bit brighter than the rest. What REALLY bothers me is the flimsy stand. Every time I go to turn the monitor off or adjust the settings, it tilts all the way to the side and I have to stabilize the top with my other hand to be able to actually press the button in (while the monitor is bending over sideways). I'm not even going to bother with the warranty since they won't honor it.
Big, inexpensive, and bright. Worked great with a Mac Air.

Nice monitor.  Opened box, attached the VESA mount that I had already, plugged in the power cord and the HDMI and off I went.  Did a little tweaking and it looks good.  Work that I am doing from home on my laptop will sure be alot easier now.  Would recommend this monitor!

review_title: Awesome picture, they don't advertise the refresh rate
review_body: I have 3 of those hooked up to a computer. Awesome picture, they don't advertise the refresh rate, its 60 hz.

Not quite like having an HD plasma TV on my desk, but similar.  I could not find any pixel flaws in all black, all white and primary color screen images.  The black is really black.  The colors are brilliant and uniform across the screen.  Using some LCD monitor test images, I could not discern any off-angle color changes before 30 degrees from perpendicular view, which gives uniform coloration for the entire screen from normal viewing distances.  That is nowhere near the 178 degree viewing angle advertised, but perfect for a single viewer.  My old LCD monitor could not display uniformity of horizontal or vertical color from even twice the width of the screen away, so this is an enormous improvement for me.

review_title: ... these for dual monitor use and they were an excellent addition. These are actually smaller than the monitors ...
review_body: I bought a pair of these for dual monitor use and they were an excellent addition.  These are actually smaller than the monitors they replaced but I don't really notice the size difference.  I will give a word of advise to anyone mounting these as I did so they don't make the dumb mistake I made.  When you remove the stand bracket make sure you immediately replace the screws you removed.  I did not and went right to mounting the wall mount bracket.  The end result is the 2 retention clips came loose and now they rattle around the back of my monitor.  Other than that the only thing I can complain about is the included DVI cables rather than HDMI.  Overall these are excellent monitors with outstanding contrast at a bargain price.
Monitor is fantastic.  I use it for gaming and it can keep up with the all the colors and movements and effects on screen with no "ghosting" latency.

I'm currently on my second monitor from these guys. The first one was DOA, but that was from UPS so I can't put that against them, but the second one got a dead pixel nearly a month after I started using it. After experiencing their customer support for the first time, i really didn't want to go through that ordeal again.

Absolutely Thrilled. I've had this monitor for more than 60 days and I've had absolutely zero problems. I use a dual monitor system in my recording studio. Sometimes I have them stacked for multi-instrument  recording and back to side-by-side for mix down. This monitor is bright and crystal clear; much cleaner and brighter than my other monitors. In the near future I plan to upgrade to a quad system and you can bet I will be using this same product.

review_title: Holy smokes that's a nice monitor
review_body: Bought this for use on an Apple mini.  Works so, so well.  Put it on an Evo LCD arm, looks as awesome as it works now.  The stand does leave quite a bit to be desired, but I would not buy another LCD without putting it on some kind of mount, so I can't knock them for using something a bit sub-par.  Color is so brilliant, monitor is capable of being hugely bright.  Had to turn it way down.  No dead pixels on mine.  Controls are somewhat unintuitive, but once they are set it doesn't really matter.  Really well designed thing, would definitely consider getting more.
Oh my gosh, I can't rate this thing high enough.  Quality and display are great!.  So easy to set up and use and so lightweight.

review_title: Does exactly what you would expect
review_body: So I just got this monitor about an hour ago. It was up and running in no time. A lot of reviews really get out of hand with the expectations they had. I mean lets start with it is a USB powered monitor, and does not have a AC power supply. So yeah, the colors are not going to be the most vivid, nor will it be the brightest, it's running on the little bit of power from a USB port, so give it a break there. The resolution is not a huge issue to me. I got this monitor for the purpose of having a second display for school work, since I have e-books for some classes, I wanted a second screen for the book to leave my laptop screen free to do the homework. The resolution is equivalent to that of a lower end laptop. If you really want a higher brightness, color spectrum, and higher resolution, move to a monitor that is not powered via USB. This monitor will solve the issue for someone who wants more screen space on the go, but does not want to hurt their wallet.

The monitor stopped working at the 90 day mark (the end of the warranty).  I sent it back to the designated service center epius or Oneness eServices LLC.  Oneness sent an email that said the item "may" be out of warranty.  I called and the person said it was damaged, he explained that it must have been dropped or similar trauma and is not covered by the warranty.  He also said that the packaging I used to sent it was not adequate (2" of bubble wrap around every surface).

I took this on a trip. I put it inside a suitcase in the provided carrying case and surrounded by clothes above and below it. The damned thing still cracked. I threw it away. Don't waste your money.The other thing I should note is that the image wasn't great.

review_title: Great idea, but many comprimises in actual design.
review_body: Lightweight, easy to travel with, nice travel bag.

review_title: Great, once get past installation of driver
review_body: Rounding up from 3.5 stars. The monitor itself is great; better than expected image quality and simple with only one cord for both connection to computer and power. However, the driver was a pain to install. Now that I do have it, it is great, but the ease of setup and use has to be taken into consideration and it should not be that difficult to connect an additional monitor to my laptop.
Fantastic, I have recommended these to so many people, Can use it at home, or put in a backpack to travel. I take this everywhere when I travel to use as a 2nd monitor.

review_title: Ok as a temporary second monitor
review_body: Use of this monitor is only meant to be as a temporary solution only.  The back lighting is uneven and the image quality is not that great.  However, this only costs less than $100 so you really get what you pay for.  Would I buy this again?  Probably not.

review_title: So far so good. It is exactly what i need when traveling
review_body: So far so good. It is exactly what i need when traveling. I have even dropped it a couple times, pretty sturdy. The price is not bad so it would be easily replaced if needed. i would definitely recommend this.

Beware. Nice light weight monitor but don't let the "portable" description fool you. I had mine for 8 months, always keep in the provided case and in a padded backpack, which when flying, was my carry on; I turned on one day to find it not working. I had purchased the Square trade protection plan, called them and was referred back to the manufacturer, who in turn said it was not covered.  Be careful buying the protection plan and anything from AOC!
I've only owned a couple monitors in my life, none of them over 23 inches.

I needed to buy some new monitors for work, so I did a bit of poking around and I was shocked when I came across these. Good size monitors from a reputable manufacture for a reasonable price. I decided that to give them a try, and if I liked them, I would consider buying them for myself. Seeing as it was the company that would be paying for them, it was similar to playing with house money. I took them to a trade show and was quite impressed. They were leaps and bounds better then what I had at home so I got two more for the home office. Overall they're exactly what I wanted. I'm pretty particular about my computer equipment, and in terms of value for money, these are a great buy.

review_title: Excellent 1st year of ownership so far and going!
review_body: Excellent 1st year of ownership so far and going!  Excellent IPS monitor good enough for photography work at a consumer monitor price.  Excellent value and great consistency across the panel and from higher angles of view.  I haven't calibrated it with any tools but looked to online reviews for best settings and standard mode was recommended for best white balance, if I remember correctly.  I rarely print and most of my photos are viewed by consumer monitors.  Maybe in the future they will all be better calibrated than my monitor is now, but this doesn't appear to be an issue right now, and I keep RAWs of the photos I keep for future reprocessing, should I need it.

review_title: Hazy when compared to another IPS screen
review_body: I have 2 ASUS PA248Q's which are AMAZING, however I am trying out video capture devices, all of which accept a max resolution of 1080p. The PA248Q's get fuzzy and stretched at that resolution so I was looking for a similar screen at a lower resolution. This screen is great and works, however there is a blurry/smudged/greyed look to it compared to the PA248Q which ruins color quality. I am currently looking to replace this with a better color quality monitor.

review_title: Arrived with two dead pixels - colours look noticeably different
review_body: I'll try to give a more detailed review later, but for now let me just say that I'm really disappointed with this buy.

review_title: Used for a dual screen workstation. Love it!
review_body: Very happy with purchase and product. Bought two for a dual screen workstation in my home office. I attached then to a desk mount to bring it to eye level and increase the desk real estate. Installation was a breeze and worked great out of the box,basically a plug and play installation. Be aware that do not come with speakers but do have 3.5 mm outputs on the rear.

review_title: May have just been me, but...
review_body: I tried and tried and tried with this monitor. I'm sure it was something I was doing wrong, but I have never had this problem with any other monitor. But it would randomly, after 5-15 mins, shut down into sleep mode, and the only way to get it back was to restart it. Now, while it was up, had a great image, pretty colors, and just all around looked great. But when it turned off, that was just too much. Had to send it back.

This monitor is nothing short of exceptional.  The build quality is stellar and the screen quality is exceptional.  The colors are extremely rich and vibrant on the 1080p screen.  I use a lot of Photoshop, Premiere Pro, and Visual Studios and cannot wait to use this monitor for my projects.  I had been using an OEM LCD screen which I considered to be a good screen; I only decided to get another display so I could have two screens for my coding projects.  At first I ended up picking up a $109 Acer LCD display from CompUSA, but was very unimpressed with the display when I got home.  I returned it and purchased this monitor for only $30 more and am SO GLAD I did.  Trust me, you will be nothing short of amazed with this display.  I have never seen such a beautiful monitor.  I'm going to have to hide my wallet from myself or I'll end up buying another one just to replace what is an otherwise perfect OEM LCD display.  For $144 this monitor is nothing short of a steal.  My computer engineering roommate thought I bought a $500 monitor.  I'm almost convinced that I did.

I looked at Monitors on amazon and review sites 4 months but kept coming back to this one because of the price and reviews, if I had wanted to spend 200$ or more then I probably would have ordered a higher end model, but this one went on sale right before Christmas and I pulled the trigger on it , I am very happy I did. No dead pixels and the stand is OK too, it does not wobble unless your desk wobbles. Good all around Monitor, Very good gaming "BF4" type games and anything else you want to do. Don't compare it to a 250$ monitor because it's not in that group, in the under 200$ group it is one of the best.

review_title: Not happy with this monitor because of that but other than ...
review_body: Had to use an old ATI video driver (version 8.87) and Catalyst Control Center (version 09.1) with Windows 8.1 to get it to expand to full screen.

review_title: I hate to give this such a low rating
review_body: I hate to give this such a low rating. After all, it is compact, light weight, and has a pretty good picture. But the box lies, it is NOT a plug and play item, you have to install software to make it work, and if your resolution differs from it, it will change it automatically. And it didn't take it very long for the software to start causing issues with the laptop to the point that the system would wind up BSODing.

review_title: Great portable screen.  Makes it easier for us who work in IT to be more productive.
review_body: Excellent screen. A bit thicker than I would have like but overall works great.  My only compliant is that the back usb3 connector is sensitive to cable movement.  I saw some comments about brightness.  If you install the latest drivers from AOC website you can adjust brightness of screen via DIsplay link software.
Using this as a second monitor with my laptop.  With a little format tweaking, it makes a very satisfying match.

Seemed like a great item... loved everything about it... EXCEPT the screen was glossy vs. matte and there was so much glare from the lighting in the room that it hurt my eyes.  I returned and got the ASUS version instead.  Would have rather this one though (due to design and pricepoint etc.)

review_title: It was been working really good with my new Lenovo Yoga 920 so far
review_body: It was been working really good with my new Lenovo Yoga 920 so far.  I love everything about it.

review_title: and I like that the display rotates
review_body: It stands well, and I like that the display rotates.
A couple of weeks ago I bought 2 monitors  AOC brand new, through AMAZON... but yesterday when I was working one of these monitors was broken when hit with a pencil.
I use this monitor for school and it has been great. I use one usb 3.0 hub on my laptop and have had no issues with it.

i have used this with my dell laptop for a year now with extensive travel. Absolutely love it. Today in the hotel it fell off the table and broke into three pieces; the front and back can and the very thin screen with a flat cable that attaches to a control board on the back panel. I was very mad at myself for knocking it off the desk but I was able to plug the cable back in and snap the whole thing together again. Works just as good as ever !
The product is plug and play but note that the resolution is low so if your using it for email and stuff. The words get blurry. So it gets hard on the eye when using for long.
Love ❤️ this!!!  Great price and awesome screen quality!  Needed this for work ao use it for over 8hrs a day...exceeded my expectations!
Wow, the image  quality on this monitor is outstanding! The image goes all the way to the edge. I will be getting more of these monitor in the future.
I love the size and the bezel-less feature. Very High Definition.

This product lasted 73 days before the screen went black and lost all display capabilities. It now makes for the most expensive paperweight I have ever purchased. Acer customer service was difficult to contact and offered little help. I didn't expect to have to purchase a brand-new monitor just two-and-a-half months after purchasing a brand-new monitor...
EXCELLENT BUY I WAS VERY PLEASED WITH IT

review_title: Very minimal bezel as advertised - great for dual monitor setup.
review_body: These are great monitors - just as advertised.  The minimal bezel makes them great for a dual monitor set up.
I wanted a large screen, I go it.  Colors are accurate.

review_title: Proplems automaticaly started up when I already turned off computer
review_body: After about a week even though my computer was off the screen kept popping up at random then goes off the only way I can fix it is to turn the thing completely off
The assembly required some force and was a bit difficult but that was the only hard part. It's decently sized and the quality is nice. I haven't had any problems with it so far.
first one i got the screen started coming unglued but they gave me a replacement, pretty good screen, wish it had speakers though...

Within days I began noticing increasing ghosting. After a little bit of looking around I discovered that this is a common problem for this monitor that can sometimes be corrected by disabling OD. Doing so lessened but did not eliminate the problem. Within a week I began noticing a slight flickering. Having read about the numerous issues other customers have had with this monitor I decided to return it, not exchange it, and look for something more reliable. I wouldn't recommend this product to anyone, it's sole purpose is to display things clearly and it is unable to do so.

review_title: Great choice from an average guy's perspective
review_body: I'm impressed with this monitor, especially given it's price. I'm a pretty average guy who uses this for Netflix, gaming, and dabbling in photography.

review_title: Performing well after a couple months
review_body: Bought this as a second monitor.  We have a 23.0 inch Asus already (earlier version and slightly smaller of this model) and liked the performance.  One very noticeable item with the new monitor beside the old one is the white's are much whiter than the older monitor that is only about 3 years old.  Moving the same web site from one monitor to the next shows that the old monitor whites have more yellow.  No monitor or windows display setting adjustments changes that effect.  So, if color is important to you and you are using dual monitors, buy two of the same monitor.  I am considering buying a second one and moving the old monitor to an older computer.

Very clear and works well with my new Evga Geforce GTX 960 video card. My previous monitor was a 17" that I had for a while and this one has a much wider view.  I was building a new Computer and hadn't really decided since the other monitor was still working good and I had purchase a new video card a few months back. I finely decided to go with all new and I'm glad I did since this monitor makes a large difference over what I had before. I am very satisfied.

review_title: Very nice monitor for the price
review_body: I'm not a professional photographer or radiologist or anything that would require super-precise color accuracy, etc., but for the money, this is a fantastic monitor for general use, is quite bright and clear, and I have no problem editing photos on it or reading on it.

I just needed a cheap IPS and this did the trick. Monitor's not as nice looking as my Thinkpad Yoga screen though lol (that one is glossy). I'm one of the few who prefers glossy screens... kinda wish I put in a little more money for Freesync too but in well

Monitor came with no problems. I have been playing Crysis 2 with my ps3 connected to it by HDMI and I must say this monitor looks amazing. As it says, it is FULL HD 1080p. Does not come with built in speakers and I don't care, cause I have my speakers connected to the headphones jack this monitor has on the back so I didn't have to buy any HDMI adaptar to reproduce audio! I haven't used my PC with an HDMI cable yet cause my PC is so old it does not support it. But in the coming weeks I'll be building my first gaming pc and I'll make sure to update this review and tell you how it looks. Right now I'm using VGA. And either way, looks awesome the colors are very vivid.

review_title: "OMG! IT'S SO TINY!" -- This is NOT what she said.
review_body: I ordered this monitor for the new computer build I'm working on. Those parts have yet to come, but this beast of a monitor has. I failed to realize how gigantic this thing was, and was shocked when I opened the package. I have been using my girl friends 18" Dell LCD monitor for over a year since my Dell 20.1" 2005FPW went out on me. This screen has so much real estate, I have forgotten what it's like. It's great.

Just like all the other reviewers say, this monitor really is an exceptional value; the best bang for your buck IPS monitor you will find out there. I am now using it with a baseline 15" mid-2010 Macbook Pro, which has more than enough of a GPU to power this display.  I tested it on some graphics heavy games and video processing software, and my Macbook Pro handles the display just perfectly; I get beautiful 1080p via an HDMI connection.

review_title: Great Monitor with an annoying drawback....
review_body: I am the type of shopper that looks at a product several times before purchasing. Reviews tend to have a strong impact on whether or not I buy a specific product or move on. Well, as I was shopping for a monitor I came across several ASUS monitors that fit the budget and did what I wanted them to do. This particular monitor's specs were great. The information on this one was a lot less specific than on the larger model (23inch?) which was the same model just a little bit bigger so that was helpful if you're looking for more specs.

Nice screen, nice carrying case. Currently the driver at the company's website will not work for Windows 10 -- you will have to go to the DisplayLink website directly to download the Windows 10 driver. The cable connector seems like it is not the tightest/strongest connection and I worry about that. All in all, good product.

I love using this monitor as either a third on my desk or as a second on the road.  It is very bright and easy to read.  Fits in my backpack and is easy to setup.  The display technology works with gotomeeting, lync, and webex which is very important to me.  I use it for business applications and don't know (or care) how it does with graphics.  For my needs it has been excellent and gets used daily.  I wish I had found this sooner.

review_title: Dont BUY if you are Gaming
review_body: This product is ok for watching movies but if you want to game 60FPS this monitor will not help you.

The product seemed completely fine in the exterior, until I plugged it in and realised it came damaged. The screen just shows weird random color pixels (lines and circles). Since I live in Venezuela I'm not even sure if I'll be able to return the product (it seems to have lifetime warranty).

review_title: Monitor would not display - Had download another driver to work
review_body: Would not work after installing drivers. Went to [...] and downloaded the USB display driver for my Windows 8. Monitor worked finally!!!

review_title: Washed out Color and Didn't work with Dell Laptop
review_body: Washed out colors when I hooked it to a my Apple.  It wouldn't work at all with my Work Wintel machine which is why I bought it in the first place.  I tried their customer support but gave up after the 4th try and contacted Amazon.

I'm shopping for another monitor and I'm amazed this one is still on the market. The one I have worked for a month or so until the power port failed.  I helped it limp along by cramming different thicknesses of paper to get the connection solid.  The product is trash, spend the money for a known, trustworthy brand that'll back its products.

review_title: Huge Waste of Money - NOT MAC COMPATIBLE
review_body: Bought it to use with my Mac because the reviews said it was compatible. It worked once and then every time after that I would have to uninstall and reinstall the drivers and restart my computer. Now it doesn't work with my Mac at all. It's been 3 months. Huge waste of money.

Works great with Windows 10 Pro after installing the drivers on the CD. Image quality is perfectly fine.  Not blurry as others state.  Has traveled with me on the road and seems durable enough. Comes with a nice padded pouch.

review_title: Auto-Pivot doesn't work. Bad costumer service.
review_body: I bought the monitor, installed the driver from AOC's website in my Windows 8.1 and the auto-pivot didn't work. I've tried to get in touch with costumer service and they gave me the following reply:
I bought two monitors for an at home workstation and they are great. No problems and they both work great. I would definitely purchase again if needed.

review_title: The Monitor Works Great, but if you look at the very edge ...
review_body: The Monitor Works Great, but if you look at the very edge on both right and left sides you will see a black ghost shadow line behind your mouse pointer unless you are looking from the front at 90 degrees. So you can't move your had from the dead center if you don't want to see the shadow. I have attached two images one shows front view the other shows angled vide with shadow.  This might be OK for some users but if you are using AutoCAD or other engineering software it is really annoying
Good monitor. No issues. I've used Acer monitors over the years for small business clients and they tend to never let me down.

review_title: Great monitor if you are on a budget
review_body: I've been using this for gaming with my Xbox One and I really like it. I'm not super technical but the picture is solid and I haven't had any issues with the monitor.

review_title: Can't get better for the price
review_body: I was blown away the first time I used these. Acer has really made a name for themselves over the past few years. I primarily use these for photography but they can be used for other things. Their definitely not a 300 dollar monitor but they're amazing for what they are.
Metal stand arrived bent preventing the monitor from locking into place.

review_title: Ended up having to return it because it didn't work ...
review_body: Ended up having to return it because it didn't work with my new Mac (which is the whole reason I bought it in the first place)
Brand name item, at a reasonable cost !
Screen looks and works great. Currently have set up in my custom bartop arcade system. Going strong!
The screen is not that good. There's no support to put on a stand. Too expensive for what it offers.

review_title: Great option for everyday computer use
review_body: Looks great - bright, sharp picture, and it auto-adjusted to the optimal resolution.  It's connected via HDMI to a Mac mini, and it was completely plug and play - up and running two minutes after coming out of the box.  Great monitor for the price.  Note:  No intense gaming or serious graphic design work going on here, so I can't comment on refresh rate, extreme color fidelity, etc.  For everyday use, it seems like a great pick so far.  The only small gripe - and I knew this before I bought it - is that it's not height adjustable.  But that's why reams of paper were invented, right...?

review_title: Good Monitor, but audio port has a pretty glaring issue.
review_body: This is a really great monitor. The colors look wonderful, even when photo editing or playing games. My biggest issue is the headphone jack on the back, which was partially why I bought this monitor. I wanted to be able to plug in headphones to that port so they aren't going all the way to the audio ports on my desktop. While the audio quality is fine, the audio port is set up to shut off when it is not detecting much sound.

review_title: My second Asus monitor and not my last
review_body: I have been using Asus monitors for a few years now.  I think they make a fine monitor.  I had a horrible 27" Haans-G monitor that died in a little over 18 months.  It started flickering and dying long before then.  When that died, I decided to look into a smaller, more reliable monitor so I didn't care as much when it dies.

review_title: 5/5 for display. 0/5 for stand. We call ...
review_body: 5/5 for display. 0/5 for stand. We call it the bobble head.  Something as minor as someone walking in the room causes it to wobble back and forth. Ended up giving it to my daughter as a serious display upgrade. Already she's complaining about the movement. I will end up either buying a mounting bracket or more probably just end up sticking a couple wood pieces under it to stop the shake. Which will look just as classy as the stand is. Ended up buying a LG which has a rock solid stand.

I bought this to replace my old HP monitor that finally bit the dust, and am very happy that I went with this one. The size is great, and unlike some, I didn't have to do any adjusting right out of the box (guess I got lucky). I've watched movies and played computer games with this monitor, and the response time is really good, very smooth motion. I really like the slim design, and while it does feel flimsy (as some reviewers have stated) and does wobble a bit, it has held up well through numerous uses, both by me and my grandchildren, and don't see there being any problems. All in all, I'm very happy with this monitor.

This monitor has everything I desired in a high quality unit.  One word of caution: I found that using a HDMI cable (pure digital signal) instead of the VGA cable (analog signal) gave me the best performance.  The problem I encountered when I used the VGA cable first was that random gray waves of noise would continuously move across the monitor's screen - especially on a white background.  That was annoying.  I thought it was the monitor's fault.  But after reading an article on another website which indicated that LCD monitors work better with a HDMI cable (or DVI), I changed my connection to a HDMI cable and the gray waves of noise disappeared!  Wow!  I highly recommend this monitor.
I love the monitor.  Well, loved, actually.  It died today.

OK this is only the second led terminal I have bought the last being about 5 years ago. I found the screen was good enough for the games that are played on it. I bought this to use with a Assassin Computronpc for gaming that my grandson uses when he is here. The only real issue I see was one mentioned in another review, the shakiness of the terminal as the base is somewhat small and it doesn't take much to make the terminal move. You can tilt the terminal OK but other then that it's fixed in place. The price was good for what you get so I had no complaints there.  I did find that they supplied a cable with the terminal that works great with my PC's digital output so you shouldn't have to buy a cable.

review_title: The one we got is unreliable, I think it's a poor value.
review_body: Bought for my Mom and right past return period decided to quit working.  Randomly shuts off and she has to turn it back on all the time.

This product was purchased to replace a Dell LCD monitor which approximately the same size.  It is being utilized with our security system DVR unit.  The product itself is fulfilling our requirements.  However, it is an LED device and the video is somewhat washed out from the glare from the ceiling fluorescent lights that are located above it.  This may not be a problem in other installations, i.e. when connected to a PC on a desktop.

review_title: I am very satisfied with this monitor
review_body: I am very satisfied with this monitor. It does drain my laptop battery fairly quickly but looks and works great so far.

This is an excellent portable monitor controlled via my laptop's USB port.  No external power supply is needed other than the laptop.  The monitor was operational for over four hours with my laptop's radios turned off (WiFi and Bluetooth).  The LED monitor's  display is good for any presentation where electricity is absent.

review_title: The resolution isn't good and it will randomly shut off for a few ...
review_body: To big and bulky. The resolution isn't good and it will randomly shut off for a few seconds even with the second USB plugged in
Great product.... I've grown accustom to having 2 screens at the office... now I have 2 screens on the road!

review_title: Fantastic quality for the price - and easy to use!
review_body: I've only had the second monitor for a couple months, but I have to say, it works wonderfully!  It's extremely easy to setup, and it's thin enough to store anywhere...a laptop bag, in luggage, etc.  Excellent item, and I look forward to using it more and more!

The angle of view and contrast leave a bit to be desired.  Get more than a tad from straight veiw angle and color and intensity of the screen spirals quickly.  Then again, just being a USB powered monitor makes it a pretty handy, portable, traveling monitor and that is pretty much its forte from my perspective.
The description says mac compatible, it leaves out that it isn't mac OS High Sierra compatible. This software is to new and doesn't have mirroring. Wasted so much time.
I bought this December 2016. It has stopped working. Would like to think it would last longer than that.
Pros: It's cheap and the kickstand is very nice.
I LOVE THIS PRODUCT!  I use this at work when going from meeting to meeting so that I can still have 2 screens - I'm the envy of many - this is awesome!

review_title: This screen is great, the side and top bezels are ultra thin ...
review_body: This screen is great, the side and top bezels are ultra thin and the price was legitimate. The only complaint that I have is that the screen does have some slight backlight bleeding in the top corners of the screen. The light bleeding is NOT noticeable unless the room is dark and the image on the screen is also dark. Even in the worst case scenario, the monitor is still near perfection. 4/5
Very nice colors, pretty big monitor, has nice back and forth movement if you need to move it. Very thin putter line, nice graphics and is very beautiful period

review_title: My cousin chose this for me as he is a photographer and saw the pixels & configuration which is a good deal for this price
review_body: I work from home sometimes and wish I could have a big screen. My cousin chose this for me as he is a photographer and saw the pixels & configuration which is a good deal for this price.

review_title: HDMI port is straight out the back, seems weaker ...
review_body: HDMI port is straight out the back, seems weaker than it should be to support a medium quality HDMI cable. Make sure you tie the cable to the base to keep the weight off of the port.

review_title: Great monitor. The only thing which upset me a ...
review_body: Great monitor. The only thing which upset me a little bit, is that there was only VGA cable and wasn't HDMI cable.
The best monitor I have ever had
looking at the screen right now, so far i have had it for about 4 months and i'm very happy with it. It sits in my basement all the time with no heat so we will see how it holds up this winter.
Great monitor, worth the purchase
Love the fact it has an option to reduce blue light, it has helped with my eye strain issues.
very nice led screen for the price

review_title: Great Monitor. Do not buy the more expensive "248H-P" model.
review_body: I've owned many Asus products, I wanted to play PC games in eyefinity mode (three monitors at once using a single large resolution). I already had a LCD 24 inch Asus 242H and loved it, so I bought this one as the 2nd monitor and then a 248H-P as the 3rd. I LOVE this monitor and HATE the look of the 248. For some reason the 248 has this ugly blue hue that you cannot get rid of no matter what you do, this is especially annoying when you are trying to make each monitors colors match. I ended up putting a 'cool' blue filter on the other two monitors to compensate until I decided that I would just return the 248 and get another 247H-P. I'm very glad that I did, having two of these and a third LCD has been great. Also, it only took me a few seconds to get the colors matched.

review_title: Broken within four months, a new record for ASUS!
review_body: I admit, I'm already not one of ASUS's biggest fans after a recent debacle over an over-heating laptop that they "fixed" and returned three separate times, without ever actually fixing the problem, until it was out of warranty and thus no longer their problem. This monitor was bought as part of the replacement computer built to replace that very laptop. And of all the parts I bought it was the only ASUS piece. And also the only one to inexplicably break after four months of gentle daily use. I tilted the screen very slightly toward myself and the screen went determinedly black. No amount of wiggling cords or unplugging and replugging could change it, it was just dead.

We bought this because of the (something about the refresh rate, lol) for our son to go with his new PC for school. He knows more about it than we do and he loves the monitor. It's actually better than mine :) I highly recommend!
Pros: Lightweight, Amazing contrast ratio, Abundance of Settings, Built-in speakers aren't bad for what they are.

This screen is clearer than I expected it to be. I am currently using a VGA connection & it still looks better than any of the computer screens at work. I can only imagine how the screen will look when I use the HDMI connection.

review_title: Great monitor with one fatal flaw.
review_body: 5 star monitor when it working, but it puts itself to sleep when I turn off my computer and it doesn't automatically wake up when I turn the computer back on. I have to turn the monitor off and on again every time I turn off my computer. I've tried changing all of the normal power settings as recommended by google search, and none change anything. I've never had this problem with any other monitor.

review_title: Asus VS247H-P 23.6-Inch Full-HD LED-Lit LCD Monitor
review_body: First thing I noticed was the angle of view. Way off to the side you still can see very good. Might be a problem in an office setting. No burnt out pixels. Impressed in how black the blacks are. Everything hooked up fine and started to work. Color is great. I have not had any of the edge glare like some have spoken of. All cords come straight out the back something to keep in mind if your desk faces a wall and you want the monitor up tight to the wall. Also some have not liked the stand. The stand is just fine for this monitor I don't know what some would like to see for a stand a boat anchor? I guess you could drill holes in it and screw it to your desk?

As with all monitors, they must be dialed to personal preferences.  I used Windows 7's Display Adjustments to get type and resolutions set.  I then used ATI's Catalyst software to adjust the colors, contrast and brightness.  It took about :15 minutes to get everything set to my preferences.  This is the third Asus monitor I owned (23.3 and 25.6) and with a value meter on price and quality of display image I have never been disappointed.  This one is particularly sweet.
