Nice dark's, color saturation, refresh, brightness, beautiful when playing Crysis 3.  Oh, no dead pixels.  I guess you have to mention it even though it happens occasionally that a monitor slips by quality control.  I could tell you a horror story on an Oldsmobile I bought, too.  It happens, RMA it.

review_title: Great value. Sharp, easy on the eyes.
review_body: We have been buying these monitors for several years. I have been satisfied with every one. Sharp image, good color, not fatiguing. None of our staff have complained about difficulty, and I have not noticed any blurriness or inconsistencies. I cannot recommend these higher for business applications. I am not a designer, so I can't recommend this for people who work in video or photo editing or graphic design, but for regular business use these are about as close to perfect as you can get at this price point.

review_title: This screen has some really nice bright color and has a nice tilt to get ...
review_body: I bought this monitor for my wife at home.  She didn't want a really big screen, as they are over whelming for her.  This screen has some really nice bright color and has a nice tilt to get the angle just right.  I like this monitor because it has an HDMI port as well as a Dvi and VGA port.  This is a good monitor is you ever decide to upgrade your computer, since most computers have HDMI out now.  Great monitor for the price.

After the first use no longer worked.  Contacted support and the only advice was to install the correct driver which was the case and still nothing.  Great idea but in my opinion, not ready for prime time - big disappoint.

MAKES WORKING FROM HOME EASIER. I am used to having two screens at work so I purchased so when I work from home I can have a small, light, portable screen to work from home with. Excellent quality for the price, many of my peers have also purchased.
light went out after 2 months make me furious.

review_title: I bought and never used it. It appears it ...
review_body: I bought and never used it. It appears it will not take anthing that would be deemed as normal usage as it now has a busted screen. I will be posting a YouTube video of my shotgun vs the AOC monitor.

review_title: Nice... if you are not running Windows 10
review_body: First off it is a nice looking little monitor, lightweight and solidly built (for the weight and price) but it refuses to interact properly with Windows 10, the AOC (United States) website has zero support for it and the drivers I did find for Windows 10 did not play nice with the monitor. I will say that I was rushed so only spent about three hours trying to get it to work before I decided to return so some may have luck with it but be warned more than 20 Years experience with computers is recommended if you are running Windows 10. (review as of 1/18/2016, updates may fix this issue)

review_title: this will be one of the best purchases you ever make
review_body: If you travel a lot for business, or even only travel a little, this will be one of the best purchases you ever make. It makes working on the road SOOOO much easier. Super easy to hook up, as it doesn't require it's own power source. I've even hooked it up in the office as a third monitor. Once you use one, you'll wonder how you ever got along without it.

review_title: It's a good screen. Not UHD
review_body: Works as advertised.  It's a good screen.  Not UHD, it is HD and works very well to expand the screen space for a laptop.

review_title: I wish I bought this earlier!
review_body: This screen is great. Now I don't have to live without two screens when I travel, and it fits great (but just barely) within my Swiss laptop bag.

review_title: Its a waste of my money
review_body: The monitor does not work at all when connected to my Asus Vivobook Pro 17.

review_title: Great find for a Traveling Consultant
review_body: This may not be the biggest or best monitor, but this monitor works for me. (especially for the price). It comes with a protective sleeve. If you place the monitor landscape, it is virtually at the same height as your laptop so eye movement is almost even. I love the ease of mobility. I can put it in my laptop bag, pull it out and connect simultaneously with my laptop turning on. The embedded display link software automatically loaded on clients computer, which surprised me. In the initial setup I did have to turn the computer off and on 2 times, but after that I have not had any lags. I use the monitor for normal work - for switching between applications and documents. It is a huge help to extend my tiny laptop screen when I always need 2-4 screens up at once. One con I did find was on the older company laptop - the monitor did not automatically switch from portrait to landscape - I had to use the computer monitor settings to switch it . Portrait for word docs and landscape for Excel spreadsheets. I may buy a second one for use on the other side of my computer.

review_title: Such a great screen! Crisp clear picture
review_body: Such a great screen! Crisp clear picture. Extremely easy to set up. All parts included - don't have to buy any extra cords or a stand.
working great as 2nd monitor.
Bought to use as a second display with my 24" Samsung all in one. Works great hooked up via hdmi cable. Great display and color!

review_title: It was great for the first year and a half
review_body: Very high quality image, when it works. Unfortunately, it sporadically goes black and is nonresponsive. It was great for the first year and a half, but if you want a monitor that lasts, look elsewhere.

review_title: Why they hide the contrast ratio from you
review_body: Cons first: It says 1,000,000 to 1 Dynamic Contrast Ratio, which if you don't know by now, is a useless measurement, Dynamic Contrast Ratio refers to the screen mode that detects light and dark scenes in order to adjust the backlight to produce more "contrast". This feature is not even on by default, not that I would use it anyway. I suspect its true contrast ratio would be lower than the typical 1000:1, which is why it's omitted both here on Amazon and on the Acer website. Coming from glossy HP monitors, the colors just seem very washed out. Dark grays turn into medium grays, etc. That's partially due to its matte finish, but it's also partially due to it being a budget IPS display. I now have another professional matte display by Dell (U2515H) that has great contrast, comparable to my glossy HP displays (27xi). If you're going to buy an affordable IPS display, I would recommend going glossy, unless you are in a super high-glare environment. The new xw series by HP has semi-gloss displays, and in stores they look like they have decent colors while having relatively low glare. They may be worth checking out.
Product works great!! Have had no problems with it and it runs fantastic! Plus it arrived it just two days!!

review_title: Acer R240HY bidx 23.8-Inch IPS HDMI DVI VGA Monitor
review_body: Received my Acer R240HY bidx 23.8-Inch IPS HDMI DVI VGA monitor today (3-9-2017) and had it up and running in about 5 min. It is nice and clear and real user friendly.
Been working great for over a year.

review_title: The picture quality is ok - it has an annoying habit of going black for 2-5 seconds and then ...
review_body: This is an ok monitor as compared to the other ones I have bought over the past 20 years. The picture quality is ok - it has an annoying habit of going black for 2-5 seconds and then coming back. Also, it also sometimes gets fuzzy for a 1-2 second at random times as well. I may have gotten a bad one but this is one of their low end monitors so you never know.

review_title: Worked fine for 8 months and then completely distorted on Left ...
review_body: Worked fine for 8 months and then completely distorted on Left hand side of screen. Customer support would offer no timeline for repair( My job requires multiple screens) so this went to the dumpster....along with any confidence I had in Acer Products.

review_title: Used multiple of times, never fails to do its job; I love these monitors.
review_body: I've bought these monitors plenty of times now and I generally use them as my main screen for video games, movies, web browsing. They have a nice clear 1080p screen with plenty of common video inputs. budget oriented so you can perhaps setup dual screens at a more affordable price?

review_title: Still a great choice for 24" 1080p monitor as of August 2012
review_body: I have a few friends with 1080p monitors ranging from 21" to 24". This monitor is one of the best choices both in terms of color and physical design. I previously own 23" Samsung PX2370 which broke after 8 months. It was just my unit. One of my friends also has PX2370 for over a year with no problem. I personally think PX2370 has better colors than this monitor. But it could also be that my eyes haven't adjusted well to this monitor yet. I have been researching for a 23" or 24" 1080p monitors and I'm not yet disappointed with this monitor. I cannot use a desk mount with PX2370 which is the primary reason I'm going for ASUS. I'm going to get a desk mount so the wobble stand is no problem for me. The amazon pictures made this monitor really thick. I found some other pictures online and this is actually very slim. Just slightly thicker than PX2370.

I like the size and the 1080p i use this to stream as a second monitor and it does the job perfect quality for what i need. I alsp sometimes use it for gaming and im surprised it does really good, Its small enough to store afterwards lol

review_title: Very nice monitor for the price
review_body: When I purchased this monitor I was not looking for a high quality gaming monitor. I was looking for decent quality to run dual monitors for work and class. This monitor does everything I need of it. It has pretty daggon good picture quality. Very nice astetics and does its job.

I was hoping to use this to at least part of the time watch cable via HDMI. I wanted a monitor with HDMI, DVI, and D-SUB options. Unfortunately my cable company won't let me connect to the HDMI on my cable box.
It looks great while playing games, etc., and it's a great size for me.

I like the size of this screen, I'm a software engineering student so I have to open a lot of windows with code and virtual machines, whit the browser open for research, so it gets annoying to hit alt+tab very often but with a monitor of this size I can have a lot of things on screen.

review_title: Two things I don't like. If you're using HDMI
review_body: Two things I don't like. If you're using HDMI, every time the screen goes to sleep, it goes to a very bright blue screen first (not a bsod). And I can't stand how long it takes to wake up from sleep. I've never had a monitor that takes that long to wake up.

I upgraded my old dual 19" 5:4 Acers with a pair of these.  Of the first two that I received, one was defective and returned within about 2 weeks.  Amazon was great about the exchange, as usual.  I got a replacement quickly, and have had no issues since.

review_title: ... version of this 3 years ago and it worked great. But this one color was horrible even after ...
review_body: I owned an earlier version of this 3 years ago and it worked great.

Terrific!  I use it with my Macbook Pro.  A few programs occasionally flicker or have hazy edges when open (Safari and MS Word), but Chrome opens just find.  I LOVE how easy it is to plug in and use.  It does drain my battery faster than usual when I'm on battery power, but I only use it when I'm pretty well set-up next to an outlet so it's not a big deal to just plug in my computer when I use it.

review_title: did not work with my desk top PC.
review_body: trying out different desk top computers this should be useful without connecting to big monitors. But it did not work on my desk top PC (with USB 3 connection). I had to return it
I am using this on a laptop to give it a dual screen when traveling.

review_title: Perfect portable monitor for the frequent traveler!
review_body: This monitor has been a life saver! Great quality, and easy to use! After installing the drivers, it literally takes 5 seconds to plug in and use! The picture is better than my laptop screen. The protective sleeve makes it easy to travel with. My coworkers and clients love it too - several of them have bought as well, after seeing mine!

Was a bit concerned it wouldnt power off the surface book 2. But I plugged it in with the included USB C cable and to my surprise it powered right up. No drivers to install, nothing - just works! The size of the screen seems a little odd, but overall it looks nice. Love how small it is too.

I've been having problems with this monitor since a few months ago; Problems: While playing video; screen flicker/refresh rates, the USB3.0 cable port in the back of the monitor isn't really secure and so sometimes it doesn't make proper contact and ends up not making connection with my computer. Because i'm using macbook pro; it freaks out a little bit and thats a bit dissapointing. the monitor takes up enough power that it interferes with other periferals (wacom tablet) and its irritating. Other wise, i've been using this monitor daily, and happy with it otherwise. Well worth the purchase.

review_title: Just wish I could find a good mount or monitor arm for my needs
review_body: Working well so far. Just wish I could find a good mount or monitor arm for my needs.

review_title: How did I manage without this?
review_body: USB powered and travel case included.  Can't imagine how I got along without this second monitor for as long as I did in my consulting work.

review_title: but if I wiggle long enough the AOC monitor finally comes on-just very annoying at the extra time spent
review_body: The USB connector must be the least expensive thus least effective cord to include with the monitor. I can never just get a connection when turning on my laptop. I have to plug and unplug several times and I will receive a message telling me the cable can not be found, but if I wiggle long enough the AOC monitor finally comes on-just very annoying at the extra time spent.

It is unreal.  I have two screens in the office and having two on the laptop when I travel was a game changer.  That said, I bought this one as a gift for someone who had helped me tremendously and it is actually a slightly cheaper model.  He is just enthralled with it, as I am with mine.

review_title: Picture quality and clarity are excellent. shipping was quick as usual I like that ...
review_body: Picture quality and clarity are excellent.
Needed a second monitor for my computer to accompany my asus vg248qe. Perfect buy for the $110 range. Viewing angles are great but the stand doesn't allow for much adjustment.
big backlight bleeding. left upper corner was almost yellow at any dark scene
Excellent color and easy workable, great transaction and fast

review_title: Great monitor. Just know you need an adapter to hang these on a wall or multi-monitor stand
review_body: These monitors are great.

review_title: Very much satisfied with the purchase
review_body: Very much satisfied with the purchase. I researched a lot before making a buying decision. Glad i made a right choice.

I use this screen for editing photoshop and print work, so being exact in color is important. This screen is perfect for that. It's a real noticeable difference in realism when I switch to this screen for editing. All in all it's great. Would recommend!

Great monitor. IPS is well worth the extra cost. The only thing is that the cables have to connect to the monitor at a 90 degree angle, sticking out behind the monitor. This is fine for me, but might not be for others.

review_title: ... 15 inch and this one is so lightweight and nice. Very
review_body: Needed a new monitor from my 15 inch and this one is so lightweight and nice. Very impressed
Perfect size for a desk !  And the thin bezel make it seamless when you put two of them together.  I bought three, and they are truly amazing.

review_title: I am extremely disappointed in this product
review_body: I am extremely disappointed in this product. It worked great for three weeks before it broke. The monitor turns on (green light) but the screen remains black. I contacted the company, and after three (inefficient) emails I was informed that I would be responsible for all shipping costs to return the item, and they would attempt to fix it which would take approximately one week, not including shipping time. Furthermore, it cost $50 to ship the monitor, half of what it originally cost. This is quite a hassle and very frustrating, especially since I bought the monitor for a specific project that I need to continue working on. Unless this situation drastically improves, I will not be buying any more Asus products.

review_title: ASUS doesn't pay on rebate offer
review_body: The monitor is working fine, but beware of trying to get your rebate. ASUS has "4myrebate.com" handling their rebates, and if you do a Google search, you'll see plenty of complaints related to non-fulfilment of ASUS rebates through this handling company. I've tried twice to submit the required documentation, and after several months of waiting, I'm denied again, with no explanation this time. I can't recall another time I haven't gotten a rebate. This ASUS experience is the only one. It certainly makes me think twice about buying any ASUS product in the future, especially one with a rebate offer.

I have a small IT company and this is out go to monitor for generic setups.  Never had any problems with them.  The picture quality is good, it has all the connections you need (screw displayport), and it looks good enough.
I bought two of these and they are VESA mounted. There are so many inputs!! I haven't had a single issue with these monitors.

Great monitor.  I am using it paired to a 25" Hanns-G monitor on a dual-monitor set-up.  Picture is crisp and clear and bright.  Adjustments are pretty standard, and I managed to get it and the Hanns-G close enough that it is virtually impossible to see any difference between the pictures.  I have used Asus gear before and have no complaints about it.  For the price, this is one of the most capable monitors in its class.  I like that it has understated light indicators, too - too many of the newer gen have way too many or too bright power or mode lights.  Keep it simple, ASUS.
I bought this item because the picture showed that it could be mounted (versa mounting). The holes in the back are not able to be used at all. They are filled with a rubber type material.

Over the last year or two I've actually bought three of these: two for home and one for work. I love this monitor. The blacks are very dark black, the contrast is excellent. The settings allow a great deal of customization and I'm easily able to choose exactly what's right for my eyes. It's an LED monitor so it's reasonably energy efficient, and it has great power-saving features. The size is perfect for me. At 23.6 inches it's neither too big nor too small, and I'm running two of these monitors side by side. Highly recommended, and an excellent price.

review_title: Great Monitor, extra features a little sily
review_body: This is a great monitor, colors look sharp and it is a good size.  It was in perfect condition, further increasing my support of purchasing refurbished goods to save money.  It has this picture mode feature which is nice, but I find silly.  It cycles through several preset "modes" that mostly (imo) just mess with the contrast and hue to give a different image.  Sometimes it looks better, sometimes worse, and most of the time it looks artificial (not as the developers intended the game to look).  Some may like their feature , others may not.  Otherwise this is a quality TV fully equipped with HDMI and good picture.

review_title: My first full HD 1080p monitor exceeds expectations.
review_body: I watched [a 1080p, 60fps music video], and literal cried tears at its beauty. (The music video was not emotional, just, so, pretty...)

review_title: Work great, no dead pixels and sharp image even after 9 months
review_body: I really like this monitor. I bought two of them for my new computer and they work great. No problems so far and I bought them about 9 months ago.

Good monitor for the price.  I ordered this as a second monitor to work with my lap top to make it easier to work from home.  Resolution is good, set up is easy, I've found that in general Acer monitors are a good return for you money.

I bought one of these monitors and it was great! The picture was really crisp and bright. So I decided to buy a second monitor. This monitor, however, is much darker than the first one I have. I've tried calibrating the color, adjusting the color using the monitor's settings, and tried different chords when hooking it up to my PC. Nothing works! I'm extremely disappointed by the difference in color and brightness. It's good when you buy one but if you buy two, cross your fingers they'll be the same.

review_title: the monitor is fine, but the stand is  wobbling, also NO speakers
review_body: the monitor is fine, but the stand is  wobbling, also NO speakers
nice size - replaced another Acer monitor that i had for over 10 years, thru four computers

This monitor is fantastic!  When I was reading reviews I was nervous about the bleeding as others had stated, but I have yet to experience such issues.  This monitor outputs in 1080p and is vibrant with color!  As well it performs great with gaming, video streaming, and all other basic needs.  I'm already considering purchasing a second one!

Loved the Acer monitor. Its perfectly sized and the pic resolution is fantastic. After having the monitor for just a few days, I decided to buy another so as to have double monitors for my laptop. This is a great buy and highly recommend them!
I'm using this monitor right now and it works exactly the way I want it to. I only wish I had bought two. I guess I can, though....

review_title: Great monitor at a great price
review_body: Right price and right monitor. It comes with the HDMI cable though so no need to order one.

review_title: This seems to do the job just fine. It is an excellent price for the product
review_body: This seems to do the job just fine.  It is an excellent price for the product.  I simply used this to replace a monitor that I got about five and a half years ago that no longer seems to be as bright as I need it to be.
The buttons under the right edge could be labeled but otherwise this is a great monitor. No vertical adjustment. Does tilt several degrees.

Awesome picture quality for the price and no complaints.  I was looking for abudget monitor with DVI and HDMI input, and found vry little to choose from at the big box stores.  At this price the choice of this ASUS monitor was a no-brainer.

review_title: Can look good, after some work
review_body: So the colors on this monitor out of the box are downright horrible.  Even with adjustments they look awful.  The monitor itself does not give enough adjustment capability to make the picture look good.  However if you happen to be "stuck" with this monitor, you can make it look pretty good by reading the following.  These articles will allow you to change the display settings in windows, i.e. it will make the monitor look good through software.  If the monitor looked like this out of the box I'd give it 5 stars, however I wouldn't recommend the monitor to others because of the hassle involved.

This is a good monitor, the visibility is great because of IPS. The only problem I've had with it is that it does not turn on automatically when Windows boots up or wakes up from the Sleep mode. I have to turn the monitor off and on again to make it work. This is apparently an issue that others have had with this monitor as well. Having said that, the quality is so high compared with the price that I might consider getting another one.

review_title: This is not the best display on the market
review_body: If you're looking for a monitor that can stack up against the latest high PPI displays in sharpness, this is not for you. This is not the best display on the market. This monitor will not impress your friends.
As the title reads, do not buy this monitor.

review_title: Great Monitors At A Great Price!
review_body: Excellent monitors!  I bought 2 of these in anticipation of getting my new editing system.  Once everything was hooked up and running they did not disappoint!  I tested them thoroughly and there are zero dead pixels!  Of course you have to tweak them to your liking rather than going with the out of box settings but that should go without saying.  These are the perfect size for my space and for what I'm doing and they are perfectly viewable any time of the day or night and at any possible angle I could be sitting or standing at and they are easily adjustable as well.  I highly recommend them to anyone!
Monitor works great. It does not have any speakers , I did not read that while buying .

review_title: I am surprised how much I like it
review_body: I bought this monitor to use as a second portrait monitor with my primary being a Samsung P2770HD (not currently available as a product link)

I ordered this item from Amazon, but it was DOA. No sign of life when connected to power. No power LED or splash screen. I tried another power cable and different electric outlets, but it was dead. I sent it back and got another one, and the same thing happened! The second one was also DoA - same scenario. Absolutely no sign of life when connected to power.

Nice monitor.  Very clear, crisp, great color etc.  I have some issues that I didn't have with the prior HP monitor.  When I unplug and/or plug-in my monitor cable for my Apple laptop (while the laptop is on)  it changes the window size of any application that is open.  Safari, Excel, etc.  The window is maximized on the monitor or made even larger than the monitor.  I then need to re-size it back down.  Kind of annoying, especially in the case when it makes it larger than the screen size.

This is an amazing monitor. I bought it for my gaming setup and it looks clean and simple. The colors and contrast are exceptional which results in a great viewing experience. Works out of the box at 1080p with HDMI. I would definitely recommend this monitor for anyone looking for a great budget monitor for a gaming setup.

Hi all, after reading the reviews and noting down the pros and cons, I decided to give this a try. At first I was very impressed, then I put my laptop right next to the screen and realized something others have already said: Yellow tint :(.

Great picture, nice and sharp.  Refresh rate is good, mostly used as a monitor for computer but have used it some for xbox.  2 negatives one of which I knew was going to be going in which is not height adjustable.  The 2nd and bigger issue has been color, I haven't been able to get it dialed in right, I have tried just about all the settings people online have suggested but haven't found the perfect mix yet.

I ordered this to supplement my Asus VE276Q (purchased in March 2012). I now have 2 asus monitors, side by side. The VS2787Q-P stands an inch taller and wobbles at the slightest touch. I don't understand how ASUS could update the design and make it so wobbly. -2 stars for the wobble!

review_title: You can't go wrong with these puppies. I love Asus.
review_body: These monitors for the price you can do no better. I bought two of them and have been using them in my home office for months now and they are just awesome. They are sharp, beautiful colors, easy on the eyes... you get no eye fatigue even staring at them for 8 hours a day. If I had one complaint, I'd just say I wish the stand allowed them to be raised a tad bit higher.... on a normal desk it's hard to center them at eye level without boosting them up on something. I also use them for gaming and they're prisitine.

Really love this monitor! I've had it for about 6 months now. It is super clear and not blurry like some of my other monitors. It is very easy to work with and set up. I love that it has an outlet for sound so I can have sound. I use it for PS3 gaming and laptop, both work very well.

review_title: Love it, wish it came with HDMI cable
review_body: Been running this monitor for about a month now and still loving it.  I use the HDMI input and the clarity is excellent, all text is easy to read without adjust font size, this alone is a big improvement over my prior monitor.  In all fairness the prior monitor was 10 years old and running on an analog input.  Setup was super easy, only down side is that the HDMI cable is the only thing not included, not a big deal because a new cable is as cheap as six bucks, twelve if you want a serious one.  All other cables are included.  And the couple extra inches in size does make a solid difference.  I would buy again.

review_title: I wanted another one so I bought this.
review_body: This was a 2nd screen I purchased of this model since I was wanting to go to a multi-screen setup and loved the original.  Nice and vibrant has multi-ports for any hook up you need HDMI, DVI, RGB.  The models I have sit a bit cool on the color but, that didn't impact the screen quality.  The 1st I purchased over 3 years ago is still rocking.

What can I say about this monitor? I purchased it to replace my old HP 22 inch monitor that died and I am glad that I did. The monitor has a solid build, uses the new IPS panel technology and comes with a variety of connectors(1 each of HDMI, VGA and DVI). The only gripe I have with it is that the default settings left the colours looking a bit dull and the contrast/brightness seemed off. This was easily rectified by fiddling with said settings in the menu until I was satisfied with how things looked. The limited viewing angle did not bother me but might be an issue for other persons.

review_title: works well.  nuance:  can't make dark or quiet.
review_body: everything works great!  i really couldn't be happier when everything just works -- both the HDMI sources, the volume, all the buttons.  in case it's important to you, the minimum levels for sound and brightness are actually a bit high.  i use this monitor at night and i like to listen to things quietly so i don't wake anyone up, and in the dark, which means i'd like the monitor to be dark as well so the contrast doesn't hurt my eyes.  i leave it on its darkest setting even during the day.  it can get very bright and louder than i ever need it to be for my small room.

review_title: Absolutely the best monitor for the price
review_body: Absolutely the best monitor for the price. In fact i would choose this above any other 1080p monitor I've ever used. The construction is pretty solid and the picture quality is great. Its best feature is the matte coating which is just thick enough to reduce glare without making it fuzzy. I also love dat slim bezel.

Loved it at first, even though if I barely touched it then it would go off. I guess the cord that connects to my other monitor isn't the sturdiest maybe. I recently turned it back on to use it again. Haven't used it since late June and it has a terrible messed up screen. Thankful for insurance

I absolutely love this monitor. I plan to purchase another as a third monitor soon. This is by far the best monitor I have had for the price. Definitely recommend this for all applications. I use it for school and some gaming.
This was an excellet replacement for me, since my old monitor was heating up my office! My other one was 27" but too big. This is perfect for my graphic art work.

review_title: Great monitor, so a sharp image
review_body: Great monitor, so a sharp image. I connected to a miniMac and the pics are stunning. Excellent color and brightness, sharp and slick unit. I love it!

Top-notch clarity - never seen better within the price range.  My son is an IT professional, and selected this for me.  It's been perfect thus far.  I'll update in a year or so to provide information on longevity.

review_title: The monitors are good. They are more of a bezel than I ...
review_body: The monitors are good. They are more of a bezel than I feel like they advertise, so I can't use two of them for gaming comfortably.

I bought this in a bit of a rush to replace my destroyed laptop, I saw the good reviews for this and it wasn't too expensive, so I got it. Initially I thought it might be unstable cause the stand or it wouldn't be able to adjust enough for me, wrong on both parts. The only thing that would make this better is if it had a VGA port, but still love it.
Perfect and after a year and a half I've never had any problems with it

review_title: Very Good monitor for the price
review_body: very good monitor for the price. Would rate it 5 stars if its speakers and microphone (none) were better.
This monitor produces a very nice sharp picture when attached to my Mac mini. Sound is adequate, if a little tinny. I use a receiver and bookshelf speakers, so this is not an issue for me.

review_title: If you are looking for a decent monitor for all around purpose I would recommend it.
review_body: 4/5 "I liked it" is a good rating

review_title: Good monitor, nice picture, sub-par stand.
review_body: I purchased this monitor for my gaming rig as an upgrade from my old second screen, and it's worked very well it that regard. The picture is excellent, the colors are great, and the setup was easy. The downsides, however, are that the stand is very wobbly and the backlight can be a bit too bright at times, which is an easy fix. All in all, a good monitor, I would just recommend you get something sturdy to mount it to or put under it.

review_title: Great monitor great price hdmi input
review_body: Great monitor. Super clear display. Can’t beat it for $100. Has all  3 ports. VGA, dvi, hdmi.  At first I couldn’t figure out how to select the hdmi port.  I had read the instructions.  But you need to Press a button on the front panel to select which input you are using.  I did it and it didn’t work.  You also need to unplug the cable from the computer and plug it back in to get the monitor to “sense” the input.  I did that and it worked.  It doesn’t say it in the instructions.

The buttons did not work on the monitor, so I ordered a replacement which Amazon sent out for free. The replacement seems to work fine so far, but the stand is uneven, causing the left side of the monitor to sit noticeably lower than the right (I also used a level to check it). The base isn't adjustable, and after trying to get it to sit evenly I just slid a folded up piece of paper under the left side of the stand.

Used exclusively as PS4 monitor, using HDMI for video (of course) and headphone jack on monitor for audio. Image is terrific, with no apparent issues with refresh, lag or motion blur. Audio through headphone jack is great. Good brightness levels, and lots of color options. Only minor gripe: the settings buttons are on the bottom right of the monitor, and two-handed operation is required to keep the monitor from rocking back and forth. I'm sure there are better monitors out there for PC gaming, but for my intended purposes (1080p with headphone jack), this was a great value.

review_title: The quality is great but it would literally cause my mom's PC to ...
review_body: Bought this monitor for my mom since her previous one died. The quality is great but it would literally cause my mom's PC to restart once-twice a day. We tried everything like updating drivers etc, nothing worked. Ended up just fixing the old monitor and using that.

This monitor was highly recommended but when I got it, the instructions were almost gibberish and also too brief to be useful.  I called their tech line and after a couple of tries to fix a problem, the technician just said it must be defective and send it back.  I knew that was not the problem.  On their web site, they have a manual you can download but I could only get the "global version" and then I discovered that I would be charged for the software that I needed to install to download the manual!  I have also through trial and error discovered that there are actually three ways to connect it to your computer.  There is a VGA outlet, a DVI outlet and an HDMI outlet.  Since I do not do games, I had no idea about the VGA cable and my computer does not even have an outlet for a HDMI cable.  I started out trying to connect all three.  I am still trying to explore the capabilities of this monitor but it would be nice if I could have instructions that I could read.

review_title: Screen Issues Two Months After Purchase
review_body: I bought two of these monitors on August 6, 2016 for a home office. After two months, one monitor has a split down the middle of the screen where the display is discolored. A third of the monitor to the left of this split is darker than the rest of the screen, and has a splotch in the display.

Hissing noise that comes from the audio output jack of this monitor. Asus "support" is a terrible joke. They won't even honor their "Rapid Replacement". First Asus product I've purchased and will be my last. Never again.

Im sure these monitors are great but my problem is that they can not be mounted with any type of wall mount or other mounting system.  They can only be mounted with the stand they come with.. (desk top only)  product description misses this fact. This is the first time I've seen monitors that don't have the holes in the back to use other mounting systems..

Zero Frame is a bit of an exaggeration. Also, the bottom part of the bezel sticks out a bit on each side, so that two monitors don't quite sit flush against each other. For the price though, these things are pretty great. No dead pixels that I can see, matte finish on the screen so they don't reflect much light. I would recommend these if you're looking for a "slimmer" frame" and relatively cheap monitors, which is exactly what I wanted.

Amazing monitor for the price listed. I'd been through several other monitors including an ultra wide, and I have to say this monitor is the perfect size, perfect resolution, and at 144hz and gsync you're going to get perfect visuals assuming you have the necessary PC (gtx 970 w/ i5 6600k)
So far so good. looks very nice, works as expected

review_title: Good quality and picture for its price
review_body: Good quality and picture for its price. I do a lot of gaming and have never noticed issues using this monitor.
the color is nice, the only problem is when i connect to my laptop the screen ratio was like 99%, there's a bit missing of the scroll bar on my firefox
This is a beautiful monitor. I am impressed.
This is a fine monitor and was inexpensive but it lacks video.

review_title: Very Very happy with this monitor!!!
review_body: So I game on my ps4 along with pc and Netflix, other broadcasting and YouTube stuff. My goal  was to get a 27 inch monitor and a 24 inch monitor. One for my PlayStation 4 and one for my PC.  Well not only will this monitor allow me to hook up to both platforms,  it can automatically sense which input is being used and switch over.  The picture is very crisp and clean and you also have the option to select different picture qualities.  And what I mean by that is you can choose gaming or energy saving mode, movie, standard or you can customize to your liking.  This item came in roughly 2 to 3 days.  It was packed very well and did not have any trouble putting the stand together.  The stand does tilt a little bit down and back.  The only negative thing I saw is there was no option for a mount.

review_title: So far so good... works great, economical but appears to be high quality...
review_body: So far so good... works great and looks nice. great economical but what appears to be high-quality monitor.

review_title: Very bright, crisp, clear, matte monitor screens.
review_body: I bought two of them and they look great.  They are really widescreen but two fit perfectly on my desk.  Not sure what other reviewers talk about when they say they can't see text very well.  The picture on these monitors is very crisp.  The wobbles that other reviewers spoke about is true.  They screw into the stand but are kind of like bobbleheads if you dont have a sturdy desk to put them on.  They won't wobble and fall over, they just shake prettty easily.  The only minor issue that I have had is there is some flickering on one of my monitors but I think I need to toggle with my video card settings and refresh rates.  Other than that, they are very crisp and sharp looking.

review_title: 1 dead pixel. I know they happen but it's ...
review_body: 1 dead pixel. I know they happen but it's still disappointing to find one. I have the Asus VW246H monitor to the left of this one and they're different heights. You would think that a company that produces monitors where you can't adjust the height would at least standardize their own heights. Have new groundbreaking ergonomics come out between the production of monitors where the lower inch makes all the difference? Have to figure out something to put underneath it now. Also the plugs in the back attach perpendicular to the monitor as opposed to the other flat monitors I've had where the connections are from underneath and lie flat against the monitor.

review_title: Just be aware this is NOT an IPS
review_body: Just accepted this monitor from UPS guy about an hour ago.

review_title: It shows me kind of blurry shaking line when I play WoT but when I played other games like Overwatch, Bf1
review_body: I bought this in February 13 2018. The screen was hard to see when I played World of Tanks.  It shows me kind of blurry shaking line when I play WoT but when I played other games like Overwatch, Bf1, Wow, it is look great. Now a new problem came which make me decide to write this review again, I start to get a purple screen when I plugin usb or unplug it.

Bought this to replace a current computer monitor.  Set up was very quick, and the colors/sharpness are great.  I don’t use this for gaming, so I can’t say how it would work for that, but it’s a great, low cost HDMI monitor.

review_title: Great monitor for Apple users... with a few tweaks!
review_body: This review is for Mac users, as the Asus is not particularly friendly to set up. The instructions are cryptic (but in many languages!) and the Amazon description doesn't tell you what's in the box. You get a VGA and DVI cables with the monitor, but no HDMI cable. The included cables might work with your Mac, but for me the best setup was to buy an HDMI cable (around $5) and a Thunderbolt-to-HDMI adapter (around $10) that plugs directly into an iMac Thunderbolt port. Both the cable and adapter are available in the Amazon Basics line, and quite affordable.

Count me another very satisfied user for this monitor -- at the price, it is one heck of a value.  Display clarity, colors and refresh rate are all excellent.  As others have noted, I have some monitor shake when a nearby DeskJet goes to work, but the stand for this monitor is almost 2 inches shorter than the 22 inch monitor it replaced, so the shake is considerably less than what I've been dealing with.  I have found one pixel malfunctioning -- in the realm of blue colors it shows white (so it's not entirely dead); but it is about an inch from the right side of the monitor, so not in an area that causes any real bother.

So I bought this monitor recently so that I could have a bigger screen than that on my laptop.  Its a good size and I like that it has a matte screen unlike glossy laptop screen.  This is important because I use my screen for drawing and its quite difficult to discern values when you can see your own reflection or the glare from the table lamp.  It doesnt come with speakers but thats okay.  I also like that it has a VGA port and comes with VGA cables since for some reason my laptop only came with a VGA port rather than an HDMI port.  Its decently light so I can move it around the room easily and it helps that there is an indentation at the top which acts like a handle.  The screen looks awesome and works really well.  Buy this monitor! :D

review_title: GREAT image LCD display with webcam builtin, BUT w/o microphone function; REALLY? :-((
review_body: I have reviewed this one before and here is the quick summary.

review_title: Works great for both word processing and photo editing
review_body: I am a freelance writer and stock photographer with a 3 monitor setup. This is a great screen at a great price. I'll probably eventually replace my oldest monitor with another one of these so all three will match. Colors look great and contrast makes type easy to read.
I purchased my monitor about two weeks ago. it worked great until yesterday. when i plug it into my laptop, the logo 'AOC' flashes for a second and then nothing happens. very disappointed.

I used this for work and took it everywhere in my very well padded bag, however after 6-7 months of use it stopped working. I can see that it's getting power, but I can't see what is happening on that screen. If this had done this 2 years down the road I would have expected it, but after 6-7 months, it's not worth the money.
This arrived as described. It didn't work right at first, but eventually I was able to get it to work. It has a stand like a photo frame stand. This can be in the way, but is fine. Gets the job done.

review_title: Good product overall, but it just isn't for me.
review_body: Personally, I like the product; however, I get headaches from using it.  After looking at the reviews, it seems that I am the only one with this issue, so it does not appear to be a widespread problem.  Despite this, I still feel that you guys should be aware of the potential issue before you buy it.

This monitor was not compatible w/my laptop.  It is not "plug and play".  Drivers have to be installed.  Even after they were installed, it did not work.  I kept getting an error msg.saying it was not compatible w/my computer.  When I went to the AOC webiste for help, the website did not exist!  I then bought the "GeChic" monitor from Amazon, and it works great.

review_title: Pretty Great Monitor - Setup was a bit tricky
review_body: I was very happy to find this wireless monitor with the mounting option on the back, after buying the other version and not understanding it didn't have mounting capability until I received it.  It came with a CD (but my laptop doesn't have a CD player), and it came with no instructions.  Additionally, my Windows 7 was unable to find the driver on its own.  After a lot of trial and error, I went to aoc.com and chose my location at the bottom and was able to download the driver and the instruction manual.  Additionally, the instruction manual wasn't the greatest, as it said choose screen resolution, but it didn't say how or where to choose that option.  I finally found it by right-clicking on my desktop screen, and from there, I was able to figure it out.  I still haven't figured out if it can act as a 2nd screen or if it only is a duplicate or alternate screen.  As a duplicate screen though, now that I figured out how to set it all up - it's fantastic - exactly what I wanted!

review_title: Easy set up light and they work
review_body: I use these in my office makes work much more efficient. Easy set up light and they work perfect

review_title: One of the best purchases I've ever made
review_body: One of the best purchases I've ever made.  I work from home on a laptop and this screen has been a lifesaver.  Excellent quality, portable and the display is clear and crisp.  Easy to pack in laptop case and would recommend to anyone that needs a second screen when working with a laptop.

It worked right away, even from a previous driver installed on my machine.  Love the wide screen and the portability as I travel for work.  The screen is wide, same size as my large laptop, so it barely fits in my briefcase, but having a large wide screen that I can set up anywhere is well worth it.

review_title: I have purchased this portable monitor twice. First time ...
review_body: I have purchased this portable monitor twice. First time I purchased did not purchase the extented warranty. The monitor lasted 6 months before the screen went dark. Second purchase purchased extented warranty and the monitor again went black. Attempted to contact manufacturer, whose telephone numbers are in India. Then went to warranty company and they were unable to reach manufacturer. They paid the warranty.

review_title: It's a great monitor that assembles in minutes with no tools
review_body: I have purchased a few of these. One for my in-laws and one for me. It's a great monitor that assembles in minutes with no tools. The picture quality is outstanding and it has VGA and HDMI ports. What more could you ask for?
easy to hookup .easy on eyes.good value for price.

Got today. Works very well. I use it for both the Raspberry Pi and my Windows 10 PC which I mainly play games and run my XMRecorder software, with some picture editing. I am getting used to the small edge bezel but I like it.
Excellent value, use it adjunct to a laptop. Very easy to hook up and great image.
has worked great for 6 months
Love it,  perfect size
This monitor looks super clean! The bezels are almost non existent! I use this mostly for gaming and it has handled everything that I have thrown at it.
Great monitor at a good value. arrived in great shape.
When I updated to Windows 10,I updated my monitor.  What a great result!  The price was very good too.  My grandson was very impressed that MeeMa was so "COOL"--or at least my computer monitor is.

If you are looking for a monitor for the price then this is the way to go. I bought one for gaming and absolutely loved it, im going to buy another one of these badboys to replace my 21inch acer monitor. I definitely would recommended these monitors

I bought this monitor based on the price.  I had to return the first one but, overall, I'm pleased with the monitor.  The screen would "splash" like ripple effect every time when I unlock my computer.  I tried different video cable - VGA, DVI, HDMI - and no such a luck.  I have another 24" inch monitor that I purchased from Amazon but didn't encounter this problem, but it was a little more expense.  If anyone is looking for a decent over-sized laptop monitor without spending too much money, then this would be it.

review_title: Owned for 5+ days and already issues
review_body: This monitor isn't all that bad (when it actually works as its suppose to). It has a nice picture and easy to use settings but that's really all it has going for it. When it first arrived I though it was great, I took it out of the box and had it connected and working in less than 5 minutes but the first thing I noticed is when I plugged in the power cable the male (prongs in side of the monitor) connectors and the "back plate" they are connected to seemed to "give" a bit, I later realized that for some reason the cable "wiggles" vertically and occasionally disconnects leaving me with the monitor randomly shutting off. If the monitor actually worked it would be amazing and definitely worth the money but this one is particular is garbage. Im only giving it 2 stars instead of 1 because its a good monitor when it works.

review_title: Light and bright, but not as crystal clear as the old CRT
review_body: My old CRT flat screen finally shut down and I needed a replacement. I picked this model because it was a decent size/price, had HDMI, and got good reviews. It even came with a DVI cable which my old desktop could implement. The HDMI is for future possibilities. I didn't want built in speakers as they sound awful 9 times out of 10 and still use my Creative set. The LED image is bright and clear, blacks are black and there's next to no glare -- but pictures are not as realistic as my old CRT 19 inch flat screen. That dinosaur weighed near a hundred pounds, this one is as light as a feather. In fact, so light it sometimes wobbles on it's rather flimsy stand. Oh well, can't have everything...

There is not much to say about these. You get what you pay for. It has one of each major input and the image with a digital (non VGA) cable is sharp. No dead pixels on either of the two purchased. It's just a good average monitor that does what it's supposed to do. You won't love it and you probably won't hate it. The biggest flaw, as with most inexpensive monitors, is the stand. Like most it doesn't feel as heavy or solid as you want. They are easy to shake and you must use them on a solid surface not prone to vibration from your typing. If you look at more expensive monitors, typically you will see wider monitor stands with a heavier base.

Since I have this monitor in a location all by itself, I have little means of comparing it to anything else.  The colors seem accurate.  Refresh rate and contrast ratio look good.  I thought the documentation was rather poor.  Otherwise, a nice low cost monitor.

As far as a piece of hardware it's really an outstanding monitor. I'm using it as an auxiliary for my 6 year old laptop when I'm at home and hookup went seamlessly.  Color and off angle viewing are really  pretty decent. I'm not a gamer so I cannot speak to how it operates in that environment.

review_title: If your table top is wobbly or shakes easily, so will this screen.
review_body: Some reviewers complain  that the screen is shaky and I found this to be true, but in our experience, it is because it is on a cheap ikea desk that is not sturdy and wobbles/shakes easily. It's very possible this would not happen if it was on a sturdy surface.

review_title: Asus monitors for now and always.
review_body: This is my third VS228H. The first two were the VS228H, and this is the VS228H-P. Two for home, with a nice dual head setup.  They are wonderful. Work gave me a cheap dell monitor with terrible resolution. I bought this, and I love it. It's a little bigger than the old version. Great resolution. Clean lines. All in all a great monitor. You really can't go wrong.  I haven't had a chance to find out if this on is HDCP compatible (the old version is, and says so in the description which is why I bought those for home). When/if I find out, I'll update this review.

I have a love/hate relationship with this monitor. On the hate side, it is too darn bright for regular internet browsing/email stuff. On the love side the brightness/contrast is excellent for gaming. Fallout 3 looks amazing on this. Anyways after a lot of tinkering what I do is turn the brightness and contrast settings way down on the "standard" setting for internet browsing and I use the srgb setting  for videos and use the other settings for gaming. I like a monitor that has preset settings such as this one. It has 6.

review_title: ASUS makes great products but Customer Service is BAD
review_body: The screen looks so good and i can use my consoles when i am not using it for my PC. Good sound for built in speakers.

review_title: Decent for document editing or running a VM
review_body: The screen is extremely light. Great for traveling. The resolution is far more inferior than my monitor so that toys with me a little going from tiny text to blown up windows. Regardless it's extremely easy to use and very light. There is no noticeable lag for standard document editing or running a virtual machine in the screen. The positives outsight the negatives.

review_title: saying its good enough. If something is rubbish just say it ...
review_body: For the live of God dont do this to urself, saying its good enough. If something is rubbish just say it is.

It’s decent and serves the purpose for what I need. I needed a portable monitor when working from home to review PDF documents mostly. The resolution on this monitor is not good at all. If you are looking for something high quality this would not fit the bill. I’m not sure how long it will last? But it works fine and it’s portable.

review_title: Doesn't work on latest version Mac - useless now
review_body: Worked great until I updated my Mac.  Now its useless.  If you have a a Mac - don't buy!

review_title: Good at first but quality\durability of the product is poor.
review_body: I have been using this product for about 4 months and it stopped working a few days ago. It never gave the best image quality but was nice to have a second screen for travel. At first a few pixels started to just be white and now half the screen is white and its worthless. I have always kept it in the cover in a laptop bag next to my laptop so don't think it saw anything outside of normal use for a portable screen.

review_title: Fantastic. I was stuck on-site on a project and ...
review_body: Fantastic. I was stuck on-site on a project and I really missed having two screens. So I ordered this, two days later it showed up at my hotel and it works great. I have a 17" 2010 Mac Pro Laptop with USB 2, and it functions perfectly, even though it is designed for USB 3.0. I downloaded the drivers from the website while it was being shipped. After that it was plug and play.
No complaints except it's a little too big for travel. It fits snug in my laptop backpack. That's my fault though, I should have measured my bag. I'm happy with it though.

review_title: so having one that I can set up anywhere is nice. The only complaint I have is that they ...
review_body: Very convenient - I'm a multiple monitor person, so having one that I can set up anywhere is nice.  The only complaint I have is that they provide only a neoprene sleeve to protect it.  I would have really preferred something with a rigid or hard shell side for the screen itself.  Good value though and quite happy with it otherwise.

this thing is incredible... I get asked about it everywhere I go... its amazing how many people do not know about usb powered portable monitors... I bring it as a second screen for dj'ing, so alot of people see it, this unit is reliable and has standed the test of durability by riding along in my backpack to many dj gigs the past few months, works like a charm

review_title: Wont stay on. Same problem others have had
review_body: Wont stay on. Same problem others have had where connection to monitor is very sensitive. The first day it could be made to work by adjusting the connection, now it won't stay on couple of seconds. Returned it.
Great price!  Perfect !  No issues.
Outstanding monitor. Easy to use. Nice whites and blacks along with accurate colors. I use this monitor 12-14 hours a day, 6 days a week. It's a work horse.

review_title: Doesn’t have all the fancy specs and bells and whistles but if you just want a great looking simple monitor that is sleek
review_body: Can’t beat the price for a 24” solid monitor. Doesn’t have all the fancy specs and bells and whistles but if you just want a great looking simple monitor that is sleek, look no further.

review_title: The picture is nice on both monitors
review_body: One of the monitors I purchased occasionally has distortion. It typically only lasts for a second or two. If not for that, I would give it 4 stars. The picture is nice on both monitors.

review_title: This one stands alone and value, quality and price
review_body: Fantastic monitor for the price. I shopped around for a while and this monitor was an amazing deal. Just take a look at the specs and compare to other monitors. This one stands alone and value, quality and price.

review_title: These are excellent monitors for the price
review_body: These are excellent monitors for the price.  I bought two of them and they work great side by side because of the thin frame.

review_title: No issues, has a bit of a yellow tint ...
review_body: No issues, has a bit of a yellow tint when viewed beside my similar acer monitor, but that could probably be fixed in calibration.
Very pleased and so happy I bought this monitor. What a gorgeous picture it produces. Nice size too!
good image quality. the stand could be a bit less shakier but overall a great monitor for the price.

review_title: and terrific. Can accept multiple inputs
review_body: For the price, sleek, and terrific. Can accept multiple inputs.Can get very bright. can change vertical angle of viewing.

review_title: Economical buy at the time, but
review_body: Good monitor, not great. Colors are little washed out on this screen.

review_title: Exactly as described. Great display, great price.
review_body: I use this product as an external monitor with an HDMI hookup to my macbook pro (via HDMI to thunderbolt connector). I rated this monitor five stars because it works great and looks good, period. The price was right in my range as well. The display is rather bright, but can easily be turned down to an appropriate level. The stand is a little wobbly, but strong enough to hold the monitor and I have no fear of it tipping over. It can take a minute for the macbook's clam shell setting to go into effect and the display to take over in 1080p but it's an amazing deal for the price. I would recommend this to anybody looking for an external monitor who doesn't want to shell out big bucks for the most recent, top of the top display.

review_title: Nice monitor. Easy to install with Vesa mounts in ...
review_body: Nice monitor. Easy to install with Vesa mounts in back. Comes with the base partially installed which you have to remove, but that is something I would have appreciated if I was going to use the base (which I suspect most users do). The screen is big and beautiful. No complaints.

review_title: Great moniotr SO pleased, We ended up buying a total of 3 over the next 2 years for all our desktop computers at home
review_body: Great monitors over 2 years ago maybe 3 can't remember I bought myself one for gaming and movies. I loved it. the following Christmas we bought my mother same exact one. She loves it. and again following Christmas bought my dad another of the exact same ones. with inexpensive HD video cards I installed this monitor is really sweet. I highly recommend it!

review_title: Solid monitor at very reasonable price.
review_body: Bought a pair of these a few years ago and broke one of them recently. Put this new one on the stand and calibrated it and they match up perfectly. No complaints, great color and brightness/contrast.

review_title: Asus VS247H-P 23.6" Full-HD LED-Lit LCD Monitor
review_body: it's up and running for a few days. no complaints, so far.  If anything there is not much contrast in the font coloring ie black & the blue. could wish for better in that instance. sound is fine.  overall quite satisfied.  now if it'll last longer than the hp i had for 3 yrs i'd say it's good money spent on this monitor

review_title: Great option for dual monitor setup
review_body: I purchased two of these and put them on a dual monitor arm for a home office.
Before now, I was always a fan of a different brand of monitor. The last one I owned last me five years plus.

review_title: Plug and Play Perfection, Especially for Price!
review_body: Just think what we had to pay for a large screen monitor like this several years ago? I needed a monitor display for our clubhouse security cameras. Our manager asked me to price out one and have it delivered when she found out the price I had to pay on Amazon Prime. When I got it delivered in two days, there was a slight hesitation over the phone when I called her to say it was delivered. I asked if there was a problem and she couldn't believe I had it already. Easy setup and great picture. You can't go wrong with this product.

review_title: Great Monitor, and Won't Break the Bank.
review_body: I dont think you will find a better monitor for $100 bucks. Bought this for my son's PC. Has great picture quality, good response time, compares to monitors that cost 2x as much. I did have a little bit of trouble the first few times I loaded up windows with getting drivers to work right, but after a few reboots it started to work great... no idea on why.

review_title: Works with my Windows and Mac laptops
review_body: Works with both my 14" Lenovo ThinkPad T450s and 2015 13" MacBook Pro Retina running El Capitan.  I had to install the DisplayLink driver for the Mac to get it to work.  A higher resolution would be nice, but the trade-off for portability is worth it.  It comes with a neoprene carrying case and fits well in my backpack's laptop pocket designed for 15.6" laptops, and it doesn't add an unreasonable amount of weight.  Not having to deal with yet another power cord is a bonus.

This would be an ok product if it weren't for the terrible design of the USB cord. It plugs in at such an awkward place on the monitor, and after about a month of use, the slightest movement causes the cord to fall out of the monitor, and it keeps getting worse as I use it. I could get a new cord, but I believe the same thing would eventually happen.

review_title: Big and bulky and bad quality
review_body: The reviews on this monitor are right. The graphic and quality is horrible. The Asus MB168 is way better for just a little bit more money. You get a much better resolution and image quality. Also, the AOC screen is too bulky and big compare to the sleek and clean feel of the asus monitor.

review_title: No excuse not to work everywhere...darn it.
review_body: Great addition to the Home office.  Clear display and very light.  I will use it for travel as well.

I regularly need 8-10 windows open at work as the internet sales manager of a major toyota dealership, this allows me to leave 1 or more of my most important programs visible at all times so i can move back & forth from home screen to the 2nd screen. My only 2 complaints (if you want to call them complaints) are that the usb cable that came with it was to short to reach from where I needed to place it on my desk from the computer tower & that side angle viewing sucks. I still plan on purchasing a 2nd monitor because you cant beat it for the money

review_title: No problems for me. Love it.
review_body: This screen works just like I hoped it would.

review_title: At first it was great, but not working after minimal usage
review_body: At first it was great, but not working after minimal usage.  Not sure if it's the drivers or what.  I do know a few folks who have it and use it regularly and love it!

review_title: It sits nice besides my MSI 15''
review_body: It sits nice besides my MSI 15'', I use for stock trade. It would be a bit laggish for gaming though. Colors are not as vivid as my laptop, but still ok.

This monitor was finicky from the start.  The USB connection rarely works.  After struggling with this product for a couple months, I'm most likely going to buy an ASUS monitor.  The cable and monitor no longer work, at all...only two months in.  Don't buy this product, even though the price point ($100) is very tempting.

review_title: The idea of a travel monitor was great, but the poor cable design is a fatal ...
review_body: Monitor connection is poorly designed. The monitor cable does not stay plugged in and the computer won't recognize there is another monitor attached -- I assume because the cable to the monitor is not tight enough in the back. Only worked 3 times and now won't do anymore than splash AOC on the monitor before going black. The idea of a travel monitor was great, but the poor cable design is a fatal flaw.

These are fantastic monitors for the price. I purchased two of them, and the colors (uncalibrated) look great. VGA, HDMI, and DVI inputs are great. My only quibble is that they only came with a (now obsolete) VGA cable.

review_title: Good monitors and the kids liked them.
review_body: Got two of these about 8 to 9 months ago.  So far so good.  The screens are very clear... kids like these monitor a lot!

review_title: ... week now and so far it is doing really good. The quality is amazing
review_body: I've had this monitor for about a week now and so far it is doing really good. The quality is amazing. The size is good and there is really no input lag or motion blur. I use this for gaming and everything seems fine. I would recommend getting this monitor it is good for its price.

review_title: No complaints. Use it for work only, so ...
review_body: No complaints. Use it for work only, so I can't comment on its performance or graphics for watching movies or gaming.
nice monitor with clear picture

review_title: I bought two of these but one works perfectly fine and while to other goes blank every 3 hours ...
review_body: I bought two of these but one works perfectly fine and while to other goes blank every 3 hours of use. The screen shuts off, then turns back on 4 seconds later. It's been happening from day one since I bought the monitors :/

review_title: Setup was fast and easy and the base is very sturdy
review_body: Setup was fast and easy and the base is very sturdy.  The resolution and picture are both very nice!  So happy with this purchase.

review_title: I can only say it's PERFECT!
review_body: Bought this for my home office, I can only say it's PERFECT!
Works well.
Great product! Thank you! A+ seller

It was a little brighter than my other Asus monitor, seemed to make bight colors to look whiter than they really were. I messed with the settings on the monitor, and then with the settings on my computer, and got them to match up pretty well.
I've had a Philips LCD for a very long time.  It was terrible for gaming considering the tremendous input lag that was present even when all post-processing features were turned off.

Got this for $160 after rebate. I got this to replace my 9 year old 20" gateway. I still like it but at this price and the newer technology, it was hard to pass up. Plus with my new computer setup, I thought I needed an upgrade to show it off. No dead or stuck pixels. It's very bright and the colors are outstanding compared to my 9 year old monitor. I use the "scenery" preset and turn the brightness down to "35". I might even turn it down a little more, it's so bright. It's about the same height as my 20" 4x3 monitor but about 5 inches wider. So the size is great. And the 30 watts it uses is far less then the 60 watts my old one uses. So I hope to save a few bucks on my electric bill. Maybe I should have gone with a 27" but I could not justify at least $100 more for an extra 2.5" wider. I don't think I would notice it much anyway. I just put the monitor a little closer and bam! Bigger monitor. So if you are looking for a monitor with all the latest technology at a great price, then get this. You won't be disappointed.

I'm giving the Asus VS247H a five, which I rarely do. There are monitors out there that are double the price that do not perform as well as this beauty does. The only thing I've had from ASUS are motherboards. That's when I put computers together myself. I usually go with Samsung or Viewsonic monitors. My Samsung died in less than five years. I didn't care for the Viewsonic picture I got before. It has not only excellent specs, it really is impressive in practice. I would recommend this to anyone looking to upgrade to a 24" monitor. I have a second monitor next to it, which is LCD. This LED monitor picture looks much brighter and crisper. I am very happy with it.

Asus delivers. I needed a large high-definition monitor for regular office use and infrequent entertainment. In this case, I was pleased to get a large an crisp monitor for one of the lowest prices on the market. The image is stable, and my eyes do not get particularly tired. As with most monitors, the control menus are non-intuitive. Compared to earlier models of this same product, the buttons are hidden under the edge of the frame for reasons unknown. The settings have a limited range (for example, the brightest setting is not all that bright), and the speakers are not a big deal. Nevertheless, I am very pleased. This is a reliable and healthy monitor for day-to-day use.

So I went from 2 17" monitors to 2 24" monitors thinking that I will have oodles of desk top space and watching movies will be great. Yep and those 2 are great. But the Explorer windows and Web pages all open huge! Far beyond the need to scroll. I'm sure there is a way to fix but not intuitive. Also, it looks as some of the characters are washed out. I think that it has to do with a somewhat large pixel size and small font. I should have stuck with 21" max.
good monitor for the money however the plastic frame of the monitor feels and looks cheap. Fine for home, but not so much for office / retail.

review_title: Perfect for everyday computing and gaming
review_body: I bought this as a monitor for both my computer and my gaming consoles. Asus is one of the few manufacturers that make monitors with 2ms response times for gaming applications. This monitor was a great deal and now sits beside my older ASUS 24" VW246H LCD monitor. While these monitors might not provide the best image quality possible, they are perfect for a wide range of users who need an affordable flexible monitor to cover multiple uses.

I bought this monitor so that I could have additional screen space for my school work which involves lots of reading and writing. I like to buy quality products and after a good amount of research, I decided to purchase this monitor. I had read a few negative reviews about the light bleed around the edges of the screen, the screen not displaying text evenly, the picture not being as clear as was expected, etc. I found none of these reviews to be true in my product. The lighting on the screen is consistent from the center to each edge and corner. All text is even and crisp. All images are clear. The amount of screen space that I have has been nearly tripled, and the screen works very well for displaying multiple windows. I obviously knew the dimensions of the screen when I bought it, but when I took it out of the box I was still surprised at how large it was. This screen is pretty massive. MUCH bigger than the screen on my laptop that I have been using for some time. I couldn't be happier with this product.

I bought two of these for a dual monitor environment and I could not be more pleased.  No comments on the stands as I have them on a dual monitor stand however the front bezel is clean, easy access to OSD controls and the power light is blue so it is not intrusive.  Mounted easily with nothing in the way to the monitor mount.
Did not work properly on 3 of my laptops including 2 workstations (does not refresh and image get frozen) but it worked flawlessly on a chip dell laptop that my wife use.

review_title: Did not receive the correct Item
review_body: When I turned the monitor on, it only showed resolution of 1366 x 768, rather than the 1920 x 1080 listed on Amazon.  I checked the part #, and I received a 1659FWU, rather than a 1659FWUX.  The FWU lists for right at $99 rather than the $136.

review_title: Very loose plug, and doesn't work in BIOS
review_body: It's really good, and it doesn't really deserve its rating to be so average.  Really it's more of a 3.5 than a 3, but that wasn't really an option.
Does not work well with my PC - has trouble with Citrix. Also, does not allow you to adjust brightness, which seems a little dim.

review_title: Doesn’t work well with Macbook Air
review_body: The first time it’s works very well but after restart my macbook air stopped to work

review_title: perfect size for a monitor to go and makes my ...
review_body: Its a grest. Its light, perfect size for a monitor to go and makes my life easier having an extra window!

review_title: PERFECT for traveling businessman and women
review_body: This makes travelling with my laptop SO MUCH EASIER....having the extra screen really helps.  And being powered through the USB, means less wires.  LOVE IT
I use it every time when I am not at work. The quality is good, which is enough for me. I would recommend it.

I got this for my daughter, but I think she is very pleased with it.  She uses it with her laptop so she can have two monitors up and running at the same time rather than switching back and forth.  It really helped her out when she had to work from home while healing from a medical problem.

On my old laptop the connections were extremely touchy and it did a lot of "blinking" on and off.  Just got a new laptop and when I connect it, it flashes on for a second and goes black.  It's less than 3 months old and now I can't return it.

The monitor is big, bright with no dead or stuck pixels. I love the very thin borders at the edge, and just overall like the sleek design of this monitor. I'd recommend for anyone who wants a crisp image with bright vibrant colors.
It was a gift, No compliants

review_title: I thought a cord was missing and called customer support ...
review_body: I thought a cord was missing and called customer support.  They were very helpful.  As soon as I got off the phone, I found the cord.  It fell out of the box as I was opening.  Monitor works as expected and is very clear.
They look good and I use two side by side with a docking station for dell laptop. Recommend a wireless mouse and keyboard to go with that setup for working at home.

review_title: The monitor is fine but I do not like the round stand
review_body: The monitor is fine but I do not like the round stand. It takes up too much room on the limited space on my desk. Price was outstanding however.
Excellent

review_title: Nice monitor with good color rendition.
review_body: Nice monitor with good color rendition. Just wish it had a USB hub on it. Missed that when I was buying, assuming stupidly, that all quality flat screen monitors had built in USB ports.
The new owner loves it compared to her old 18" screen.
So far so good! Picture is nice and clear, and I haven't seen any dead pixels. Color is gorgeous.

review_title: ... I was missing out on after plugging in this bad boy. I am very impressed so far and ...
review_body: I have had an old 19" Dell for so long I didn't realize what I was missing out on after plugging in this bad boy.  I am very impressed so far and I'm loving it.  For the money, it's a very good deal for a modern, light-weight monitor.  I am extremely happy with it.

Amazing screen, upgrading from a 18.5inch. The colors are so bright, maybe not as vibrant as the glossy monitors but still just as amazing. It is very lightweight but it will wobble a bit on the stand if there big movement such as bumping into the table, sturdy otherwise. Another bit is make sure if you are using another monitor with this that you change the display on the monitor to either vga dv or hmi whichever is plugged into otherwise all you get is a black screen. No drivers are needed,  it works once plugged in. Will update after further use

review_title: These are great looking and performing monitors for the price
review_body: These are great looking and performing monitors for the price. I have a professional level 16:10 Samsung at work, that is 2-3x the price, and there is barely a difference between the two. The monitor came very well packaged, with both DVI and VGA cables included, which is always a plus.

review_title: ASUS: switch back to your old screen supplier. Yellow whites abound.
review_body: I had to return this. Something has changed over at ASUS insofar as where they are sourcing their screens. I bought this same monitor two years ago, and the colors are great. The most recent one I purchased had an abysmal yellow tint to everything, no matter what color profile I loaded and no matter how much adjusting I did in the OSD. This is a common problem, it seems.

review_title: An excellent monitor at a reasonable price
review_body: An excellent monitor at a reasonable price.
