The monitor works very well.  I returned one because it would not turn on.  When I received the replacement, it initially turned on, but when I adjusted the monitor, it went off.  I discovered that the power cord that came with the monitor did not fit snugly in the receptacle.  I took one from my stash of cables, plugged it in and the problem was solved.  If you don't have the correct spare cable, don't buy it.

I bought this for a friend and I have to say I was not expecting such a nice picture for this relatively low price. Afterwards I realized I haven't bought a new monitor since 2008 and apparently you get a lot more for your money these days. I can only imagine what you get for the 500 dollar range now. Might be time for me to upgrade.

review_title: Great monitor at a great price
review_body: I have a laptop computer that I work on every day. I have this monitor connected to it and it greatly improves my productivity. I have it positioned directly behind and above my laptop screen. I can easily look up and down to transition between the two screens. The HDMI cables provides the highest quality resolution from my computer. Images look sharper and brighter on this display than on my laptop screen. Great monitor.
comes with HDMI and DVI cables. I don't think it's full LED because the box says LCD. Overall it's very bright and crystal clear. A few weeks using it with no issues yet.

Having had a 22 inch 1620 x 1050 for so long, just assumed the next 22 inch would be the same...but no!  A pleasant surprise to see side-by-side the difference.  1920 x 1080 is so much more...  Colors and brightness are fine...the controls are OK, but a bit clunky to me.

review_title: Fantastic Monitor/ Flat Screen Unbeatable Price!
review_body: I bought this and mounted it on a flatscreen tripod (Audio2000s Ast-420y Flat Panel Lcd Tv/monitor Stand with Tripod Base) so I can watch movies while I exercise on my elliptical machine.  Hooked up to a blu-ray player via the HDMI port on the monitor.  Wow, great picture, no dead pixels, very nice quality.  I've been using an earlier version of this ASUS monitor for my desktop for 2 years now, and never had a problem.  Cost me half what I paid for my desktop monitor 2 years ago.
Easy Set Up.  Great performance.  Purchased two to use on my desk for my ASUS laptop.
This monitor is awesome. It arrived on time with no dead pixels or weird screen problems. I'll edit if something goes wrong.

review_title: False Advertising and Lousy Customer Support
review_body: This review is for the VS247H-P 23.6 inch monitor:

Good display, nice monitor, no complaints! I bought one a couple years ago and liked it enough to purchase a second one now. I would recommend it to anyone who needs a nice monitor but doesn't want to spend a whole lot for some of the fancier, newer tech.
Did not work with my Lenovo lap top.  Downloaded software, but never could get it to work.  Very Disappointed.

review_title: Mostly OK, but has driver conflicts with other monitors.
review_body: When it works, it works great. But the drivers for it frequently conflict with main video card drivers or other drivers in the system, which will make the monitor useless until it gets sorted out. It'll be great as a solo monitor for a laptop or palmtop (or Raspberry Pi!), but it's mediocre at best as a second (or third, and so on) monitor.

I sometimes travel for business purposes and this little workhorse is a lifesaver. It is lightweight and fits easily in my laptop backpack. It's a must-have for those of us that dislike constantly toggling between screens to view related documents and workspaces.

review_title: Unless you don't plan on traveling with them this is an absolute garbage product.
review_body: This monitor, though made for traveling, is extremely delicate.  I have had 2 and both broke the first time I flew with them in my laptop case.  Obviously I am careful with this case as it is also carrying my laptop.  On both occassions the screens appeared to be cracked internally.  Unless you don't plan on traveling with them this is an absolute garbage product.
Bulky

review_title: Great portable monitor, but needs Linux drivers
review_body: This is a terrific monitor.  Use with Mac requires download and install of a driver from the manufacturer site, but after that it Just Works with my MacBook.

It looked nice and was just the right size, but I had some mega problems with it. It get overloaded and fuzz out a bunch while I was streaming. I decided to buy one with an HDMI cable instead of a USB cable. This might be a good product, but it doesn't cut it if you are doing a lot with A/V stuff (making and watching videos at the same time)

Received my “new” monitor and it appears to work, but the seal tape on the box was cut, the cd package was ripped open and you could tell someone tried to put the plastic tape back on the front of the monitor. There were finger prints on the monitor as well.
Excellent USB monitor.  For a USB monitor, good viewing angle.  Could not be easier to setup.
I travel for work and this monitor has come handy. Very easy to install.  It will drain your computer very quickly if you do not have it plugged in.
Awesome picture display easy to set up would recommend others to have
Great product

review_title: Colors are accurate and beautiful, and the bezel is so think
review_body: I haven't seen any light leaking as some people have said.
It looks like very good. Clear, enough big and see comfortably.
Great product with great screen display.

review_title: um where do i start its a good monitor nothing too crazy good picture however i couldnt ...
review_body: um where do i start its a good monitor nothing too crazy good picture however i couldnt get the speakers to work using pc hdmi dont know if its a defect or if i was doing somthing wrong oh not alot of options the bear minimum no options for resolution  just brightness and contrast. but im comming from an old asus lcd monitor from 2012 to this ips monitor so..yeah i am happy with it overall
Beautiful display for the money.
Great picture, arrived on time
Extremely satisfy!
Good quality
This is a great monitor, big enough to be satisfied, but not too big that you feel crowded.

This monitor arrived on time and works as advertised. I owned a previous version of a similar ASUS monitor that worked well for my purposes at this price level. Admittedly, I had problems twice with that older version over 3 years of constant use. That sounds bad but the service with ASUS under the 3-year warranty was excellent and fast. So, I bought this one as much for that service as anything else since I didn't really see any other lower-priced monitors with consistently better ratings.

Great monitor. I use it in addition to my laptop monitor, and when comparing them side by side it's night and day. Settings are pretty useful (you can even set the vibrance on it) and there's no dead pixels or anything so far. the non-adjustable stand wasn't really a problem for me, just because of how big the monitor is.

For the money this is a great monitor. I only use it for general computing and a little photo and graphics editing but not gaming so your mileage may vary. One small annoyance is that the monitor stand allows the monitor to shake if the monitor is touched or the desk bumped. It's just not a solid enough stand to make it solid. Having said that, it isn't a problem for me. Unless I bump the desk pretty hard or the cat jumps up and bumps the monitor it's steady. I liked the value of the monitor I bought two more for my kids computers.

review_title: Wide enough to feel like 2 screens!
review_body: I love this wide monitor. Good picture quality, but mainly wide enough to work on 2 documents side-by-side. My desk isn't big enough for 2 monitors so this is the next best thing. Great value.

I took a little time before pulling the trigger to buy a new monitor, in the end I had my choice narrowed down to this one and a viewsonic. I'm very pleased with this monitor, I do play some games and it performs great on everything I have thrown at it. I suppose if there is anything negative to say about the monitor is that I don't really care for the stand too much, would have preferred something a little more sturdy, this one tends to wobble if I am too aggressive playing a game or something but as far as the performance, picture and quality of the monitor itself, I can't find anything bad to say about it.

review_title: good for image editing and movies
review_body: This monitor has surprising color rendition for such a low priced unit. The sRGB setting is particularly wonderful for editing images and video. I leave it set to that at all times, so that i do not botch a print. Movies and games will look a little drab, but it is a decent compromise.

review_title: I own 6 of these and they work very well.
review_body: I have bought 6 of these for my office and they all have arrived in perfect condition and work well. The picture is crisp and the color is good. They are very attractive. I would recommend.

review_title: Great display and very slim profile.
review_body: Pros:
wonderful monitor. Great clarity and color for the price.

review_title: If only zero stars was possible
review_body: Stopped working after a couple months and claiming the warranty is a HUGE pain and likely not even worth it. Every time I plug it into my laptop it turns on and shows an icon telling me to plus it into my computer...

I use two screens at home and at work.  I was on the road all last week, and needed to get work done at night in my hotel room.  This was a very useful, easy to use second monitor.  I was also considering the ASUS portable monitor.  What sold me on this monitor is the adjustable arm on the back, which works very well.  The monitor fit nicely in my computer bag, too.

review_title: Great build quality, but constant high pitched humming made it unusable for me
review_body: Seems like a quality built monitor. Picture also was very good.
Outstanding

Only works periodically. I leave it at home to be able to work from home on my laptop with a second screen so it wouldn't have wear and tear from travel but it only sometimes works. When it does work it is a good problem but it is too hit or miss to buy again or to recommend someone else to buy it.
this saved me.. love it

review_title: It's pretty much exactly what I expected
review_body: It's pretty much exactly what I expected. It isn't anything fancy but if you need a second monitor to look stuff up in a web browser or edit documents then it works just fine.

review_title: Auto pivot will not work with windows 10
review_body: Contrary to the product description, I was able to confirm with their own tech support that auto pivot will not work with Windows 10. Unfortunately, the auto pivot was a prime motivator for my purchase so it is being returned.

review_title: You need to download & install the driver from the company's website and then you're good to go
review_body: I use this as a portable second screen for my Macbook Pro. You need to download & install the driver from the company's website and then you're good to go. It comes with a USB cable & a soft case and is small enough to fit in my laptop bag.
Husband loved it! Makes it easier for him to read on one and type on the other monitor
very soft on the eyes
Sharp image for a fair price!
Good clear steady picture. Lightweight. Easy setup. Resolution reduces eye strain. Good price to performance ratio.
I got the 21” for gaming and it is a great investment. Very little lag even tho it isn’t a fancy G-Sync monitor

review_title: The users love them and I'm so impressed that I'll be buying ...
review_body: I bought a bunch of these for a dual monitor project at work.  The users love them and I'm so impressed that I'll be buying these for my home setup next.  Great job on this monitor Acer.
Solid work screen. Great price.

This is a very nice and sleek looking monitor. The size (24") and quality for the price (sub $140) is an extremely good bargain, and it is as impressive if not more so in person than the pictures. There is nothing to complain about in build quality, and the stand is nice and sturdy.
I ordered 4 monitors in a short amount of time, some 24", some 27". the picture on these amazes me. it's incredibly crisp. I'd recommend these to friends.
I purchased two of these to use on my office desk. I'm very pleased with the size, heaviness and quality of this item. Would definitely purchase again.
No built-in speakers. Miss read the information.
Thank you!

review_title: Everybody is right - DONT BUY IT
review_body: I received it, and the first try it would turn on show the logo and turn off. I installed the driver. After that it gets some light in the screen and not even the . logo appears before it turns off. DONT BUY IT

This product worked fine for a few weeks, but has now suddenly lost the connection to the USB cable going into the device and won't connect.  Just outside the return/support window of course.  Would not recommend.

Downloaded the software on my newer work laptop (I work remotely and wanted this to travel with) , rebooted, and the entire screen just went black. Had IT try to restore my computer, but it is now damaged and has to be replaced. Don't know what happened, but obviously some glitch in their software destroyed my computer. DO NOT BUY!

These monitors are amazing!  I travel often and need to work remotely. I need dual monitors in order to create newsletters, etc. Now I actually have three monitors:  my laptop and two of these. I thought having two monitors was great yet having three screens makes me even more productive than I could have imagined. The resolution on these AOC monitors is even better than the stationary dual monitors my employer had previously provided me in the office. I bought (and needed) the Anker USB 3.0 4-Port Compact Hub to complete the setup as my laptop didn't have enough USB ports for these and my wireless mouse.  Fantastic product!

review_title: They don't make them like they used to.
review_body: I have a older version that is still working.  This screen broke in less than 2 months and I've been caring it in my laptop backpack. Looks like the USB cable put pressure from on the edge of the frame and caused the screen to crack. All this while it was in its sleeve.

review_title: Directions needed to be explicit in requiring upload of CD ...
review_body: Directions needed to be explicit in requiring upload of CD BEFORE attaching screen.  I didn't and the auto rotation doesn't work.  Should be able to dump the drivers and start over..will find out.  Works quite well though.

review_title: Small, light and works great. Color can not be adjusted match the laptop display.
review_body: This portable monitor works great with my laptop. It is small, light and easy to uses, The display colors do not match my laptop display and cannot be adjusted on this monitor. The resolution is not a good as I would have liked.
Works flawlessly on Windows 10 laptop, but the connection port could have been placed at a more convenient spot; like on the side.

review_title: So far so good, have only had to use it a couple ...
review_body: So far so good, have only had to use it a couple of times.  Great to multitask with a mobile office laptop setup (since it will also fit in a laptop case.  Great value for the money.

This screen is awesome for my desk, the only problem is my fault, my HDMI cable is a bit short, should've bought a longer one, but hey, I have two screens and this works fantastic. No problems i can percieve and I turned up the contrast because I've always thought it looks better. It takes a bit of getting used to for the manual adjustments on the monitor menu, but it's not rocket science.

review_title: ... monitor for about a year and it is really good for the money
review_body: Had this monitor for about a year and it is really good for the money. The pixel quality is no less then what you would expect from asus which is always amazing. I used this as my monitor for my gaming PC and it has delivered outstanding quality throughout this year that I've had it.

I picked up this up to use as a second monitor and it does the job nicely. It took a bit of calibrating to get the colors, contract, saturation, etc matching my Asus PA248Q; and while it doesn't quite get to the calibration of the 248Q, it pairs up just fine.

The monitor for the most part is what I expected it to be. It is has vibrant colors and can easily be switched for night viewing at the touch of a button. It arrived with multiple dead pixels which is why it received only 3 stars for lack of quality control.

Bought two for dual display. Color on both out of the box has been spot one. I have overclocked both to 70Hz with no problem using a 1050 graphics card. They wouldn't overclock to 75Hz. For the price after rebate this is a great buy. Highly recommend.

Love this monitor. I use it for gaming and light productivity. I was able to overclock mine to 74hz via HDMI. If you know how to use Nvidia control panel it should be fairly easy. Just set a custom resolution leave the resolution the same and play with the Hertz counter. Test until u find the highest number it'll accept.

Having been through numerous machines and monitors I am pleased to say that this is the best display I have ever seen. It rivals my 3 Samsung HDTV's. I am connected via a HDMI cable and have watched HD movies, it is truly 1080P. You can play with the settings all you want and when you screw it up, just do a reset snd start over. The "Splendid" presets are useful, but to truly see the vivid quality of the display, hook up a Blu-ray drive and view a 1080P movie; it is stunning. The response time is equally wonderful. I consider this one of the best puchases I have ever made. BTW, no dead pixels.

I Game a lot and watch a lot of movies on my computer and some times even work. This monitor is the best all around monitor that I have ever had. I trusted Asus with motherboards for a very long time but this is my first monitor by Asus.  Eight months now and this Ausa monitor is doing just find.

I am an avid Xbox Gamer. This monitor appealed to me as it was an IPS monitor (took some research to find this out where it didn't say in the listing), and the Dual-HDMI ports. Where I use a Headset (

The combination of size, resolution, features and price were perfect for my needs. I use this in an "air desk" system to work from a recliner. The screen size and resolution is perfect at an eye-to-screen distance of 30-36"". "Retina" resolution is 300 ppi at 10-12" distance, so is equivalent to 100 ppi at 30-36" distance.
Got this monitor and I absolutely love it. It beats my other 1080p monitors hands down.
LOVE it no wasted space! is an awesome monitor!

It's a really good monitor and I really liked it. Would recommend for slow or normal paced gaming because its 60 hz and would not be good with fps games but still very playable. Buy it if it's your on a budget but otherwise it's gud m8. POSITIVE REVIEWS ALL DAY BOIZ AND GIRLZ GG. y do i do dis
Really regret buying this...the light-bleed is rediculious....basically a 9" monitor if the screen gets too dark...
Great so far.  Easy set up.  Picture looks great.  Great clarity and color.  Fast delivery was a plus.
Love the larger screen.
Very nice display :)
AWESOMe, and speechless good jobs
Best monitor I ever had.

review_title: but after shopping at Best Buy and reviewing the options this was by far ...
review_body: I rarely write reviews, but after shopping at Best Buy and reviewing the options this was by far the “best buy” for the money: outstanding quality, stable and great resolution!
Seems to work fine.  I have not used or traveled extensively yet but in my intial testing it works nicely on both my work and a home laptop.

review_title: Handly for carrying from office to office, and as ...
review_body: Handly for carrying from office to office, and as a second monitor when travelling with laptop. However, it doesn't suport HD, which means when attached to MacBook, iTunes can't play HD movies, but when unplugged, all goes well again. A bit of let down.
love it, it makes a world of difference as I'm trying to work from home on some day.

review_title: SCREEN IS WAY TOO DARK ON A MAC - AND NO WAY TO FIX IT.
review_body: The screen is so dark on a mac.

Bought a couple days ago, the screen resolution is nice but the display color is a little bland. Definitely worth the price paid for it, only problem I am having is with the USB connector, when I move the screen the USB will move around in the port and disconnect from my laptop.  I don't know if it is just my laptop or a bad USB connector.
Is very easy to set up and takes the home office to a whole new level!  My parter also takes it to work and can set up quickly outside and work from almost anywhere!

review_title: Not as bright as I would like but fits in bag just fine for travel
review_body: Not as bright as I would like but fits in bag just fine for travel. Future HD version may be worth investment.
Works great, even on a work laptop (where I don't have admin privileges but it still installed the drivers which were built in).
Cheap plastic. Didn't survive the shipping. Waste of money.

review_title: great item and a great help since I work at ...
review_body: great item and a great help since I work at home, now I have 2 screens and I can take both items with me without worry.

I have had dual ACER 22-inch LCD monitors on a desk-mounted display stand for the last several years. They have been decent monitors, but one of the flaked out over the weekend. After my efforts at resuscitation failed, I decided to go ahead and get the ASUS. I now have the ASUS LED mounted beside the ACER LCD. There's no comparison. Although the Acer seems to have a sturdier overall build, the ASUS has a FAR superior picture. In fact, the difference between the two is so stark, I am giving some thought to getting a second ASUS and gifting the other ACER to my parents. So far, I am very impressed.
Fast and clear, the buttons to control it are a bit difficult to figure out when you first plug it in, but as part of a 3 monitor trading setup it's great

review_title: It's a fantastic monitor, especially for its price
review_body: I purchase for a Union. I've upgraded 23 monitors so far to this unit. I've only had to ship one back because it wouldn't turn on. It's a fantastic monitor, especially for its price, and considering the hours of work our staff is on the computer, the IPS has really cut down on the eye strain. The color is good and the font value is clear. I'm purchasing several more to upgrade more desks.

I feel obligated to write this review after a year because the fact is I really haven't used this monitor for a year. I bought it when I started going back to school and even got myself a desk. Problem is that the stand wobbles so much that it's impossible to use. I'm finally buying a wall mount for it and will hopefully be able to use this without getting distracted, but the simple truth that this REQUIRES a $20 mount to not annoy the heck out of me means this loses a star.

review_title: Nice monitor at a decent price
review_body: I bought this monitor on Amazon after living with a very old 15" dell LCD monitor for years, and I use it for regular computer uses (internet and MS office applications).

review_title: You can turn it to where you are comfortable. The 1ms delay is good for gaming and ...
review_body: It is a big monitor. You can turn it to where you are comfortable. The 1ms delay is good for gaming and recording. It has a beautiful picture quality. It has really good settings. I think this monitor is awesome, I like it!
Typical hit and miss Asus quality.  This one seems to work great. And remember, folks!  It's not pronounced "Ehsus" or "Hesus" like the Mexican Jesus. It's pronounced "a*H*sus".

I don't know a lot about monitor technology, but my best existing monitor was already going on 8 years old. Still going strong, but I needed to replace the monitor for my secondary PC. So decided to buy this one to use on my primary, and move my old one to the secondary.

Had it less than 4 months, already crapping out. Unplugged it to move to another desk and then it wouldn't turn on at all. No power at all. Used different power cord, not it either. Couple days later I try it again, works fine. Once again try and unplug and move to the spot I need it, dead again. So basically if it's working, just never ever unplug or turn it off and maybe you won't have any problems?

I bought two of these true 24" monitors to go along with my Dell UltraSharp 2407WFP-HC 24" monitor for a 3-monitor (3x1) Eyefinity setup.  Eyefinity setup resolution of 6048x1080.  These are great monitors.  They have no ghosting problems that I have seen and draw very little power.  The colors are very good and the black levels are really good as well as the whites being very bright.  I highly recommend these monitors if you are on the market for a 24" monitor.  I honestly have not missed with the Splendid function.  Don't see a reason for right now, but I have the option if I ever choose to mess around with that feature.

review_title: My eyes can see the glory!
review_body: The ideal complement to my new MacBook Pro 13".

review_title: Perfect for what they are made for.
review_body: Monitors are amazing, I had one issue I had to get around but that wasn't a problem with the monitors it was with how my computer wanted to register them. I do love that DVI was a option for video because I wasn't going to try to use VGA and convert it, Also the HDMI port was already in use.
Excellent color, sharp image, good quality and easy to assemble. I would definitely buy this product or any other Acer monitor again.

review_title: A great monitor for a great price
review_body: A great monitor for a great price. It would be a solid 5 stars if only there was less backlight bleed. Otherwise it is really nice
great image
The quality of image is fantastic. The screen and model also. I’m pretty satisfied with my purchase.

review_title: Exactly what i was looking for at an awesome price.
review_body: Great monitor. Functions exactly as described.  Bought two for a docking station setup.  The small bezel is great for multi monitor setups.
awesome  and clear
Looks beautiful, I use it for competitive gaming and it works great. I play rocket league, overwatch, and bf1 on it.

Excellent value for money. I suspect this to be one of the best choices of monitors in the category. I am very satisfied with it's performance and have found no evidence of leaks around the perimeter (as a review I had read might have suggested). Picture image is absolutely steady and color and detail are vivid and sharp. The frame around the image is arguably the thinnest in its category. This is a big plus when it comes to long sessions of work. Also, it would be a plus when using multiple monitors. As I expected, there is a relatively wide viewing angle from any direction - so there is little need to adjust the stand constantly. Again, during long sessions of work I change my angle and height of viewing quite a bit, the wide viewing angle is much more comfortable in such cases. One small issue I have noticed while testing is that I would have preferred a height adjustment on the stand. My preferred viewing height would have been about an inch shorter than the fixed 4.5 inch height (bottom of image to desktop). Sometimes I have to place the monitor on a standard tabletop at work, which is particularly where this need becomes apparent. I thought of mentioning this only for the manufacturers, but it is not really a big problem since I am quite accustomed to it even at this time, three weeks after putting the monitor into use. Since I use this monitor with a new build, its generic drivers were installed by Windows during assembly. However, I replaced these with the Acer drivers. Regardless of how impressed I was with this monitor, I have to state that although I have been a computer builder and business user/enthusiast for many years, I have not been able to figure out how to use the physical buttons on the monitor to tweak its settings - I gave up and used the Windows Control Panel instead. The monitor comes well tuned and does not need much or any tweaking out of the box. Overall, I think most customers would be entirely satisfied with buy and I recommend it highly.
This was such a great purchase, goes with me every day (outside sales person), holds up to being on the road every day for over a year now.  Great compliment to my Dell Tablet.

review_title: Great but needs an improved plug in the back.
review_body: I love this thing I just wish it was a little thinner and I am going to have to use my warranty on it already as the plug doesnt secure very well.
Works ok. It is a bit fragile.

This has surprisingly low resolution for its size, but I could deal with that because it's so handy.  Unfortunately, after about two months of use it will no longer start up, due to a short in the wiggly-since-day-one USB connector.
I absolutely love this monitor. I personally use it as a third monitor for my desktop were I will have the news or weather constantly running it's a great little add-on.
I bought it because it said it was compatible with Windows XP but it is not.  Product quality is good.

review_title: usb placement in back is bad, usb connection became loose after just one month ...
review_body: Pro: light weight, cheap cost, decent monitor quality
Great monitor!  Sharp & clear with good color resolution. Easy to connect, & stand adjusts to multiple angles. This acts as a second monitor to my laptop, & it's superior!

review_title: The softward is not as plug and play as advertised ...
review_body: The softward is not as plug and play as advertised. I could get it to work on one of my laptops and not on another. Spent 3-5 hours trying to make it work

review_title: Great monitor especially for the price.
review_body: This has been one of the best USB monitors ever. Works flawlessly with clear images and text, very thin and light.  One draw back and the only reason it's not a 5 start is that a monitor this size is fairly easy to crack the screen if you travel. It would be nice to find a hardshell cover for the screen similar to what DoubleSight has for their monitors.  I would still buy another one, just knowing I would have to be extra careful.

I must have been one of the unlucky ones. First one I received had multiple dead pixels, the worst one was right in the middle of the screen. Got a replacement, and while it was dead pixel free, it had horrible light bleed in the bottom left of the screen. Was nearly impossible to enjoy games, cause blacks looked gray in that part of the screen. Also what is with everyone abandoning 1920x1200 resolution. I give it two stars cause the price is good, and when turned off it looks great. I am sure it is a great monitor, as long as you are lucky. Sent it back and went with a Dell IPS screen instead.

this is an amazing monitor for my needs and for $125 you cant beat it, i wish i had gotten the one with speakers but this monitor has just the ports i need for all my entertainment and work, ive got my ps4 hooked up to the hdmi and my gaming pc hooked to the vga, theres also an audio port for speakers in general, i jsut kinda prefer the already built in but no problem that was my fault

My 19" monitor ended up dying after 5 years so I thought i'd treat myself to something a little more fancy... all I can say is WOW, I immediately noticed a huge difference, everything seems alot more colorful, I mainly use this for gaming and someone asked me if I had turned up the graphics (which were all max settings before besides going from 1440x900 resolution to 1920x1080) anyways needless to say it was well worth the purchase, i'm extremely happy, easy to setup also... no problems what so ever, no dead pixels no nothing!

The 23.6-inch monitor is definitely a good buy for the money. My only complaint about the monitor itself is the stand. The neck that runs from the base to the monitor is very flimsy. This isn't too big of a problem while the monitor is sitting on the desk, but it gets annoying when you're trying to push the buttons and the whole screen shakes. I also don't understand why some of the menu items are unchangeable, such as saturation, sharpness, etc., but the picture is fine how it is, so I'm not complaining.

Bought 3 of these monitors for 3d gaming. Run all three monitors with one GTX670 video card and all three monitors are working flawlessly. Beautiful colors and sharp image. I read several reviews on Amazon about these monitors and how they have a cheap stand that is not sturdy. I am a little confused by those reviews. I find the monitor's stand to be quite solid and do not understand why people are claiming to have problems. When comparing this monitor with other monitors with like features and capabilities, you are getting a great deal for the money you spend.

review_title: This is a fantastic monitor. the display is large
review_body: This is a fantastic monitor. the display is large, crisp and clean. Even up to 30 months after purchase there are zero dead pixels. the downside? liquid crystal bleeds. about 6 months ago the liquid crystal began to bleed from around the edges of the bezel onto the screen. some have gone away, some are permanent. there was never any damage to the monitor to explain the bleed so I have to chalk it up to poor manufacturing or quality control. currently working on getting it rma'd back. i'll report how that goes.

I purchased three of these for an "eyefinity" gaming set up. They worked perfectly. Asus equipment has never let me down, and their prices are very reasonable. This monitor come with three kinds of connections 1 HDMI, 1 DVI and 1 VGA. I run 3 of these in "eyefinity" with a ATI HD 6970 graphics card and looks great. I recently added a second 6970 and looks even better. Sure there are a lot better monitors out there, but this one is better than some high end monitors. I would definitely recommend.

I bought this monitor as an upgrade to my 17" sub-1920 x 1080 Spectre monitor. This monitor is bright and perfect for gaming. The colors really pop, especially if you take some time to configure the monitor's settings.
One of the best monitors I have ever purchased...the screen is so vibrant, I tried to setup my other monitor the same way (with color, contrast, brightness, etc.) but without any luck.

a very nice unit -- LOVE IT! (was a bit concerned about a few dead pixels after reading about that in a couple other reviews, but mine is picture perfect) Haven't played a lot with video presets for theater view, etc -- Chromecast looks fine, multiple video inputs handled well, and just-use-it-as-desktop-PC with Windows is almost pretty good. Cleartype fonts is pretty weak compared to most other dedicated 1920x1080 pure-PC monitors I regularly use, but the compromise as my multimedia, multi-use monitor is worth it.
works great

Great!

I'm using a newer laptop which makes everything seem better, but really for the price and the look have to give this a 5 start.  As for durability or any issues I can only speak for the time I've had it.
A GREAT MONITOR!!!!

Perfect love it

Make sure to check compatibility with your computer. Large screen requires a ton of power, which most tablets cannot sustain. This product did not work with my Surface Pro 3. Seems counterintuitive as smaller tablets/hybrids are most in need of large external monitor.

review_body: Great addition to a laptop on the go. The resolution is at a lower quality that I imagined, but it definitely serves its purpose.
I really needed a decent sized external monitor for my laptop that I could travel with. This thing is perfect! I love it!

review_title: Do not buy this product!! It barely lasted ...

review_title: Did not work from day one
review_body: I was excited to use this monitor after reading the reviews. I was unable to download the setup disc and the monitor would not come on at all.

review_title: will not work w/ Haswell MacBook Air
review_body: I really wanted this display for traveling and extra screen real estate at home.  AOC bills it as Mac compatible but it will not work on the latest MacBook Air with Haswell processor and 802.11ac (13" Mid 2013).  I installed the correct driver (and uninstalled 5 times).  I even tried the Beta Mavricks driver twice.  All I get is the screen flashing between blue, red, green and gray.
works well! definitely a good buy!

review_title: I am crippled without a second monitor. This works ...
review_body: I am crippled without a second monitor. This works well for travel, and is convenient that it charges through the USB.
Bought 3 of these for triple monitors and haven't had any problems

I have just received my monitor and am currently using out of the box settings. The monitor is very bright and the whites, and more vibrant colors, are great. The quality overall is amazing. I am very satisfied with my purchase, especially because of the quality received at this price range.

review_title: I just cannot see why this monitor consistently gets 5 stars!
review_body: It works, it fills the screen properly, still screens render wonderfully, so it's nice.  But, it came with a big dead pixel shining like the north star at 10 o'clock center, the loose plug mentioned in other reviews is driving me nuts--move it just a little and it disconnects, and I gave up trying to figure out how to change any of the settings, it's crazy. Sure, they have a downloadable manual from their website, but it's useless, and the Asus website itself is just the same, never ran into more pages not available.  Weird.  All this would be not so bad, I might even go 4 stars, were not for the fact that this monitor's streaming video is totally awful, it blinks, and between blinks it looks like I'm watching from underwater sometimes and other times the images wrinkle in little waves.  Nice price though.  I like the energy star too, but hesitate to recommend this to anyboy.

Monitor is sharp. Colors are true and outstanding. No dead pixels. The monitor has numerous preset color variations that you can select, depending on what you're viewing or working on (movies, gaming, or using a word processing or graphics program), and of course, you can modify and customize your own.  However, the default normal setting has been working just fine for me.  Upon setup, the display almost seemed too large, but I've adapted well to it.  I use it mostly for music composition (sequencing) and watching movies, so having that extra wide viewing area is great. The monitor has built-in speakers, but since I use studio monitors for sound, I've disabled them.  One thing to be aware of is that the monitor will add it own sound driver and use it in addition to your computer's sound card to drive the speakers in the monitor. This confused me at first because I couldn't figure out why I was hearing sound from somewhere else other than from the headphones i was wearirng it the time. When I took off the headphones, I was still hearing sound and couldn't figure out where it was coming from.  I later realized that the sound was coming from behind the monitor. All you need to do is go into the control panel and disable the other driver. Yes, I would definitely recommend this monitor.
displays an "Asus" window upon start up and after sleeping which is kindof annoying, but otherwise happy with it.

I've had this monitor for a month already. It's a good monitor. My only major problem is that I can't see what is on the monitor whenever I look at it with my polarized sunglasses on. I like wearing sunglasses while on the computer. (My eyes are overly sensitive to light. Camera flashes are unbearable to me.) So whenever I have to look at this monitor, I shouldn't be wearing my sunglasses to be able to see. Other than that, everything's fine.

I've had this monitor for several months now, and overall I'm pleased with it. I have not had any dead pixels, the matte screen is very good at reducing glare, the colors are full and vibrant. There are only two gripes I have with it: the power cord connector in the back of the monitor is loose and comes off easily, and it would also be nice if the stand had a height adjuster instead of only an angle adjuster.

Excellent screen for the price. Was a bit ugly out of the box, but with some settings adjustments this monitor came to life. I have it VESA mounted in a multi-monitor setup and it performs great. The bezels aren't the slimmest, but surely aren't the widest either. Minimal light leak in the corners (to be expected with IPS) but isn't too bad. A great upgrade from an older 720p TN.

review_title: Overall good, slim, sturdy design. Quality matches price.
review_body: Good resolution. Clear fonts, etc.

It's a good monitor but there's a newer model (ASUS VS229H-P) that has the same specs as this one (1080p, 5ms, etc), on top of having IPS which improves viewing angles and overall colors. This model just isn't worth buying anymore when the VS229H-P is only a few dollars more expensive.
Better than I expected. Beautiful graphics,clear as a bell. Hoping my old one will break down so I can purchase one of these.
Very nice, the screen is very matte, looks very nice. The stand and menu are strange, but work.

review_title: Great budget monitor, good for gaming too
review_body: This monitor is a great deal for the price, I got it for $129.99. I've used it mainly for gaming so far and while it's not a "gaming monitor" I can still notice a big difference playing FPS on this compared to my TV. It's also a great picture and bright screen.
Works great in my home office.

Although the image displayed on the screen does not fill the screen to the actual bezels, the bezels are tiny. Great contender for a multi screen set up if desired. Viewing angles are great as would be expected for an IPS panel.

review_title: don't waste your time and money

This monitor is absolutely outstanding.

I'm very happy with this monitor. It has great resolution and looks sharp. My only complaint is that I don't really like where the button is to turn it on and off, I wish it was a bit easier to press, but I'm a stickler for turning my monitors off when I'm done. For those curious, the button is on the bottom right of the monitor, under a little bezel.

review_title: Best IPS monitor with low price! It's really worth it!
review_body: OMG!!! Are you kidding? This low price with this kind of amazing color and performance. Big thumbs up with this product. Very very awesome.

review_body: It fits my bill as a stand-by monitor when I'm mobile. However, the video quality could have been better. Still, it's a great versatile product, and I'd recommend it.
Great 2nd monitor when traveling. Just plug it in the usb port. What a lifesaver

I did not drop it, bang it around or anything. Worked one day and then it was broken. AOC would not cover it and said it was my fault. Very poor quality design. Don’t buy it.

review_body: Worked great for 2 years and 3 months.  Dead this morning.  Won't power up.  Multiple attempts with different power cables and outlets.  Based on previous reviews, I don't have faith in the ASUS warranty process, so I'm buying a different model/vendor.

review_title: Good monitor, great for the money.
review_body: Overall I'm really happy with this. Bought it to connect to my Macbook Pro 13" Retnia as my old display didn't render a great image with the Macbook. This monitor's pixel pitch is pretty good and even next to my Macbook's Retnia display it looks decent.

I thought I was gonna be the first to review. None the less, This monitor is great. If you ever played Witcher 2 with uber samperling on. You are in for a treat. Games like COD Black Ops and Crysis 2 has that extra bloom to it thanks to the LED

The monitor itself is fine and what you would expect for the price.  However, my sister and I both bought this and have the same complaint - the cord is SO SHORT.  Unless you are within about 6 inches of an outlet, you're going to need an extension cord.  I often am not in the same place when working and take my monitor and every time its a covert mission to figure out how to plug this thing in.  When I am able to plug it in, it usually hovers about six inches to a foot above the floor and ends up tripping someone and nearly breaking the thing.  I actually hope someone breaks it soon so I'm forced to buy another one.

I've been using this monitor for almost 2 years now and I don't have any problem with it.  The HD screen is big enough to watch some online movie, youtube and any other movies that you would like to watch.  I don't have any problem with it, so I will always buy them.

This is the perfect size monitor for use as a main or secondary monitor. I use in in conjunction with my 17" Laptop screen.The colors are very vibrant with great brightness controls. The only downside, which is a very minor one, is that the power button does not depress as easily as it could. Sometimes I think I have turned it on or off and then I look at the LED on the front and it does not change state. This is a minor problem that does not effect the main screen at all.

review_title: Ratify screen great picture quality def would recommend my only complaint is ...

review_title: Called customer service which was very good, but was finally told that not enough wattage ...

Called customer service which was very good, but was finally told that not enough wattage was being delivered through my laptop usb port.  Never able to get monitor to work.  He suggested that I might consider a power booster to increase the desired wattage.  I already over spent on the Monitor, don't want to spend any more money.  Going to take a hit with restocking fee and paying to have it shipped back.  I am not a happy camper right now.

just received it today.  loaded the software and works great. its a little dim in contrast to my laptops contrast/brightness.  but its very easy one the eyes.  the case is durable, better than expecting.  Velcro sealed closure. inside of the cover is soft felt.
The product functions as advertised. The only complaint is the build. I feel like I have to Handel it like fine China or it will break.
Love this monitor. Great travel for business and personal. I love that it's USB powered.

review_title: driver issues with RT, and XP.
review_body: Doesn't work out of the box with windows 8 RT, or windows XP.

review_title: Very cheap and decent quality for the price. I ...
review_body: Very cheap and decent quality for the price.  I  knew what I was getting into with a 21" screen but take a look at one in store before you make a purchase.  It's very small compared to the more common 23.5" monitors (some say 2.5" smaller).

review_title: otherwise the panel has good color ratios fast refresh rates and is the ideal ...
review_body: I have two of these monitors that are used for my custom built gaming pc. The reason i give these monitors a three is because both of them had a dead pixel in almost the same area straight out of the box. I also have a 2nd Gen Nexus 7 tablet that is also manufactured by Asus and there are also problems with the panel. otherwise the panel has good color ratios fast refresh rates and is the ideal company for gaming. The only thing Asus really needs to work on is its build quality and customer service which is almost nonexistent.

This monitor has worked great.  We have used it now for three months.  It is located in our sound booth, so a major selling point was the display angles and the tilt capability of the monitor.  Both provide great flexibility for use in a room where people are moving around and need to see this from multiple points.

review_title: Great Picture Quality at a Great Price!
review_body: This monitor works great and is built well! I generally use it for gaming since it is a 1080p monitor. This monitor is crystal clear and has great color to match. The screen tilts forward and back for optimal viewing angles. It doesn't have built-in speakers, but in my opinion, its better to get your own speakers with a sub included like the Logitech LS21 2.1 Stereo Speaker System. It has much better sound than any monitor that comes with built-in speakers.
I purchased two of these screens and experienced no issues at the 6 month mark. Both arrived without issues, no pixelation issues, screens are controllable, and inexpensive.

I play some games on it and don't really have any issues on lag. Unless you have a huge budget for your computer display these are the screens for you. Crisp image, looks nice and well priced, Just do it!

review_title: Don't factor rebate into your decision
review_body: Monitor works well enough; waiting on rebate for over six months now.

I ordered this monitor based on reviews on Amazon and elsewhere after my 4 year old Samsung died. It took quite some time to set up the Asus to my liking and it is still a little too bright. It's actually not quite as good as my refurbished HP that I bought from Woot which has more balanced colors and is noticeably sharper. The stand on the Asus is a little "wobbly". Having said that the Asus is still good value for money and does give you a load of customization options - it doesn't make 5 stars but a good solid 4!!

review_title: I don't know if you could get better. I'm a hardcore gamer and video editor
review_body: For the price of this monitor, I don't know if you could get better. I'm a hardcore gamer and video editor, and this monitor serves as a second display for my MacBook pro 15 inch. No complaints so far.

review_title: Monitor is great. Colors are nice and haven't noticed any dead ...
review_body: Monitor is great. Colors are nice and haven't noticed any dead pixels. I have 2 problems with it. The monitor sits pretty low and doesn't have an adjustable stand, but you probably can't find that in this price range. Also when my computer goes to sleep the monitor also goes to sleep but the monitor will not wake up with the computer, I have to turn it off and on again to use it. May be a problem with my graphics card though.
excellent product

My only complaint which I consider nit picking is all the adjustment buttons including the on-off button should really be on the front of the monitor not the bottom right edge. Works great with my high end security cameras. Cant go wrong with this one.

review_title: good with dell 7270e no worky with surface pro 3
review_body: It DOES NOT work with surface pro 3 - it just flashes, I suspect this is because the 3 only has one usb port and the monitor cable has one of those y cables for more power.  With my work Dell E7270 if works great.  The 'free' sleeve it comes with leaves a lot to be desired, it is so tight that the stitching that holds it together makes putting it in require that one side the stitching be on the front of the monitor and on the other side it needs to be on the back. this skews the whole sleeve so that the closing flap is crooked. Also there is no place to put the usb cable. a pocket would be great.  Also the sleeve doesn't look like it will provide much protection  As others have mentioned the usb connector looks like it will fall out easily, They could have made some kind of cable latch in the well where the cable comes out. I'm thinking of doing some kind of makeshift Velcro cable hold down. ... All of these things could be fixed easily, which is disappointing. But using the monitor with the Dell machine has been good so far

usb cable head connecting to the back of the screen is extremely thin and can break inside the jack. The screen's back stand is awkwardly designed and trips the wire when the screen is moved even slightly. Very annoying.

Nothing to complain about after 3 weeks of owning it, it's a really nice monitor and pretty cheap after the $20 rebate. Obviously you'll need to adjust the settings to get your desired look but that's with any monitor. Very pleased! The stand could be a little bigger though to fully support the size of the monitor, it does wobble sometimes but it's really not that bad. I purchased the "HP Single Monitor Arm" (also on Amazon) for it, it's a nice desk mount that this monitor will fit on.

Mine did come with one dead pixel, top left portion of the screen. It doesn’t show up all the time so I can live with it. I noticed some folks have complained about the stand, seems fine to me. Excellent picture and so far so good.  I think I made my husband jealous.  He bought a $400 dell monitor, and I bought this one for a third of that.  They seem very similar. Also, this monitor doesn't get stuck in power save mode like my previous dell monitor, which gets a two thumbs up from me!  Oh by the way, the power buttons and such are underneath the bottom right of the frame, not on the face of frame itself.  I had a panic moment that I'd gotten a dud until I realized that.

Great monitor. I bought this to display my ASUS 13" laptop screen and simulate a desktop setup. It works well for what I need. The one thing I didn't realize was that it does NOT have built in speakers. However this is not a problem since I use external speakers anyway. But if external speakers aren't your thing, this may not be the best monitor. Otherwise, it's great so far!

I've always bought Asus products due to their nice looking hardware, whether it's computer components or whole computers. This monitor has totally met my expectations for Asus. I use it for watching movies and gaming on my PC, and so far I love it! The color reproduction seems to be very good, the viewing angles are superb, and it has a blazing fast refresh rate for a monitor at this price. My only complaint is that the stand is just a little bit weak for the monitor, as in when you knock the desk, it wobbles a little bit. Other than that, I really like it and would highly suggest it!

review_title: This is good monitor for the price with good picture

Although I think in the future I would prefer some with higher it is fine since it is not a main monitor.  I would recommend this is look great a nice price for what you get it is a TN panel so if that is a deal breaker then you might pass on this monitor.

review_title: Best option for a 1080p IPS monitor
review_body: Needed a cheap, compact monitor to bring back and forth to college and not be too worried about. I was using my TV as a monitor prior to purchasing this, and it's night and day compared to the TV (obviously). This monitor is extremely thin, and has a really slick, edge-less design. The colors of this monitor are amazing, better than anything I've used before. I guess that's what you get with an IPS monitor. I am running a GTX 1070 so this monitor is a bit low-end in comparison to the card, but it is working great for application. The screen really is the most vivid and beautiful screen I've ever used. Even the 60Hz refresh rate is amazing, because I am used to gaming on an xbone with "cinematic 30-fps". I feel like for the price, there is no better option. Once I am out of college, I will upgrade to a 1440p IPS paired with a 144Hz TN monitor, but for a college student this is more than sufficient.
This monitor is beautiful. Everything looks amazing. Extremely sharp very good looking. buying 3 more very soon.
Love this monitor! I bought one to use as an external display for my computer and I'll probably buy a second when I upgrade my desk.
My grandson loves it.
nice , good price  , hdmi
Amazing Screen at an amazing price!
This monitor is meeting our needs for work and movies from Amazon prime. Work on the laptop while watching videos on this screen is super.

I love my monitor.  I use dual monitors in my office and work from home on certain days.  Using one monitor at home was very time consuming for the type of work that I do, so this purchase was a winner!  The only downside is that the resolution could be brighter compared to the screen on my laptop. Otherwise--- I am happy with this product.
purchased this portable monitor in June, and it barely lasted 3 months. Initially everything worked great and then the monitor just suddenly stopped working

review_title: and works great! Plug it in to USB 3
review_body: Purchase this about a year ago.

There are better and more insightful reviews out there, but I use this monitor daily. For PC users make sure you know which USB port has the most power. If you select the wrong one, you may need to use the secondary USB cable to get sufficient power to the monitor. Biggest complain is compatibility with Mac, but that's an Apple issue. For anyone looking for a secondary monitor this is perfect. Extremely helpful in meetings and situations where a second monitor is useful.

Great product. Works exactly like expected. Plug in, installs driver, works! No downloading of any kind necessary. As long as you have a newer laptop, this should work exactly as expected. Super happy w purchase!
Use this monitor as a second screen to my laptop does exactly what I need.  What a great product.

No complaints about the monitor. However, don't expect to hear from AOC if you need any type of support. My dog knocked my original monitor off the coffee table (bad dog) and I tried several times to contact AOC to inquire about replacing the screen. I figured popping a new one in would be a little cheaper than buying a new monitor. Nevertheless after not hearing back I bought another unit an I'm back in business.
easy set up. Easy to use.
perfect for travel

review_title: Great Monitor, even though I returned it
review_body: I bought this as a replacement for my wife's Samsung that appeared to have died.  Forgot about my big box membership store since they changed the return policy on CPU related items and TV's.  Direct Swap it worked, angle is adjustable and resolution is great - until static came back and I found that motherboard, video had been cracked and now I have returned this and will purchase a new motherboard from Amazon.  Why - returns are easy, we have the Prime service as we have cut the cord with cable and satellite.
So far this is better quality picture than the LED monitor that it replaced. We're very happy with this purchase.

review_title: scratched the heck out of my desk
review_body: The screen gets the job done but they need to put some kind of pad or cushion on the bottom of the "foot". This thing has scratched the heck out of my desk...
Excellent performance in resolution, colors and image display. It has several preset display scenarios from which to choose from like Theater Mode, Game Mode, etc.

Ok, so the 21 inch monitor I had stopped working. I needed something that was good for gaming and good for photography. I got it with this monitor! I spend about 12hrs a day on this monitor and it works perfect every time. No dead pixels or ghosting. I run every game at top settings and it makes the graphics pop. Images are crisp and clear. Text is also very clear no matter the size of the text. I love this monitor and will be buying a second as soon as I can. I could not be happier!

review_title: Can't find a better IPS panel for the money
review_body: I've ordered 2 of these and am about to order a 3rd.

review_title: BEWARE if you plan on attaching to a swing-arm mount
review_body: The threads on the back of the monitor where the mounting plate should attach are NON STANDARD.  That is, U.S. made 8/32 metal screw won't fit.  I talked with a guy at my local hardware store who has been selling screws & bolts for 2 decades.  He explained that the threads of some screws machined in East Asia are just less than a hair thinner than those machined in the U.S.  I called ASUS Tech Support and they were no help -- even after spending nearly an hour on the phone (ASUS -- you can look it up - my case # is N160309486).  When the support person came back on the line after nearly a half-hour wait, the connection was so bad I couldn't understand him (I was on a landline).  He could hear me so I asked that he call me back.  I gave him my phone number & name.  Now, 24 hours later, I still haven't gotten a call back.  So -- facing the prospect of not being able to mount the monitor, I switched into a MacGyver mindset.
After a little bit of calibration the picture quality seems to be very good. No pixel issues or any other such complaints. Quality seems to live up to the other positive reviews here.

review_title: A great value, but not for everyone.
review_body: As the title says, you really get what you pay for.  The product is solidly built, and the colors and viewing angles are great.

The size of 22" was fine to replace a dud monitor by another brand ( hint starts with a V) , I used two of these to get a three monitor surround and they are fine. The original settings were kinda washout so I backed down the brightness and the red/green and the color is great. Controls are in the front on the panel bottom  and same as any other ASUS. For a first monitor, surround or business monitor this is the best choice.
Great looking low priced entry level monitor. You could do worse for more.
Great screen. I use this along with my laptop and connect them to go back and forth. Works great!

This monitor is so awesome! There is no backlight, excellent viewing angles, and such a small vessel! Its just great!
i got this for me to use with the gaming pc i was gonna build and i tested it to a lenovo screen and this monitor was way better.

This is a great monitor. I have this connected via DVI in a 4 monitor set up and it works great. I have no complaints. The brightness is great, the contrast is good. I do normal work stuff and watch tv shows on it so I am not doing any games to rave about the FPS or anything like that.

I like the quick mode switch (Night mode to theater mode and such). I would give it 5 stars but without careful calibration the picture is foggy, like a veil of grey is over everything I'm viewing, but performs well for the price.

This monitor was recommended to me by a coworker.  I did little to no research and just wanted something functional and not too expensive that could handle some moderate gaming.  I had never had above a 19" before as I was always content with that but my SO does art work so I thought I'd get us both one.

review_title: I recommend this product to anyone looking for an everyday general ...
review_body: I purchased this monitor approximately a year or so ago.  I did not know much about ASUS at the time but this is the right monitor for the job.  I use it for everyday viewing, no gaming.  The colors are very sharp.  I recommend this product to anyone looking for an everyday general purpose monitor.  The price was great as well.

I've spend several hours trying to calibrate this monitor. Whatever I tried, I ended up with unnatural colors and either an over bright picture, or a very dull one - no middle ground. I'm not very picky about my monitors and their calibration, but this one looked so bad it was hard to ignore - I'm currently looking into returning it and buying a new one.

review_body: Edges had a yellow tint when viewed from angles other straight on. Side-view and top view, the yellowing could be seen and was quite noticeable with apps that use white backgrounds.

review_title: Great color!  Great price!  Crappy stands....and DEAD PIXELS
review_body: Bought two of these from the Amazon Warehouse.  They were both defective.  One had a huge scratch and the other had a section of the screen that was slightly blueish, only I couldn't tell until my replacement came in for the scratched one, and they were side by side.  It's taken a few weeks to get what I want (though the return process is super easy), but I like the monitors now that they are in prime condition.  Great color.  The stands are flimsy though, especially if you are used to something more substantial like a Dell.  I ended up getting a beefy dual monitor stand, but without that, the screen would shake while typing.
Awesome...

review_title: A great monitor at a good price
review_body: I love that it has all three inputs: VGA, DVI and HDMI. It has very good contrast and low latency so it can be used to view movies. The stand is stable and the tilt is firm. I did not test the headphone jack.

It clearly does its job, but also has a lot of functionality. No delay when turning the screen on (as in no wait time before image appears), colors are vibrant, and the buttons on the frame are very functional and easy to use. The ability to use hdmi/dvi/vga with my desktop/laptop is great. The stand can come off and fit in a carry-on bag for easy trans-portability for flights.

I did a lot of research before purchasing 2 of these monitors and am very satisfied with their performance. It comes with a base which is the only thing you need to attach, although I bought these with the intention of mounting them.

review_title: This is a business-grade monitor, very much worth considering
review_body: I usually take much longer to research and evaluate products like this before making a decision.  My previous monitor, a Samsung 224, was dying rapidly and I didn't have the luxury of time to do a lot of evaluation ... I needed a monitor now.  The Samsung was only 6 years old and after recent research I learned that that particular model was prone to early capacitor failures, rendering an expensive monitor useless.  Only weeks ago I learned that Samsung refrigerators made in at least the past 8 years are prone to design flaws that rendered $1000 - $2000 refrigerators useless. Mine died after less than 2 years.  I was starting to see a trend with Samsung making products that they didn't stand behind so I opted to look for a different brand for my replacement computer monitor.

review_title: Great monitor. I have had it since 2013 and ...
review_body: Great monitor. I have had it since 2013 and it is still going strong. The only cons are that the stand is very wobbly and for some reason my comuter thinks this model has speakers which it does not!

First off, let me say that this monitor was hideoous when I first took it out and hooked it up, but since has grown on me. The color choices you get with it are strange to say the least and it doesn't like setting up a custom setting. Most of the presets are horrendously oversaturated, or else won't give you a nice deep black.
I have been using this monitor for over three years without any issues.  The resolution is excellent and the screen size is just perfect.  I would buy this monitor again and  I highly recommend it.

Beautiful monitors! Ordered two and have had them for a little over 2 months now. No dead pixels, color looks great, super bright monitors (they shipped at 100% brightness, had to actually turn them down). Auto detected the input signal on first power on and are all in all some pretty sharp screens. Some reviews mentioned wobbly stands, but I have not experienced that at all. Monitor base screwed in firmly.

It is amazing! I am a digital artist and I work mostly on my laptop and this baby really wowed me! I can set any mode I want to get that perfect color. No dead pixels and no drama. The resolution is awesome and the stereo jack is a plus because I can set up my audio jack to listen to music as I work. I like the sleek design and its color modes. The HDMI was a win because my laptop  only had a HDMI port. I am really happy that I got this monitor!  :D

review_body: This monitor is fantastic.  The color, viewing angle, speed are all excellent.  I was coming from a 20" TN monitor, so this was a definite upgrade, and I can tell a significant difference, as I still have both running side-by-side.

Some others have more adjustable stands, but I find this one works fine for me.  I really appreciate the larger landscape when using my large spreadsheets, or opening multiple views side by side (my previous monitor was much smaller).

Running a bank of three of these monitors. These are long-term commercial monitors, guaranteed to be available for a number of years. Out of the box, each monitor needs to be tuned to match the others in a multiple monitor setup, hence 4 star rating.

review_title: This monitor has a great contrast ratio and does not ghost a while lot
review_body: There isn't much i can complain about with this monitor. If anything i had more issues with the supplier since i bought it "Used-Like New" But anyways let me get to it. This monitor has a great contrast ratio and does not ghost a while lot. There is no latency with the screen. When i recieved it, the colors were a little funky but, I took some time, and was able to get the settings where i like them. Very nice monitor especially since i saved a decent amount of money with it.

review_title: Quality Monitor in a Budget Price Range
review_body: I am no expert on monitors, but I can tell you from my experience installing many monitors over the years (IT Professional), that this is a nice monitor for the price.  The colors are right and bright, the build is solid, the adjustments in tilt are acceptable, over all a nice purchase.  If I need additional monitors in the future, I will consider this model again.

ASUS has amazing packaging, goes above and beyond. The picture quality is amazing and I have this along side of 2 other manufacturers monitors. I will definitely be buying ASUS monitors as I replace the others. I have bought other ASUS products for my computer and am very happy with all my purchases.

Have purchased half a dozen of these for my office.  Each is the same as the last, bright screen, plenty of space, turns on turns off, it works.  The picture is clear, primarily used for office work not graphics or gaming so I can't speak to the performance in that respect.  Everyone who has started using one love it over their old smaller screens, it seems to be a great value for the size.  We will buy more.

For the cost, i think the monitor is worth every penny. I have the monitor at work and at home and will be buy a few more for other needs. I'm not as well spoken as other reviewers, so I'll plainly say that it works as expected and that it's clear, colorful, and does exactly what I needed it to do only better. I've tried it with my PC, my XBox360, and a Blu-Ray player. The picture quality is excellent!

I am not a computer hardware expert, nor am I someone who spends oodles of money on the latest and greatest gadgets.  I was looking for a wide-screen LCD monitor and got this one.  I have always liked Asus products, and they did not disappoint.

review_title: it's a good deal. And the image quality is crisp
review_body: Yes, it's a good deal. And the image quality is crisp. However, the contrast (and thus, the color saturation) bleeds out toward the bottom of the screen. It's much better at the top of the screen. I can't imagine this has to do with the settings (all of which I've played with at length) -- and it's quite bothersome. I'm hesitant to return it because of shipping and hating the idea that this might not get resold and thus be wasted, but I'm very disappointed with this defect.

A what steal! This monitor is amazing and such a good price! The visuals on this monitor is so good! It is perfect for my needs of gaming and watching YouTube videos! The monitor shipped fast and was packaged well! I would recommend to anyone looking for a nice entry level monitor!

review_title: Big and Bright but with a some problems
review_body: As a few other reviewers have stated, this monitor is bright like the sun. I ended up throwing f.lux on my machine to keep the eye strain down.
Bought 2 of these monitors and love them!

review_title: Amazing for a dual screen setup.
review_body: I was a little skeptical picking up an ASUS Screen.

Do to the foolish design of this product, you can NOT flat mount this monitor to the wall.  The large AC power cable literally plugs right into the back of the monitor...protruding out farther than your flat VESA mount.  We build video walls for surveillance systems and ordered several of these monitors only to realize that we would have to rethink what should have been a simple mounting process.  Just a heads up as we've never run into this issue and it was pretty ridiculous to know the product was designed like that.

I found it quite disappointing that no local retailer, either big-box or small store, has 27" monitors on display so that you can compare them side-by-side.  That being said, I had to make do comparing the 23" monitors from the same makers with the hope that the 27" models would be comparable.  Having compared them, I have to say that what pushed me in the direction of the ASUS is the fact that it was the only one I was looking at that has two HDMI ports, allowing me HDMI connections from both of my computers (rather than having one HDMI and one DVI as would be the case with most other monitors).  I have been quite pleased with the performance.  Game play is very smooth with absolutely no tearing, contrast, brightness, and color are excellent, and the controls are well thought-out.  Switching between computers is as simple as a push of one easy-to-reach button.

This monitor was a replacement for my old school CRT monitor and looks WAY better of course. I only wish it had come with hdmi cables so I didn't have to spend the extra few bucks on it but that's okay I guess. Humongous LED screen looks wonderful any time of the day or night without any glare thus far. I'm sure there are better monitors out in the world but for the price I think I made the best choice I could here. Would recommend to anyone wanting a good upgrade with a good bang for the buck.
Very sharp pictures with great colors.

review_body: Wish it were a better resolution, but for my purposes, it works great!  I am in school, so I can pull up documents on this screen while I'm working on my laptop.  Great setup!

Bought this monitor to upgrade from my previous 21" monitor. I use this mainly for gaming on games such as Battlefield 3, Diablo 3, Max Payne 3. No ghosting what so ever! The picture is awesome! Theirs also a user setting to change the color of the screen from Gaming mode to Theatre Mode and plenty other modes that adjust the brightness and contrast, it works great. Highly recommended, great gaming monitor hands down. Reasonably priced.

I bought this monitor to go with my first gaming computer using an HDMI cable. It turned on quickly and the picture is amazing! So crisp and vivid. The base was easy for me to assemble and is sturdier than it looks. If you connect with an HDMI cable, the 2nd button to the right is how you change input modes. It took me forever to figure that out because that wasn't addressed in the manual. Also, the power plug can be hard to plug into the back of the monitor, but that could be because I was scared of breaking it. I'm extremely pleased with this purchase.

My fiancé recently built a computer and purchased this monitor. I'm used to having 2 monitors at work, so I purchased a 2nd. These monitors are great. They are a great size and they have a clear crisp image. They are a little pricy just for a monitor, but what isn't expensive these days?

I already had a monitor in mind, but when I came across this ASUS I really saw the extra benefits it provided besides the other. Another factor was pricing, this ASUS was about 60 dollars less than the other monitor if I remember correctly. So, this made a great to me. I hope it does the same for you.

This monitor is much better than my old 19 ... more accurate color, crisper image, etc. ... so when I'm working on photos and such, I use the Asus as the main monitor and use the old 19 to drive the software.  FWIW, I'm using the DVI connection, and haven't tried the others.  All-in-all, this is a great monitor at a great price.

I am reviewing the Asus VS247H-P 23.6-Inch Full-HD LED-Lit LCD Monitor. As I have always found with Amazon, the monitor arrived in only a few days after I ordered it and on the day it was promised. Set-up was a breeze and the picture quality was truly amazing. Unfortunately, my wife thought it was too big and insisted I send it back. I followed the online instructions for returning items provided by Amazon and received confirmation of a full refund (minus my initial shipping cost, not the shipping cost of returning it) within a few days. I immediately ordered another monitor (an Acer, to be reviewed separately). Everything about my experience with Amazon was great. I wish I could have kept this monitor as it was an amazing monitor for a reasonable price.

This was a great deal. I am using it with a desktop in an area with reflection of light, and this matte finish is fantastic. Colors are great. No bad pixels -checked with free online software. Nice performance with sharp picture and quick refresh. Use it with peripheral speakers so can't comment on internal sound. Is perfectly stable in my setup - on a table without much movement - would be wobbly on a less stable surface - this is NOT a rock solid stand. Overall - I highly recommend this stand with a sharp, clear picture with excellent color.

review_title: Everything I wanted from a monitor
review_body: Just like everyone else, I went through the all the reviews and tried to decide on the best monitor for a reasonable price.  Although the reviews were mixed on this particular model, I decided to go with it anyway, since it happened to be the best selling monitor on Amazon at the time.  Someone out there definitely knows what they're buying.  This monitor proved to be everything it advertised, it gave a very sharp HD picture with no glare, controls were easy to use and the tilt adjustment is really nice.  As a bonus, I was a little concerned about the base being wobbly from the reviews I read, but surprisingly, it is quite sturdy once you tighten the screw.  The only thing I would have liked would've been a height adjustment, but at this price, it really is a lot of ask.  You also shouldn't look for a speaker with this particular monitor; the plug-in jack on the back is fine.  If you're really concerned with sound, buy some quality speakers and plug them into the back of your computer.  You're not going to get good speakers on a monitor, anyway, especially at this price.  Like I said from the beginning, this is a great monitor, we happened to buy it for gaming, and if you're looking for something solid for the price, look no further.

Over 5,000 positive reviews....i'm wondering how many of them were paid reviews. I bought this monitor because of the price and the overwhelmingly positive reviews. After 1 week of light daily use, it lost signal to all the HDMI ports. I have a background with building and repairing computers. I know ASUS usually makes a good product. I now think they are using cheaper parts and half A$$ processes. I went through the whole troubleshooting process. Plugging in another monitor, new cables, another computer, everything. It isnt software related. I WON'T BE CALLING ASUS CUSTOMER SERVICE OR MAILING THEM ANYTHING! I have already read about the horrible and shifty experiences with them. I cracked that baby open myself. Loose VESA mounting plate. Loose/Ill fitting video port mounts. I can't believe it didn't rattle. It all seemed careless or rushed. Either the folks who worked on it or the machines that put it together, are malfunctioning lol. I did get it fixed, I had to do a little soldering and some screwing, but it works....PLEASE DO NOT TRY TO DO IT YOURSELF! Look for another product. As for me....i'm not putting ASUS in any of mine or my customer's computers. I just can't trust the product as much as I used to.
