I'm a highly mobile worker and it has helped me increase my productivity incredibly. I absolutely recommend this to all of my co-workers. If you benefit from dual monitors at your desk then this will make you feel at home regardless of where you are!

I absolutely love this monitor!!!!!!! I think anyone who had any issues or complains about it had a faulty one or were blind. it displays my games beautifully. I love the vibrant colors. I love the different settings you can put it on, whethere it be gaming or on theater mode. it's just awesome. I'd definetely reccomend it.
It does a great job of displaying things and making them look nice

Been using this for a while now and have no issues. It is a good size to fit on my desk; the screen is clear and the monitor is simple to mess with if you need to fix any settings. The only reason I wouldn't get this again is if I needed something in a bigger size.

review_title: Very good picture, but the stand is cheap and wobbly
review_body: I bought two of these monitors for a dual monitor system.  The picture quality is great and I have no complaints in this area at all.  In fact I think it is an awesome monitor and I am about to buy another, however there is one 'problem' that may be important to others.  The stand the monitor sits on is weak and the monitor will wobble with the slightest touch or movement of the desk or whatever it may be sitting on.  This hasn't been an issue for us as we don't have an enviroment where the shaking could happen.  If you are in a work or home environment where there may be occasional shaking of the desk, building or the monitor will need to be adjusted often I would imagine that this 'problem' would be significant.  The slightest touch and the monitor starts to wobble.  Otherwise a great buy.

review_title: Screen is good, bezel and stand not so much
review_body: The bezel and stand looks plasticity and cheap. Stand is very wobbly. Compared to my other monitors the bezel also looks very thick. The glossy plastic easily scratches. On the bright side, the panel is top quality and the picture is excellent. Colors are rich with the ips display and the 60hz shows games with no lag. It has all the video connectors dvi, hdmi, and displayport. One thing I like about this model is that it uses a standard power cable and no power brick that other monitors have.

Purchased two of these for myself and my fiancée and it's been almost a month and we both absolutely love them still. Not any notable problems and they look fantastic. Rich colors and more than acceptable contrast ratio. I play a lot of fast-paced games and it's been a dream in that regard.
Great picture, none of the issues the negative reviews had. (At least not yet)

When I first received the monitor, it had a dead pixel, which was really distracting. Thanks to Amazon's phenomenal return policy, I had a new monitor at my doorstep the very next day. I've had the monitor for almost a year now and have had no issues with it. It works great for both console and PC gaming. I would definitely recommend it for those on a budget.

When I got it I just attached the HDMI cable and it worked perfectly. I highly reccomend it.  Has plenty of screen realestate for my video production work as well.

My old monitor was a 19" 720p Gateway with a 16:10 ratio and this monitor blows it away. Not to mention I love the anti-glare, matte surface of the screen. The only weird thing I noticed is that in Minecraft there will be obvious ghosting unless you go into the monitor menu and change the Trace Free setting to 0. For all other applications I have it at 20. All in all this is an awesome monitor, I don't regret spending my money at all.

There will be no spare/standby monitor and they want me to be out of work for 20 days !! I even have a SQUARE TRADE warranty but the can't do anything till my manufactures warranty expires ! I've been buying ASUS monitors for years now, and so has our IT department at work.  This particular model continues the wonderful experiences I've had with ASUS monitors.  It looks great, seems durable (I've never had a problem with the ones I own -- even the ones that are years old) and was definitely the right price.  Moreover, when there's a rebate I have had no problems with ASUS rebates.  Would certainly buy again if needed.

review_title: Great price, good display, awful stand
review_body: It is hard to beat the price and, especially for the price, the display is great.  It also is very light weight if that is a concern.  However, the problem is the base/stand is very flimsy so that it wobbles as you type, etc. and it also keeps the monitor crooked.  It's not adjustable in any way, i.e., it doesn't tilt, pivot, or raise or lower.  I had to return it (and spend more) to get one with more solid construction and that allows me to move it up to eye level or tilt it to get a flat presentation for viewing.  It would be great as a low cost item to mount on a wall.

review_title: The monitor is useless to me at this moment
review_body: It lightweight is advantageous.  However, It does not work on any computer/laptop, which have no USP3.0.  Unfortunately all my PC, Mac and Laptop do not have USP3.0 plug.  I bought a USB 3.0 Hub powered USB splitter with 1 USB charging Port specifically for this situation. Unfortunately the additional purchasing does not solve the problem.  I do not know when I will buy a PC with USB 3.0 yet.  The monitor is useless to me at this moment, but the failure to be used for the computers which only have USB2.0 is not the fault of AOC international and The failure does not constitute the action of 'returning' the device to them.  I just swallowed the results - this is my own fault.  The manual says clearly it is USB3.0 powered.  I learned the lesson.  One thing I want to warn Amazon and all the customes. When I trying to find if I could find a converter from USB2.0 to USB3.0, I have a dozen of replies.  I guess there are a few was only for phishing.  My computers almost be hijacked. I believer that Amazon has very secure system for their website, but the "answering question' might be a "backdoor' for hackers.  Since then I received more emails which offer the answer to my questions and I delete them instantly - comparing to the possibility of being hacked, knowing the answer becomes the 2nd important.  I hope the Amazon would pay attention to this possibility.

Yes, IPS does have backlight bleed inherent, but the amount on this monitor was intolerable. In particular, a large area in the upper left hand corner was severe enough to be seen even in medium bright backgrounds let alone black. White areas were uneven along the sides with overall subpar image quality. The shinny black plastic sides and back scratch easily even when wiping with an extremely soft cloth. Trying to use a feather duster to clean creates static cling that magnetizes dust sticking. I don't expect a whole lot for the price, but this monitor was given the go back. Too bad as it is such a sharp looking unit. BTW, I also own the Acer H257HU 2k which is absolutely fantastic. Build quality is far superior with a metal base and bezel which it should be given its a 2k screen and much loftier price.

The picture is great and the monitor itself looks nice too but the other issues are not going to cut it.  I will be returning this to Amazon and think about another size.  I would like to keep the 27" size but not sure I can take the rocking...may have to go down to 24".

My workplace has this exact monitor, and I liked it enough to order one for personal use at home. The one I received, however, has a manufacturing defect in the stand. The stand is composed of two pieces: a circular base and a vertical bar, which are supposed to be joined together by an included bolt. When assembling the base and bar, however, the holes do not line up, so the bolt is unable to connect the pieces. I've attached pictures of the defect. I'm sending the monitor back to Amazon for a replacement.

I love the picture, the look and the controls.  I looked at reviews and was aware the stand only tilted and was a bit wobbly.  I needed height adjustment as this monitor sits on a low table next to my recliner and i wear progressive lens.  I got a nice weighted stand that does this and more but when I went to put it on i couldn't because the power cord is almost in the center and it interferes with the stand.  I could have done without having to make a 1/2" spacer out of plywood, purchasing an angled power cord and longer screws.  The HDMI cable just barely clears the stand as well.  i like being able to see the inputs but they really need to be moved to the side more.  i hope someone from Asus sees this and passes it on to whoever is responsible.  I didn't see any way to leave feedback on their website and I'm not on Facebook or other social sites.

This monitor has an exceptional out-of-the-box configuration. Everything seems perfect already and I have yet to make any changes to any of the settings. It is a fair bit wobbly while I'm typing, but I'm also on a not-so-sturdy desk so that could be part of the issue. The viewing angle is incredible. It DOES have a tilt up/down and of course you can turn it left/right, but it does lack a height adjustment. Docking 1 star simply because of the lack of height adjustment. Everything else is exceptional!

review_title: Great display, but won't stay on?
review_body: This is definitely the nicest monitor I've ever had, and I love it for gaming, but for some reason it goes into sleep mode after a few minutes and won't turn on if I move the mouse or press a key. I have to actually press the power button on the monitor to turn it back on, which is a little inconvenient. Maybe this is just an issue with my PC, but I felt it was worth mentioning.
Clear image, beautiful monitor, solid construction

review_title: All 3 were perfect no dead or stuck pixels
review_body: Just got my 3 monitors I ordered. All 3 were perfect no dead or stuck pixels. Nice picture colors right out of the box. It did auto adjust so I might fine tune to get a little bit better picture but to be honest I don't really need too. Auto adjust picture looks crisp, clear and colorful.  It's a really nice 24inch TN monitor. I'm glad I bought them and plan to order another one soon. Great job amazon. Great product, fast delivery and service. Thank you.

I use one on HDMI and the other on VGA. They are great for dual screening. I mainly play PC games using it. It's pretty good. I dont know much about the technology but I am satisfied.

The monitor is great, IPS is the way to go, the colors are beautiful! I have noticed many people having issues with the monitor waking up from sleep mode. This is likely due to the use of an HDMI cable. They aren't always the best for monitors. Order a DVI-D cable and switch it out. Presto, problem solved! The DVI-D won't take away from picture quality and they're cheap!
beautiful screen, no dead pixels. Best bang for the buck 1080P IPS 60Hz display, neat little stand for it too.

I was using it w IOS so PC users may have more luck with screen adjustments, but even with the downloaded software I could not make this useable and not irritating.

I've had this monitor for almost three months now. I can honestly say I'm very happy with it. When compared side-by-side with my existing 22" Apple Cinema Display, I can honestly say that it has better color, much better contrast and intensity, and overall works like a charm. It does take a bit to get the colors sorted out, the defaults are a little lacking. Makes an excellent primary display for AutoCAD, 3ds Max, and is spectacular for gaming; Tomb Raider, MW3, and Metro: Last Light all look great! It has a very nice, small footprint which enables very flexible positioning in unusual, or tight layouts.

After a disappointment with the VS228 H-P (very weird reverse ghosting issues) and the BENQ GL2450HM (a little too much inverse ghosting). I decided to buy this monitor and I must say I am extremely pleased with it, I use this for coding, docs and gaming so ghosting was a big concern for me. If you set the Trace free Setting to 60 there really isn't any noticeable ghosting at all. Although color quality/reproduction is better on the GL2540 the no ghosting made this a clear winner for me.

Bought a pair of these for everything from digital painting to coding to serious PC gaming. They are absolutely perfect. I have one hooked up as DVI, another as HDMI. They're both have sharp, high quality image with the same colour temperature on both screens. They're light to carry and look great.

review_title: Good Monitor except for stuck pixel
review_body: I'll start this review by saying this monitor is big. The 24" for home use, including gaming and hd movies, is splendid and immersive sitting a short distance away. As with any monitor however, one runs the risk of confronting a damaged pixel. At first, I believe at least as I have had bad pixels before, the monitor was in perfect condition.  After 2 weeks, a small white dot appeared in the lower center of my screen.  Dead and stuck pixels drive me crazy, but after returning so many monitors for them, I gave up on this one.  The pixel is stuck and white but on this monitor is much less noticeable than others.  So I will be keeping this, despite the annoyance I am just forcing myself to deal with.  I do not wish to go through the process of waiting for a new monitor to come in again and this monitor is good enough even with the white pixel.
Was exactly as described, shipment was prompt and satisfactory, great picture for the price

The monitor itself is outstanding with large real estate, bright display and excellent depth of contrast.  The controls make it a loser, which is a shame.  If you can deal with the controls it's for you.  I'm sending this one back.

I purchased three of these and they have been going strong for well over a year now the only complaint I have is one of the monitors colors are very washed out compared to the other two. They have all received the same amount of use but one is pretty far off. These are IPS panels 60hz but they worked for what I need.

I have to say I am very pleased with the monitor so far. It does not show any ghosting, has an even backlight and mine had no dead pixels. I am a very picky person and could not find any reason not to like this EXCEPT for the fact that the monitor wobbles side to side when you push the buttons to adjust settings or turn the monitor on/off. Other than that it is great. I won't take a star away for the wobble as it does not impact me 99% of the time (only when I change the settings which is rare).
Always love ASUS products and the company has always stood behind them for me so I will continue to buy them when I can

review_title: Great. Able to overclock to 65 mhz
review_body: Cost effective and great monitor. I've had it for a little over a year. Now that I look back maybe I would have preferred a thinner bezel, but for this price it's great. 1080p gaming. I've even overclocked it to 65 mhz. Actually does provide a noticeable difference. Can't wait for my next 144mhz monitor. Will stick with asus if they offer it.
I've had this monitor for over a year and it's still working great.  I connect it to my Macbook Pro to have a second screen to work and it works perfectly.  No complaints.

Very nice monitor for my desktop computer.  I do more music downloading and listening than videos.  However, this monitor was easy to install and does a great job with videos and the simple type games I do on the internet.  No problem at all.  Bright and clear and has lots of adjustments if you need to tweak your viewing.  Very happy with this ASUS!

This is the first monitor I have ever owned that is not a Dell Ultrasharp and also my first non IPS. My old Ultrasharp was turning yellow and getting a little burn in. This thing is the real deal and the colors pop and the response time is minimal. A little calibration and I like the way this monitor looks enough to put it in the center of my 3 monitor set up. I would have bought another Ultrasharp but i was willing to try out something new and let me tell you it was worth it. Value wise this thing is near untouchable.

The monitor itself is as described. It's wider than my previous 24-inch Samsung monitor, but that means the overall area of the screen is smaller (it's wider and shorter, my previous one is closer to a square). Otherwise it's fine, a good economical purchase.

review_title: IPS by itself is not a guarantee of a great monitor
review_body: IPS, IPS, IPS!  Yes it is a technology that is supposed to be much better than good old LCD and LED lit panels using standard technology.  But you really get what you pay for.  This IPS screen is nowhere near as good as my old (much more expensive) NEC 1990sx.  The big problem with the Asus is that is looks no better when viewing a web page than a normal LCD or LED screen.  If you move your head up and down or left and right from center you still get dimming and loss of resolution on a web page.  You get less of that with a well done ips panel of several years ago.
Has some ghosting that is visibly noticeable when gaming.

I used it directly plugged into a USB 3 plug on the notebook, and also through a USB 3.0 hub.  The constant data flow causes the hub to run hot, but no performance change on the screen vs plugged into the notebook.  I even watched a lot of video on it with no problems.

So if somebody else wants to see the screen from different angle - you can not turn the screen itself but only with the base. My previous monitor had a very solid base and it was more convenient.

review_title: Works just as good as the previous
review_body: I bought one of these monitors as my first monitor back when I made my build around October of 2012, and it has not given me any problems at all. No dead pixels, no lagging, nothing. Asus delivered, and I'm quite satisfied.

I've enjoyed the monitor thus far I've had it, I'm glad it came with a DVI-D cable so I could use it in a dual monitor setup. HDMI cable was not a complaint for me as I have millions sitting around my house.
The monitor picture is great, the stands feel pretty solid (albeit incredibly simple).

review_title: Good gaming monitor, one pixel was out upon arrival.
review_body: The monitor is perfect for gaming.  When playing, the input lag is virtually nothing.  It was much better than monitors and TV's I have used in the past. The only issue I have is that when I received the monitor there was a pixel out on the bottom right quadrant of the screen. It's only noticeable when the screen is black so it doesn't bother me enough to return it.  If I received  the monitor without the pixel being out I would rate it a 5 out of 5.  I just got it last week and it's definitely a little disappointing.
Just the right size, and very good quality.

Let me start out by saying I love Asus. Their motherboards are top of class in my book, and their video cards though pricey are also top quality. That said, I'm a bit disappointed with this monitor. Out of the box, the standard settings require A LOT of tweaking. There are a multitude of settings, but as other reviewers have found it is a bit of a struggle finding the sweet spot for yourself. I use a dual monitor setup, with the second monitor being the 17 inch monitor on my gaming laptop. I had one heckuva time getting the color settings to match between the two.

Bright, crisp, with colors that pop.  I find reading text on this display to be significantly easier on the eyes than my previous display and my display at work.  I write a lot of code, so using this thing has been a wonderful development for me.  I don't do much gaming, but StarCraft II and Deus Ex both look great on this display; no discernible latency issues.  I have since purchased one for my dad and a second one for myself.  The only reason I docked a star is because the connection ports stick straight out, instead of down; this makes it impossible to flush mount on the wall without some L-adapters.  Would give it 4.5 stars if I could.

review_title: It pretty much just replays Frozen a dozen times a day ...
review_body: Got this tv for the kids room. It pretty much just replays Frozen a dozen times a day in the background but the picture is great and I haven't had any issues. Plus the price was nice.
For the price this monitor simply can't be beat. It took some time to adjust the screen to match the color output of my macs monitor but it looks great.

If the anti-glare coating doesn't bother you this monitor produces a great picture.  I did some calibrating on it because I didn't like the color, black level and brightness out of the box.  My only other complaint is the placement of the headphone jack on back instead of the side.  I don't use it much so that's not a deal breaker for me.  If you want sound out of it though be sure to purchase a HDMI cable.  I got mine on Amazon Blue Rigger, I think, and they work great.

I used the ATI Catalust Control Center to scale the image so that it reaches the edges of the screen.  That removes the thick black borde but text seems oddly distorted.  I'm returning the monitor.  It was cheap but even it were free I'd not use it.

This new one broke silently inside my bag after traveling with it twice. It's a nice looking monitor, but the insides cracked at some point and the liquid in the montior now moves around freely. I rode on an Amtrak train on both of my trips and I don't know what contact actually broke the monitor, but I'm definitely not rough with my laptop case, and everything else in the case was undamaged. This was a complete waste of money and I would have rather had the old USB 2.0 version with a slightly more durable build. I would not advise buying this monitor if you plan on traveling with it.

That worked for about 2 weeks. Now, it is now just a unusable piece of junk sitting on my home office table. I originally bought this because at my job I move around from room to room a lot and having two screens ins a luxury. Partly because people steal monitors from rooms frequently. Two screens for my job is almost mandatory. Luckily I've been moved into another building and have one of my own that is bolted to my station. review_title: The picture is clear and perfect for our business
review_body: I have purchased over 20 of these monitors for my office over the last 2 years.  My employees have dual monitors at their stations, and the large dual screens allow them to run several programs at once for more efficiency.  The picture is clear and perfect for our business.  We do not do any graphic design or video editing, so I wouldn't know if these monitors meet the requirements for that profession.  However, for general office work and sales, these are perfect.  I also like the fact that they have built in speakers for general use.

Don't get my wrong, I've seen better screens but I needed a quick and dirty 22" for my wife to use with her Surface tablet when she's at home.  The contrast ratio doesn't seem as high as advertised and I struggled a bit with finding a good contrast/brightness balance.  The viewing angle seems to affect the perceived brightness greatly.  Response times are top notch and the build quality is excellent.  Just for those who might be wondering, the base has very little adjustment at all so if you're going to be picky about the placement, get another screen.  Colors looks great.

I love this monitor. It's been working for about two years now and is fantastic as well as cost effective. Highly recommend for any normal buyer as 4k is an early adopter gimmick with laughable mainstream support.
I have one previouse to purchaing the one from Amazon. And that one is perfect.

I bought this monitor 6 months ago and it suddenly went black last week. I sent it in for warranty [using an exorbitant amount of bubble wrap to ensure no damage in transit] and was informed that the monitor has an "internal cracked screen". I was then told that it was considered to be consumer damage and not covered under warranty. It has literally only sat on my desk. I have no idea how that could happen as I do not move it, I do not tilt it, it's barely ever touched! Acer then told me that they can do the repair... for $80 dollars! I did not pay much more than that originally! Our office will be buying new non-Acer monitors from now on.

The bottom edge is only three inches off the desk and it can only pivot forward or backwards. This is advertised as "zero-frame" but there is still a black border along all edges of the screen. It might be that they couldn't make the display go all the way to the edges, so they made the frame smaller and called it "zero-frame" as that is technically true.

If I wish to turn on the monitor I have to hold on to the bezel with my thumb and middle finger or else I'll lift the monitor from the desk and I won't be able to press the power button enough to turn it on. review_title: Not for use through USB hub
review_body: The monitor lives up to the review others have posted about it - great size, easy setup, decent color, good value for the money. However, it will only work when plugged directly into my computer's USB port - it will not work when plugged into a USB hub (which is then plugged into the computer's USB port). The electronic store guy said it can't access the drivers when it's plugged into a USB hub. For me, this is a deal breaker - I'm working on a Surface Pro 3 (which has only 1 USB port. Welcome to the future?) and I need to connect an external USB drawing tablet to the computer as well. This was the perfect storm requiring me to return the monitor, and I hope to save someone else my trial and error. Cheers.

review_title: Excellent choice for an HDMI monitor.
review_body: We purchased this monitor to use with a Q-See QS558-852-1 8 Channel Full D1 Security Surveillance DVR System (which was very disappointing; see my review of that product for details). The DVR has no DVI connector, only VGA and HDMI, so we needed a monitor with an HDMI input. As with most LCD monitors these days, setup was effortless. The display is bright and sharp, and the unit's menu offers a variety of options to fine tune the picture. The 22" display is great for viewing all eight channels of our security system simultaneously, though you'd want to go bigger if you had a twelve or sixteen camera setup. The VS228H-P is glossy black and minimalist in design, so it conveys exactly the professional appearance we want in our office. If you're looking for an HDMI monitor, try this one; I think you'll be pleased.
Nice picture. No bad pixels. Good price. I wish it were adjustable up and down, but at this price, that is asking for a lot.

At first this monitor was fantastic. It filled the void for a primary monitor in a dual monitor setup. But in the space of around a few weeks I had some problems. The colors are fantastic and if you have a ton of money you can probably afford this monitor every month or so. It was fantastic for gaming and everyday use until a dead pixel in the middle of the screen ruined the fun. After all attempts of fixing it failed, I have finally decided to send it back. Great monitor but I guess I just got unlucky. Later more dead pixels cropped up and made it apparent that it was only good for a month or so.

review_title: Best monitor at this price range
review_body: Oh I love this. I was doing quite a lot of research on amazon and other sites to choose the best affordable 24 inch LED monitor and after all that research, finally bought this monitor and I am very happy with my decision. By far this is best 24 inch LED monitor with HDMI port at this price range that I have found. It is a nice monitor with excellent display. I use this monitor for my software development and thoroughly enjoy working for hours together. I would recommend this.

review_title: If you need a monitor to play a video game console, this is a good choice.
review_body: Works great! I bought this so I could play my console games at my PC desk, and it displays the normal PC mode beautifully and my console games look great. I have only one complaint, there is a small black dead pixel at the top of the screen. This isn't too much of a problem for me, as my tool bar is black and covers it up, but it's still disappointing that it's there.
good quality picture and has very little screen distortion

review_title: Couldn't be happier. Do note that the monitor only accepts 1 ...
review_body: These are absolutely gorgeous, light weight, functional monitors. They do what you'd expect, at a fraction of the price of some competitors. Bought 2 of them, and plan to purchase a third immediately. Couldn't be happier.
Same yellow tint problem & over-saturation even after hours of adjusting.

review_title: A very good screen. Would recommend it to other people
review_body: A very good screen.  Would recommend it to other people.
Quite border less (7-8mm, 0.3inch) has brillant colours, a good set of port (HDMI, VGA, DVI).

The 23.8 inch Acer R240HY is an excellent value monitor for the visuals it provides. Using these as multiple monitor set-up is by a far a great way to enhance the aesthetics of your in home office. The thin bezels and crisp clear colors are what makes this monitor amazing considering the fact it is only 1080P as well. Overall, it provides a feeling of simplicity for a great price for $135 at the time of purchase. So if you are looking to replace some old monitors, this would be a definite recommendation for all that this monitor offers for a great price.

review_title: this display is beautiful. It's very elegant to work with such a ...
review_body: I just got this monitor to add to my H236HL BID double monitor setup. I wanted an additional monitor to compare image development and get a variety of views for comparison. Even on VGA standard connection, this display is beautiful. It's very elegant to work with such a thin border and I believe it is one of the thinnest models you can obtain (of quality) for the price. The back shell is glossy, which I would have preferred if they designed it with a matte finish instead, but that's my only minor comment. Some of you have inquired about the very minor light bleeding. And that's exactly right - it is very minor and only apparent when the screen is on a dark standby or when you are viewing an entire black background. As light spectrum is added, this becomes unnoticeable. The other contender I considered, was the AOC i2367fh, which is an elegant monitor. But functionality wise, and while also trying to maintain an overall familiar design in my workspace - the R240hy wins, without sacrificing any quality. Again, images and vibrance is beautiful and zero gloss or distortion from any angle. You'll easily spend hours, just testing hd images on this thing : ) Enjoy!
decent monitor. I am so satisfied.
Except for a dead pixel on the upper left corner (not very noticeable), the screen is pretty good.
Great monitor for the price. Not quite as vivid as my main monitor, but it performs just fine.

The response time is fast however my BF3 game looks terrible. The colors are horrible and the game details look rough and too bright. I tried turning the brightness down in-game and on the monitor but then my view distance is reduced. I upgraded from a 7 year old Samsung 206bw 2ms 20 inch that gave crisp, fast and vivid graphics. I thought maybe it was because my video card (GTX470) was working too hard pushing two monitors, but even after running only one the results were the same. The ASUS monitor shell is really thin and cheap compared to the Samsung’s. I might return them, or give them to the kids as an upgrade for their CRT monitors lol, but first I’ll try a new video card and see if that helps.

review_title: Great monitor! I have owned one for 14 months ...
review_body: Great monitor! I have owned one for 14 months and love the quality and performance. I ordered another for a dual screen setup and after calibration it matches flawlessly.

This is a very nice monitor.  It's colors are way better than the HP 4 year old 2408 that I have.  I was going to use my old monitor  with the new HP computer that I got but after I saw the way this one performed I changed my mind.  It has three switchable input modes: VGA, DVI, and HDMI. As long as this monitor holds up, I'll be very happy.

Excellent product so far. I ordered this monitor because it has all the features I was looking for at only $135. The ASUS VS228H-P has an HDMI connection, full 1080p, and in a thin, attractive 22" style. As of this review, there haven't been any issues with it, the blacks are consistent, and colors are beautiful. Works very nicely with Blu-ray drives ,or other HD content. Games look fantastic with a high response rate. The menu is basic, but I use my computer's software for color correction. The monitor is extremely light, maybe too light for the stand, however I've noticed once you put it into place it is fairly stable as long as you're not constantly fidgeting with it. Definitely consider this option.

There is a manual included which is describing almost everything except the most important thing which is how to put the monitor together with the stand. We will see how long it is going to last. Really disappointed, though it was a TN panel. Hope I can get a refund. Otherwise, It's a great monitor. Good color, very adjustable, great viewing angle.

review_title: Forget the Rebate, Forget Asus - UPDATE
review_body: The monitor is ok but the rebate offer is a scam.  I bought two of these monitors because I needed two new ones.  I was very careful to fill out the documentation and include everything required.  I submitted well within the time frame.  I just received two rejections by email saying that I didn't include the UPC code.  What I cut off the box was labeled as the UPC code.  I saw other reviews that said they were rejected as well.  What a bunch of bull for a company to say they offer a rebate and then blatantly scam you just to buy their product.  This will be the last Asus product that I will ever purchase.

review_title: They looked great. Getting the screens to look identical was a ...
review_body: I didn't have any issues with the monitors at all. They looked great. Getting the screens to look identical was a it of a chore, as it is now, they are slightly off, but only really noticeable if you are looking for the slight variance. I use the MSI Gaming app to toggle between gaming mode and other other modes that the video card offers and they respond perfectly well for my needs. It is nice to have matching monitor sizes and resolutions. It has really cut back on the eye strain and headaches I used to get with my two mismatched monitors and resolutions.

Light bleed is a little higher than the Samsung and while it’s not unacceptable its approaching it.  The monitor doesn’t seem to auto-off but I need to double check that.  With all this said performance is about the same as the highly rated Samsung which is most important so 3 stars it is.

Both with a HDMI cord and VGA cable (not at the same time obviously) , the screen flicks to a black screen at the slight touch/bump, then comes back to the normal screen after a few seconds. I have no idea why this is happening - all cables are working fine and they are snugly fit into the ports. Starting to question this monitor. Other than that, it has been awesome.

review_title: You get what you pay for -- didn't last 2 months.
review_body: Bought this item from Amazon and it was delivered on February 20, 2017.  Installed it shortly after that for an office desk. We paired it with a MacBook Pro and Logitech bluetooth keyboard for a pretty nice setup.  Few weeks later, the monitor started acting up.  Occasionally it would show a black screen or a static screen for a few seconds, then return to normal.  We thought it was a glitch that could be fixed by resetting the monitor to factory settings, or trying a different computer.  Neither solution worked and the issues got more frequent over the next few weeks.  It got to the point where the issue was happening several times daily, and the black or static screen was showing for several seconds at a time.  Incredibly disruptive and not acceptable, but we were outside the 30-day return window for Amazon so reached out to ASUS for support.

review_title: Very good quality monitor for the price
review_body: I purchased mine in late Dec. 2012.  No missing pixels or other observable problems.  Screen quality is very good for my varied uses, but probably not perfect for someone involved in high-tech graphics like photo or video editing.  I added it as a second monitor to a more expensive Dell monitor that I already had, and I've switched them around, so that the new Asus is now my main monitor and the Dell is my secondary one.

I bought two of these monitors.  I tested both and only found one dead pixel between the two which is pretty good.  The pixel is dead not stuck so there is no recovering it.  I tried several things.  So far I like these monitors.  I don't think they are a match for traditional 16:10 monitors running 1920x1200.  When I got them I performed some very basic adjustments on them.  I feel like the adjustment menu could be slightly easier to use.  Like most TVs these monitors had the brightness turned all the way up which was apparent next to my 24" dell.  These monitors are extremely light weigh, so light that when adjusting them they move.  If used as a secondary monitor these are great just realize that they aren't 16:10 monitors so they are really more cheap HD TVs than traditional PC monitor.
My old computer monitor began to flicker and I decided to replace it. It took 2 days of research to decide what to buy.

It wasn't all that long ago that a monitor of this quality would have cost five hundred bucks. In fact that's what I paid a few years ago for one with less capability. My only complaint is that it would have been nice if they had incorporated a few USB ports in the monitor like my Gateway 24 incher does. Still and all a good buy.

Everything on the web is brighter, crisper, and more colorful, and the same for DVDs. Online gaming is like playing new games because of the color and detail I can see. The matte finish on the screen works well in my bright room, the glossy border is no problem. It is easy to set up and adjust. Don't worry about the stand. I know this monitor might not compare with one that costs $500, but. A smart buy.

I was debating between a high end led monitor and an IPS monitor cause i game all the time and the MS response time on most ISP monitors is horrible it just go's with the type of monitor it is but when i seen this one and the 4 MS response time i decided it was time to just bite the bullet and buy it VERY glad i did at first it was really bad display too dark a lot of tearing and stuttering in the image but it was not the monitor its self it was my poor 1.2 or 1.4 HDMI cable i was using so i upgraded to a 2.0 cable man that fixed EVERYTHING and it's cut down on the tearing and stuttering its going to happen regardless but do yourself a favor get an HDMI 2.0 cable even though its not a 2.0 port it needs it it can not be restricted in its data flow to your pc and my gaming is super smooth and very detailed and the color its really deep get this monitor you will not be disappointed i am not it was so good i got one for my wife too with an 2.0 hdmi cable and she is very happy as well

review_title: I recently returned an ASUS "frameless" monitor due to poor image quality
review_body: Really liking this monitor so far. I recently returned an ASUS "frameless" monitor due to poor image quality. The ACER R240HY was significantly cheaper and much better image quality. The R240HY doesn't have speakers built in but does have a headphone jack, I'm guessing for audio passthrough from the HDMI cable. I don't use this feature others might though. Playing with some of the settings I noticed something called "OD" , enabling this setting had a really bad impact on video playback, I almost packed the monitor back up to be returned but turning this setting off immediately restored excellent video quality. I downloaded and looked through the manual but found nothing explaining what this setting does, as far as I can tell there is no benefit to having it on at all. It only comes with a VGA cable which is pretty sad but unfortunately kind of normal, why, I don't understand, but the price of this monitor makes it much easier to add a HDMI cable to your order.The frame on this monitor is very slim and the screen is a nice matte that doesn't reflect any light that I can see at all. Very happy so far. I'm not a gamer really so I can't comment on how this monitor performs with games, it says it has a 4ms response time for the in-panel switching so it should be fast enough and not ghost too bad but maybe someone else can comment definitively on gaming with this.

review_title: Great quality IPS screen for the price
review_body: I got the 24inch IPS 1080p model. Very happy with this purchase, really great deal for this quality screen. No dead pixels although there is some minor backlight bleeding but not enough for me to bother trying to exchange it. I spent a while calibrating it but it was pretty good out of the box. I wish it was VESA compatible but the included stand is fine. It doesn't tilt or raise/lower so I got a small stand to raise it up. The ports are easily accessible and all point out at a perpendicular angle so you don't have to blindly feel around for them which is nice. I really like the super thin bezel around the sides and top. Some other 'bezel-less' monitors in this price range have a big gap between the physical bezel and where the image actually starts but this one is only a couple millimeters at worst. Definitely recommend.

I play a lot of FPS like CoD and BF so having a low response time is key and ASUS nailed it here!  I'd recommend this sucker if you aren't looking to break the bank but still get a quality item.  The menu is pretty easy to get use to after you mess with it for a bit, as well as the other settings you can adjust.  I'm considering buying another!!

I originally bought one a couple years back when I built my PC and couldn't fit a more expensive monitor in the budget (bought the first one for ~$120 after rebate). For the price back then I thought I got a really good deal. Accurate colors, good size, fast response time, and overall build quality (except the glossy scratch magnet that is the front bezel and base). Jump forward to last month and similar situation - I built another computer for someone and they needed an inexpensive monitor for it. We ordered this one again and put both side by side to compare. The screens looked identical (sometimes an issue when getting the same monitors at different times). Seeing how it's still a good monitor after years (and dropped in price), I'm tempted to get myself another one for a dual monitor setup (1440p and up monitors are still overpriced in my opinion). Also, we both use it primarily for gaming.

review_title: You find no better monitor in the price range!
review_body: Hands down amazing.  Pro's: Everything.  Cons: Nothing. One of the two purchased had a scratch in the screen, but Amazon is replacing.  Unfortunately things happen and you get a funky situation.  I can't knock a star down because of that though.  The picture is great, the low response time makes it a pretty darn good gaming monitor too!  Honestly, I really couldn't be more ecstatic about this product.  Way to go ASUS.  I can't imagine what the higher end models look like.

review_title: Great picture, display can't become very dim.
review_body: This monitor is great, the picture is really sharp and vibrant, the matte screen reduces glare, and the response time makes the image very smooth, especially when gaming. The display is very bright, however it can't become very dim, and if you're playing in a dark room, it is kind of annoying. You can turn the contrast down to dim the image further, and this doesn't seem to negatively impact the image, but it's an extra step and so kind of an annoyance. Definitely recommended though!

I love ASUS products (I own many - motherboard, this monitor, AC66U router, dual video cards) and I bought this to replace my other ASUS monitor that my cousin's kid broke - it involved a very large workout ball. It's even more crisp than my previous ASUS monitor and I didn't need to adjust it for movies, games (mostly Sims 3), or day to day browsing.

If you are prone to accidents like me, go ahead and invest in something more sturdily built.  The USB chord that comes with this monitor is not very long, and apparently the screen is about as durable as a piece of tissue paper.  So, long story short, the first time I used the monitor, I accidentally pulled the monitor off the coffee table and it took a tumble; now half the pixels are disabled and the screen is useless.  It only fell about a foot and a half, mind you, and it didn't look like it hit very hard.  So do yourself a favor: save a hundred dollars and buy something else.

This is a good monitor. Menu seems intuitive, One tiny quirk, it does not autoswitch inputs, but switching inputs is painless with the button on the monitor that's easy to operate. My setup is 2 monitors 1920x1080 connected to my laptop. One of the monitors is the ASUS and I have an Acer monitor that work well together.

This was a real good deal when I purchased it from amazon, though prices for monitors this size came down shortly after I made this purchase. That being said, I still really like this monitor, no dead pixels, colors are vibrant, and screen is very bright. Only minor downside is that it could wobble a bit if your desk shakes a little, but it's actually something I don't really notice at this point. I've owned this for a month at the time of this writing and I'm a happy customer. Good job Asus!

review_title: Would not recommend for gaming at all.
review_body: For starters, the monitor was great to for everything that a normal person would use it for like watching YouTube and surfing the internet. The problem started to come when i was playing world of Warcraft. When i would move my character in the game everything around me would get a really bad black outline and i have never had that problem before. So i configured my settings around on my game (everything is on ultra high) and i could not get the problem to go away. I only caught it because i have two monitors and the other one does not do it. Also when the monitor is on the gaming setting the screen turns everything into a really had shade of yellow.

This is the 21 inch monitor everyone should have. The color range is much better then other monitors since it is an IPS. You can see so much more detail in the highlights and darks than a none IPS monitor. This added detail also makes it easier to read text. It runs very cool, the stand is sturdy but thin.  The monitor updates very quickly, and I have never noticed any ghosting. There is a bit of glow form the bottom of the screen when the monitor is completely dark, you may never notice it with normal usage.

review_title: Very good. This was my first good monitor
review_body: Very good. This was my first good monitor. Although it has a 5ms response time you really can't tell the difference from 5 to 1 ms. I say this because my friend had a asus monitor just like this but a little more expensive therefore had a 1 ms response time and a few other small improvements. But anyways we could not tell much of a difference between the two. For the price this is a steal. I play ps4 and pc games on this and it works perfectly. Highly recommend. Shipping was fast and careful arriving in perfect condition.

So I will be returning this monitor.

review_title: You Can't Go Wrong with this One
review_body: I think you will be happy  with this monitor. My second purchase of this monitor. Very pleased with it and it blows some of the other monitors I have away. I own and buy quite a few monitors, and this is my favorite when you consider the bang for the price. I have this one in a dual display with one I bought a year or so ago, and they match nicely.

This monitor is above average, no speakers, but you're better off buying aftermarket. The screen resolution is great, as well as the feel of quality.  The only negative is the instructions on how to adjust the screen adjustments, you'll have to resort to trial & error. I tried reading the instructions, poorly written, there should be a Youtube how-to on this.

I have no faults with the picture, brightness and colors. I think it's great. The stand is a bit wobbly, but as I have it on a solid table and don't bump into it, it stays rock steady most of the time. If you do bump it, the wobbling is a bit disconcerting, but just for a second or so. I consider it a minor flaw and only mention it as so many other reviews have.

I have only had this monitor for a few weeks. It replaced my old 21inch Insignia. So far, so good! The picture is great and it arrived ahead of schedule with no dead pixels or issues whatsoever. Comes with two HDMI and one DisplayPort inputs, which is great. I have my PC and my PS3 hooked up to this huge monitor. As other reviewers have stated the base is slightly wobbly hence my 4 star rating. A monitor this nice and expensive should have a more stable stand. review_title: Good gaming monitor for a low price.
review_body: All in all I think you'll be hard pressed to find a better gaming monitor for such a low price, but there are definitely a few things to be aware of with this monitor. First, it seriously needs a break in period, it takes several days of use for the monitor to really come alive. I don't think I've ever had a monitor that looked so much better after it's break-in. Before break in I was about to return the monitor, colors were very washed out, the edges of the display were sort of foggy and the monitor had a lot of ghosting. I fiddled with setting and got it to a point that was reasonable but I was far from impressed. Still I didn't have time to return it right then and figured I'd give it a little more time. after a few days, with only a few hours use per day, the monitor started to become more what I had expected. The ghosting stopped, the colors warmed up and the darks got a lot better. There is still a little bit of that fogginess around the edges but it's minimal and I only notice it if I look for it. The darks on the monitor are still fairly washed out but it isn't terrible. Where this monitor shines is the quick response time and complete lack of input lag. the screen in general just looks to be much more clear than my previous one as well. If you aren't too picky and want a good gaming monitor this one is worth a try. Make sure to let it break in before you judge it though. And on amazon, if you decide you don't like it you can just send it right back!

This thing was a absolute deal to pick up. Delivered a day early and the best looking screen in all the monitors i have sitting around the house. I was using a 21.5 inch dell something or another monitor which this just blows right out of the water. The colors are very rich. As others have noted the blacks are not 'true black' but they very rich. Text is very easy to read and FPS games like BL2 and Crysis 3 work like a charm.
