I recently bought this for my gaming pc. As far as the design, I really like it. I is extremely thin. As for gaming, it is pretty good. The response time is more than enough for most games, and I have never noticed any ghosting. The one thing that I have noticed is pixels. If you are not using this for gaming then this should be perfect. If you are using this for gaming then you will notice some pixels, but not to the point where it makes the game look bad. The one thing that fooled me with this monitor is the bezel. There is a bezel but it is not too big. On the picture it looks smaller. My conclusion is that this is a great choice for non-competitive gamers.
Works well.
Beautiful quality!!!
Excellent!
This is the one.
Great display, Light weight, easy to use. However one trip through the air port the screen was shattered. Needs better protection like the HP version.
if only the screen was not glossy and it was in a matte finish option...it would be a five.

Very cool monitor, a little dim, since it's USB powered, but fine as long as I used it in a well-lit area. SUPER-convenient to not mess with a power cord. Unfortunately, it worked great for a month, then the cable port went bad. Every time the cord would jiggle, the whole thing would blink off for a few seconds, then come back on. Too late for Amazon return, but looking into warranty. Bummer.
Fine
Love it
Easy set up. quality and weight/size are exceptional for the price.
A great product
This are wondeful screens! We love them!!
Plug it in. It works! Fits in my computer back pack and is with me, ready to help me teach going from classroom to classroom.

DOES NOT WORK WITH CHROMEBOOK which is what I needed it for but that isn't a reason to leave a bad review because it is a great monitor that will work for most. Likely will buy it if I ever need it for my work laptop.
Excellent monitor for a great price.  I highly recommend this monitor.  I watch movies on it  as well and the picture is very sharp.
perfect monitor other then it flickers when i leave netflix or amazon video
Bought this for laptop/desktop use.
Fantastic monitor for the price

review_title: ... of these monitors about a month ago and I love them. They were extremely affordable and the quality ...
review_body: Bought 2 of these monitors about a month ago and I love them. They were extremely affordable and the quality really surprised me for the price. Giving four stars because viewing angles aren't super great, but as long as you're looking to it close to head on there won't be any dissapointment.

review_title: Audio jack is not working with any head phone. ...
review_body: Audio jack is not working with any head phone. Screen turns green for every 30 min no matter either with VGA or HDMI and need to restart the computer and without touching HDMI or VGA cable it comes to normal and 30 min later same Eastman color. I very unhappy with this product.

review_title: Great e-IPS Monitor for the money.  HDMI takes tweaking but it is not the monitor's fault.
review_body: PROs:

review_title: 7 months after purchase, this monitor lost the ability ...
review_body: 7 months after purchase, this monitor lost the ability to display VGA, DVI and HDMI video; the only thing that it would display was the ASUS logo proclaiming "perfection" after one turned the monitor on. Even the "menu" button ceased to function.

review_title: Great Monitor at a Great Price
review_body: This is an excellent 24" Monitor for a low cost. I expecially like it for gaming and watching netflix, hulu and YouTube. I also like that this screen in non-glare. The only down side is the viewing angles are not that good but for the price it's not an issue for me.

review_title: I have bought two and would consider agian.
review_body: I own two of these and they work well. No complaints with them. I've seen sharper pictures but the price is right. Matte screen helps in my room with window glare. I think if you are after a very crisp detailed picture you may want to look around.

review_title: The main problem is that the menu/buttons are rather poor: it's easy to press the power button instead ...
review_body: Viewing angles are ok. Colors are ok for the price. The main problem is that the menu/buttons are rather poor: it's easy to press the power button instead of the rightmost menu button because they're spaced very closely and shaped identically. It has no clear way of saving settings and there seem to be a few bugs with the color temperature between different settings.

Thee monitors are great. Bought a pait that are perfectly color matched. Great brightness and color. The anti glare is perfect as well. Response time is good enough for gaming and color reproduction is good enough for graphic production. Build quality is great. Unbeatable for the price.
Nice

Its an ok monitor, theres no Display port connector so that's a bummer along with is glaring back light bleed, but for this price you can get an LG ultra wide, definitely give it a look because if it would have been available at the time I would have gotten it instead.

review_title: The monitor came fine on time and in good condition
review_body: The monitor came fine on time and in good condition.  The monitor is suppose to be HD and can't get it to work properly.  Spent a good hour with Acer technician and they did not know their products and was of no help at all.  I can't return it because I'm a week late.  I was waiting for my son to come visit from out of state and he deals with computers for his business and could not make it work correct as well.  He was also on the phone with Acer, still no help.

For the price, I guess it's an ok monitor. I've had nothing but problems with it, though. Acer has an option called "Overdrive" and every time the monitor is turned on, it automatically turns on the Overdrive setting, which results in terrible ghosting. Even when I go to the menu to turn it back off, I still get bad ghosting. Overall image quality is good, but not with moving images (movies,games,etc)

review_title: Missing necessary cords but works fine....
review_body: Needed a monitor for my new gaming computer. Works wonderful. Crystal clear and game fine with it. Only problem was that it didn't come with all the cords I needed but luckily I had a HDMI lying about that I used. That is why only 3 stars.
Bought it for my son's dorm, he likes it and has had no issues with any light bleeding or anything and he tends to whine about stuff so it must be pretty good.

review_title: 27" Model R271 Does not have speakers!
review_body: No Audio on the R271 Model 27" and the Description on the page wasn't clear on if it had audio or not I guess I should have read more before ordering But I just figured  $200 monitor would have at least a 50 cent speaker.
This is a great portable monitor. Easy to use and it comes with a protective case.

review_title: Good monitor only due to the lack of alternatives
review_body: Usage period: Above a year

Pretty "bulky" for my taste, overall design is okay.  Not slim like I've seen others, the built in stand looks like it works out if used.  Needs two USBs to run it, and won't work out of the box for macOS's

Don't expect to play videos or games on it, that was very disappointing to figure out. Otherwise it works for documents and other light use, once you install the drivers (windows update automatically does it for you when you run it, I would recommend that rather than searching for drivers yourself).
Awesome!
some damage on the lcd panel
So easy to use and great resolution.  I would recommend this monitor to anyone who has a need to some portability.
Great monitor, incredibly useful. It would be better if it came in a higher resolution than just 1366x768 but I'm happy with it nonetheless.

it got knocked off a table one time from about 2 feet onto carpet and no longer works, so i consider it pretty flimsy for what is supposed to be a piece of equipment that is supposed to be portable.  disappointed because i was liking it when it worked, except that the connection cord was a little awkwardly placed.
Every business traveler Needs this portable monitor! Anyone who ever gets frustrated off of working with one screen does not have to be anymore.
I bought this monitor years ago, and use it every single day.  Nothing about it disappoints.  I have two of them for a dual setup, using them to work in Pro Tools.

review_title: Good color and contrast, weird visual artifacts
review_body: This monitor is sufficient for everyday needs, but I wouldn't recommend it for videophiles or photo/video editing.
As described works great

Bought this a couple years ago, and its still a gorgeous monitor. Looks great gamingx programming, or watching a movie. Also durable, having survived several house moves and getting slung around between desks.

Absolutely enjoy the larger size of the monitor. I had bought this when Asus was giving out a 40 dollar rebate. Worth every penny. I use as an additional monitor to my laptop, and it suits my programming and movie watching habits quite well. In terms of color and monitor resolution, I have no problems watching HD movies.

review_title: The only monitor(s) I will ever use! They're the ...
review_body: The only monitor(s) I will ever use! They're the EVO monitors and 24" is ample amount of space for whatever you're gonna be doing online. I'm in the process of saving up to purchase a third monitor for a full set up (I'm at 2 right now!). Buy it, you won't regret it!

review_title: Great monitor, you will NOT be disappointed
review_body: I've held out writing a review until I have used this monitor for a decent length of time. Well, it's been about 10 months and I can say with confidence that this is one of the best monitors in its class that I have seen and used. The colors are vibrant, the  quality is excellent, the build is fairly solid, if you can live with a glossy bezel. When I first put it on my desk, I was worried about the sturdiness of the stand, as it appeared to be a bit wobbly, but it never caused any problems for me. Buy and enjoy it.
I would have never upgraded if my laptop screen hadn't failed . Now I can't imagine working without a standalone monitor.

review_title: This is perfect and a great form factor !
review_body: Lightweight monitor. It's great for traveling and bringing it with you. Perfect size for portability. I will be taking this with me instead of my Dell monitors that cost more haha! Love it !

review_title: Power source/connection failed after less than 6 uses
review_body: I've used the monitor maybe five times?? When I took it out of the box to use it today, it wouldn't turn on. The plug won't even go all the way in? It feels really cheap. I've emailed amazon to ask for a refund. Waiting to hear back.

For some reason, both of my screens seem to lag? I'm using an HDMI - DisplayPort cable on my GTX980. Had no problems with my previous monitor, but now I'm getting some lag when I move a window on a screen displaying like a video.

EXCELLENT monitor! At least for me. It's light, beautiful and most importantly not expensive. The shipment is fast and for now it works properly. I also tried it with L4D and i think 4ms response time is enough foe most pc games and players. BTW it provides only VGA cable, if you want to hdmi, like me, you need to prepare it yourself.
I believe I got a refurbished one. Although I paid for a new one.

review_title: Doesn't deserve all those glowing reviews
review_body: There are no assembly or quick start instructions that come with the monitor so you have to figure out the basics of assembling the stand and hooking up the monitor on your own.  Out of the box, the display is blinding, retina-searingly bright.  I'm not exaggerating--there was ghosting of the image from the monitor still in my eyes when I closed them.  The six(!) unlabeled buttons under the monitor are not intuitive (except for the power button, which is logically the one on the outside) and even after downloading and reading the instruction manual it took me about 10 minutes to figure out how to navigate the button/menu combination so I could turn down the brightness.

review_title: Perfectly adequate monitor for the money
review_body: Easy to set up.  Plenty of adjustment options.  Didn't get the spectacular colors that an IS purported to provide, but plenty good enough.  Do not like where on-off button is placed.  Hard to turn off and on with one hand.

review_title: Garbage -- display failed after less than 1 month of use
review_body: The display failed after less than 1 month of use. The backlight lights up, but I get no picture... no splash screen on startup, no display menus, nothing. I've checked the power supply output, I've tried every input, and multiple cables... but nothing works. Now I've got to go through some crap return process and (like an idiot) didn't save the original box... so who knows how that will go. I'll update if/when Acer responds.

The screen itself is very good; looks sleek, has all the resolution and other optical specifications that I need, and I noticed no defects that some of the other people commented about. The reason I gave this product one star is that the base for the screen (the one pictured that comes with it) was NOT sturdy. My screen fell off it when my desk tilted about 10 degrees (very small) and it landed on my keyboard and is now broken. Apparently most of the bases have a better locking mechanism than mine, however, Acer would not refund my product (even partially) based on the fact that they haven't gotten complaints from other people about the base not locking. I would not recommend this product based on that long, drawn out negative customer experience alone, without even taking into account I am now out $130 for a screen I only used for 3 months before it broke. My product was under warranty but damage is not covered.
Bought this some time ago and it is working great.  The blue light filter technology is an eye saver over our previous monitors that did not have it.  Less eye strain.

Nice monitor, but it only comes with a VGA cable; there was no HDMI cable, meaning I needed a trip to the store before I could actually use it with my laptop.  I probably should have read the detailed specs more closely to have known to order one with the monitor

review_title: If there is a problem, you will need to return he rather then have it repaired
review_body: I bought two monitors. One had and shaking picture. I contacted the manufacturer and they told me it would take five weeks to have it repaired. I returned it to Amazo and got a replacement in 48 hours.
Excellent product.

review_title: It works , once you get it to sync, some days dont feel like fighting with it.
review_body: I attempted to use this with my Thinkpad W520.  (which only has usb 2.0 ports)

Piss poor product that does not work.  I've tried it on 2 different Windows 7 PCs and it will not work on either; one being brand new (1 wk)!  Installed drivers before connecting, & updated from AOC website. Rebooted laptop mutliple times & nothing!  Should have just given my money to a homeless person!
Superb. Lives up to expectations.
Works great, arrived quickly.
not very mac friendly. Very few instructions provided for those who want to use it with Macbook air. If you are looking for mac driver go to this page
Has worked great so far.  I've had it a couple of months.

review_title: Tons of time is spend to get the cord just right to work and you better not move your laptop or monitor from that point ...
review_body: Lasted about 4 months. The issue is the connection in the back. If you use it as a travel monitor it means you have to disconnect/re-connect the cord each time. The back connection is cheap and eventually loosens up. The result is the monitor constantly flickering or losing connection all together. Tons of time is spend to get the cord just right to work and you better not move your laptop or monitor from that point forward. Second AOC portable monitor purchased with a poor cable connection, you get what you paid for. I've learned my lesson and it's worth spending a little bit more for a better quality product.

review_title: Works as designed, but doesn't look that great. Maybe better calibration will improve it?
review_body: I use this with a 15" Mac Book Pro Retina so this review is heavily biased by having this USB screen sitting next to what amounts to an industry gold standard for portable computer displays. So it works once the mac driver is installed (you have to download a driver for the mac platform which can be found at http://www.displaylink.com/mac)  Light as a feather, almost too light as in I worry about how well it will hold up, but could be just perception. But the look of the screen is pretty washed out. The text is anemic and soft. The gamma is low, too. I played around with the color profiles to little real improvement. I'm not sure I'm going to keep this, the look is so awful. But it's usable, I'll give it that. I'm going to give it a couple of days before I hand in my final verdict.

I got a E1659Fwu for use with my Sony VAIO (running Win 8 64-bit)while traveling. I am glad to have a light monitor like this with low cabling needs.  I had a couple of problems with the display that made it impractical  to use (see below) and, more importantly, I got zero response from the vendor (AOC)about the problems.  Ultimately, I returned the AOC in favor of a similar product from Toshiba, which is working flawlessly with my configuration.

Monitor works well, colors are extremely vibrant.  Very easy to install and setup with computer.  I am sharing this monitor between 2 computers using DVI and hdmi inputs with no problems.  The only negative is that the stand feels very flimsy and the monitor wobbles when touching controls.  Price is very good value.

review_title: Steer clear of this monitor. Within 5 months the ...
review_body: Steer clear of this monitor.  Within 5 months the hdmi port began going in an out.  anytime the monitor is touched, the screen goes blank, has to be unplugged and wiggled before getting it to come back on.  A quick google search shows this is not an uncommon problem.
Have two - both work hard most of each day and neither has given me any problems yet. Had one around a year and the other for over a year.
I am very pleased with this monitor. The display is sharp and the colors are true. The price is right, as well. Highly Recommended.

This Asus should be five-star, but it has serious drawbacks that prevent me from recommending it. The hotkeys for contrast and brightness are not working (brightness worked once, then stopped). The buttons are far too hard to press, and they must be pressed repeatedly to get anything done. The friend I bought this monitor for has nerve damage in her hands and this will be a major obstacle to her using the monitor well.

Great addition to my desk.  Prior to having this monitor, I had an old, 21.5" dell with the same resolution.  The colors are perfect for the money and I am very satisfied.  I use this monitor for gaming and watching videos.  In gaming, there is no ghosting and watching videos is a blast.  I got this monitor on sale for an amazing $139.99 with free shipping (prime).  I suggest you wait till Black Friday to get the best savings on this monitor.  The only minor con is the slightly wobbly base, which isn't a big deal as long as you have a sturdy desk/table.  If you are looking for a inexpensive monitor that still performs well, look no further.  BUY IT!!!
ive been using it for about 3 months now and i have had no problems with it

review_title: It's a hit with a 16 year old gamer
review_body: Very good gaming monitor, right out of the box. No adjustments needed for Minecraft or other online games.
Perfect HDMI monitor and cant beat the price --- like it a lot for my surveillance setups

Must compliment the quality of Asus warranty service. Asus paid for Fedex shipping both ways and I had my monitor back in less than a week. The screen had turned white one month before the 3 year warranty expired. I had used the monitor almost every day.
Great color, slick and super-thin profile! The setup controls are a little awkward, but otherwise well worth the money.
Upgrade time. Perfect size ... went from 19" to 23". My old Acer lasted 10+ years. I gave it away to family still in great shape. Trust this brand!
It's just fine, quite a bit lighter in weight than the one that replaced it. Colors are fine, and I get a good image from side to side and top to bottom.
This is worth the price. Getting a monitor this good for this price Is gold. The response time is amazing. Looks amazing. Had no problems with it. Overall, amazing monitor. Highly recommend it

review_title: This replaced another Acer & I luv it. I ...
review_body: This replaced another Acer & I luv it. I overclocked my graphics card(superclocked) actually & this monitor compliments that card perfectly. Very bright,vivid,it almost looks 3 dimensional. Worth EVERY penny without a doubt.
This monitor is fantastic but shockingly doesnt have hdcp 2.2 so you cant stream 4k from netflix and other 4k sources.

great monitor for the price. Would like to buy another soon. Only improvement is that I wish the monitor position or angle could be adjusted just a little. but whatever, it was really inexpensive so I was expecting that.

review_title: Excellent product, excellent price, looks incredible
review_body: Excellent product at an excellent price. It looks great and is basically frameless. The stand is well designed and gives you the ability to lay things like pens inside the circle base. It has built in speakers too

review_title: Really impressive when your old 20" inch is failing!
review_body: Pro: Feels like a good deal.
Excellent visual quality as external monitor for my MacBook Pro. Zero setup requirements... just plug-n-play. Nice and affordable.

review_title: Great Monitor of its type and price point!
review_body: There are VERY few monitors of this type on the market period. (Full HD Resolution) Even less at this price point.  The quality appears to be very good for the price point.  It was very easy to set up and as long as the computer is fairly new, there is no problem with the USB powering of the monitor.  (It notice it was not quite as bright as other monitors that I have , but what can you really expect.)  I hope that it continues to impress as we use it more.

review_title: Nice addition to my mobile office
review_body: Works great, exactly met my expectations.
Excellent product! Light weight for my computer bag and clear view.
1 pixel isn't working quite right but it wasn't worth returning.
Love it! Clear picture
Works great as a second monitor while traveling
Used on a couple devices with no problem. Plugged it into my Toshiba laptop and my Asus T100. Will try it on my Surface Pro and a couple android tablets and Note 3 phone next.
It's really awesome, light weight, usb powered is fantastic.

I like having this as an extra screen but it is slow even my mouse icon skips around on it. Can't use software that requires high refresh rate due to the lag. it works ok for making a word doc but not so much using a chrome browser.
great

review_title: great color and easy to install.
review_body: I am using this monitor at the end of a HDMI cable and the results are great. The tuning is so so but the modes will probably give the viewer enough choices. I don't play games so sorry no comment on speeds and refresh. Watching movies , editing video and photos the screen is true to my color tuning and I am never catching ghost or artifacts. .

Love it! works great at a lot of resolutions and has no dead pixels.  Customer service is great and sent a replacement cord even though it was my fault that it failed.  I'd give it 10-stars if I could.

review_title: Excellent Monitor! Great for dual monitor set-up
review_body: Excellent monitor. Originally purchases the VE247H but there were issues with pixel speckling at 59-60Hz; I believe it was just one of those rare occasions of a manufacturing issue. So I returned it for the VS248H-P and I could not be happier. Wonderful picture quality for a great price! Purchasing a second one immediately for dual set-up.
Excellent computer monitor. Inexpensive with fast response and very good definition.

We just purchased 2 of these displays for the office and overall they are very good. The installation of the monitor to the stand was dead simple and my hats off to ASUS for making it so easy. (NO TOOLS)

The monitor is fantastic, Asus service is terrible!  When I tried to register my product, I kept getting errors.  I contacted Asus customer service via e-mail, on-line chat and phone.  I received a trouble ticket.  After a week I called and was told I didn't need to register my product.  I never received anything from e-mail service or chat.
Beautiful Picture. Nothing but gear so far. Puts previous monitor I had to, shame. Highly recommend this to all.
dead pixels.

review_title: No problems so far. No dead pixels. Wish ...
review_body: No problems so far. No dead pixels. Wish it came with a HDMI cable. It just has VGA, DP, and DVI cables.

review_title: Nice quality monitor for the price!
review_body: Great monitor, we use our in our store, work great!

review_title: Love it. WISH it had a mounting surface on ...
review_body: Love it. WISH it had a mounting surface on the back to use a monitor stand. Great other than that

Great moniter for my asus computer.. its wide and the color is perfect.. there is a small glare when the sun is behind it but because you can move the position of the moniter it doesnt bother me much.. i really want to buy another so i can have dual moniters.. i highly recommend for the price!
Old monitor went out.  Looked at reviews.

review_title: Nice Monitor-Bad instructions for screen adjustments-exercise in frustration and no info on the internet I could find.
review_body: This is a nice looking monitor and for a very reasonable price. I gave it only three stars because of the real lack of detailed information in the manual on how to adjust the color and contrast. The buttons to do so are very small and on the underside bottom of the monitors frame. I have looked and looked on the internet for some in depth instructions on adjusting the screen and never did find any. What instructions there are are not of much use and so if you want an exercise in futility buy this monitor and spend a lot of time trying to figure it out. Not new to computing and never had a monitor this hard to adjust because of lack of proper instructions on how to do so. That being said, out of the box, the screen looks good but if you are like me and want to fine tune it then the controls to do so are a problem. Exact sequential instructions are need for screen adjustment For the price, in spite of the adjustment problem, it is a good value.

review_title: This is simply a great monitor at a great price
review_body: No need to overthink this one.  I needed a monitor to connect via hdmi to my laptop when I work from home.  I wanted a matte screen and didn't want to spend a lot of money.  This is simply a great monitor at a great price.  Spreadsheets are huge on this thing!
Love it.  Easy install, bright colors, screen works just as expected.  It serves as a second monitor and I love it.
Really nice monitors for general duty computer work. They work great side by side with the thin bezels.

review_title: Awesome screen, Shaky stand, doesn't take away from the experience though. (23.8in 1080)
review_body: Really awesome screen and minimal bezels which creates a really beautiful screen overall. The only thing I don't like is the stand as it is pretty shaky even when typing on my keyboard, however that doesn't take away from how beautiful the screen is and I will most likely mount it to my wall or desk.
used it once. vacuum not real strong. will try in future again

review_title: Monitor is great with a really crisp picture
review_body: Monitor is great with a really crisp picture. I use two of these as dual extended displays and they works seamlessly with my MacBook Pro via HDMI and by using a Minidisplay to HDMI Cable. The only thing I dislike is that it could be brighter to show up well in well-lit rooms, but that is the IPS displays fault.

Outstanding product. Arrived in time for my deployment to South Carolina to aid in the flood relief there. I couldn't have manged the data coming in from the field effectively without this additional monitor. Very crisp and clear picture, and having the capability to run it off the USB port on my lap top allowed me to use it in the field for real time data. Highly recommended.

review_title: AOC USB monitor on OS X Yosemite
review_body: This screen is incredibly usable if you travel a lot. However on a Mac with OS X 10.10(yosemite), installing the required USB device driver (displaylink) renders your thunderbolt -> display output unusable. You have to uninstall the displaylink driver and restart the computer if you want to use the thunderbolt display ports. OS X also has a habit of freezing and reporting display errors while the displaylink driver is installed. I believe this display works ok under Linux and Windows.

review_title: I had a previous version AOC E1649Fwu that worked great -- until I left the very unique cable that ...
review_body: I had a previous version AOC E1649Fwu that worked great -- until I left the very unique cable that comes with it on a plane, and for the life of me could not find on Amazon or elsewhere where you could just buy a replacement cable.  So given I liked the product I went ahead and bought this new updated larger monitor instead.  Unfortunately, I was not able to get this product to work with my Dell Inspiron laptop.  I spent hours on the phone with AOC and Dell tech support troubleshooting and updating drivers, etc, but no dice, couldn't get it to work.  It seems like this new monitor is not fully compatible with all laptops.
nice size, features and portability for the price
Great

review_title: I do like the idea of a thin light weight USB only ...
review_body: Plugged into my Microsoft Surface and it is supposed to just work. Well it did not after searching countless Google pages and downloading the driver  with no success, I wiggled the connection on the back of the device and noticed the image was intermittently appearing on the screen, which proved to me this product was defective and I am sending it back for a full refund.  I do like the idea of a thin light weight USB only extra monitor but the quality of this product is very poor. Not because it was defective but just looking at the device you can tell it is very poor quality.
I really love it.

review_title: no printed installation manual, install driver first then plug. otherwise great
review_body: I got this for my Windows 7 bootcamp MacBook Air 13" 2012. The good this about this is that it uses USB port instead of hdmi or vga. The size is similar to my 13" screen. But because it's black, it doesn't match my macbook color (silver). If you have a black laptop, it'll match. Well, most monitors are black anyway, never seen a silver case monitor.

review_title: AVOID THIS CRAPPY PRODUCT!!!!!!!!  CHOOSE ANOTHER VENDOR!!!!!
review_body: I purchased this product and was never able to get it to work!  The female end of the USB port on the back of the monitor does not allow the male end to fully enter, so the monitor is completely useless.  I tried sending an email to their support staff asking for assistance which has been unanswered.  I am sure that it probably has a nice screen resolution, etc, but am unable to verify since it mechanically will not engage.
very portable! good!

I got this monitor to play my Xbox 360 on it with an HDMI cable. It's nice bright screen makes me feel like I am playing a completely different game. Although it does not have speakers, I use my headset which puts the sound right in my ears. I'm sure that if I hooked it up to a CPU, the picture would be just as clear as the HDMI picture. It was easy to set up and lightweight so there is no trouble in moving it from one side of the desk to another. I did my research for weeks and chose this one because of the great price and it had the aspects that I needed. I suggested this monitor to my friends who also play Xbox with me. Great screen and great picture make my gaming sessions a lot more fun than they used to be.

review_title: Have three unbelievable displays. I've had samsung and others ...
review_body: Have three unbelievable displays. I've had samsung and others. They put a lot of money into developing these and it shows.
This is an excellent monitor.  The size is just right, the colors are excellent and the display is very clean and sharp.  Great performance, reasonable price.
This monitor works great, as advertised. Nice bright image from every angle. I use it all the time now, with my laptop and my desktop computers.

I went from having a 23.6" to this 24" monitor so not much of an improvement there on size for me... I gave my old PC to my kids so I decided to stick with around the same size. This monitor has a crisp clear display, as did my old monitor.

review_title: Good picture, especially for the price
review_body: This monitor has good color and a quick enough refresh for anything I do (mostly programming, email, and Netflix... sorry Amazon, your Prime Video streaming is too much of a pain). There are adequate video hookups. I don't have any complaints.

review_title: Monitor not working after 6 months.. Any help?
review_body: I bought this monitor 6 months ago, and for some reason randomly my screen went black and my computer was still running fine. But the monitor went black still showed the light on and when I tried turning it off, it would stay on until I uplugged it. Then when I plugged it back in, it wouldn't turn on until 20 minutes later. And when it does come on it works perfectly fine.. And the monitor is a good one because I bought two of them.. But now one is acting up..

The picture is so clear and the colors so bright and vibrant. Watching movies and playing video games on this monitor, words don't do it justice to explain how good this item is. Asus always produces high-quality items.

This is a very inexpensive monitor for a reliable brand. I am using it right now in fact. The picture and contrast are amazing. We bought this to update our older one so we could use it for picture editing. I have no doubt that this is the best monitor for the money, and for much more money.

Amazing monitor for gaming. The 2ms response time and the 1080p resolution makes playing games a lot of fun. At a little less than 24" there isn't a real need for a 4K resolution, so the resolution works great for its size. The contrast ratio gives a great depth of colors as well
I loved that this was good for my son's eyes. That's why I picked it.
Bought this for my husband. It is a really nice monitor and he loves it.

review_title: Good value. Great color and quality
review_body: Wow, what an improvement from my last monitor.  Good value.  Great color and quality.
The product arrived on time and as expected. So far no issues.
I REALLY like my monitor and so glad that I made a good choice

Absolutely worth every penny. This monitor is EXTREMELY high quality. There is no glare, no lag, no problems at all. If you're looking for a very high quality monitor at a very fair price, this is it.

review_title: Color great! The refresh rate has kept pace with my ...
review_body: Color great!  The refresh rate has kept pace with my work.
The clarity is great, and overall great value in my opnion.
It's like watching TV on my computer. So clear & bright.

review_title: This monitor does not come with the square universal mounting ...
review_body: This monitor does not come with the square universal mounting so it will not work with my mount. Did not even turn-on the monitor. Do not buy this for use with a wall mount or standing type desk.

review_title: This monitor is awesome. I use it in so many settings (offices
review_body: This monitor is awesome. I use it in so many settings (offices, homes, coffee shops) that I hardly ever use the giant desktop monitor I have. I've "sold" its merits to at least 5+ people who also purchased one. It simply doesn't get much easier than a USB-only setup.
Simply awesome
Short money for a useful product. Glare issue is manageable.

review_title: I'm sitting here with two useless AOC monitors
review_body: This monitor uses DisplayLink software to work at all with MacOS, and with the latest High Sierra OS Update Version 10.13.4 Beta (17E182a), it is not supported AT ALL. Now, I'm sitting here with two useless AOC monitors. So, if you're a Mac user. Either, don't ever update your OS, or buy something else.

I have purchased four of these, one for myself and three for coworkers. I was really happy orignially. Very easy to use and convenient. But now on 3 out of the 4, all less than one year old, the cord has either stopped working or been incredibly finnicky to the point it is not worth using.

review_title: My other monitors work fine with it
review_body: Got this to go with my new surface book.  Will not work at all.  I can get it to work on my mac, but not on my surface.  My other monitors work fine with it.  I have my IT guy work with it for an hour.  He tried but couldn't get it to work.  I sent an email to support, never got a reply.  Called the support line.  Waited and waited....finally got the auto message that said to wait to be transfered to a tech, them it asked me to leave a message.  So here is my message.....YOU SUCK

Screen resolution is horrible. I purchased it so I can have a few excel sheets opened at the same time using my laptop. I was not able to see the cells on excel with this screen. I adjusted the settings but that still not help.

review_title: An imperfect solution. Great concept with a terrible screen.
review_body: It gets the job done. Barely.
Must have..!

The connection on the back is very touchy, and if my laptop is on my lap and I shift, it sometimes causes the connection to break. Otherwise, as long as I set it up and don't move it slightly, it works just fine.

review_title: Very nice monitor but no speakers
review_body: Great quality picture, Amazon is amazing for the price and fast shipping. The only down side is there are no speakers included built into the monitors. Good quality from a name brand company.

review_title: Our company has bought at least 30 of this monitor ...
review_body: Our company has bought at least 30 of this monitor over time, no issues with any one. Many of them are mounted on monitor arms.
I got it... I like it... I did have to dis-assemble the base plate and attach the bare metal plate first before re-assembling plastic cover because the fit is or was poorly thought out.
Very pleased with these monitors. Priced well and meet my needs, which are modest. I'm not into gaming or graphic design. Bought two for my home computer setup.

Bought 2 of these for a dual monitor setup, and holy crap, I wasn't prepared for the size of these. Coming from an old 19" 1440x900 Samsung, this was a huge step up. Setup was easy but I did have to tinker with the color settings both on the monitors and in Windows. One monitor had a greenish tint to it and a stuck pixel at the very bottom. I was going to deduct one star for quality, but for the price I expected as much. Now I just need to upgrade my video card :(
Cheap chinese parts, puts out a lot of noise in radio frequences.

This is a fantastic-sharp looking monitor which will satisfy every craving I have in quality until I upgrade to a 1440p monitor, that being said, the damn stand for this thing is flimsier and I could have made a better support out of legos, unless you have a desk that is solid and guarantees no shaking or movement when you type or move things about you will not like the stand on this monitor, I can assure you that. Only other problem is that there is a dead pixel (just 1) which only bothers me for a few moments when the screen is a solid color or I am playing a dark game. Other than that solid buy, maybe plan for a DYI stand though, because I know I will be making one

I love the price. I love the quality, I love the company.......... I very much dislike the yellow tint. You do get used to it if it's your only monitor but next to a more expensive one it's clearly got a yellow tint. You can play with the settings to help get rid of it but it's not going completely away. I'm not returning it because this is only a placeholder for a better one later. I give it a 4/5 for only it's yellow tint. It's the only thing wrong with them.

review_title: I bought two of these to use with our security ...
review_body: I bought two of these to use with our security camera system. Both run on the HDMI connection and have been working well.

Since opening up this product i've been nothing but happy with it! No dead pixels, the stand is just fine for me (though it isn't adjustable its not slanted like some of the other reviews I read stated. The graphics are WAY better than my old monitor. It was simple to assemble with no awkward installation process. If it has some hidden bad side i haven't found it yet- but i'll keep you updated if I do.
No screw holes to connect a monitor mount. Nice edge-to-edge display on 3 sides though.
Product is as the seller described work well.

When I bought this monitor in early May 2017, the product description advertised a 1080p monitor that was capable of being overclocked to 75Hz. I recently built a PC and was excited to overclock this monitor, but it refuses to clock any higher than 67Hz. I was mislead and now I'm stuck with a measly 60Hz.

review_title: Product and Seller performed as expected....
review_body: Product and Seller performed as expected....

Just got this monitor.  Sound is confusing.  The manual says that some models have speakers, some have audio input, some have audio output, but they are all model R240HY.  I'm not sure how to tell the difference.  The one I received has audio output (headphone jack), but no speakers. I tried with HDMI, and it does get sound to the monitor, but the only way to hear it is to use the audio output jack. No speakers.
Haven't really used it yet, but the packaging is great, nice size, looks stylish, and easy to put together

Thus is a great sCree that won't break the bank! Low input lag and ips. Just be aware this does not tilt or have height adjustment. Other than that it's a solid monitor. I don't think you can beat acer. They make great monitors.
The monitor is great but the instruction manual is poor.
Great monitor for the home office! Really shows color!

review_title: The speaker on my unit does not work. I ...
review_body: The speaker on my unit does not work. I did not buy it knowing that it had a speaker so I will still use it.
It fits in my bag, it needs no power supply, the screen is clean and crisp, the graphics could be a little sharper, but over-all, considering the weight, price and USB connections....love it.

I have had this monitor for a couple of years I don't use it very often.  The screen/image is great when it works but it has chronic connectivity issues I have to plug and unplug it multiple times to get it to work don't matter which laptop or port I use.  It has been that way since I purchased it did not send it back because I didn't use it much.

when i have to work remotely i am more efficient when using two screens .  this light weight usb monitor is great for doing that.,  i have my laptop monitor and this.  great set up for remote working.

review_title: however the plastic case it came in is cheap and smells horribly of chemicals
review_body: The monitor works very well, however the plastic case it came in is cheap and smells horribly of chemicals. It's a shame, because we bought a lower resolution version of this monitor a few months ago, and it came in a nice neoprene sleeve. I threw the plastic case away and bought a new sleeve instead.

review_title: Good and Functional with a little fuss
review_body: I preordered this monitor, the first one I received was defective (dead pixel) and was happily swapped out by amazon. My current monitor is fine sans the fact every now and then just endlessly cycles colors when waking from sleep.

review_title: Get the warranty if you buy this item
review_body: 6 months later and it doesn't work. I'll be looking at a better brand in the future.
Very happy with monitor.  I'm not super crazy that the plug in is located behind the stand as it gets in the way when opening/closing the stand.  Nice that it came with a bag.

review_title: hubby says worth its weight in gold and then some ...
review_body: hubby says worth its weight in gold and then some. can get a lot done away from the office now too.  (NOT THAT I suggest EVER bringing work home!)

I really loved this item, until I got home from a trip and it didn't work. The item was well packaged and did not receive any external damage, however the screen is black when I connect to my PC. My control panel can still detects the screen, but I cannot see anything. Can you assist me in anyway? I'm travelling out of the country again in 4 days and I desperately need this item for work.

The monitor only lasted 1 month until the screen cracked and became useless. This monitor must be very delicate since I have no idea when or why mine broke. It was in it's sleeve inside my computer case, upon taking it out of it's sleeve I noticed the monitor was cracked. The idea of a usb powered monitor is great. The main purpose of it, in my view, is for portability and therefore must be durable - not this one. The lag on this monitor is also very annoying.

review_title: The screen is a nice non-glossy matte finish
review_body: The screen is a nice non-glossy matte finish, leaving no glare behind, a very good feature. Seems solidly built and is a good size for working at a desk. My only complaint about this monitor is the colors feel off. You are going to have to put in a good amount of time before you can get the colors to look correct. When I say the colors look off I mean that The blacks are not very deep and there seems to be a crazy amount of contrast by default.

One month into purchase got one white line across the monitor. And today I got a second white line across. I'm forced to replace it. Asus warranty does not cover charges to send it back and that is close to $75. Might as well buy a new monitor! Disappointed! :-(

Ok, Image is sharp and colorful! which of course I love! everything was amazing at first, until the monitor started to blink and shut off and on... that wasn't due to an unusual pick in electrical current, I have another screen so this has to be broken. This started after 8-10 months of use.

review_title: Excellent mid-range monitor at a very attractive price
review_body: Excellent mid-range monitor at a very attractive price.  The picture is bright and very clear with a wider viewing angle than most of the other monitors that I have owned.

It took some tweaking of the brightness, contrast and RGB levels to my preferences, but the performance as a computer monitor is excellent; sharp, bright, good contrast...really nothing more I could ask for.  I haven't tried video programming via the HDMI so can't comment on that though I expect it would be fine.

Since my friend told me to get this instead of a TV when it comes to video games I really do NOT regret buying this monitor at all. Looks amazing, it feels amazing, say good bye to the glitches (tv problems). I do love how it looks and just everything about it. Its worth it, to who ever is trying to get a monitor for gaming, this is a perfect one. I use it for my PS4 with the HDMI. It just works and looks so great.

The quality is outstanding and the look is sleek. I agree with other reviews that the base is poorly made and will wobble anytime it is nudged- not a problem for me since its on the back of my sturdy desk and never moves. If you tend to move or adjust your monitor often you may not like the wobbly base.
Works great

I have no problems with this monitor - I actually wish I went a little larger though. The problems I have are probably computer related. I can't set the monitor to the maximum resolution - the computer doesn't go there...
This screen is very nice for the price. It has all the inputs you could need plus the Vesa mount comes in handy (i have a mini-pc attached to the back).
love this monitor with all my heart but I spent hours trying to figure out why my audio would not play, changing system files and ect.
amazing computer screen no speakers tho.

review_title: Nice. I like it so far!
review_body: Works great! Very happy.
Nice picture and works great.
No vga input
A bit small for the price but very high quality
great monitor
A great replacement for my monitor that died.
gift for 15 year old sun and he loves it
great picture

review_title: NOPE a big waste of money
review_body: This monitor does not work with any PC I own, I have Dell, HP, desktops, laptops, all very new, with 3.0 usb ports, the drivers work with nothing.  UGH... I was really hoping I could use this portable with my i7 Dell Laptop, but no, so I tried it with my HP i7, and my HP i5 chipset.  NOPE  a big waste of money.  It is very aesthetically pleasing, and portable, the case is nice etc.  but does not work.  Big disappointment.

review_title: Great device, but not next to a Retina Display
review_body: Great device - if you don't try to pair it with a MacBook Pro with Retina Display. Next to those Macs, the display looks to have a painfully low resolution that makes it disappointing to work with.

I love this monitor.  It's perfect for travel and bringing with me whenever I'm not at my desk.  Could be my only second monitor.  It's awesome.  Was easy to set up and works perfectly.  nice not to need another power cord.
very heavy and thick. It is not suitable for carrying on a go .

review_title: Good monitor by why a cd install disc. We don't use Cd/dvd
review_body: I would give it a 5 if the installation software was on thumb drive or sd card. CD is kind of outdated.

Worst display driver of all time. I installed the driver and not only did it prevent my work computer from booting up, it also prevented itself from being uninstalled and denied the F8 key from working at boot.

review_title: I use the screen to help me out when working ...
review_body: I use the screen to help me out when working from home as there is just no way to work on just my laptop's screen and get anything done.
Plugged this into my Dell M4700 dock's USB3 port, and added it as a 4th external monitor, after the 2 DVI and the 1 VGA from the same dock. Works great.

review_title: It's just okay.  Color depth hurts this display.
review_body: You should make note of the detailed description on this, it only has 18-bit color so even though it's 1600x900 resolution the lack of color depth makes the image look grainy and washed out. It can be hard on the eyes for extended periods of time.
This is my second one. First one arrived DOA. As always, Amazon provided quick turn around on replacement. Replacement worked like a charm. Crisp, nice size, quick. And 11  days later it died.
3 of these on one computer and 2 on another. Love these things.
Looks great

review_title: ... an ASUS monitor of the same size which I like much better
review_body: I also purchased an ASUS monitor of the same size which I like much better.  The overall display is not as clear and my ASUS although the have the same specifications.

I've been looking for monitors for about 2 months and it came down to this one because of price and quality and I have to say that this is the best purchase I made. I got two of these for dual monitors and it hasn't let me down. Nothing was wrong with both of mine when they came in so that was good luck! All in all these monitors are really clear and great!

I have no complaints about this monitor at all. I bought it specifically for gaming, and it is fantastic. The color accuracy is great with very adjustable settings and different viewing modes. I have never noticed any ghosting, lag, burn-in or anything of the sort.
love it best monitor i have had

review_title: Not good for sensitive eyes, but otherwise it's a nice quality monitor.
review_body: For some reason, the high contrast ratio gave me a lot of eye irriatation and I now use a Samsung with a 1:1000 contrast static ratio which seemed to resolve my eye issues. So, not good for sensitive eyes, but my boyfriend loves it as I gave it to him, so it also works for both.

review_title: He seems to like it a lot
review_body: I purchased this as a gift for my boyfriend. He seems to like it a lot! No complaints have been heard. The buttons are super slick and it responds/boots fast. Awesome Monitor!

The monitor has everything that I could think of wanting. Firstly, it has a 1920x1080 resolution. Secondly, it has connections for HDMI, DVI and VGA. Lastly, it has VESA mounts. It was hard to find a monitor that had all three of those features in this size range. That way, I get a bigger second screen for my laptop, but it still fits on my desk.

review_title: Good monitor at a good price
review_body: So far, we are pleased with this purchase.  We will see how long it lasts before there are any problems. In reviewing its features before we made the decision to purchase it, the monitor appeared to be an adequate solution at a good price. Out of the box, it delivered on graphics quality and ease of installation. Time will be the next test.
No issues
Meh. Poor quality, but good price. Would work fine as a productivity monitor, not for gaming or any enthusiest use. Get a G-Sync, or at least a 144hz monitor. ASUS RoG

review_title: Does not have the ability to use standard monitor mounts
review_body: I purchased this for our company after seeing that is was VESA compatible.  The monitor like many Apple iMac computers only mounts on it's own stand.  There are no mounting holes on the monitor.
met our requirements

review_title: Failure after 6 months - no quality control?
review_body: Was a steal for price per item. IPS for this cheap with a circle stand, awesome!
Best computer ever!

review_title: I needed a monitor so I bought this monitor. ...
review_body: I needed a monitor so I bought this monitor. Shipment came in on time, plugged the monitor in, and everything is working as expected. 5stars
Very good
Good monitor for a decent price. Noted it didn't cam with HDMI  cable with my purchase. Buyer be aware!
Thanks

review_title: It pays to buy quality. This isn't quality.
review_body: What a bitter disappointment. I thought I'd found a convenient and inexpensive way to view full page documents in portrait format. The third time I attempted to use it, the monitor failed completely. You get a one second peek at the logo, then blackness. Good points: Fails immediately, so you can get your refund quickly and easily.
It was working fine for about a year but then stopped working. It does not turn on when I plug it in. I don't recommend it.

review_title: Stopped working after 5 months but just replace the cable
review_body: I've had this for 5 months and it stopped working. Figured out it was the cable. Amazon Basics sells one for pretty cheap.

review_title: Easy to set up; right size.
review_body: The monitor was easy to set up, and it is the right size for my computer armoire.  It's also very light and comes with a pocket, so it will fit easily into my computer case for traveling.
- Resolution poor (to do any significant work other than maybe an IM window etc.)

This monitor have a mouse, video and everything else's lag on it. I don't know if it manufacture like this or the driver isn't up to date but I did what I could and look around and people seem to confirm it is a monitor lag with these particular kind. It display things just fine but if the lags bother you I would not spend $150 for it. I just need it to help me display a separate web preview module so that I can learn coding and not too much interaction with it.
Had a little trouble with the setup on Windows 10. But it finnaly took the drivers and it's working as expected
Don't bother... Drivers etc.  OS to mess with.  I could have built one quicker
I only needed one of the USB power cables.  Works great, especially for the price.  Also, no old bulky monitor cables, this is strictly USB.  I highly recommend this USB Monitor.
Unbelievable how dim it is.  All other things okay--weight, sturdiness.  etc....Can't change the dim fact.

Absolutely LOVE this monitor! I've had it for over a year now for gaming, graphic design, and photography editing with absolutely no problems at all. Great product and definitely would recommend this to anyone looking to get a nice set up going.

review_title: Good monitor with few minor exceptions
review_body: Display is good and easy to set up.  My only objections are the power cord provided is fairly short and the access to the set-up buttons is a bit difficult as they are located under the edge of the frame behind a small ridge and buttons themselves are small.

The monitor was beautiful right out of the box, no dead pixels, no bad coloration, no difference from side to side. It is a crisper monitor than other LGs and Gateways I have, and and have not experienced any issues with it.
Great bang for your buck, but I recommend getting one with the HDMI in the back.

This monitor works really well but not even a week after I set it up I noticed several dead pixels near the center of the screen, its not really too big of a problem its just a nuisance. Also I noticed on the product description is says that this monitor is an LED monitor however on the box and the papers that came with the monitor it said LCD not LED.

review_title: A Picture is Worth a Thousand Words....
review_body: And it would take that long to describe all its positive qualities.
I ordered this monitor to use for console gaming.  I've had other Asus monitors and they've all been stellar quality,  which is why I was extremely disappointed when I setup this monitor.

review_title: The different modes are pretty handy for quick adjustments of the screen settings
review_body: Bought two (2). They arrived without damage so I don't have issues people have relating to delivery. I play World of Warcraft and Wildstar primarily for games and have no issues (run both at the same time with one on each screen - 24s are the way to go if you have the room) As for work, no real issues here. Sit for hours behind these with no problems. The different modes are pretty handy for quick adjustments of the screen settings. I also watch a lot of Anime and movies - no complaints here.

This monitor looks as good as many listed for twice the price.  I have been very impressed with it both for software development, and video gaming.  I would highly recommend this model.  I am thinking about getting another one for use with my laptop.  There is also a model with integrated speakers that I may pick up for an older desktop machine.

i have this monitor sitting next to another same size monitor thats not 1080p and the color difference is astonishing. i always thought it was a load of crap, and while i wouldnt say ditch your old monitor for something like this i would say to get this no matter what if youre getting a new one. monitors physical quality is also superb
awesome for the price
The monitor has a slight tilt downwards that you cannot change. You will want to prop it up on several thick books.

This was my first monitor to purchase and a can promise you it was worth it! Came in the mail packaged perfectly, practically borderless, and amazing for business and such an outstanding display for gaming!
Acer monitors are good value... this is no4 in my house...
Bought two of these for my grandson's gaming computer.  He's happy, I'm happy!
Works as advertised.
Great quality and value.  Would get 5 stars but they take a long time to boot from power down.

BRIGHT! Colors seem very deep and rich for such a value. Have not noticed any ghosting or other monitor abnormalities. No LED light when monitor is off which is nice. OSD Menu is nice and intuitive. Thin bezel, it will rotate up and down a good degree.
Bought for my mother, and she is really enjoying the improved picture from previous monitor.
This monitor does not support HDMI and VGA, I used about 3 hours of life time just to figure out how turn this on. It only gives me black screen and the symbol of 'no signal'. HORRIBLE MONITOR!!!

I have purchased hundreds - maybe thousands of items online, and this is my first review. Thought this item was too good to be true, as it worked beautifully.  Until this morning when it won't turn on.  Blank screen.  Imagine my surprise when the ability to return the item expired TWO DAYS AGO.  Don't buy this product.

review_title: Poor Support, Won't Work Without USB Extension Cable With Macbook
review_body: Neither the promotional materials (including photos of the monitor connected to a laptop) nor the very limited info on the AOC website indicate that the monitor requires 2 USB ports to work.

review_title: picture quality, viewing angle, clunky, cheap
review_body: First off. Of course the product's image is photoshoped. Despite this, the picture quality is not even remotely this good. If you were to look at this monitor from the angle in that photo it would be an ugly discolored mess. It is not meant for anything but dead-on viewing.

review_title: Works as Advertised on MacBook Air
review_body: The product works well on a MacBook Air mid-2011, no issues at the moment. I plugged the USB 3.0 cable in (indicated by the blue strip on the inside of the plug). I had to update the drivers from a version which worked with the previous generation of this device for it to do anything other than flash the AOC logo and turn off, so that is something important to note if you are experiencing issues. I had a problem with the old version of this device where it would hum, but this device does not do that. This product, at least on the first day, is excellent.

Decent monitor that is helpful as a second screen.  After installing the drivers it worked right out of the box without any issue.  The brightness is very bad though and can't be adjusted.  It also is fairly bulky when in the case.  Definitely portable, but the extra weight and bulkiness is noticeable.

I'd definitely take this middle option over the cheapest. I had it, and it broke (well, cause I dropped it) but after ordering the LED monitor for $30 more, it was well worth it. The quality of the stand and the monitor is worth the difference, slightly bigger screen and it's brighter!
Brightness and resolution could be better but good for the price.
I love my potable monitor saved my life. I travel with a surface pro screen much too small allows me to see what I'm working on clearly.
SUCKS!! resolution is very bad... always ZOOMED in
Returned for refund
Stand is a little flimsy.  Great view and decent resolution.
Love it, perfect size for my needs.  No set up issues whatsoever and the picture is clear!

While thinking about getting a monitor for my older backup computer, I found this monitor heavily discounted on Amazon at about $50 cheaper than anyone else and pulled the trigger. Though not as cheap as my Samsung 24" 1080p, the performance is better on paper, so I am confident I got a great deal and I am happy with my purchase.

review_title: It all worked as it should.
review_body: Was a gift for grandson who picked it out himself.

review_title: Really good monitor for the price!
review_body: I was hesitant to buy a monitor online due to the fact that there could be dead pixels. However i should have done this along time ago! Monitor arrived in perfect condition. It includes a dvi and vga cables which is a plus! currently i have it set up as my primary monitor. My previous monitor was a toshiba 19inch 720p monitor. My oh my, 1080p makes a big difference. Playing games, watching movies, and even web browsing is a pleasure on this monitor. i'm thinking of getting another one for a dual monitor setup.

I absolutely love this monitor. The resolution is crystal clear. I purchased this monitor as a replacement. I chose this Asus because it had three connections including a  HDMI. Most monitors don't have a HDMI connection,at this price.. The size was perfect for the limited amount of space I had to work with. Also it has a tilt adjustment. Great monitor. I would recommend.

review_title: Best ASUS monitor I ever own ...
review_body: ASUS rocks. AAA brand. for me, one of the best monitors I have own until now. best resolution, warm colors, excellent contrast. I found the best reviews in AMAZON.COM for this monitor and now I recommend to buy. I NEVER has a complain in equipment from ASUS brand. Easy to handle, lightweight. Recommended.
Very nice monitor for my needs

review_title: Purchased this as a second monitor hoping to match my ...
review_body: Purchased this as a second monitor hoping to match my ASUS 242 24-inch unit but this one is much brighter.  I never realized how 'grey' and washed out the background really was on my 242.  When finances allow I'll get another one of these!

At this price the image is fantastic! I tried a few lower priced monitors and was very unhappy with the image quality. This is really nice and the price is great. Some nice features that I did not realize were included until the on-boxing. Great color, great image, great price.
Light weight monitor, no complaints.
it is a monitor, and it works.  Everything I was looking for in my home office.
This monitor is great, sure the response time is low but that doesn't really matter.  The monitor has a gorgeous full HD display and it's available for such a low price.
great for the prize
DO NOT BUY THIS S...

review_title: seems like a pretty simple thing to add to such a ...
review_body: Only issue I've found with it is that it has no DVI input, seems like a pretty simple thing to add to such a high quality monitor.
So far so good. The quality is good, and price is favorable.
This monitor is stunning. Almost no bevel frame and no flicker. Excellent picture quality.
Niece says it is a great help for online classes
Love it.

review_title: ... usually work off of a laptop this is a perfect addition to your tech toys

If you aren't going to do a calibration, the "scenery" mode is the one that looks the most natural to me without any adjustments.

Got this monitor at a steal of $160us, regretted not purchasing another at the time. Planning to set up an eyefinity display with two more of these. Hopefully the price goes down again. But this monitor is definitely worth the $$ & I'm officially only purchasing Asus monitors from now on. They always deliver quality products. A must buy if you're in the market for an LED monitor.

review_title: Really good display for the price
review_body: The display quality is great and I am able to run it at 1920 x 1080 from my computer. The display controls are actually on the bottom of the monitor rather than on the display bezel – once you figure this out there is no problem with the adjustments. I could not find any “dead” pixels or display areas which is great. The display came with a variety of cables and adapters to connect to the video source. The ONLY drawback that I can see is there is no (physical) height adjustment – only tilt (thus four stars rather than five). This display was well worth the price.

I called ASUS customer service, and the guy there connected remotely to my computer, but he also could not fix the problem.  He then told me that he would connect me to technical support and there would be a charge for the help.  I clarified that I literally just unboxed the monitor- it came broken.  Why would I pay more to fix it?  The ASUS customer service rep hung up on me.  So, I have returned this monitor.  Won't buy from this company again.

review_title: -1 star for external power supply ("wall wart") - I've ...
review_body: -1 star for external power supply ("wall wart") - I've never seen a monitor with an external power supply, but I guess it's a way to cheat the price down. -1 star for having no way to mount the monitor on a swinging arm. That is, there are absolutely no screw holes on the back of this thing. I had intended to mount this monitor on a swivel arm pair and would have bought a second matching one, but no dice. Had to switch this monitor out with the one on my desk that will mount on the arm. The stand it comes with has a tilt adjustment but no height adjustment, so make sure you have a thick book or shelf to put it on. Other than that, it's an inexpensive monitor that works.

review_title: Internal screen crack destroyed this product
review_body: This monitor worked very well, for the short time that it worked. Lag time was minimal, colors were crisp, setup was easy, and my productivity improved noticeably. Unfortunately, less than two weeks after it was shipped to me, the screen cracked internally for no reason whatsoever. I always carry the monitor around in its protective case, handle it very gently, and have never dropped it. It sits on my desk 95% of the time and sits in a backpack the other 5% of the time. The screen is completely nonfunctional now. It's sad, considering that I've owned this product for just two weeks and it's already broken beyond repair.

review_title: Do NOT Buy if you have a Macbook Air 2013
review_body: After wrangling with technical forums for displaylink for OSX, trying 3 different drivers, repairing disk permissions, etc etc etc, I've come to the conclusion that this is a horrible purchase if you have a Macbook Air 2013. It does not work. The screen flashes red, green, blue, and just keeps cycling between these colors. On the very, very, rare occasion I've gotten this to work, I have to do a ridiculous workaround, with a USB 2.0 Hub and both usb cables plugged in. It will not work with a usb 3.0 hub. This is just garbage, don't waste your time on it. I thought a portable monitor this size would be amazing for travel, unfortunately, yes, it is too good to be true. I cannot recommend ANY displaylink technology for Macbook Airs, just take a look at the displaylink forums. Nightmare.
Maybe I'm spoiled to IPS monitors, but I haven't seen a monitor with a viewing angle this terrible in many years.

review_title: What a waste of time and effort
review_body: Don't bother if you have a Mac book.  I don't have a CD on my Mac.  I tried getting the driver from the AOC website and the link was broken.  I tried contacting AOC customer support a few times and never got a response. I followed some of the advice on the feedback here and got a driver from the DisplayLink driver and it error -  not compatible.  What a waste of time and effort.  Mine is packed up and ready to ship back.  The product description should not say it supports Mac.  I will not purchase any AOC devices in the future either.

Less than 6 months old and already busted beyond repair. something happened inside the screen where all I see is liquid what with some black circles and then random lines.  I'm pretty annoyed with the longevity and sturdiness of the product. Also, the inability to adjust the screen resolution was a pain.  I will be purchasing a new travel monitor. Needless to say, it will not be this brand. Very Disappointing. The only reason it got two stars is because while it worked, it made my job on the go a little more manageable.
It look like a good monitor but I got it to day and when it arrived there was no hdmi port

review_title: I love how large the screen is
review_body: The product works as expected.  The fact that the monitor is just USB powered was essential to my ability to use it.  I love how large the screen is.  My only complaint is the maximum resolution of 1600X900.  I shouldn't complain, I should have known better based on the product specs.  But a resolution of only 1600x900 seems like a waste of potential for this 17" monitor.  For sake of comparison, my widescreen laptop (15.4") functions optimally at 2880X1620.  I currently have it set at 1920x1080 because it's easier to see.  I can set my primary monitor to 1600X900, but it's such a gross resolution on my high graphics display that it doesn't look good.  So, as a result, there is a disparity between primary and secondary.

review_title: I purchased this screen and the description beefs it up. Its not good quality. Did not work with my mac, what a bust
review_body: Not worth it. Poorly built,

DisplayLink has apparently taken an Anti Linux stance and refuses to work with Linux Users.  I got this display to add to my netbook,  then found that I could not as almost all my systems are Linux based.
Crap

No where in the product description was there indication the monitor wouldn't work on my laptop with windows 7 and 2.0 USB ports. I contacted tech service as was told it should work; however, not only did it not work on the laptop it also failed on my PC. Finally tech service concluded my system could not support it. Note: both the laptop and PC "saw" the monitor though the screen remained dark. Either the unit was defective or AOC needs to update the limitations.

I don't know how this has such good reviews! I ordered it and it doesn't work at all. I downloaded the software and it still didn't work. I was on hold with AOC for 30 minutes before I got transferred to a voicemail. Obviously I never got a call back. My roommate bought the same monitor and hers also doesn't work, but in a different way. It just flashes multicolored. I can't imagine that it is just a coincidence that both of ours don't work.

review_title: Really would have liked to have known that before I bought it
review_body: Bought this work with my Samsung Series 9 Ultrabook.

review_title: Your Laptop HAS to have a USB-C Slot
review_body: This monitor looks solid, it's very thin and the cover/stand is nifty, strong magnets hold it in place. HOWEVER, you HAVE to have a USB-C slot in your computer which VERY few laptops at this point do. I have a cable with USB-A on one end and USB-C on the other and this will NOT work. I bought a HDMI to USB-C cable, this also will NOT work.

I was excited to upgrade from an older, lower-res AOC USB display. The screen is very thin and light and the combination cover/stand works well and takes up very little space. Sadly the display only seems to work with USB 3.1 with DisplayPort Alt Mode which my laptop doesn't support. Wish this had been clearer up front.

review_title: ... seems I’m out the cost of this item not happy

review_title: This has been the worst monitor I have purchased ever
review_body: This has been the worst monitor I have purchased ever! It doesn't work properly, my laptop doesn't recognized, and it is completely useless. Think twice before purchasing this.

review_body: Doesn't work at all on older OSX laptops.  Doesn't work for OSX MacBook Air circa 2015, with Sierra with USB ports.  I purchased a USB-C to USB converter and it doesn't work. Tried installing the drivers, no success.

review_title: Lasted just long enough to be out of warranty.

I feel like I want to take a sledgehammer and smash it. It won't stay on the input I set it to! I repair computers, when I turn the PC on waiting for initial screen with likely information about problems it switches to another input by itself and I miss the info I was looking for. Yesterday I left two computers connected, the second one didn't have screensaver. I switched it to the one that had. Came back in the morning, first computer turned the display off and this freakin' monitor switched itself to the second computer and was on all night long!
