Original review:

review_title: More like a mini desktop monitor
review_body: Not the most portable monitor. More like a mini desktop monitor. Weight it high.
Didn't work for me. Driver crashed my computer. Should be plug and play but it was not. Too bad,  I had high hopes.

I have a new generation mac pro which only has one usb port on each side (which is a poor design choice if you ask me but ultimately beside the point of my review.) so in order to use the screen, I have to plug it into a usb hub that has an external power supply.  When I do this, the screen draws so much power that it throws an error on my computer saying that all usb function is stopped due to the device pulling too much current. I also found that it burnt out both of the usb3 hubs I tried plugging it into into AND seems to have cooked the wireless mouse fob that was plugged into the hub as well. I am super disappointed.

review_title: No Driver Is Available, And It's Non-Functional Without
review_body: You need to install a driver for this monitor to work. This device came with a paper which supposedly provided a link to the driver. Unfortunately, I visited that link, and the driver for this product wasn't available. I then emailed the company asking them if there's a driver located elsewhere that I could download. Their automated system said that they'd get back to me within 2 days. It's been over 3 days and I've still received no response from them. Thus, I'm left with a really nice looking monitor that I can't use.
I did not receive this monitor. Nothing was left infront of my house

review_title: Not the best, but suits my needs for telecommuting
review_body: This review is for the AOC E1659FWU 16-Inch with 1366 x 768 resolution, at the time selling for $99. I ended up purchasing from another retailer since Amazon had it on back order during the time I needed it for extended travel while working. Based on the negative reviews about the USB connection failing, presumably due to poor soldering, I decided to buy the extended 4-year warranty. I also followed the advice of some reviewers that found ways to secure the USB cable to the back of the monitor in order to try and prevent the connection from failing prematurely. I think this should be a good way to extend the life of the connection. As an aside, friends and family often bring me their cheap external hard drives that stopped working for me to fix, and 9 out of 10 times, they've failed merely due to a faulty USB connection because the solder was shoddy and wore out in time. In almost every case, I've been able to install the drive in a new enclosure and it's worked just fine. Based on the reviews, I consider this monitor to have the same issue, so am taking precautions to try and prevent that from happening.

review_title: OK for occasional use, very limited functionality
review_body: Monitor driver can be downloaded, then monitor is ready for use. Got this for occasional work use at home but this isn’t one you’d want to use on a daily basis. Low resolution is very noticeable comparing laptop screen and this screen. Also, it’s not possible to adjust monitor’s brightness or zoom—adjusting your laptop’s settings doesn’t affect this monitor’s display. Screen is very bright, for better or worse. I tried the separate software that’s supposed to make display adjustments possible but it does not consistently. OK monitor for occasional use; pay a bit more for something higher end.

review_title: Good except for a few minor issues
review_body: I bought this refurbished off of woot.com, and when it came I was just able to plug it into my computer and it worked without doing anything else. The wire it comes with has two USB plugs, one of them I'm guessing is for extra power, But I was able to only plug in one and it worked perfectly.

review_title: This monitor only come with DVI cable, but no ...
review_body: This monitor only come with DVI cable, but no DVI-D. My desktop need DVI-D cable, so I need to buy a new DVI-D cable for my own to connect my desktop with monitor.

review_title: but otherwise the monitor is great.
review_body: The speakers do not work with Mac, but otherwise the monitor is great.
Pretty freaking dank.

The monitor came with brightness turned up to maximum and it burns your eyes out.  Unfortunately, this is impossible to adjust since the menu which displays brightness and other qualities is inaccessible.  The buttons designated to navigate this menu change the screen instead.  Unfortunately, this makes the monitor unusable.
So far no issues. Great monitor

review_title: The resolution is terrible. Maybe it's because I've become accustomed to Mac ...
review_body: The resolution is terrible. Maybe it's because I've become accustomed to Mac retina displays, but this screen is freaking hard to look at.
so~

The leaflet that came with it states that the monitor base is "attached to the monitor ... and it is undetachable." Not true, it came in two pieces, with no instructions, and they don't seem to firmly latch in place. I am tired of manufacturers reprinting the same mostly useless crap without checking if it applies to this particular product.

I finally hooked my 3 new ZERO-FRAME monitors up and I'm not happy. The whole point of buying a zero frame monitor is to have the edge of your desktop go to the very edge of the screen. There's about a 1/4" black edge between the edge of the screen and the actual picture displayed. While that is better than what I had before, it's not what I expected and advertised. What's the point of having the picture stopping on the screen (which looks like it's part of the same material that makes it up) stop before reaching the edge, unless you're just trying to make it look like it's a zero frame monitor.
Screen was incredibly cracked and completely worthless when it arrived. Not surprised as the material seems cheap... 5/7

review_title: Bad support and poor quality product
review_body: Had the monitor for 2 year, and it was just perfect with my laptop, was able to work on documents and spreadsheets side by side. The colors suddenly faded, some colors are displayed in different color. Contacted support since it was under the 3 year warranty, sent them pictures, they sent me RMA, a week later the monitor comes back, plug it and it's the same, contacted them and they claimed that they changed the controller board, that was a BS, nothing was changed, it was exactly the same, cost me shipping and time for nothing. Never trust this company again.

review_title: Disappointed that it was not as cool as I hoped for
review_body: I was excited to get this.  When I travel, I often find myself needing a 2nd and sometimes a 3rd monitor so that I can compare code that I'm updating.  This thing was going to make my life much more simple.  Meh.  Not too happy with my purchase.
I had high hopes for this monitor. My setup requires a couple monitors and I thought these would be my solution. Wrong.

Exactly what I was looking for. I have a macbook and you have to download the driver via the website instead of on the disk it gives you. I just googled "AOS DisplayLink driver for mac" and found it. I would also recommend getting a different case than the one it comes with-- that one is just a tad too tiny for the display and there's no room to store the USB cord. I ended up getting a 15" laptop sleeve for mine with a little cord case and it works great.--->

review_title: It works, but the image is terrible.  Makes using the monitor for business purposes all but worthless.
review_body: It works, but the image is terrible.  Flat, lack of contrast and usable brightness.  Makes using the monitor for business purposes all but worthless.  Might be good for video, but not much else.  There is really no excuse for putting out a product with such horrendous image quality.

review_title: This monitor can’t hold up to frequent travel
review_body: I travel for work and find myself working out of hotel rooms or random onsite offices all the time where dual monitors would be a god send. I decided to purchase this monitor given the price point and a recommendation from a colleague. Out of the box I was concerned with the feel of the monitor. It just felt like it would break easily and after plugging it in the monitor did it’s job, although the picture could be better, for what I paid I was happy with it. I have now had this monitor for 2 weeks and after getting to my work area this morning I plug the monitor in to see the screen cracked. Quite honestly, I am not sure what happened as I keep my laptop and this monitor in a padded computer backpack that stays with me constantly when traveling. My laptop and iPad were perfectly fine but I do feel this monitor is not meant for folks that travel. This may be a good option for a home office looking for a cheap dual monitor set up but this will most likely not be able to handle the bumps that come along with frequent travel.

My cousin ordered this monitor and it would not stay connected - it would keep turning on and off -  so she sent it back on warranty.  She left town and when it was returned, I tested it only to find that nothing was fixed.  I plugged it in and the AOC showed for an with of a second and then disappeared - every time I unplugged and replugged it in - this would happen.  It was returned again and they claim they replaced the motherboard.  It just came back today and NOTHING was fixed.  It is doing the same thing.  It looks like the plug does not seat 100 percent and wiggles, but you can't shove it in any further.  You would think that they would see this for themselves - that is if they bothered to actually plug it in.  I think they just keep repackaging the thing and sending it back without doing anything.  If I could give 0 stars, I would.

If all you are looking for is some extra screen real estate for working on spreadsheets with a laptop, then you will be very happy with these AOC USB monitors.  Keep in mind that the weak link in this technology is how well your PC device plays with the DisplayLink software.  DisplayLink creates a special video feed signal on your PC that can travel through a USB cable to the monitor.  Your computer will probably have no problem doing that, but don't blame the monitor if you have issues.  What I would recommend doing if you're not sure is installing DisplayLink on your laptop (it's a free download) and head to the nearest electronics store that will let you hookup to a USB monitor they have on display.

review_title: This is a nice lightweight display that is great for people that need ...
review_body: I purchased this monitor to use with my Surface Pro 4 for when I travel for work, so that is what my review is based on. I have been using this display for about 3 months and it was purchased through my wife's Prime account which is why it won't show up as a verified purchase.

review_title: Power button is a nice touch that was absent on the AOC
review_body: I purchased this monitor to replace an AOC USB monitor that died. Much slimmer with more features. Power button is a nice touch that was absent on the AOC. Specs say it works with Windows 7 but I struggled with it for several hours with no success. Doing a free upgrade to Windows 10 fixed the problem, it took me about 30 minutes to get it working after doing the upgrade. The included case/stand is worthless, I recommend getting a third party stand. Does not seem to work with USB 2.0 port but does fine with USB 3.0. Included USB cable is only abut 3 feet long, too short for my needs, I had to get a USB 3.0 extension cable. The printed quick start manual is pictorial and is confusing regarding how to configure the stand. CD contains drivers and a manual that is a bit more helpful. Display looks good to me, but I've got poor eyesight so take that for what it's worth. Monitor itself seems to be an overall good product, but I've only had it for a couple of days.

review_title: A fairly good reliable transportable monitor
review_body: I bought this monitor in March of 2013. About a year in the USB connector failed and I had to send it in for warranty. It took about 2 weeks but they honor the warranty and I got a new unit. That you and it has been in use on a professional level for 40 to 60 hours a week without fail.
Running Windows 10. Followed the directions perfectly. Installed the drivers. Didn't work.

review_title: and it worked nicely for three weeks
review_body: After reading all of the glowing reviews, I purchased this monitor, and it worked nicely for three weeks. It was lightly used. The screen wasn't super sharp, but I thought it was sharp enough for occasional use. For the past three weeks it has been unusable. I have exchanged many, many emails with the corporate office  and have downloaded and uninstalled the driver many more times. [Running a macbook air with mavericks.] Indeed they have come out with two updates since my troubles began. Alas, the monitor is now useless.

In a situation with the Macbook that only has one USB-C port, and it's kind of a bummer that you can't charge your laptop at the same time that you use this monitor. It'd be amazing if they just had another USB-C port on the opposite side of the monitor to allow power to flow through the screen to the laptop so you can work and charge at once without an adapter.

review_title: and I really like it. I have an older laptop that doesn't ...
review_body: I've been using this for a couple of months now, and I really like it. I have an older laptop that doesn't support the high power USB this needs to operate, but I'm able to plug it into the charging port on the laptop power supply and it works fine. I do the same thing with my Surface Pro 3 and it works great. As a lot of people have mentioned, the resolution isn't great, but I generally just have a spreadsheet or wiring diagram open on it, and it works fine for that. I wish the USB cables were a little longer, but other than that it's very hard to beat at this price point. Oh, and as a bonus it fits perfectly in the lid of my Pelican 1510 travel tool box. I use some foam and a piece of Lexan to separate it from my tools, and it's been great.

Update:  It has been a tad bit more than a year with this monitor as a constant travel companion.  It has stood up to drops, and all the little rubber feet have been lost, but it still works with two caveats.

I was a bit skeptical on the specs, specifically the 25ms and the 1.4 inch depth. Plugged it in, I experience zero mouse lag and the bezel is actually around 0.5 inch thick, the middle about 1 inch at most. Note I am using a XPS 13, late 2015 edition.

USB-C cable it came with is suuuuper loose. I fixed it with a binder clip so it would stop jiggling out, and now it works fine. I'm addicted to two monitors and it performs it's duty admirably, but before I clipped the cable onto the side of the screen, it would disconnect at the slightest jolt, making it impossible to use on anything but a flat, stable surface. The stand is nothing to brag about either, but it gets the job done. I purchases this on Woot for around $65-70 and if you can grab it at that price, it's worth it. Little laggy, nothing awful, perfect for putting up a tutorial video or a document.

I travel a lot and am a software developer.  Using this with my laptop is a game changer.  This monitor is rock solid with my Macbook Pro.  I use it constantly, on the road. Fits right in my backpack with my laptop. I love the portrait orientation!  Saves my neck too as I don't have to look down as much.  Even writing this review on it now!

I HIGHLY recommend not buying one of these. I had one that I treated with the utmost of care, doubling the padding around it whenever transporting it, using heavy duty racks when using it. (I used it roughly once per week as a separate monitor for my laptop.) After about two months the video went out and displayed a bizarre pattern. I called them on it (it should have still been under warranty) and they said that the display wasn't covered. Total loss. I noticed that the price had dropped nearly half what I paid for it and I decided to take a chance and try another one. The USB cable input has gone out. I tried many new cables and adjusting the cable prongs to seat the cable tighter. No luck. Guess what, they will not replace it. Total lack of quality in the monitor as well as the company that makes it.
horrible.

Bought the monitor last October (2017) and performance was quirky from the start with the need to reconnect to USB after the computer booted. Monitor quit working last week showing nothing but the AOC logo on boot, then a black screen, and I checked the monitor on a laptop where it worked initially, then stopped. Nothing but blurred color on the screen.  Would not recommend it and ordered a replacement from another company.  Never before had a monitor crash in under a year.

I found this product the day after my 2011 MacBook Pro display died, and I was really excited by its simplicity.  I used Micro Center's work station monitor to install the DisplayLink driver software, and I was ready to go.  I went to my conference, and it worked perfectly.  But after several weeks, I started having trouble getting it to work.  The AOC logo would appear as soon as I plugged it into the USB port (USB 2.0 on the old Mac), but then it would go black again.  Occasionally, it would just fire up after about 5 minutes for totally unknown reasons.  I tried all the resets, downloaded all the updates and arcane support software, and scoured the web for advice.  Sometimes it works, most times it doesn't.

This product was exactly what I was looking for. I wanted a portable second monitor to use while traveling with my laptop. For the first few months it worked like a charm. I was in love and getting lots of compliments and questions about it. However over time the connection in the back has become so loose I can't get a connection anymore. For a time if you had the cord 'just right' it would connect... but god forbid you sneeze!

NOTE: I'm not a computer savvy person. Honestly, the monitor worked well until the second Windows 10 upgrade. The driver that came within the box was outdated and didn't work. I went to the AOC website and there are no drivers under the support (see screenshot); however, you can get the driver from DisplayLink website. When looking through what drivers support this monitor (inspecting the "Details" document for each driver) it's very difficult to figure out what one is going to work for this monitor on Windows 10 - I had to download and install then uninstall a few. Due to the sheer lack of cooperation between the company and their supplier (DisplayLink provides the display chips to AOC, I think), they make it difficult to determine what software (drivers) you need for your exact hardware (monitor) purchase. Additionally, don't lose the original chord, I had a difficult time finding another one that was compatible.

This would have been a great product if they could have figured out the power problem. If your laptop/surface/Ipad can't put out enough to power this unit, you have to use the 2nd usb port to supply additional power. This leave no other ports available IF you have 2 ports. It won't run through a USB bank unless its powered, which really kind of defeats the point of a portable setup.

review_title: WARNING!!! Does not work with Windows 10!!!!
review_body: I would have given this 5 stars, had it not stopped working when my computer was upgraded (by our IT department) to Windows 10. This occurred sometime in January 2017, and as of this writing (August 2017) AOC still has not written a Windows 10 driver. Indeed, they do not even acknowledge that there is a Windows 10 problem on their website. Very disappointing.  And Microsoft Help says to ask the manufacturer, so no help there. So my unit sits unused--can't return it, can't in good conscience sell it. Thanks-a-lot AOC.  :-(

review_title: The resolution matches the laptop resolution and the size is compariable so easy transition between screens
review_body: Our company has purchased more than 15 of these over the past year for our onsite-auditors to use. The resolution matches the laptop resolution and the size is compariable so easy transition between screens.
First of all, it does not auto rotate.

review_title: I love using this monitor for my organizational needs on the laptop
review_body: I have owned this monitor now for a little over a year and I have to say it is working as I had hoped that it would. So much so that I would love to get a USB-C type of the same size for my new laptop that I got.

review_title: Disappointing product - this was a replacement but was faulty as well.  2 strikes and they're out.
review_body: this was a replacement to the 1st one I bought, however both had the same issue / glitch.
You get what you pay for.  Very Poor graphics quality.  Buy something better rated with a higher price.

review_title: Was great at first, but it's just gotten terrible now and can no longer return.
review_body: When I first got this monitor it was great. I loved the "borderless" design, I paired it with a 25" 2560x1440 monitor also by Acer. I bought them both at the same time and they both worked great, but how I felt about this monitor quickly diminished. After using it for a couple of days it started to get a little backlight bleeding, this wasn't a huge issue at first, it was small and only visible at certain angles, and since the monitor was angled directly at me there were a lot of times where I did not see it. Then the screen started to cut out at times, randomly turning off and then coming back on after a few seconds, I tried multiple different ports and cables, and am completely confident in saying it is the monitor, not my video card (GTX 960 G1) or any of the cables that I have tried. But after a month of usage the backlight bleeding has gotten terrible and the cutting out just happens more and more often, and at this point I can't even return the product and I don't have the time to deal with sending this in to get repaired by Acer directly as I am a programmer and really require more than one screen to be productive in my work. It was a great monitor at first, but it's just terrible now..

review_title: looks like i have purchased two separate monitors from two different ...
review_body: I have purchased two monitors in same order, when i assembled it to use as dual monitor set up, it doesn't align at all, looks like i have purchased two separate monitors from two different companies.

review_title: I haven't connected the monitor or tried it out. ...
review_body: I haven't connected the monitor or tried it out. About the size, the three stars I gave are for the product description that says: Item Size/ Item Dimensions 8.82 x 19.6 x 15.1 in. These are the measurements of the box it arrives in. If you're interested in the actual monitor size it measures approximately 19.5" W x 11.875" H x 1.385" D (widest/ lower three to four inches on back side/ the greater portion is thin about .385") including bezels (frame) overall. The actual screen size is about 18.5" x 10.5." Hope this helps someone.

After receiving this monitor I found out that although it has a plastic stand it does not come with the standard VESA mount on the back. It was not clear to me that a little additional part would be required costing $37 + shipping.

At first the monitor was great. I loved the big screen, it seemed to be of good quality. I got it all hooked up on 1-3-16 and by 7-29-16 I had 2 red lines running through the monitor. I contacted Acer and they said I'd have to ship it off to repair. Ugh, okay, not enthused about that, but at least it's under warranty. Oh, by the way, YOU have to pay the shipping to get it reapired.
Sent back to Amazon, way to bright. Colors seemed whited out. No remote
Too expensive

I purchased 3 of these monitors believing that all necessary cables would be shipped with the product, ready to go out of the box after a brief computer hook up. VGA cable is supplied. No DVI or HDMI cables. Very, very disappointed....

Functionality of this monitor sucks. Does not allow you to increase saturation of the colors. In my opinion this is not a true ips monitor, more like a TN Panel. I expected more out of this monitor but was highly disappointed.

review_title: Beautiful edge-to-edge monitor with a clever stand
review_body: Pros: gorgeous screen, light weight, easy to assemble, all standard connections (VGA, DVI, HDMI), stand is actually useful

review_title: Listing isn't accurate, but product is decent enough
review_body: This monitor is fine for a $100 range monitor, but it's not the best value for some of the hassles you may face, and if you do make the purchase, you'd be better off getting it from somewhere other than Amazon to make sure you're getting the correct model everytime, and the correct equipment with them.

review_title: Great colors for an IPS and good response time for ...
review_body: Acer R240HY bidx 23.8-Inch has great colors and good response time for the price. The viewing angles are great as expected. I do notice ghosting on my monitor so the 4ms advertising makes me question if I am being lied to.

Actually a pretty good monitor for the price. I bought a couple of monitors off amazon to test them and this one was about the same price (sometimes cheaper by a few bucks) and it's actually not that bad. The colors are nice than the others and the response rate ain't too bad and actually very little ghosting for every day use.

review_title: Great General Purpose Monitor, Not So Good For Gaming
review_body: This isn't a bad monitor. In fact, it's a nice monitor with decent colors. For web browsing and Netflix, this is a good monitor. For gaming, not as much. The colors are good, but have a warm feel to them. The whites are a bid washed out. I have it connected as a second monitor and found I preferred reading web pages on it than my main due to this. However, when loading up games, I could definitely see the downside of the color washout. The best way I can describe it is that it's to warm. I changed some of the settings around for awhile, but kept coming back to it's "Graphics" setting as that was the best all around.

review_title: Good well rounded monitor for beginner photo editing
review_body: When I purchased this Monitor I initially forgot to pick myself up some of these 6.5 feet cables: http://amzn.to/1kKgSd6 to connect it up so ended up having some down time to look at the build and design which I have to say is really good. The stand is where I'm most impressed as it gives you a bit more freedom than some of the older stands I've seen when looking in stores.

review_title: The Size: I found out the product dimensions below ...
review_body: The Size: I found out the product dimensions below the unit description are the size of the box the monitor will arrive in. Three Stars I gave is for the lack of clarity regarding the W x H of the actual screen or monitor overall, beyond 23.8 viewable diagonally. Bezel appears to be 1/4" wide on three sides and about 1" at bottom for this unit. I purchased a smaller size and am returning it. Bezel for R221Q appears to be 1/2". Not as easy to see bezel with unit uninstalled (no power/ no picture).

Received this monitor new from my IT department at work for use in graphic arts work. Perfect sized for most everything, 1/4" bezel around the edge of the display area with the screen on, except on bottom. Soft, non-glare finish. Color is very good, it has all the controls you need on the menu. I have it hooked up to a MacBook Pro 2015 model via HDMI, and calibrated it right out of the box. Calibration software was able to get the numbers pretty much dead-on target.

review_title: Acer 23.8 inch IPS Full HD Widescreen Monitor
review_body: The unit arrived in perfect shape in a well packaged box...  set up was quick & easy, just about as painless as it gets, as.. unless you have never done this before... there is no need to read instructions, just plug n play.

No hdmi cable is included. I had to order it separately after I received the item. Very cheap choice by ACER. Also, the product description is misleading. They should clearly say that no HDMI cable is included.

review_title: You get what you pay for. Done after 1.5 yrs.
review_body: Bought this in November 2016.  this past week, the monitor started flashing horizontal black lines across the bottom quarter of the screen.  I know it is the monitor and not the graphics card. I attached a different monitor and there is no problem with it.  It just amazes me that the quality of computer equipment continues to degrade because cost is driven down by eliminating quality control, and quality parts and labor.  I've never had a monitor crap out in such a short time.  This was my first acer and probably the last.

Absolutely beautiful! Stunning display. I wasn't in the market for a new monitor, but I had always wanted to have a triple display. I have been using a 32" ASUS that is about 6 years old now and it's served me well, but it's not really compatible with multiple monitor configurations due to a wide bezel. That is absolutely where this monitor shines. Not only is it gorgeous and fast, it has a teeny tiny bezel and is extremely affordable, making a dual or triple monitor setup entirely feasible for once (for me, anyway). Receiving this beauty has inspired me to pick up two more and I can't wait to try them out. Set up was extremely fast and simple and I can't say enough about how stunning it is. Pick this one up. You won't regret it.

A while back, I bought a 22" LED monitor to replace my aging, squarish, Dell LED.  I selected an ASUS 22" monitor, but it was too big (width wise) to fit in my computer cabinet - so my wife became the happy owner of a 2nd monitor!!
horrible purchase, had this for two days before the flickering started, now it's unusable I can't even return it.. don't buy this it will be the worse purchase of your life
The acer R240HY IPS monitor has a beautiful screen, colors, and pretty close to a frameless border.

I purchased this monitor 1. While on sale at $130 2. Refurbished in perfect condition for $100. Although it is very rare that you will find this kind of deal, if you can, pick it up immediately. This is the best purchase I've made in a while and even if not refurbished. This is a 24" IPS 1080P screen for $130 people. A VERY competitive price point for a great product. Did I mention it's basically bezzless? 60HZ Is more than plenty for your average gamer or content consumer, and personally I already owned a DVI chord before the purchase. But you will need one or an HDMI chord, heads up. Doesn't come with it.

This monitor is really gorgeous. It's simple to set up (just plug it in and go), and while I may tweak with the color/brightness/contrast settings eventually, it works great right out of the box. The colors are rich and vibrant, and it's a very bright monitor. What's more, I really love how much screen space you get. The bevel on the top and sides is tiny, which means you get maximum screen space for the size of the monitor. The footprint of the monitor is actually smaller than the one it replaced, but I'm getting more screen space. This is a great monitor for the price, I'm very happy with it.

review_title: You get what you paid for.
review_body: This monitor is very nice for what it costs but it's not nearly as spectacular as most of the reviews says. The picture has great colors but it is grainy and suffers from SDE (screen door effect) which many people probably wouldn't even notice but the ones who would will find it pretty annoying. Enough so that I definitely recommend going for a higher end monitor if that's an issue for you. Otherwise, if you're on a tight budget and want something solid, this will do fine.
